sourceString: you feel like tightness on your chest
targetString: तपाईँले आफ्नो छातीमा जकडिएको जस्तो महसुस गर्नुहुन्छ
en-mt: You feel like you're stuck in your chest

sourceString: you know i got diabetes and stuff
targetString: तपाईँलाई थाहा छ मलाई मधुमेह र अरु भयो
en-mt: You know I had diabetes and others.

sourceString: you said you're having this chest pain
targetString: तपाईँले भन्नुभयो तपाईँलाई यो छातीको दुखाई छ
en-mt: You said you have this chest pain

sourceString: Rapidly increasing cumulative incidence of coronavirus disease (COVID-19) in the European Union/European Economic Area and the United Kingdom, 1 January to 15 March 2020
targetString: युरोपेली युनियन/युरोपेली आर्थिक क्षेत्र र संयुक्त अधिराज्यमा कोरोनाभाइरस रोग (COVID-19) को द्रुत रूपमा बढ्दो सञ्चित घटना, 1 जनवरी 2020 देखि 15 मार्चसम्म
en-mt: Rapidly increasing accumulated incidence of coronavirus disease (COVID-19) in the European Union/European Economic Zone and the United Kingdom, from January 1, 2020 to March 15, 2020

sourceString: The cumulative incidence of coronavirus disease (COVID-19) cases is showing similar trends in European Union/European Economic Area countries and the United Kingdom confirming that, while at a different stage depending on the country, the COVID-19 pandemic is progressing rapidly in all countries.
targetString: कोरोनाभाइरस रोग (COVID-19) का संचयी मामिलाहरूले युरोपियन युनियन र युरोपियन आर्थिक क्षेत्र देशहरू र युनाइटेड किङ्डममा यस्तै प्रवृत्ति देखाउँदै छ, जबकि देशका आधारमा फरक अवस्थामा, COVID-19 महामारी सबै देशहरूमा द्रुत गतिमा अघि बढिरहेको छ।
en-mt: The cumulative cases of coronavirus disease (COVID-19) are showing a similar trend in the European Union and the European Economic Zone countries and the United Kingdom, while in different cases by country, the COVID-19 epidemic is rapidly advancing in all countries.

sourceString: Based on the experience from Italy, countries, hospitals and intensive care units should increase their preparedness for a surge of patients with COVID-19 who will require healthcare, and in particular intensive care.
targetString: इटालीको अनुभवमा आधारित भएर, देश, अस्पताल र सघन स्याहार एकाइहरूले स्वास्थ्य स्याहार र विशेष सघन स्याहार आवश्यक हुने COVID-19 का बिरामीहरूको लहरको लागि उनीहरूको तयारी बढाउनुपर्छ।
en-mt: Based on Italy's experience, countries, hospitals and intensive care units should increase their readiness for a wave of COVID-19 patients requiring health care and specialized intensive care.

sourceString: On 31 December 2019, a cluster of pneumonia cases of unknown aetiology was reported in Wuhan, Hubei Province, China.
targetString: 31 डिसेम्बर 2019 मा, वुहान, हुबेई चीनमा अज्ञात रोग विज्ञानका निमोनियाँ केसहरूको समूह रिपोर्ट गरिएको थियो।
en-mt: On December 31, 2019, a group of pneumonia cases of unknown pathology was reported in Wuhan, Hubei China.

sourceString: On 9 January 2020, the China Center for Disease Control and Prevention reported the causative agent as being a novel coronavirus now referred to as severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).
targetString: 9 जनवरी 2020 मा, चीन रोग नियन्त्रण तथा रोकथाम केन्द्रले कारक एजेन्ट नोवेल कोरोनाभाइरस भएको हाल गम्भीर तीव्र श्वासप्रश्वास सिन्ड्रोम कोरोनाभाइरस 2 (SARS-CoV-2) भनिने भनी रिपोर्ट गर्‍यो।
en-mt: On 9 January 2020, the China Centers for Disease Control and Prevention reported that the causative agent being novel coronavirus is currently called severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).

sourceString: Since, the illness resulting from SARS-CoV-2 infection has been named coronavirus disease (COVID-19).
targetString: त्यसपछि, SARS-CoV-2 सङ्क्रमणबाट हुने बिरामीपनालाई कोरोनाभाइरस रोग (COVID-19) भनी नाम राखिएको छ।
en-mt: Since then, illness from SARS-CoV-2 infection has been named coronavirus disease (COVID-19).

sourceString: Evidence to date is that ca 80% of individuals with COVID-19 have a mild disease, i.e. a respiratory tract infection with or without pneumonia, and most of these recover.
targetString: यस मितिसम्मको प्रमाण यो छ कि COVID-19 भएका 80% व्यक्तिहरूमा हल्का रोग छ, अर्थात् निमोनियाको साथ वा बिना श्वासप्रश्वास पथ सङ्क्रमण र यीमध्ये अधिकांश निको हुन्छन्।
en-mt: Evidence to date is that 80% of people with COVID-19 have mild disease, i.e. respiratory tract infections with or without pneumonia and most of these are cured.

sourceString: In ca 14% cases, COVID-19 develops into a more severe disease requiring hospitalisation while the remaining 6% cases experience critical illness requiring intensive care.
targetString: 14% केसहरूमा, COVID-19 थप गम्भीर रोगमा विकसित हुन्छ जसलाई अस्पतालमा भर्ना गर्न आवश्यक हुन्छ जबकि बाँकी 6% केसहरूले जटिल बिरामीपना अनुभव गर्छन् जसलाई सघन स्याहार आवश्यक हुन्छ।
en-mt: In 14% of cases, COVID-19 develops into a more serious disease that requires hospitalization while the remaining 6% of cases experience complicated sickness that requires intensive care.

sourceString: The mortality of patients hospitalised due to COVID-19 is ca 4%.
targetString: COVID-19 को कारणले अस्पतालमा भर्ना भएका बिरामीहरूको मृत्यु दर ca 4% छ।
en-mt: The mortality rate of patients hospitalized due to COVID-19 is ca4%.

sourceString: In this study, we assess the trends in the cumulative incidence of COVID-19 in each European Union/European Economic Area (EU/EEA) country and the United Kingdom (UK) and compare them to that of Hubei Province, China.
targetString: यस अध्ययनमा, हामी प्रत्येक युरोपेली संघ/यूरोपियन आर्थिक क्षेत्र (EU/EEA) देश र संयुक्त अधिराज्य (UK) मा COVID-19 का संचयी घटनाको प्रवृत्तिको मूल्याङ्कन गर्दछौं र तिनीहरूलाई हुबेई प्रान्त, चीनको घटनासँग तुलना गर्दछौं।
en-mt: In this study, we evaluate trends in the cumulative incidence of COVID-19 in each EU/European Economic Zone (EU/EEA) country and the United Kingdom (UK) and compare them with the incidence of Hubei Province, China.

sourceString: We also compare the current number of COVID-19 cases in EU/EEA countries and the UK with that in Italy during 31 January–15 March 2020.
targetString: हामीले 31 जनवरी–15 मार्च 2020 सम्मको अवधिमा इटालीसँग EU/EEA देशहरू र UK को COVID-19 केसहरूको हालको सङ्ख्याको पनि तुलना गर्छौँ।
en-mt: We also compare the current number of COVID-19 cases in EU/EEA countries and the UK with Italy during the period from 31 January–15 March 2020.

sourceString: COVID-19 cases in EU/EEA countries and the UK
targetString: EU/EEA देशहरू र UK मा COVID-19 मामिलाहरू
en-mt: COVID-19 affairs in EU/EEA countries and UK

sourceString: Subsequent to China, COVID-19 underwent further geographical spread and the dynamic of the COVID-19 pandemic in the rest of the world currently follows that of this country.
targetString: चीनपछि, COVID-19 को थप भौगोलिक प्रसार भयो र संसारको बाँकी भागले हाल यो देशको COVID-19 को गतिशीलता पछ्याउनेछ।
en-mt: After China, there was a further geographical spread of COVID-19 and the rest of the world will currently follow the dynamics of this country's COVID-19.

sourceString: On 11 March 2020, the Director General of the World Health Organization (WHO) declared COVID-19 a pandemic.
targetString: 11 मार्च 2020 मा, विश्व स्वास्थ्य सङ्गठन (WHO) का निर्देशक जेनेरलले COVID-19 लाई महामारी घोषणा गरे।
en-mt: On 11 March 2020, The Director General of the World Health Organization (WHO) declared COVID-19 a pandemic.

sourceString: In the 5 March issue of Eurosurveillance 2020, Spiteri et al. reported on the first European confirmed COVID-19 cases according to the WHO case definition.
targetString: 5 मार्चमा जारी भएको यूरोसर्भेलेन्स 2020, स्पिटेरी et al. ले WHO को केस परिभाषा अनुसार पहिलो युरोपेली COVID-19 पुष्टि भएको रिपोर्ट गर्‍यो।
en-mt: In Euroservalence 2020, released on 5 March, Spiteri et al. reported being the first European COVID-19 confirmed according to WHO's case definition.

sourceString: In the EU/EEA, the first three confirmed cases were reported by France on 24 January 2020 in persons returning from Wuhan, Hubei Province, China.
targetString: EU/EEA मा, पहिलो तीन पुष्टि भएका मामिलाहरू फ्रान्समा 24 जनवरी 2020 मा वुहान, हुबेई प्रान्त, चीनबाट फर्केका व्यक्तिहरूमा देखा परेका थिए।
en-mt: In EU/EEIA, the first three confirmed cases were reported in France on 24 January 2020 in people who returned from Wuhan, Hubei Province, China.

sourceString: As at 15 March 2020, COVID-19 cases had been detected in all 30 EU/EEA countries and the United Kingdom (UK), whereby between 31 December 2019 and that date included, 39,768 cases and 1,727 deaths had been reported, with 17,750 cases and 1,441 deaths from Italy alone.
targetString: 15 मार्च 2020 सम्ममा, COVID-19 मामिलाहरू सबै 30 EU/EEA देशहरू र युनाइटेड किंगडम (UK) मा पत्ता लागेका थिए, यस अन्तर्गत 31 डिसेम्बर 2019 र त्यस मिति सहित, 39,768 मामिलाहरू र 1,727 मृत्युहरु रिपोर्ट गरिएका थिए, जसमा इटालीबाट मात्र 17,750 मामिलाहरू र 1,441 मृत्युहरु समावेश छन्।
en-mt: As of 15 March 2020, COVID-19 cases were detected in all 30 EU/EEA countries and the United Kingdom (UK), including 31 December 2019 and that date, 39,768 cases and 1,727 deaths were reported, including 17,750 cases and 1,441 deaths from Italy alone.

sourceString: Obtaining cumulative number and cumulative incidence of COVID-19 cases
targetString: COVID-19 मामिलाहरूको संचयी संख्या र संचयी घटना हरू प्राप्त गर्ने
en-mt: Achieving cumulative number of COVID-19 cases and cumulative incidence

sourceString: At the European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control (ECDC), the notified COVID-19 case counts in each country worldwide, obtained from only official sources such as the countries’ Ministry of Health, national and regional health authorities and the WHO, are updated each day at 8:00 a.m.
targetString: युरोपेली रोग रोकथाम तथा नियन्त्रण केन्द्र (ECDC) मा, सूचित COVID-19 केस विश्वव्यापी रूपमा हरेक देशको गणना हुन्छ, जुन देशहरूका स्वास्थ्य मन्त्रालय, राष्ट्रिय र क्षेत्रीय स्वास्थ्य निकायहरू र WHO जस्ता आधिकारिक स्रोतहरूबाट  मात्र प्राप्त हुन्छन्, तिनलाई प्रत्येक दिन बिहान 8:00 बजे अद्यावधिक गरिन्छ।
en-mt: At the European Centers for Disease Prevention and Control (ECDC), the reported COVID-19 cases are counted in every country worldwide, which are received only from the countries' ministries of health, national and regional health bodies, and official sources such as WHO, are updated every day at 8:00 a.m.

sourceString: These data were used for assessing the trends of COVID-19 in EU/EEA and the UK, and comparing them to that in Italy.
targetString: यी तथ्याङ्कहरूलाई इटालीको तुलनामा EU/EEA र UK मा COVID-19 को प्रवृत्ति आँकलन गर्न प्रयोग गरिएको थियो।
en-mt: These data were used to estimate the trend of COVID-19 in EU/EEA and UK compared to Italy.

sourceString: As a proxy of the prevalence of active COVID-19 cases, we calculated the 14-day truncated cumulative incidence of COVID-19 cases, thus taking into account the natural course of COVID-19, in each EU/EEA country and the UK, during the 1 January–15 March 2020 period.
targetString: सक्रिय COVID-19 केसहरूको व्यापकताको एक प्रतिनिधिको रूपमा, यसर्थ COVID-19 को प्राकृतिक पाठ्यक्रमलाई ध्यानमा राख्दै, 1 जनवरी-15 मार्च 2020 सम्मको अवधिको समयमा प्रत्येकEU/EEA देश र UK मा हामीले COVID-19 केसहरूको 14-दिनको छोटो सञ्चित घटनाको हिसाब गर्‍यौँ।
en-mt: As a representative of the prevalence of active COVID-19 cases, therefore taking into account the natural course of COVID-19, during the period from January 1-15 March 2020 in each EU/EEA country and in the UK we accounted for a 14-day short cumulative incidence of COVID-19 cases.

sourceString: We also presented the cumulative number of notified cases of each country as at 15 March 2020 8:00 a.m. compared with that of Italy for the 31 January–15 March 2020 period.
targetString: हामीले 31 जनवरी–15 मार्च 2020 को अवधिको तुलनामा 15 मार्च 2020 को बिहानको 8:00 बजेसम्मको प्रत्येक देशका सूचित केसहरूको सञ्चित सङ्ख्या पनि प्रस्तुत गर्‍यौँ।
en-mt: We also presented the accumulated number of reported cases in each country up to 8:00 am on March 15, 2020, as compared to the period 31 January–15 March 2020.

sourceString: Trends of COVID-19 in EU/EEA countries and the UK
targetString: EU/EEA देशहरू र UK मा COVID-19 को प्रवृत्ति
en-mt: Trend of COVID-19 in EU/EEA countries and UK

sourceString: The trends in the 14-day truncated cumulative incidence of COVID-19 cases in EU/EEA countries and the UK generally followed that of Hubei Province (China) (Figure 1).
targetString: EU/EEA देशहरू र UK को COVID-19 केसहरूको 14-दिने सञ्चित घटनाको प्रवृत्तिले साधारणतया हुबेई प्रान्त (चीन) को प्रवृत्ति पछ्याउँछ (चित्र 1)।
en-mt: The trend of 14-day accumulated incidence of COVID-19 cases of EU/EEA countries and UK generally follows the trend of Hubei Province (China) (Figure 1).

sourceString: For the EU/EEA and the UK overall, the cumulative incidence of COVID-19 started to increase around 21 February and then increased sharply around 28 February 2020 (Supplementary material).
targetString: EU/EEA र UK समग्रका लागि, COVID-19 का संचयी घटनाहरू 21 फेब्रुअरी का आसपास बढ्न सुरु भए र त्यसपछि 28 फेब्रुअरी 2020 (पूरक सामाग्री) का आसपास द्रुत गतिमा वृद्धि भए।
en-mt: For THE EU/EEA and UK overall, the cumulative incidence of COVID-19 began to rise around 21 February and then increased rapidly around 28 February 2020 (Supplementary Material).

sourceString: This was mostly driven by the rapid increase in the number of reported cases from Italy, but all other EU/EEA countries and the UK showed similar increasing trends of the cumulative incidence of COVID-19 (Supplementary material).
targetString: यो प्रायः इटालीबाट रिपोर्ट गरिएका घटनाहरूको सङ्ख्यामा द्रुत वृद्धिबाट प्रेरित भएको थियो, तर अन्य सबै EU / EEA देशहरू र बेलायतले COVID-19 (पूरक सामग्री) को सञ्चयी घटनाको समान वृद्धि प्रवृत्ति देखायो।
en-mt: This was mostly driven by a rapid increase in the number of reported cases from Italy, but all other EU/EEA countries and the UK showed a similar increased trend in the cumulative incidence of COVID-19 (Supplementary Material).

sourceString: Figure 2 shows the cumulative number of COVID-19 cases, in EU/EEA countries and the UK compared with that in Italy for the 31 January–15 March 2020 period.
targetString: चित्र 2 ले 31 जनवरी–15 मार्च 2020 सम्मको अवधिमा इटालीको तुलनामा EU/EEA देशहरू र UK को COVID-19 केसहरूको सञ्चित सङ्ख्या देखाउँछ।
en-mt: Figure 2 shows the accumulated number of COVID-19 cases of EU/EEA countries and THE UK compared to Italy during the period from January 31–15 March 2020.

sourceString: It highlights that, as at 15 March 8:00 a.m., 15 other EU/EEA countries and the UK had already reported a total number of cases comparable to that of Italy just 3 weeks prior or less.
targetString: यसले जोड दिन्छ कि, 15 मार्च बिहानको 8:00 बजेसम्म, 15 अन्य EU/EEA देशहरू UK ले इटालीको भन्दा 3 हप्ता वा कम समय पहिलेको तुलनाका केसहरूको जम्मा सङ्ख्या रिपोर्ट गरिसकेका थिए।
en-mt: This emphasizes that, by 8:00 a.m. on March 15, 15 other EU/EEA countries had already reported a total number of cases compared to 3 weeks or less earlier than italy.

sourceString: Our results indicate that the number of notified cases of COVID-19 is rapidly increasing in the EU/EEA and the UK.
targetString: हाम्रो परिणामहरूले संकेत गरे कि COVID-19 का सूचित मामिलाहरूको संख्या EU/EEA र UK मा द्रुत रूपमा बृद्धि भइरहेको छ।
en-mt: Our results indicated that the number of reported cases of COVID-19 is rapidly increasing in EU/EEA and UK.

sourceString: The observed trends in the cumulative incidence of COVID-19 suggest that the pandemic is progressing at a comparable speed in all countries.
targetString: COVID-19 को संचयी घटनाहरूमा अवलोकन गरिएको प्रवृत्तिले देखायो कि महामारी सबै देशहरूमा तुलनात्मक गतिमा अगाडि बढिरहेको छ।
en-mt: The observed trend in the cumulative incidence of COVID-19 showed that the epidemic is advancing at a comparable pace in all countries.

sourceString: This is despite countries being at different stages, variations in national public health responses, and possibly different case definitions in countries and different protocols for selecting patients that must be tested for confirmation of COVID-19, including catch-up testing.
targetString: यो विभिन्न देशहरू विभिन्न चरणहरूमा भएकोले, राष्ट्रिय जनस्वास्थ्य प्रतिक्रियाहरू र क्याच-अप परीक्षण लगायत COVID-19 को पुष्टिको लागि परीक्षण गरिनुपर्ने चयन गर्नको लागि देशहरूमा सम्भावित भिन्न केस परिभाषाहरू र भिन्न प्रोटोकलहरू भएकोले हो।
en-mt: This is because countries have potentially different case definitions and different protocols for selecting what should be tested for confirmation of COVID-19, including national public health responses and catch-up testing.

sourceString: Early March 2020, doctors in the affected regions of Italy described a situation in which ca 10% of patients with COVID-19 required intensive care and media sources reported that hospitals and intensive care units in these regions had already reached their maximum capacity.
targetString: मार्च 2020 को सुरुवातमा, इटालीको प्रभावित क्षेत्रहरूको अवस्थालाई वर्णन गरे जसमा ca 10% COVID-19 का बिरामीलाई गहन हेरचाहको आवश्यकता थियो र सञ्चार स्रोतहरूले बताए कि यी क्षेत्रहरूमा अस्पताल र गहन हेरचाह एकाइहरू पहिले नै आफ्नो अधिकतम क्षमतासम्म पुगिसकेका छन्।
en-mt: In early March 2020, described the situation in the affected areas of Italy in which caia 10% of COVID-19 patients needed intensive care and communication sources reported that hospitals and intensive care units in these areas had already reached their maximum capacity.

sourceString: Data on admission of COVID-19 cases in a hospital and/or an intensive care unit are currently available at EU/EEA level for only 6% and 1% cases, respectively (data not shown).
targetString: अस्पताल र/वा सघन स्याहार एकाइमा COVID-19 केसहरूको भर्नाको तथ्याङ्क हाल EU/EEA स्तरमा क्रमशः 6% र 1% केसहरूका लागि मात्र उपलब्ध छन् (तथ्याङ्क देखाएको छैन)।
en-mt: Data on admission of COVID-19 cases to hospital and/or intensive care units are currently available only for 6% and 1% of cases, respectively, at the EU/EEA level (data not shown).

sourceString: They should, however, be collected in a systematic fashion to complement current surveillance data that focus on the number of reported cases and the number of deaths.
targetString: यद्यपि, तिनीहरूलाई रिपोर्ट गरिएका केसहरू र मृत्युको सङ्ख्यामा जोड दिने हालको निगरानी तथ्याङ्कको पूरा गर्न प्रणालीगत शैलीमा सङ्कलन गरिनुपर्दछ।
en-mt: However, they should be collected in a systemic manner to meet current surveillance data emphasizing the number of reported cases and deaths.

sourceString: A study performed in 2010–11 showed a large variation in the availability of intensive care and intermediate care beds in Europe, ranging from 29.2 in Germany to 4.2 beds per 100,000 population in Portugal.
targetString: 2010-11 मा गरिएको अध्ययनले युरोपमा गहन स्याहार र मध्यवर्ती स्याहार गर्ने बिस्तराको उपलब्धतामा ठूलो भिन्नता देखायो, जसमा जर्मनीमा 29.2 देखि पोर्चुगलमा 4.2 बिस्तराहरू प्रति 100,000 जनसङ्ख्या सम्म विस्तारित पाइयो।
en-mt: A study conducted in 2010-11 showed a large difference in the availability of intensive care and intermediate care beds in Europe, ranging from 29.2 in Germany to 4.2 beds per 100,000 population in Portugal.

sourceString: This means that countries may have more or less resources than Italy (12.5 intensive care and intermediate care beds per 100,000 population in 2010–11).
targetString: यसको अर्थ धेरै देशहरूमा इटाली (2010–11 मा 12.5 सघन स्याहार र मध्यवर्ती स्याहार शैय्याहरू प्रति 100,000 जनसङ्ख्या) को भन्दा बढी वा कम संसाधनहरू हुन सक्छन्
en-mt: This means that many countries may have more or less resources than Italy (12.5 intensive care and intermediate care beds per 100,000 population in 2010–11).

sourceString: Modelling scenarios related to healthcare capacity saturation, with estimates for each EU/EEA country and the UK of the prevalence of hospitalised COVID-19 cases associated with a > 90% risk of exceeding intensive care bed capacity, are provided in the sixth update of the ECDC rapid risk assessment on COVID-19.
targetString: स्वास्थ्य सेवा क्षमता संतृप्ति सम्बन्धित मोडेलिंग परिदृश्य, प्रत्येक EU/EEA देश र UK को लागी व्यापक अस्पताल भर्ती भएका COVID-19 मामिलाहरू जुन गहन देखभाल बिस्तरा क्षमता को अधिक हुने >90% जोखिमसँग सम्बन्धित, लाई COVID-19 मा ECDC द्रुत जोखिम मूल्याङ्कन को छैटौँ अद्यावधिक प्रदान गरिन्छ।
en-mt: The modeling scenario related to healthcare capacity saturation, widespread hospitalizations for each EU/EEA country and THE UK that are associated with a >90% risk of being overcrowded intensive care bed capacity, are provided with the sixth update of the ECDC Rapid Risk Assessment in COVID-19.

sourceString: Since cases have so far clustered in certain regions in EU/EEA countries and the UK, and hospitals and intensive care units usually serve a defined regional catchment population, information about cases and intensive care beds should preferably be made available at the Nomenclature of territorial units for statistics 2 (NUTS-2) level.
targetString: मामिलाहरू हालसम्म EU/EEA देशहरू र UK मा रहेका केही क्षेत्रहरूमा समूहगत भएका हुनाले र अस्पताल र गहन स्याहार एकाइहरूले सामान्यतया परिभाषित क्षेत्रीय क्याचमेन्ट जनसङ्ख्याको सेवा गर्ने भएकाले, मामिलाहरू र गहन स्याहारका बिस्तराहरका बारेमा जानकारी प्राथमिक रूपमा तथ्याङ्क 2 (NUTS-2) स्तरको लागि क्षेत्रीय एकाइहरूको नामकरणमा उपलब्ध गराउनुपर्दछ।
en-mt: Since cases have so far been grouped into EU/EEA countries and some regions in the UK, and because hospitals and intensive care units serve a generally defined regional catchment population, information about cases and the content of intensive care should be made available primarily in the nomenclature of regional units for the Statistics 2 (NUTS-2) level.

sourceString: The experience from Italy and the current trends in other countries show that the COVID-19 pandemic is progressing rapidly in the EU/EEA and the UK.
targetString: इटालीको अनुभव र अन्य देशहरूमा हालको प्रवृत्तिले COVID-19 महामारी EU/EEA र UK मा छिटो बढिरहेको देखाउँछ।
en-mt: Experience in Italy and recent trends in other countries show that the COVID-19 pandemic is growing rapidly in EU/EEA and UK.

sourceString: Countries, hospitals and intensive care units should thus prepare themselves for a scenario of sustained community transmission of SARS-CoV-2 and an increase in the number of patients with COVID-19 requiring healthcare, and in particular intensive care, such as the one occurring in the affected regions of Italy.
targetString: देश, अस्पताल र सघन स्याहार एकाइहरूले तसर्थ SARS-CoV-2 को दिगो सामुदायिक प्रसारण भएको खण्डको लागि र इटालीका प्रभावित क्षेत्रहरूमा भएको जस्तो स्वास्थ्य स्याहार र विशेष सघन स्याहार आवश्यक हुने COVID-19 का बिरामीहरूको बढ्दो सङ्ख्याको लागि आफूलाई तयार गर्नुपर्दछ।
en-mt: Countries, hospitals and intensive care units must therefore prepare themselves for a segment with sustainable community transmission of SARS-CoV-2 and for the increasing number of COVID-19 patients requiring health care and specialized intensive care, as is the case in affected areas of Italy.

sourceString: As pointed out in the recent ECDC rapid risk assessment, a rapid, proactive and comprehensive approach is essential to delay the spread of SARS-COV-2, with a shift from a containment to a mitigation approach, as the anticipated rapid increase in the number of cases may not provide decision makers and hospitals enough time to comprehend, accept and adapt their response accordingly if not implemented ahead of time.
targetString: हालको ECDC द्रुत जोखिम आँकलनमा बुँदागत गरिए अनुसार, आशा गरिएको केसहरूको सङ्ख्यामा द्रुत वृद्धिले यदि समय अगावै कार्यान्वयन नगरिएमा निर्णयकर्ता र अस्पतालहरूलाई त्यसअनुसार उनीहरूका प्रतिक्रियाहरू बुझ्न, स्वीकार्न र अपनाउन पर्याप्त समय प्रदान नगर्न सक्ने कारणले नियन्त्रणदेखि शमनको दृष्टिकोणसम्म SARS-COV-2 को प्रसार कम गर्न द्रुत, सक्रिय र व्यापक दृष्टिकोण अत्यावश्यक छ।
en-mt: As pointed out in the current ECDC Rapid Risk Assessment, a rapid, proactive and comprehensive approach to reduce the spread of SARS-COV-2 from control to mitigation approaches is imperative as the rapid increase in the number of expected cases may not provide enough time for decision makers and hospitals to understand, accept and adopt their responses accordingly if not implemented prematurely.

sourceString: The rapid risk assessment also lists the public health measures to mitigate the impact of the pandemic.
targetString: द्रुत जोखिम मूल्याङ्कनले महामारीको प्रभाव कम गर्नका लागि सार्वजनिक स्वास्थ्य उपायहरू पनि सूचीबद्ध गर्दछ।
en-mt: The rapid risk assessment also lists public health measures to mitigate the impact of the pandemic.

sourceString: There is a short window of opportunity during which countries have the possibility to further increase their control efforts to slow down the spread of SARS-CoV-2 and decrease the pressure on healthcare.
targetString: देशहरूले SARS-CoV-2 को प्रसार कम गर्न र स्वास्थ्य स्याहारमा चाप कम गर्न आफ्नो नियन्त्रणका प्रयासहरू अझ बढाउने सम्भावनाको अवसर भएको छोटो अवधि हुन्छ।
en-mt: There is a short period of time when countries have the potential to further increase their control efforts to reduce the spread of SARS-CoV-2 and reduce the pressure on health care.

sourceString: Failing this, it is likely that the healthcare systems of other EU/EEA countries will face a surge of patients that require intensive care within the coming days or weeks.
targetString: यसमा असफल भएमा, अन्य EU/EEA देशहरूका स्वास्थ्य स्याहार प्रणालीहरूले आगामी केही दिन वा साताभित्र सघन स्याहार आवश्यक हुने बिरामीहरूको लहरको सामना गर्ने सम्भावना छ।
en-mt: Failing this, health care systems in other EU/EEA countries are likely to face a wave of patients requiring intensive care in the next few days or weeks.

sourceString: The outbreak of Coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19), caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS) coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2), has thus far killed over 3,000 people and infected over 80,000 in China and elsewhere in the world, resulting in catastrophe for humans.
targetString: कोरोनाभाइरस रोग 2019 (COVID-19) को प्रकोप, गम्भीर तीव्र श्वासप्रश्वास सिन्ड्रोम (SARS) कोरोनाभाइरस 2 (SARS-CoV-2) का कारणले, चीन र अन्यत्र विश्वभर अहिलेसम्म 3,000 भन्दा बढी व्यक्तिलाई मारिसकेको छ र 80,000 भन्दा बढी मानिसलाई सङ्क्रमित गरिसकेको छ, जुन मानवका लागि विनाशको रुप हो।
en-mt: The outbreak of coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19), caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS) coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2), has killed more than 3,000 people worldwide and infected more than 80,000 people, which is a form of destruction for humans.

sourceString: Similar to its homologous virus, SARS-CoV, which caused SARS in thousands of people in 2003, SARS-CoV-2 might also be transmitted from the bats and causes similar symptoms through a similar mechanism.
targetString: योसँग मिल्दोजुल्दो भाइरस SARS-CoV, जसले 2003 मा हजारौं मानिसमा SARS गरायो, यो जस्तै SARS-CoV-2 पनि चमेराहरूबाट प्रसारित भएको हुन सक्छ र उही संयन्त्र मार्फत उही लक्षणहरू गराउँछ।
en-mt: The virus similar to this SARS-CoV, which caused SARS in thousands of people in 2003, may also have been transmitted from bats and caused the same symptoms through the same mechanism.

sourceString: However, COVID-19 has lower severity and mortality than SARS but is much more transmissive and affects more elderly individuals than youth and more men than women.
targetString: यद्यपि, COVID-19 को SARS को भन्दा कम गम्भीरता र मृत्युदर छ तर यो ज्यादै बढी प्रसारक छ र युवाभन्दा धेरै वृद्ध व्यक्तिहरूमा र महिलाभन्दा धेरै पुरुषहरूमा प्रभाव पार्दछ।
en-mt: However, COVID-19 has a lower severity and mortality rate than SARS but it is much more diffuse and affects older people than young and more men than women.

sourceString: In response to the rapidly increasing number of publications on the emerging disease, this article attempts to provide a timely and comprehensive review of the swiftly developing research subject.
targetString: उदीयमान रोगमा द्रुत रूपमा बढिरहेका प्रकाशकहरूको सङ्ख्याको प्रतिक्रियामा, यो लेखले द्रुत रूपमा विकास भइरहेको अनुसन्धान विषयको समयमै र व्यापक समीक्षा प्रदान गर्ने प्रयास गर्दछ।
en-mt: In response to the rapidly growing number of publishers on emerging disease, this article attempts to provide a timely and comprehensive review of a rapidly evolving research topic.

sourceString: We will cover the basics about the epidemiology, etiology, virology, diagnosis, treatment, prognosis, and prevention of the disease.
targetString: हामीले यो रोगको महामारी विज्ञान, हेतु विज्ञान, भाइरोलोजी, निदान, उपचार , पूर्वानुमान र रोकथामको बारेमा आधारभूत कुराहरू समेट्नेछौँ।
en-mt: We will cover the basics of epidemiology, biology, virology, diagnosis, treatment, prognosis and prevention of this disease.

sourceString: Although many questions still require answers, we hope that this review helps in the understanding and eradication of the threatening disease.
targetString: यद्यपि धेरै प्रश्नहरूको अझै उत्तर आवश्यक छ, हामी आशा गर्दछौं कि यस समीक्षाले खतरनाक रोगको बारे बुझ्न र उन्मूलन गर्न मद्दत गर्दछ।
en-mt: Although many questions still need answers, we hope that this review will help to understand and eradicate dangerous disease.

sourceString: The Spring Festival on January 25, 2020 has become an unprecedented and unforgettable memory to all Chinese who were urged to stay indoors for all the holiday and for many weeks after due to the outbreak of a novel viral disease.
targetString: जनवरी 25, 2020 को वसन्त महोत्सव नयाँ भाइरस रोगको प्रकोपको कारणले पूरै विदाको लागि र धेरै हप्तापछि पनि घरभित्र बस्न आग्रह गरिएका चिनियाँहरूका लागि अभूतपूर्व र अविस्मरणीय बनेको छ।
en-mt: The Spring Festival of January 25, 2020 has become unprecedented and unforgettable for the Chinese who have been asked to stay indoors for a full holiday due to the outbreak of the new virus disease and even after several weeks.

sourceString: The virus is highly homologous to the coronavirus (CoV) that caused an outbreak of severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS) in 2003; thus, it was named SARS-CoV-2 by the World Health Organization (WHO) on February 11, 2020, and the associated disease was named CoV Disease-19 (COVID-19).
targetString: यो भाइरस 2003 मा गम्भीर तीव्र श्वासप्रश्वास सिन्ड्रोम (SARS) को प्रकोप ल्याउने कोरोनाभाइरस (CoV) सँग एकदमै मिल्दोजुल्दो छ; यसर्थ, यसलाई फेब्रुअरी 11, 2020 मा विश्व स्वास्थ्य सङ्गठन (WHO) द्वारा SARS-CoV-2 नाम राखियो र सम्बन्धित रोगलाई CoV रोग-19 (COVID-19) नाम राखियो।
en-mt: This virus is very similar to the coronavirus (CoV), which caused an outbreak of severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS) in 2003; Therefore, it was named SARS-CoV-2 by the World Health Organization (WHO) on February 11, 2020, and the related disease was named CoV Disease-19 (COVID-19).

sourceString: The epidemic started in Wuhan, China, and quickly spread throughout the entire country and to near 50 others all over the world.
targetString: यो महामारी वुहान, चीनमा सुरु भयो र छिट्टै नै देशभरि र संसारका लगभग अन्य 50 देशहरूमा फैलियो।
en-mt: This epidemic started in Wuhan, China and soon spread throughout the country and almost 50 other countries of the world.

sourceString: As of March 2, 2020, the virus has resulted in over 80,000 confirmed cases of COVID-19, with more than 40,000 patients discharged and over 3,000 patients who died.
targetString: मार्च 2, 2020 सम्म, भाइरसले गर्दा 80,000 भन्दा बढी COVID-19 का केसहरू पुष्टि भएका थिए, जसमा 40,000 भन्दा बढी बिरामीहरू डिस्चार्ज भए र 3,000 भन्दा बढी बिरामीहरूको मृत्यु भयो।
en-mt: As of March 2, 2020, more than 80,000 cases of COVID-19 were confirmed due to the virus, with more than 40,000 patients discharged and more than 3,000 patients dying.

sourceString: WHO warns that COVID-19 is “public enemy number 1” and potentially more powerful than terrorism.
targetString: WHO ले यो चेतावनी दिन्छ COVID-19 कि “सार्वजनिक शत्रु नम्बर 1” हो र सम्भवतः आतङ्कवाद भन्दा बढी शक्तिशाली छ।
en-mt: WHO warns this COVID-19 that the "public enemy is No. 1" and is probably more powerful than terrorism.

sourceString: According to PubMed (https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/), in less than two months, over 200 papers have been published on COVID-19 including its virology, epidemiology, etiology, diagnosis, and treatment since the first report on January 7, 2020 that determined the sequence of the virus isolated from multiple patients.
targetString: पबमेड (https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/) का अनुसार, जनवरी 7, 2020 को पहिलो रिपोर्टदेखि दुई महिना भन्दा कम समयमा COVID-19 मा 200 भन्दा बढी पत्रहरू प्रकाशित भइसकेका छन्, जसमा यसको भाइरोलोजी, महामारी विज्ञान, निदान र उपचार समावेश छन्, जसले बहु बिरामीहरूबाट अलग्गिएको भाइरस निर्धारण गर्‍यो।
en-mt: According to PubMed (https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/), more than 200 papers have been published on COVID-19 in less than two months since the first report of January 7, 2020, including its virology, epidemiology, diagnosis and treatment, which determined the virus isolated from multiple patients.

sourceString: This review attempts to summarize the research progress in the new and swiftly developing subject area.
targetString: यो समीक्षाले नयाँ र द्रुत रूपमा विकास भइरहेको विषय क्षेत्रमा अनुसन्धानको प्रगतिलाई सारांशमा प्रस्तुत गर्न प्रयास गर्दछ।
en-mt: This review attempts to summarize the progress of research in a new and rapidly evolving subject area.

sourceString: Whenever possible, we will try to compare COVID-19 with SARS and another CoV-caused disease, Middle East respiratory syndrome (MERS, an outbreak in 2012).
targetString: सम्भव भएसम्म, हामी COVID-19 को तुलना SARS र एक अर्को CoV-कारण रोग, मध्य पूर्व श्वासप्रश्वास सिन्ड्रोम (MERS, 2012 मा एक प्रकोप ) संग गर्ने प्रयास गर्नेछौं।
en-mt: If possible, we will try to compare COVID-19 with SARS and another CoV-causing disease, Middle East respiratory syndrome (AN outbreak in MERS, 2012).

sourceString: We will also discuss what we have learned so far regarding the prevention and prognosis of the disease as well as some remaining yet urgent questions.
targetString: हामी रोगको रोकथाम र निदानका सम्बन्धमा अहिलेसम्म सिकेका कुराहरू र साथसाथै केही बाँकी अझै जरुरी प्रश्नहरूको बारेमा पनि छलफल गर्नेछौं।
en-mt: We will discuss what we have learned so far regarding the prevention and diagnosis of the disease, as well as some remaining important questions.

sourceString: CoVs have been traditionally considered nonlethal pathogens to humans, mainly causing approximately 15% of common colds 4.
targetString: CoVs लाई परम्परागत रूपमा मानवहरूका लागि गैर घातक रोगजनक मानिन्छ, रूघा 4 को लगभग 15% कारक मानिन्छ।
en-mt: CoVs has traditionally been considered a non-lethal pathogen for humans, with about 15% of the cold being considered a factor of 4.

sourceString: However, in this century, we have encountered highly pathogenic human CoVs twice, i.e., SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV, which caused an outbreak originally in China in 2003 and Saudi Arabia in 2012, respectively, and soon spread to many other countries with horrible morbidity and mortality.
targetString: यद्यपि, यस शताब्दीमा, हामीले दुई पटक अत्यधिक रोगजनक मानवी CoVs को सामना गरेका छौँ, अर्थात्, SARS-CoV र MERS-CoV, जसले मूलतः 2003 मा चीन र 2012 मा साउदी अरेबिया मा क्रमशः प्रकोप उत्पन्न गर्‍यो र चाँडै नै भयानक विकृति र मृत्युदरका साथ अन्य धेरै देशहरूमा पनि फैलियो।
en-mt: However, in this century, we have encountered twice the highly pathogenic human CoVs, namely, SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV, which originally caused outbreaks in China in 2003 and Saudi Arabia in 2012 respectively and soon spread to many other countries with terrible morbidity and mortality.

sourceString: Therefore, the current COVID-19 is the third CoV outbreak in the recorded history of humans.
targetString: त्यसकारण, हालको COVID-19 मानव इतिहासमा रेकर्ड भएको तेस्रो CoV प्रकोप हो।
en-mt: Therefore, the current COVID-19 is the third CoV outbreak recorded in human history.

sourceString: As shown in Fig. ​Fig.1,1, clusters of pneumonia that had unknown origins were first reported from Wuhan on December 31, 2019 to the China National Health Commission.
targetString: चित्र ​चित्र.1,1 मा देखाइए अनुसार, डिसेम्बर 31, 2019 मा वुहानबाट अज्ञात उत्पत्ति भएका निमोनियाका समूह चिनियाँ राष्ट्रिय स्वास्थ्य आयोगमा सुरुमा रिपोर्ट गरिएको थियो।
en-mt: As shown in Figure 1,1, a group of pneumonias with unknown origin from Wuhan on December 31, 2019 were initially reported to the Chinese National Health Commission.

sourceString: Seven days later the sequence of the CoV was released.
targetString: सात दिनपछि CoV को अनुक्रम जारी भयो।
en-mt: Seven days later the sequence of CoV was released.

sourceString: On January 15, 2020 the first fatal case from Wuhan was reported.
targetString: 15 जनवरी 2020 मा, वुहानबाट पहिलो घातक मामिला रिपोर्ट गरियो।
en-mt: On 15 January 2020, the first fatal case was reported from Wuhan.

sourceString: Meanwhile, the epidemic rapidly spread to the neighboring cities, provinces, and countries.
targetString: यसै बीच, महामारी छिटो रुपमा छिमेकी शहरहरू, प्रान्तहरू र देशहरूमा फैलियो।
en-mt: Meanwhile, the epidemic quickly spread to neighboring cities, provinces and countries.

sourceString: On January 20, the infection of health-care providers was reported, suggesting that human-to-human transmission was possible.
targetString: जनवरी 20 मा, स्वास्थ्य-सेवा प्रदायकहरूको सङ्क्रमणको रिपोर्ट गरियो, सुझाव अनुसार मानव-देखि-मानव सङ्क्रमण सम्भव थियो।
en-mt: On January 20, infections of health-care providers were reported, suggesting that human-to-human infection was possible.

sourceString: On January 23, the city of Wuhan was locked down with all its public transportation stopped.
targetString: जनवरी 23 मा, वुहान सहरलाई यसका सबै सार्वजनिक यातायात रोकेर बन्दाबन्दी गरिएको थियो।
en-mt: On January 23, the city of Wuhan was locked down by stopping all its public transport.

sourceString: On January 24 the first clinical study on the disease reported that, out of 41 patients with confirmed cases, only 21 had direct contact with the Wuhan seafood market that was considered the starting site of the infection from an unknown animal source.
targetString: जनवरी 24 मा रोगको पहिलो चिकित्सकीय अध्ययनले रिपोर्ट गर्‍यो कि पुष्टि भएका केसहरूको 41 बिरामीमध्ये 21 को मात्र वुहान समुद्री खानाको बजारमा प्रत्यक्ष सम्पर्क थियो जसलाई अज्ञात जनावर स्रोतबाट सङ्क्रमणको सुरु भएको स्थलको रूपमा मानिन्थ्यो।
en-mt: The first clinical study of the disease on January 24 reported that only 21 of the 41 patients with confirmed cases had direct contact with the Wuhan seafood market which was considered as the site of the onset of infection from an unknown animal source.

sourceString: On January 30, WHO declared the outbreak a global health emergency.
targetString: जनवरी 30 मा, WHO ले प्रकोपलाई विश्वव्यापी स्वास्थ्य आपतकाल घोषणा गर्‍यो।
en-mt: On January 30, WHO declared the outbreak a global health emergency.

sourceString: By the time of this report, the disease has already spread throughout China and near 50 other countries all over the world (Fig. ​(Fig.2).2).
targetString: यो रिपोर्टको समयमा, यो रोग चीन र संसारभरिका लगभग अन्य 50 देशहरूमा फैलिसकेको छ (चित्र ​(चित्र2) 2)।
en-mt: At the time of this report, the disease has spread to China and almost 50 other countries around the world (Figure 2)2).

sourceString: As the situation is rapidly evolving, the final scope and severity of the outbreak remain to be determined.
targetString: स्थिति द्रुत गतिमा विकसित हुँदै गर्दा, प्रकोपको अन्तिम क्षेत्र र गम्भीरता निर्धारित गर्न बाँकी छ।
en-mt: As the situation evolves rapidly, the final area and severity of the outbreak remains to be determined.

sourceString: On February 11, 2020, a multi-center study on 8,866 patients including 4,021 confirmed COVID-19 patients presented a more updated illustration of the epidemic as follows (https://mp.weixin.qq.com/s/UlBi-HX_rHPXa1qHA2bhdA).
targetString: 11 फेब्रुअरी, 2020 मा, 4,021 पुष्टि भएका COVID-19 बिरामीहरू सहित 8,866 बिरामीहरू बारे मल्टि-सेन्टर अध्ययनले यस महामारीको अधिक अद्यावधिक दृष्टान्त निम्नानुसार प्रस्तुत गरेको छ (https://mp.weixin.qq.com/s/UlBi-HX_rHPXa1qHA2bhdA)।
en-mt: On February 11, 2020, a multi-center study of 8,866 patients, including 4,021 confirmed COVID-19 patients, presented a more up-to-date illustration of this pandemic as follows (https://mp.weixin.qq.com/s/UlBi-HX_rHPXa1qHA2bhdA).

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 infected people of all ages, but mainly at the age of 30-65.
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 ले सबै उमेरका मानिसहरूलाई सङ्क्रमित गर्‍यो तर मुख्य रूपमा 30-65 को उमेरमा।
en-mt: SARS-CoV-2 infected people of all ages but mainly aged 30-65.

sourceString: Almost half (47.7%) of the infected individuals were over 50 years old, very few were under 20, and only 14 infected individuals were under the age of 10.
targetString: सङ्क्रमित व्यक्तिहरू मध्ये लगभग आधा (47.7%) 50 वर्ष माथिका थिए, 20 मुनिका धेरै कम थिए र 14 जना सङ्क्रमित व्यक्तिहरू 10 वर्ष मुनिका उमेरका थिए।
en-mt: Nearly half (47.7%) of the infected people were over the age of 50, very few were under 20, and 14 infected people were under the age of 10.

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 infected more men (0.31/100,000) than women (0.27/100,000).
en-mt: SARS-CoV-2 infected men (0.31/100,000) more than females (0.27/100,000).

sourceString: COVID-19 expanded in clusters mainly in and around Hubei.
targetString: COVID-19 मुख्य रूपमा हुबेई र आसपासमा समूहमा फैलिएको थियो।
en-mt: COVID-19 was mainly spread in groups in and around Hubei.

sourceString: COVID-19 took an average of 5 (2-9) days from onset to diagnosis.
targetString: COVID-19 देखिएदेखि निदान हुन औसत 5 (2-9) दिन लागेको थियो।
en-mt: It took an average of 5 (2-9) days to be diagnosed since the appearance of COVID-19.

sourceString: The average incubation period was 4.8 (3.0-7.2) days.
targetString: औसत इन्क्युबेसन अवधि 4.8 (3.0-7.2) दिन थियो।
en-mt: The average incubation period was 4.8 (3.0-7.2) days.

sourceString: The average time from onset to death was 9.5 (4.8-13) days.
targetString: लक्षण देखिएदेखि मृत्युसम्मको औसत समय 9.5 (4.8-13) दिन थियो।
en-mt: The average time from symptom onset to death was 9.5 (4.8-13) days.

sourceString: The basic reproductive number (R0) was 3.77 (95% CI: 3.51-4.05), and the adjusted R0 was 2.23-4.82.
en-mt: The baseline reproduction number (R0) was 3.77 (95% CI: 3.51-4.05) and the adjusted R0 was 2.23-4.82.

sourceString: The number of infected people increased exponentially before 23 Jan. 2020, matching the time of massive transportation before the Spring Festival in China.
targetString: चीनमा वसन्त महोत्सव भन्दा पहिले विशाल यातायातको समयसँग मिल्ने गरि, सङ्क्रमित व्यक्तिको संख्या 23 जनवरी 2020 भन्दा अघि द्रुत गतिमा बृद्धि भएको थियो।
en-mt: In Line with the time of huge transportation before the Spring Festival in China, the number of infected people increased rapidly before 23 January 2020.

sourceString: The mortality of patients with confirmed cases was 1.44% (95% CI: 1.10-1.86%), and the adjusted mortality of all the patients was 3.06% (95% CI: 2.02-4.59%).
en-mt: Patients with confirmed cases had a mortality rate of 1.44% (95% CI: 1.10-1.86%) and the adjusted mortality rate of patients was 3.06% (95% CI: 2.02-4.59%).

sourceString: Three major risk factors for COVID-19 were sex (male), age (≥60), and severe pneumonia.
targetString: COVID-19 को लागि तीन मुख्य कारक तत्त्वहरू लिङ्ग (पुरुष), उमेर (≥60) र गम्भीर निमोनियाँ हुन्।
en-mt: The three main causative factors for COVID-19 are gender (male), age (≥60) and severe pneumonia.

sourceString: CoVs are a subfamily of large and enveloped viruses containing a single strand of sense RNA.
targetString: CoVs चेतना RNA को एउटा स्ट्र्यान्ड समावेश भएका ठूला र बन्द भाइरसहरूका उपपरिवार हुन्।
en-mt: CoVs consciousness is a subfamily of large and closed viruses consisting of a strand of RNA.

sourceString: They can be divided into four genera, i.e., alpha, beta, gamma, and delta, of which alpha- and beta-CoVs are known to infect humans.
targetString: तिनीहरूलाई चार जेनेरामा विभाजन गर्न सकिन्छ, अर्थात् अल्फा, बेटा, गामा र डेल्टा, जसमा अल्फा- र बेटा-CoVs मानवलाई सङ्क्रमण गर्नेको रूपमा चिनिन्छन्।
en-mt: They can be divided into four genera, namely Alpha, Beta, Gamma, and Delta, in which Alpha- and Beta-CoVs are known to infect humans.

sourceString: The envelope spike (S) glycoprotein binds to its cellular receptors angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 (ACE2) and dipeptidyl peptidase 4 (DPP4) for SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV, respectively, and then membrane fusion occurs.
targetString: इन्भेलोप स्पाइक (S) ग्लिसेलोप्रोटिन यसका सेलुलर रिसेप्टर्स SARS-CoV र MERS-CoV का लागि क्रमशः एन्जियोटेन्सिन-कन्भर्टिङ इन्जाइम 2 (ACE2) र डाइपेप्टिडिल पेप्टिडेज 4 (DPP4) सँग बाँधिन्छ र त्यसपछि झिल्ली संयोजन हुन्छ।
en-mt: Envelope spike (S) glyceloprotein binds to angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 (ACE2) and dipeptidyl peptidase 4 (DPP4) for its cellular receptors SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV, respectively, and then membrane combination.

sourceString: The viral RNA genome is released into the cytoplasm; after replication of the viral genome, genomic RNA accompanied by envelope glycoproteins and nucleocapsid proteins forms virion-containing vesicles, which then fuse with the plasma membrane to release the virus.
targetString: भाइरल RNA जीनोम साइटोप्लाज्ममा छोडिन्छ; भाइरल जीनोमको प्रतिकृति पछि, जीनोमिक RNA सँगै इन्भेलोप ग्लाइकोप्रोटीन र न्यूक्लियोक्याप्सिड प्रोटिन ले विषाणु-युक्त पुलिकाहरू बनाउँछ, जुन त्यसपछि भाइरस छोड्नका लागि प्लाज्मा झिल्लीका साथ फ्युज हुन्छ।
en-mt: The viral RNA genome is left in the cytoplasm; After replication of the viral genome, genomic RNA along with envelope glycoprotein and nucleocapsid protein form virulence-containing pulica, which then fuse with the plasma membrane to release the virus.

sourceString: The first genomic sequence of SARS-CoV-2 was reported on January 10, 2020.
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 को पहिलो जीनोमिक अनुक्रम 10 जनवरी, 2020 मा बताइएको थियो।
en-mt: The first genomic sequence of SARS-CoV-2 was stated on January 10, 2020.

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 was found to be a new type of beta-CoV with more than 99.98% genetic identity among 10 sequenced samples collected from the original site of the outbreak, the Huanan Seafood Market in Wuhan.
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 एउटा बेटा-CoV को नयाँ प्रकार भएको पाइएको थियो जसमा प्रकोपको उद्गम स्थल वुहानको हुवानान समुद्री खानाको बजारबाट सङ्कलन गरिएका 10 अनुक्रममा 99.98% भन्दा बढी आनुवंशिक पहिचान भएको थियो।
en-mt: SARS-CoV-2 was found to be a new type of beta-CoV with more than 99.98% genetic identity in 10 sequences collected from the Huanan seafood market in Wuhan, the epicentre of the outbreak.

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 is genetically more similar to SARS-CoV than to MERS-CoV.
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 आनुवंशिक रूपमा MERS-CoV भन्दा SARS-CoV सँग बढी मिल्दोजुल्दो छ।
en-mt: SARS-CoV-2 is genetically more similar to SARS-CoV than MERS-CoV.

sourceString: Through transmission electron microscopy, SARS-CoV-2 particles were found in ultrathin sections of human airway epithelium.
targetString: इलेक्ट्रोन माइक्रोस्कोपी प्रसारण मार्फत, SARS-CoV-2 कणहरू मानवका वायुमार्ग इपिथेलियमका ज्यादै साना खण्डहरूमा पाइएका थिए।
en-mt: Through electron microscopy transmission, SARS-CoV-2 particles were found in very small sections of the airway epithelium of humans.

sourceString: Human ACE2 was found to be a receptor for SARS-CoV-2 as well as SARS-CoV.
targetString: मानव ACE2 SARS-CoV-2 को साथसाथै SARS-CoV को लागि रिसेप्टर भएको पाइयो।
en-mt: Human ACE2 was found to be the receptor for SARS-CoV-2 as well as SARS-CoV.

sourceString: However, the S protein of SARS-CoV-2 binds to human ACE2 more weakly than that of SARS-CoV, which is coincident with the fact that SARS-CoV-2 causes less severe infection in patients than SARS-CoV.
targetString: यद्यपि, SARS-CoV-2 को S प्रोटिन ACE2 सँग SARS-CoV भन्दा थप कमजोर रूपमा बाँधिन्छ, जुन SARS-CoV-2 ले बिरामीहरूमा SARS-CoV को भन्दा कम गम्भीर सङ्क्रमण गराउने तथ्य भएको घटना हो।
en-mt: However, the S protein of SARS-CoV-2 binds to ACE2 more weakly than SARS-CoV, which is a phenomenon of the fact that SARS-CoV-2 causes less severe infections in patients than SARS-CoV.

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 can also form a novel short protein encoded by orf3b and a secreted protein encoded by orf8.
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 पनि orf3b द्वारा साङ्केतिक शब्द दिइएको नयाँ छोटो प्रोटिन र orf8 द्वारा साङ्केतिक शब्द दिइएको उत्पादित प्रोटिन बनाउन सक्छ।
en-mt: SARS-CoV-2 can also form a new short protein given the sign word by Orf3b and a produced protein given the sign word by orf8.

sourceString: The orf3b of SARS-CoV-2 may play a role in the viral pathogenicity and inhibit the expression of IFNβ; however, orf8 does not contain any known functional domain or motif.
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 को orf3b ले भाइरल प्याथोजेनेसिटिमा भूमिका खेल्न सक्छ र IFNβ को अभिव्यक्तिलाई रोक्न सक्छ; यद्यपि, orf8 ले कुनै ज्ञात कार्यात्मक क्षेत्र वा विशेष लक्षण समावेश गर्दैन।
en-mt: ORF3b of SARS-CoV-2 may play a role in viral pathogenicity and inhibit the expression of IFNβ; However, ORF8 does not contain any known functional region or particular traits.

sourceString: On February 18, 2020, Zhou, et al., reported the cryo-EM structure of the full-length human ACE2 at 2.9 Å resolution in complex with the amino acid transporter B0AT1.
targetString: 18 फेब्रुअरी, 2020 मा, Zhou, et al. ले B0AT1 एमिनो एसिड ट्रान्सपोर्टर सँगको मिश्रणमा 2.9 Å रिजोलुशनमा पूर्ण-लम्बाइ मानव ACE2 को क्रायो-EM संरचना रिपोर्ट गर्‍यो।
en-mt: On February 18, 2020, Zhou, et al. reported the cryo-EM structure of full-length human ACE2 at 2.9 resolution in mixture with the B0AT1 amino acid transporter.

sourceString: They found that the complex, which had open and closed conformations, was assembled as a dimer and the ACE2-B0AT1 complex can bind two S proteins, which provides evidence for CoV recognition and infection.
targetString: तिनीहरूले खुला वा बन्द अनुरूपता भएको कम्प्लेक्स डाइमरको रूपमा जोडिएको र ACE2-B0AT1 कम्प्लेक्सले दुइटा S प्रोटिनहरूलाई बाँध्न सक्छ, जसले CoV पहिचान र सङ्क्रमणको लागि प्रमाण प्रदान गर्दछ।
en-mt: They are connected as open or closed conformity complex dimers and the ACE2-B0AT1 complex can bind to two S proteins, providing evidence for CoV identification and infection.

sourceString: B0AT1 may become a therapeutic target for drug screening to suppress SARS-CoV-2 infection.
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 सङ्क्रमण दबाउनका लागि B0AT1 ड्रग सुरक्षा जाँचको लागि एक चिकित्सकिय लक्ष्य बन्न सक्दछ।
en-mt: B0AT1 may become a medical target for drug safety checks to suppress SARS-CoV-2 infection.

sourceString: The origin and intermediate host
targetString: उद्गम र मध्यवर्ती होस्ट
en-mt: Origin and intermediate hosts

sourceString: It has been known that both SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV originated from bats and were transmitted to humans via civet cats and camels, respectively.
targetString: यो पत्ता लागेको छ कि SARS-CoV र MERS-CoV दुवै चमेराबाट उत्पत्ति भएका थिए र क्रमशः सिभेट बिरालाहरु र ऊँटहरूबाट मानवमा प्रसारित भएका थिए।
en-mt: It has been found that both SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV originated from bats and were transmitted to humans from civet cats and camels, respectively.

sourceString: Through a phylogenetic comparison of SARS-CoV-2 with other CoVs, bats were considered the native host of SARS-CoV-2 as the new virus is 96% identical to two SARS-like CoVs from bats called bat-SL-CoVZX45 and bat-SL-CoVZX21.
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 को अन्य CoVs सँग फाइलोजेनेटिक तुलना मार्फत, नयाँ भाइरस चमेराका दुई ओटा SARS-जस्ता CoVs ब्याट-SL-CoVZX45 र ब्याट-SL-CoVZX21सँग 96% मिल्दोजुल्दो भएकोले चमेराहरूलाई SARS-CoV-2 को नजिकको होस्ट मानिन्छ।
en-mt: Through phylogenetic comparison of SARS-CoV-2 with other CoVs, bats are considered close hosts of SARS-CoV-2, as two SARS-like CoVs bats are 96% identical to bat-SL-CoVZX45 and bat-SL-CoVZX21.

sourceString: However, what intermediate host helped the virus cross the species barrier to infect humans remains unknown, and the transmission route is yet to be elucidated.
targetString: यद्यपि, कुन मध्यवर्ती होस्टले भाइरसलाई प्रजातिहरूको अवरोध पार गरी मानवलाई सङ्क्रमित गर्न मद्दत गर्यो भन्ने अज्ञात रहन्छ र सङ्क्रमण मार्ग अझै स्पष्ट पारिन बाँकी छ।
en-mt: However, it remains unknown which intermediate host helped the virus infect humans by crossing the species barrier, and the transition pathway remains unclear.

sourceString: Ji, et al., proposed snakes as a carrier of the virus from bats to humans which involved homologous recombination within the S protein.
targetString: Ji, et al. ले सर्पलाई चमेरोबाट मानवमा भाइरसको वाहकको रूपमा प्रस्ताव गरे जसमा S प्रोटिन भित्र समरुप पुर्नसंयोजन सामिल थिए।
en-mt: Ji, et al. proposed the snake as a carrier of the virus from bats to humans that contained homologous recombination within the S protein.

sourceString: According to a study, researchers in Guangzhou, China, suggested that pangolins - long-snouted, ant-eating mammals often used in traditional Chinese medicine - are the potential intermediate host of SARS-CoV-2 based on 99% genetic homology in a CoV discovered in pangolins and SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: एक अध्ययन अनुसार, ग्वाङझाउ, चीनका अध्ययनकर्ताहरूले सालक - लामो-थुतुनो भएका, कमिला-खाने स्तनधारीहरू प्रायः परम्परागत चिनियाँ औषधिमा प्रयोग गरिन्छ - सालकमा भेट्टाइएका CoV र SARS-CoV-2 मा 99% आनुवंशिक समानता पाइएको आधारमा यिनीहरु SARS-CoV-2 का सम्भावित मध्यवर्ती होस्ट भएको सुझाव गरे।
en-mt: According to a study, researchers from Guangzhou, China, suggested that salk – long-specked, ant-eating mammals often used in traditional Chinese medicine – found in Salk — and SARS-CoV-2 found in Salk have a 99% genetic similarity, suggesting that they are potential intermediate hosts of SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: However, 1% difference spread all over two genomes is still a big difference; thus, conclusive results for concrete evidence are awaited (Fig. ​(Fig.33).
targetString: यद्यपि, दुई जिनोम भरि 1% प्रसारको भिन्नता ठूलो भिन्नता हो; यसर्थ, ठोस प्रमाणको लागि निर्णयात्मक परिणामहरूको प्रतीक्षा हुँदैछ (चित्र ​(चित्र33)।
en-mt: However, the difference of 1% prevalence across the two genomes is a large difference; Therefore, judgmental results are awaited for concrete evidence (Figure 33).

sourceString: The physicochemical properties of SARS-CoV-2 are largely not yet known.
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 भौतिक-रासायनिक गुणहरू अझै पनि धेरै थाहा भएका छैनन्।
en-mt: The physico-chemical properties of SARS-CoV-2 are still not very well known.

sourceString: SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV can survive in vitro for 48 hours in a dry environment and up to 5 days under 20 °C and 40%-50% humidity.
targetString: SARS-CoV र MERS-CoV शरीर बाहिर शुष्क वातावरणमा 48 घन्टासम्म र 20 °C भन्दा कम र 40%-50% आर्द्रतामा 5 दिनसम्म बाँच्न सक्छन्।
en-mt: SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV can live for up to 48 hours and less than 20 °C and up to 5 days in arid environments outside the body and at 40%-50% humidity.

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 may possess similar properties.
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 मा उस्तै गुणहरू हुन सक्छन्।
en-mt: SARS-CoV-2 may have similar properties.

sourceString: It has been reported that SARS-CoV-2 is sensitive to ultraviolet rays and heat at 56 °C for 30 minutes; ether, 75% ethanol, chlorine-containing disinfectant, peracetic acid, chloroform, and other fatty solvents, but not chlorhexidine, can effectively inactivate the virus.
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 परावैजनी किरणमा र 56 °C मा 30 मिनेटको लागि राखेमा संवेदनशील हुन्छ; 75% इथानोल, क्लोरिन-भएको डिसइन्फेक्टेन्ट, पारासेटिक एसिड, क्लोरोफर्म र अन्य चिल्लो घोलकहरू तर क्लोरहेक्सिडिन बाहेक अरूले भाइरसलाई प्रभावकारी रूपमा निष्क्रिय बनाउन सक्छन्।
en-mt: SARS-CoV-2 is sensitive to ultraviolet rays and at 56 °C when kept for 30 minutes; 75% ethanol, chlorine-containing disinfectants, parasetic acid, chloroform and other greasy solvents but none other than chlorhexidine can effectively neutralize the virus.

sourceString: The entire human population generally lacks immunity to SARS-CoV-2 and hence is susceptible to the novel virus.
targetString: सम्पूर्ण मानव जनसङ्ख्यामा साधारणतया SARS-CoV-2 मा रोगसँग लड्ने क्षमताको कामी हुन्छ र तसर्थ नोवेल भाइरसमा शङ्कास्पद हुन्छ।
en-mt: The entire human population generally has the ability to fight the disease in SARS-CoV-2 and is therefore suspected of the novel virus.

sourceString: Currently, no detailed study has been reported regarding the immunological response to SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: हाल, SARS-CoV-2 को प्रतिरोधात्मक प्रतिक्रियाको बारेमा कुनै विस्तृत अध्ययन रिपोर्ट गरिएको छैन।
en-mt: Currently, no detailed studies have been reported regarding the resistive response of SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: Thus, we can only refer to previous studies on other CoVs, especially SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV (Fig. ​(Fig.4).4).
targetString: यसर्थ, हामी अन्य CoV हरू माथि अघिल्ला अध्ययनहरूलाई मात्र उल्लेख गर्न सक्छौँ, विशेष गरी SARS-CoV र MERS-CoV (चित्र(चित्र 4).4)।
en-mt: Therefore, we can only refer to previous studies on other CoVs, most notably SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV (Figure (Figure 4).4).

sourceString: In general, after a virus invades the host, it is first recognized by the host innate immune system through pattern recognition receptors (PRRs) including C-type lectin-like receptors, Toll-like receptor (TLR), NOD-like receptor (NLR), and RIG-I-like receptor (RLR).
targetString: सामान्यतया, भाइरसले होस्टलाई आक्रमण गरेपछि, यो सर्वप्रथम C-टाइप लेक्टिन-जस्ता प्रापक, टोल-जस्ता प्रापक (TLR), NOD-जस्ता प्रापक (NLR) र RIG-I-जस्ता प्रापक (RLR) सहित ढाँचा पहिचान प्रापकहरु (PRRs) मार्फत होस्ट जन्मजात प्रतिरक्षा प्रणाली द्वारा पहिचान गरिन्छ।
en-mt: Typically, after the virus has attacked the host, it is first identified by the host innate immune system through pattern recognition recipients (PRRs), including the C-type lectin-like recipient, Toll-like recipient (TLR), NOD-like recipient (NLR), and rig-I-like recipient (RLR).

sourceString: Through different pathways, the virus induces the expression of inflammatory factors, maturation of dendritic cells, and synthesis of type I interferons (IFNs) which limit the spreading of the virus and accelerate macrophage phagocytosis of viral antigens.
targetString: विभिन्न मार्गहरू मार्फत भाइरसले सुजनका कारकहरू, डेन्ड्रिटिक कोषहरूको परिपक्वता, र टाइप आई इन्टरफेरन्स (IFNs) को संश्लेषणको अभिव्यक्तिलाई प्रेरित गर्दछ जसले भाइरसको फैलावटलाई सीमित गर्दछ र भाइरल एन्टिजेन्सको म्याक्रोफेज फागोसाइटोसिसलाई तीव्र पार्छ।
en-mt: Through various pathways the virus induces the expression of inflammatory factors, maturation of dendritic cells, and synthesis of type I interferons (IFNs) that limit the spread of the virus and accelerate macrophage phagocytosis of viral antigens.

sourceString: However, the N protein of SARS-CoV can help the virus escape from the immune responses.
targetString: यद्यपि, SARS-CoV को N प्रोटिनले भाइरसलाई प्रतिरक्षा प्रतिक्रियाहरूबाट जोगिन मद्दत गर्दछ।
en-mt: However, the N protein of SARS-CoV helps the virus avoid immune responses.

sourceString: Soon, the adaptive immune response joins the fight against the virus.
targetString: चाँडै, अनुकूलन प्रतिरक्षा प्रतिक्रिया भाइरस बिरूद्ध लडाइमा सामिल हुन्छ।
en-mt: Soon, the adaptive immune response joins the fight against the virus.

sourceString: T lymphocytes including CD4+ and CD8+ T cells play an important role in the defense.
targetString: प्रतिरक्षामा CD4+ र CD8+ T कोषहरू सहितको T लिम्फोसाइट्सले महत्त्वपूर्ण भूमिका खेल्छ।
en-mt: T lymphocytes, including CD4+ and CD8+ T cells, play an important role in immunity.

sourceString: CD4+ T cells stimulate B cells to produce virus-specific antibodies, and CD8+ T cells directly kill virus-infected cells.
targetString: CD4+ T कोषहरूले भाइरस-विशिष्ट एन्टिबडीहरू उत्पादन गर्न B कोषहरूलाई उत्तेजित गर्दछन्, र CD8+ T कोषहरूले भाइरस-सङ्क्रमित कोषहरूलाई सिधै मार्दछन्।
en-mt: CD4+T cells stimulate B cells to produce virus-specific antibodies, and CD8+T cells directly kill virus-infected cells.

sourceString: T helper cells produce proinflammatory cytokines to help the defending cells.
targetString: रक्षक कोषहरूलाई सहयोग गर्न T सहयोगी कोषहरूले प्रोइन्फ्लेमेटरी साइटोकाइन्स उत्पादन गर्छन्।
en-mt: T helper cells produce proinflammatory cytokines to support protector cells.

sourceString: However, CoV can inhibit T cell functions by inducing apoptosis of T cells.
targetString: यद्यपि, CoV ले T कोषहरूको एपोप्टोसिस उपपादन गरी T कोषका प्रकार्यहरूलाई प्रतिरोध गर्न सक्छ।
en-mt: However, CoV can inhibit the functions of T cells by underproducting apoptosis of T cells.

sourceString: The humoral immunity including complements such as C3a and C5a and antibodies is also essential in combating the viral infection.
targetString: C3a र C5a र एन्टिबडी जस्ता पूरक सहित ह्युमरल प्रतिरक्षा पनि भाइरल सङ्क्रमणसँग लड्न आवश्यक छ।
en-mt: Humoral immunity, including C3a and supplements such as C5a and antibodies, is also necessary to fight viral infections.

sourceString: For example, antibodies isolated from a recovered patient neutralized MERS-CoV.
targetString: उदाहरणका लागि, निको भएको बिरामीबाट अलग गरिएका एन्टिबडीहरुले MERS-CoV लाई तटस्थ गरिदियो।
en-mt: For example, antibodies isolated from recovered patients neutralized MERS-CoV.

sourceString: On the other hand, an overreaction of the immune system generates a large number of free radicals locally that can cause severe damages to the lungs and other organs, and, in the worst scenario, multi-organ failure and even death.
targetString: अर्कोतर्फ, रोग प्रतिरोधात्मक प्रणालीको अनावश्यक प्रतिक्रिया स्थानीय रूपमा धेरै सङ्ख्यामा स्वतन्त्र रेडिकल सृजना गर्छ जसले फोक्सो र अन्य अङ्गहरूमा गम्भीर क्षति र सबभन्दा खराब अवस्थामा, बहु-अङ्ग विफलता र मृत्यु पनि हुन सक्छ।
en-mt: On the other hand, the immune system's unnecessary response locally creates a large number of independent radicals that can cause severe damage to the lungs and other organs and, at worst of all, multi-organ failure and even death.

sourceString: The SARS-CoV-2 infection, featured by clustering onset, is more likely to affect elderly people with comorbidities and pregnant women.
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 सङ्क्रमण, सामूहिक सुरुवात द्वारा चित्रित हुने, सहरुग्णता भएका वृद्ध मानिसहरू र गर्भवती महिलाहरूलाई प्रभावित गर्ने धेरै सम्भावना छ।
en-mt: SARS-CoV-2 infection, to be characterized by mass onset, is very likely to affect older people with comorbidities and pregnant women.

sourceString: It is common that for people who are exposed to a large number of viruses or whose immune functions are compromised, they have higher chance to be infected than others.
targetString: यो सामान्य छ कि ठूलो संख्यामा भाइरसको सम्पर्कमा आएका व्यक्तिहरू वा जसका प्रतिरक्षा कार्यहरू सम्झौता गरिएका छन्, तिनीहरूमा अरू भन्दा सङ्क्रमित हुने बढी सम्भावना हुन्छ।
en-mt: It is common that a large number of people who have been exposed to the virus or whose immune functions are compromised are more likely to be infected than others.

sourceString: The estimated mean incubation period of SARS-CoV-2 is 1-14 days, mostly 3-7 days based on a study of the first 425 cases in Wuhan.
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 को अनुमानित औसत इन्क्युबेसन अवधि 1-14 दिन हुन्छ, धेरैजसो वुहानमा पहिला 425 केसहरूको अध्ययनको आधारमा 3-7 दिन हुन्छ।
en-mt: The estimated average incubation period of SARS-CoV-2 is 1-14 days, mostly 3-7 days based on the previously studied 425 cases in Wuhan.

sourceString: However, a study on 1,099 cases demonstrates that the incubation period was 3 days on average and ranged from 0 to 24 days.
targetString: यद्यपि, 1,099 मामिलाहरूको एक अध्ययनले इन्क्युबेसन अवधि औसतमा 3 दिन भएको र 0 देखि 24 दिनको दायरामा भएको देखाउँछ।
en-mt: However, a study of 1,099 cases shows that the incubation period is on average 3 days and ranges from 0 to 24 days.

sourceString: A more recent study, as described above, demonstrates that the incubation period was 4.8 (3.0-7.2) days based on the demography of 8,866 cases.
targetString: माथि वर्णन गरिए अनुसारको अर्को हालको अध्ययनले देखाउँछ कि 8,866 केसहरूको जनसङ्ख्याको अध्ययनको आधारमा इन्क्युबेसन अवधि 4.8 (3.0-7.2) दिन थियो।
en-mt: Another recent study as described above shows that the incubation period was 4.8 (3.0-7.2) days, based on a study of a population of 8,866 cases.

sourceString: It is very important for health authorities to adjust the effective quarantine time based on the most accurate incubation period, thus preventing infected but symptomless people from transmitting the virus to others.
targetString: स्वास्थ्य निकायहरूले सबैभन्दा मिल्दो इन्क्युबेसन अवधिमा आधारित प्रभावकारी क्वारेन्टाइन समय समायोजन गर्नु धेरै महत्त्वपूर्ण छ, जसले सङ्क्रमित तर लक्षणविहीन मानिसहरूले अरूमा भाइरस प्रसारण गर्नबाट रोक्छ।
en-mt: It is very important for health agencies to adjust effective quarantine times based on the most matched incubation period, which prevents infected but asymptomatic people from transmitting the virus to others.

sourceString: As a common practice, individuals exposed to, or infected by, the virus are usually required to be quarantined for 14 days.
targetString: सामान्य अभ्यासको रूपमा, भाइरसको सम्पर्कमा आएका वा द्वारा सङ्क्रमित, व्यक्तिहरू लाई सामान्यतया 14 दिनको लागि अलग राख्न आवश्यक हुन्छ।
en-mt: As a normal practice, individuals who have been exposed to or infected with the virus usually need to be isolated for 14 days.

sourceString: Should the quarantine time be extended to 24 days?
targetString: क्वारेन्टाइनको समय 24 दिनसम्म बढाउनु पर्छ?
en-mt: Should quarantine time be extended to 24 days?

sourceString: Fever is often the major and initial symptom of COVID-19, which can be accompanied by no symptom or other symptoms such as dry cough, shortness of breath, muscle ache, dizziness, headache, sore throat, rhinorrhea, chest pain, diarrhea, nausea, and vomiting.
targetString: COVID-19 को मुख्य र प्रारम्भिक लक्षण ज्वरो हो, जुनसँग कुनै अरू कुनै लक्षण नहुन वा सुक्खा खोकी, स्वाँस्वाँ, मांसपेशी दुखाइ, रिँगटा, टाउको दुखाइ, घाँटी पाछ्ने, नाकबाट पानी बग्ने, छातीको दुखाइ, पखाला, वाकवाकी र बान्ता जस्ता लक्षणहरू हुन सक्छन्।
en-mt: The main and early symptoms of COVID-19 are fever, which may have no other symptoms or symptoms such as dry cough, shortness of breath, muscle pain, ringworm, headache, sore throat, runny nose, chest pain, diarrhea, nausea and vomiting.

sourceString: Some patients experienced dyspnea and/or hypoxemia one week after the onset of the disease.
targetString: केही बिरामीहरूले रोग देखिएको एक हप्तापछि श्वासप्रश्वासमा कठिनाइ र/वा हाइपोक्सेमियाको अनुभव गरे।
en-mt: Some patients experienced breathing difficulties and/or hypoxemia one week after the onset of the disease.

sourceString: In severe cases, patients quickly progressed to develop acute respiratory syndrome, septic shock, metabolic acidosis, and coagulopathy.
targetString: गम्भीर अवस्थाहरूमा, बिरामीहरूले द्रुत गतिमा श्वासप्रश्वास सिन्ड्रोम, सेप्टिक झट्का, मेटाबोलिक एसिडोसिस र कगुलोप्याथी विकास गर्न प्रगति गरे।
en-mt: In severe conditions, patients rapidly progressed to develop respiratory syndrome, septic shock, metabolic acidosis and coagulopathy.

sourceString: Patients with fever and/or respiratory symptoms and acute fever, even without pulmonary imaging abnormalities, should be screened for the virus for early diagnosis.
targetString: ज्वरो र/वा श्वासप्रश्वास लक्षणहरू र तीव्र ज्वरो, पल्मोनरी इमेजिङ एब्नर्मालिटिज बिना पनि प्रारम्भिक निदानको लागि भाइरसको जाँच गरिनु पर्छ।
en-mt: The virus should be screened for early diagnosis, even without fever and/or respiratory symptoms and acute fever, pulmonary imaging abnormalities.

sourceString: A demographic study in late December of 2019 showed that the percentages of the symptoms were 98% for fever, 76% for dry cough, 55% for dyspnea, and 3% for diarrhea; 8% of the patients required ventilation support.
targetString: 2019 को पछिल्लो डिसेम्बरमा गरिएको एक जनसांख्यिकीय अध्ययनले देखायो कि लक्षणहरूको प्रतिशत ज्वरोको लागि 98%, सुक्खा खोकीको लागि 76%, डिस्प्नियाको लागि 55% र पखालाको लागि 3%; बिरामीहरूको 8% लाई भेन्टिलेसन सहायताको आवश्यकता छ।
en-mt: A demographic study conducted in the last December of 2019 showed that the percentage of symptoms was 98% for fever, 76% for dry cough, 55% for dyspnea and 3% for diarrhea; 8% of patients need ventilation assistance.

sourceString: Similar findings were reported in two recent studies of a family cluster and a cluster caused by transmission from an asymptomatic individual.
targetString: त्यस्तै खोजहरू एक परिवार समूह र लक्षण विहीन व्यक्तिबाट सङ्क्रमणका कारण निर्मित समूहका दुई भर्खरका अध्ययनहरूमा रिपोर्ट गरिएका थिए।
en-mt: Similar findings were reported in two recent studies of a family group and a group created by infection from asymptomatic individuals.

sourceString: Comparably, a demographic study in 2012 showed that MERS-CoV patients also had fever (98%), dry cough (47%), and dyspnea (55%) as their main symptoms.
targetString: तुलनात्मक रुपमा, 2012 मा एक जनसांख्यिकीय अध्ययनले देखायो कि MERS-CoV बिरामीहरूलाई ज्वरो (98%), सुक्खा खोकी (47%) र डिस्पेनिया (55%) पनि मुख्य लक्षणहरू का रुपमा थिए।
en-mt: In comparison, a demographic study in 2012 showed that MERS-CoV patients had fever (98%), dry cough (47%) and dyspnea (55%) as main symptoms.

sourceString: However, 80% of them required ventilation support, much more than COVID-19 patients and consistent with the higher lethality of MERS than of COVID-19.
targetString: यद्यपि, तिनीहरू मध्ये 80% लाई भेन्टिलेसनको सहायता आवश्यक थियो, जुन COVID-19 बिरामीहरू भन्दा ज्यादै बढी थियो र COVID-19 भन्दा पनि MERS जस्तै उच्च प्राणघातक थियो।
en-mt: However, 80% of them required the help of ventilation, which was significantly higher than that of COVID-19 patients and was even more lethal as MERS than COVID-19.

sourceString: Diarrhea (26%) and sore throat (21%) were also observed with MERS patients.
targetString: पखाला (26%) र घाँटी दुख्ने (21%) पनि MERS का बिरामीहरूमा देखिएका थिए।
en-mt: Diarrhea (26%) and sore throat (21%) were also seen in patients with MERS.

sourceString: In SARS patients, it has been demonstrated that fever (99%-100%), dry cough (29%-75%), dyspnea (40%-42%), diarrhea (20-25%), and sore throat (13-25%) were the major symptoms and ventilation support was required for approximately 14%-20% of the patients.
targetString: SARS का बिरामीहरूमा, ज्वरो (99%-100%), सुक्खा खोकी (29%-75%), श्वासप्रश्वासमा कठिनाइ (40%-42%), पखाला (20-25%) र घाँटी पाछ्ने (13-25%) मुख्य लक्षण भएको र 14%-20% बिरामीहरूलाई भेन्टिलेसन सहायता आवश्यक भएको देखिएको छ।
en-mt: In patients with SARS, fever (99%-100%), dry cough (29%-75%), difficulty in breathing (40%-42%), diarrhea (20-25%) and sore throat (13-25%) are the main symptoms and 14%-20% of patients are found to require ventilation assistance.

sourceString: By February 14, the mortality of COVID-19 was 2% when the confirmed cases reached 66,576 globally.
targetString: फेब्रुअरी 14 सम्म, विश्वव्यापी रूपमा पुष्टि भएका मामिलाहरू 66,576 पुग्दा COVID-19 को मृत्युदर 2% थियो।
en-mt: As of February 14, the mortality rate of COVID-19 was 2% when confirmed cases reached 66,576 worldwide.

sourceString: Comparably, the mortality of SARS by November 2002 was 10% of 8,096 confirmed cases.
targetString: तुलनात्मक रूपमा नोभेम्बर 2002 सम्म SARS को मृत्यु 8,096 निश्चित केसहरूको 10% थियो।
en-mt: By comparison, as of November 2002, SARS deaths accounted for 10% of the 8,096 confirmed cases.

sourceString: For MERS, based on a demographic study in June 2012, the mortality was 37% of 2,494 confirmed cases.
targetString: MERS को लागि, जुन 2012 को जनसाङ्ख्यिक अध्ययनमा आधारित हुँदा, मृत्युदर पुष्टि भएका 2,494 केसहरूको 37% थियो।
en-mt: For MERS, based on a 2012 demographic study, mortality was 37% of the 2,494 confirmed cases.

sourceString: An earlier study reported that the R0 of SARS-CoV-2 was as high as 6.47 with a 95% confidence interval (CI) of 5.71-7.23, whereas the R0 of SARS-CoV only ranged from 2 to 4.
targetString: एक अघिल्लो अध्ययनले SARS-CoV-2 को R0 95% विश्वास अन्तराल (CI) 5.71-7.23 का साथ 6.47 जति माथि थियो, यसैगरी SARS-CoV को R0 2 देख 4 सम्म मात्र विस्तारित थियो भनी रिपोर्ट गर्‍यो।
en-mt: A previous study reported that the R0 of SARS-CoV-2 was as high as 6.47 with a 95% confidence interval (CI) of 5.71-7.23, similarly the R0 of SARS-CoV extended only to 2 looking 4.

sourceString: A comparison of SARS-CoV-2 with MERS-CoV and SARA-CoV regarding their symptoms, mortality, and R0 is presented in Table ​Table1.1.
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 को MERS-CoV र SARA-CoV सँग तिनीहरूका लक्षण, मृत्युदर र R0 अनुसार तुलनालाई तालिका तालिका 1.1. मा प्रस्तुत गरिएको छ।
en-mt: Comparison of SARS-CoV-2 with MERS-CoV and SARA-CoV according to their symptoms, mortality, and R0 table Table 1.1. is presented in.

sourceString: The above figures suggest that SARS-CoV-2 has a higher ability to spread than MERS-CoV and SARS-CoV, but it is less lethal than the latter two.
targetString: माथिका चित्रहरूले SARS-CoV-2 फैलिने MERS-CoV र SARS-CoV भन्दा उच्च क्षमता हुन्छ, यो पछिल्ला दुइटा भन्दा कम घातक हुन्छ।
en-mt: As shown above, SARS-CoV-2 has a higher capacity than MERS-CoV and SARS-CoV spreading, making it less deadly than the latter two.

sourceString: Thus, it is much more challenging to control the epidemic of SARS-CoV-2 than those of MERS-CoV and SARS-CoV.
targetString: यसर्थ, SARS-CoV-2 को महामारी नियन्त्रण गर्न MERS-CoV र SARS-CoV भन्दा ज्यादै बढी चुनौतीपूर्ण छ।
en-mt: Therefore, controlling the epidemic of SARS-CoV-2 is much more challenging than MERS-CoV and SARS-CoV.

sourceString: Clustered onset often happens in the same family or from the same gathering or vehicle such as a cruise ship.
targetString: सामूहिक आरम्भ प्रायः एकै परिवारमा वा उस्तै भेला वा सवारी साधन जस्तै क्रुज जहाजबाट हुन्छ।
en-mt: Collective beginnings usually occur in the same family or by the same gatherings or vehicles, such as a cruise ship.

sourceString: Patients often have a history of travel or residence in Wuhan or other affected areas or contact with infected individuals or patients in the recent two weeks before the onset.
targetString: बिरामीहरूका प्राय: वुहान वा अन्य प्रभावित क्षेत्रहरूमा यात्रा वा बसोवास गरेको वा लक्षण देखिनुअघि हालैको दुई हप्तामा सङ्क्रमित व्यक्तिहरू वा बिरामीहरूको सम्पर्कमा आएको इतिहास हुन्छ।
en-mt: Patients often have a history of traveling or settling in Wuhan or other affected areas or coming into contact with infected people or patients in the recent two weeks before symptoms appear.

sourceString: However, it has been reported that people can carry the virus without symptoms longer than two weeks and cured patients discharged from hospitals can carry the virus again, which sends out an alarm to increase the time for quarantine.
targetString: यद्यपि, मानिसहरूले दुई हप्ताभन्दा बढीसम्म लक्षणबिना भाइरस बोक्न सक्छन् र अस्पतालबाट डिस्चार्ज भएका उपचार गरिएका बिरामीले फेरि भाइरस बोक्न सक्छन् भन्ने रिपोर्ट गरिएको छ, जसले क्वारेन्टाइनको लागि समय बढाउन चेतावनी दिन्छ।
en-mt: However, it has been reported that people can carry the virus without symptoms for more than two weeks, and treated patients discharged from the hospital can carry the virus again, warning of extending the time for quarantine.

sourceString: Patients have normal or reduced number of peripheral white blood cells (especially lymphocytes) at the early stage.
targetString: सुरुको चरणमा बिरामीहरूमा सामान्य वा घटेको गौण सेतो रक्तकोषको सङ्ख्या (विशेष गरी लिम्फोसाइटहरू) थियो।
en-mt: Patients in the early stages had normal or decreased secondary white blood cell numbers (especially lymphocytes).

sourceString: For example, lymphopenia with white blood cell count < 4×109/L including lymphocyte count < 1×109/L, and elevated aspartate aminotransferase levels and viremia were found in 1,099 COVID-19 patients.
targetString: उदाहरणका लागी, सेतो रक्त कोष गणना < 4×109/L सहित लिम्फोपेनिया र लिम्फोसाइट गणना < 1×109/L र उन्नत एस्पार्टेट एमिनोट्रान्सफेरेस स्तरहरु र भिरेमिया 1,099 COVID-19 बिरामीहरूमा फेला परेका थिए।
en-mt: For example, lymphopenia and lymphocyte counts including white blood cell count < 4×109/L < 1×109/L and elevated aspartate aminotransferase levels and viremia were found in 1,099 COVID-19 patients.

sourceString: The levels of liver and muscle enzymes and myoglobin were increased in the blood of some patients, and C-reactive protein and erythrocyte sedimentation were increased in the blood of most patients.
targetString: केही बिरामीहरूको रगतमा कलेजो र मांसपेशीहरूका इन्जाइमहरू र मायोग्लोबिनको स्तरमा वृद्धि गरिएको थियो र केही बिरामीहरूको रगतमा C-रियाक्टिभ प्रोटिन र इराइथ्रोसाइट अवसादन बढाइएको थियो।
en-mt: The levels of liver and muscle enzymes and myoglobin were increased in the blood of some patients and increased C-reactive protein and erythrocyte sedimentation in the blood of some patients.

sourceString: In patients with severe cases, the level of D-dimer, a fibrin degradation product present in the blood, was elevated, and lymphocyte count was progressively reduced.
targetString: गम्भीर अवस्थामा भएका बिरामीहरू, D-dimer को स्तर, रगतमा रहने एक फाइब्रिन गिरावट उत्पादन, उच्च गरिएको थियो र लिम्फोसाइट गणना क्रमशः कम गरिएको थियो।
en-mt: Patients with severe conditions, D-dimer levels, producing a fibrin degradation that remains in the blood, were elevated and lymphocyte counts were gradually reduced.

sourceString: Abnormalities in chest radiography are found in most COVID-19 patients and featured by bilateral patchy shadows or ground glass opacity in the lungs.
targetString: धेरैजसो COVID-19 का बिरामीहरूमा छातीको रेडियोलोजीमा असामान्यताहरू फेला पर्छन् र यो फोक्सोमा द्विपक्षीय विविध छायाँ वा धूलो सिसाको अपारदर्शिता सँगै देखिन्छ।
en-mt: Abnormalities are found in chest radiology in most COVID-19 patients and this is seen alongside the opaqueness of bilaterally diverse shadows or dusty glass in the lungs.

sourceString: Patients often develop an atypical pneumonia, acute lung injury, and acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS).
targetString: बिरामीहरूमा प्राय: विचित्र निमोनियाँ, तीव्र फोक्सोमा चोटपटक र तीव्र श्वासप्रश्वास तनाव सिन्ड्रोम (ARDS) विकास हुन्छ।
en-mt: Patients often develop bizarre pneumonia, acute lung injury, and acute respiratory stress syndrome (ARDS).

sourceString: When ARDS happens, uncontrolled inflammation, fluid accumulation, and progressive fibrosis severely compromise the gas exchange.
targetString: ARDS हुँदा, अनियन्त्रित सुजन, तरल पदार्थ संचय र प्रगतिशील फाइब्रोसिसले गम्भीर रूपले ग्यास आदानप्रदानमा सम्झौता गर्दछन्।
en-mt: When ARDS occurs, uncontrolled swelling, fluid accumulation and progressive fibrosis severely compromise gas exchange.

sourceString: Dysfunction of type-I and type-II pneumocytes decreases the surfactant level and increases surface tension, thus reducing the ability of the lungs to expand and heightening the risk of lung collapse.
targetString: प्रकार-I र प्रकार-II न्यूमोसाइट्सको खराबीले सर्फेक्टेन्ट स्तर कम गर्दछ र सर्फेस टेन्सन वृद्धि गर्दछ, यसर्थ यसले फोक्सोको विस्तार हुने क्षमता कम गर्दछ फोक्सोको घातको जोखिम वृद्धि गर्दछ।
en-mt: Malfunctionof type-I and type-II pneumocytes reduces surfactant levels and increases surface tension, so it reduces the lung's ability to expand and increases the risk of lung malignancy.

sourceString: Therefore, the worst chest radiographic findings often parallel the most severe extent of the disease.
targetString: तसर्थ, सबैभन्दा खराब छाती रेडियोग्राफिक खोजहरू प्रायः जसो रोगको सबैभन्दा गम्भीर हदसँग समानान्तर हुन्छ।
en-mt: Therefore, the worst chest radiographic findings often parallel the most severe extent of the disease.

sourceString: On February 18, 2020, the first pathological analysis of COVID-19 demonstrated the desquamation of pneumocytes, hyaline membrane formation, and interstitial lymphocyte infiltration, and multinucleated syncytial cells in the lungs of a patient who died of the disease, consistent with the pathology of viral infection and ARDS and similar to that of SARS and MERS patients.
targetString: फेब्रुअरी 18, 2020 मा COVID-19 को पहिलो प्याथोलोजिकल विश्लेषणले न्यूमोसाइट्सको डिस्क्वेमेशन, हाएलिन झिल्ली गठन र मध्यवर्ती लिम्फोसाइट इन्फिल्ट्रेशन लाई प्रदर्शन गर्‍यो, र यस रोगबाट मर्ने बिरामीको फोक्सोमा भाइरल सङ्क्रमण र ARDS रोग विज्ञानसँग मिल्दो र SARS र MERS बिरामीहरूको जस्तै सिन्सिसल कोषहरू मल्टिन्युक्लेट गर्यो।
en-mt: The first pathological analysis of COVID-19 on February 18, 2020, demonstrated the discovery of pneumocytes, haelin membrane formation and intermediate lymphocyte infiltration, and multinucleated the sinusal cells similar to viral infection and ARDS pathology in the lungs of patients dying from this disease and multinucleated like THOSE of SARS and MERS patients.
