sourceString: The detection of SARS-CoV-2 RNA via reverse-transcriptase polymerase chain reaction (RT-PCR) was used as the major criteria for the diagnosis of COVID-19.
targetString: रिभर्स-ट्रासन्क्रिप्टेस पोलिमरेज चेन रियाक्सन (RT-PCR) मार्फत SARS-CoV-2 RNA को पहिचानलाई COVID-19 को निदानको लागि मुख्य मापदण्डको रूपमा प्रयोग गरिएको थियो।
en-mt: Identification of SARS-CoV-2 RNA via reverse-trussyphrase polymerase chain reaction (RT-PCR) was used as the main criteria for diagnosing COVID-19.

sourceString: However, due to the high false-negative rate, which may accelerate the epidemic, clinical manifestations started to be used for diagnosis (which no longer solely relied on RT-PCR) in China on February 13, 2020.
targetString: यद्यपि, उच्च गलत-नकारात्मक दरको कारण, जसले महामारीको गति बढाउन सक्छ, फेब्रुअरी 13, 2020 मा चीनमा निदानका लागि क्लिनिकल अभिव्यक्तिहरू (जुन अब केवल RT-PCR मा निर्भर थिएन) प्रयोग गर्न सुरु गरियो।
en-mt: However, due to the high false-negative rate, which could accelerate the pace of the epidemic, clinical manifestations (which were no longer dependent solely on RT-PCR) were started in China on February 13, 2020.

sourceString: A similar situation also occurred with the diagnosis of SARS.
targetString: SARS को निदानमा पनि उस्तै अवस्था देखिएको थियो।
en-mt: A similar situation was observed in the diagnosis of SARS.

sourceString: Therefore, a combination of disease history, clinical manifestations, laboratory tests, and radiological findings is essential and imperative for making an effective diagnosis.
targetString: तसर्थ, प्रभावकारी निदानका लागि रोगको इतिहास, क्लिनिकल अभिव्यक्ति, प्रयोगशाला परीक्षण र रेडियोलोजिकल खोजहरूको संयोजन आवश्यक र अनिवार्य छ।
en-mt: Therefore, a combination of disease history, clinical manifestations, laboratory tests and radiological findings is necessary and essential for effective diagnosis.

sourceString: On February 14, 2020, the Feng Zhang group described a protocol of using the CRISPR-based SHERLOCK technique to detect SARS-CoV-2, which detects synthetic SARS-CoV-2 RNA fragments at 20 × 10-18 mol/L to 200 × 10-18 mol/L (10-100 copies per microliter of input) using a dipstick in less than an hour without requiring elaborate instrumentation.
targetString: फेब्रुअरी 14, 2020 मा, फङ चाङ समूहले SARS-CoV-2 पहिचान गर्न CRISPR-आधारित SHERLOCK तरिका प्रयोग गर्ने प्रोटोकल वर्णन गर्‍यो, जसले विस्तृत उपकरणहरूको आवश्यकताबिना एक घन्टाभन्दा कम समयमा डिपस्टिकको प्रयोग गरेर 20 × 10-18 mol/L देखि 200 × 10-18 mol/L (प्रति माइक्रोलिटर इनपुटमा 10-100 प्रतिहरू) मा संश्लेषित SARS-CoV-2 RNA फ्र्यागमेन्टहरूको पहिचान गर्दछ।
en-mt: On February 14, 2020, The Fung Chang Group described a protocol using a CRISPR-based SHERLOCK method to identify SARS-CoV-2, which identifies 10-18 mol/L × 200 × 10-18 mol/L (10-100 copies per microliter input) synthesized in 10-18 mol/L (10-100 copies per microliter input) using dipsticks in less than an hour without the need for detailed equipment.

sourceString: Hopefully, the new technique can dramatically enhance the sensitivity and convenience if verified in clinical samples.
targetString: आशावादी रूपमा, चिकित्सकीय नमुनाहरूमा प्रमाणित भएमा नयाँ तरिकाहरूले संवेदनशीलता र सुविधालाई नाटकीय रूपमा सुधार गर्न सक्छन्।
en-mt: Optimistically, new methods can dramatically improve sensitivity and convenience if proven in medical samples.

sourceString: Due to the lack of experience with the novel CoV, physicians can mainly provide supportive care to COVID-19 patients, while attempting a variety of therapies that have been used or proposed before for the treatment of other CoVs such as SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV and other viral diseases (Table ​(Table2).2).
targetString: नोवेल CoV सँगको अनुभवको कमीको कारणले गर्दा चिकित्सकहरूले COVID-19 बिरामीहरूलाई मुख्यतया सहयोगी हेरचाह प्रदान गर्न सक्छन्,जबकि SARS-CoV र MERS-CoV जस्तै अन्य CoVs र अन्य भाइरल रोगहरूको उपचारको लागि पहिले प्रयोग वा प्रस्ताव गरिएका विभिन्न उपचार पद्धति को प्रयत्‍न गर्दै (टेबल(टेबल2).2)।
en-mt: Due to the lack of experience with novel CoV, physicians can provide mainly supportive care to COVID-19 patients, while using various treatment modalities previously used or proposed to treat other CoVs and other viral diseases such as SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV (Table 2).2).

sourceString: These therapies include current and potential treatments with antiviral drugs, immunosuppressants, steroids, plasma from recovered patients, Chinese medicine, and psychological support.
targetString: यी उपचारहरूमा एन्टिभाइरल औषधीहरू, इम्युनोसप्रेसेन्ट्स, एस्टेरोइड्स, निको भएका बिरामीहरूबाट प्लाज्मा, चिनियाँ औषधी र मनोवैज्ञानिक सहायताको साथमा वर्तमान र सम्भावित उपचार समावेश छन्।
en-mt: These treatments include current and prospective treatment with antiviral drugs, immunosuppressants, asteroids, plasma from recovered patients, Chinese medications and psychological support.

sourceString: Even plasma from recovered patients was proposed to be used for treatment.
targetString: निको भएका बिरामीहरूको प्लाज्मा समेत लाई उपचारको लागि प्रयोग गर्न प्रस्ताव गरिएको थियो।
en-mt: Plasma from recovered patients was also proposed to be used for treatment.

sourceString: Pharmaceutical companies are racing to develop antibodies and vaccines against the virus.
targetString: फार्मास्यूटिकल कम्पनीहरू भाइरस विरुद्ध एन्टिबडी र खोपहरूको विकास गर्न दौडिरहेका छन्।
en-mt: Pharmaceutical companies are racing to develop antibodies and vaccines against the virus.

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 mainly attacks the lungs in the beginning and probably also attacks, to a lesser degree, other organs that express ACE2, such as the gastrointestinal system and the kidneys.
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 मुख्य रूपमा सुरुवातमा फोक्सोमा आक्रमण गर्छ र सायद केही हदसम्म अन्य अङ्गहरूमा पनि आक्रमण गर्छ, जसले ACE2 अभिव्यक्त गर्छ, जस्तै ग्यास्ट्रोइन्टेस्टिनल प्रणाली र मृगौलाहरू।
en-mt: SARS-CoV-2 primarily attacks the lungs at the beginning and probably to some extent also attacks other organs, which express ACE2, such as the gastrointestinal system and kidneys.

sourceString: Nevertheless, respiratory dysfunction and failure are the major threat to the patients and the major cause of death.
targetString: यद्यपि, श्वासप्रश्वास शिथिलता र विफलता बिरामीहरूका लागि प्रमुख खतरा र मृत्युको प्रमुख कारण हुन्।
en-mt: However, respiratory dysfunction and failure are the leading risk and leading cause of death for patients.

sourceString: Thus, respiratory support is critical to relieve the symptoms and save lives and includes general oxygen therapy, high-flow oxygen, noninvasive ventilation, and invasive mechanical ventilation depending on the severity of the disease.
targetString: यसर्थ, लक्षणहरूलाई राहत प्रदान गर्न र जीवन रक्षा गर्नको लागि श्वासप्रश्वास सहायता अति महत्त्वपूर्ण छ र यसमा रोगको गम्भीरताको आधारमा सामान्य अक्सिजन थेरापी, उच्च-प्रवाह अक्सिजन, गैर-आक्रामक भेन्टिलेसन र आक्रामक यान्त्रिक भेन्टिलेसन समावेश छन्।
en-mt: Therefore, respiratory support is of utmost importance to provide relief to symptoms and save lives and includes general oxygen therapy, high-flow oxygen, non-invasive ventilation and invasive mechanical ventilation depending on the severity of the disease.

sourceString: Patients with severe respiratory symptoms have to be supported by extracorporeal membrane oxygenation (ECMO), a modified cardiopulmonary bypass technique used for the treatment of life-threatening cardiac or respiratory failure.
targetString: गम्भीर श्वासप्रश्वास लक्षण भएका बिरामीलाई जीवनको लागि खतरा हुने कार्डियाक वा श्वासप्रश्वास विफलताको उपचारको लागि प्रयोग गरिने संशोधित कार्डियोपल्मोनरी बाइपास प्रविधि, एक्स्ट्राकर्पोरियल मेम्ब्रेन अक्सिजेनेसन (ECMO) द्वारा समर्थित हुनुपर्छ।
en-mt: The modified cardiopulmonary bypass technique, used to treat life-threatening cardiac or respiratory failure for patients with severe respiratory symptoms, should be supported by extracorporeal membrane oxygenation (ECMO).

sourceString: In addition, the maintenance of electrolyte balance, the prevention and treatment of secondary infection and septic shock, and the protection of the functions of the vital organs are also essential for SARS-CoV-2 patients.
targetString: थप रूपमा, इलेक्ट्रोलाइट सन्तुलनको मर्मत सम्भार, द्वितीय सङ्क्रमण र सेप्टिक झट्काको रोकथाम र उपचार र महत्वपूर्ण अंगहरूको कार्यहरूको संरक्षण पनि SARS-CoV-2 बिरामीहरूका लागि आवश्यक छन्।
en-mt: In addition, maintenance of electrolyte balance, prevention and treatment of II infection and septic shock, and preservation of the functions of vital organs are also essential for SARS-CoV-2 patients.

sourceString: It has been known that a cytokine storm results from an overreaction of the immune system in SARS and MERS patients.
targetString: SARS र MERS बिरामीहरूमा प्रतिरक्षा प्रणालीको ज्यादा प्रतिक्रियाबाट साइटोकाइन आँधी हुने थाहा भएको छ।
en-mt: In SARS and MERS patients, an increased immune system response has been known to cause cytokine storms.

sourceString: Cytokine storm is a form of systemic inflammatory response featured by the release of a series of cytokines including TNFα, IL-1β, IL-2, IL-6, IFNα, IFNβ, IFNγ, and MCP-1.
targetString: साइटोकिन आँधी प्रणालीगत सुजन प्रतिक्रियाको एक रूप हो जुन TNFα, IL-1β, IL-2, IL-6, IFNα, IFNβ, IFNγ, र MCP-1 सहित साइटोकिनहरुको एक जारी श्रृंखला द्वारा चित्रित छ।
en-mt: Cytokine storms are a form of systemic swelling response characterized by an ongoing series of cytokines including TNFα, IL-1β, IL-2, IL-6, IFNα, IFNγ, and MCP-1.

sourceString: These cytokines induce immune cells to release a vast number of free radicals which are the major cause of ARDS and multiple organ failure.
targetString: यी साइटोकिन्सले प्रतिरक्षा कोषहरूलाई ठूलो संख्यामा स्वतन्त्र रेडिकलहरू जारी गर्न प्रेरित गर्दछन् जुन ARDS र बहु ​​अंग विफलताका प्रमुख कारण हुन्।
en-mt: These cytokines induce immune cells to release a large number of independent radicals that are the leading causes of ARDS and multiple organ failure.

sourceString: Immunosuppression is essential in the treatment of cytokine storms, especially in severe patients.
targetString: साइटोकिन आँधीका, विशेष गरी गम्भीर बिरामीहरूको उपचारमा इम्यूनोसप्रेशन आवश्यक छ।
en-mt: Immunosuppression is essential in the treatment of cytokine storms, especially severe patients.

sourceString: Corticosteroids and tocilizumab, an anti-IL6 monoclonal antibody, have been used to treat cytokine storm.
targetString: कोर्टिकोस्टेरोइड्स र टोसीलिज़ुमाब, एन्टी-IL6 मोनोक्लोनल एन्टिबडी, साइटोकिन आँधीको उपचार गर्न प्रयोग गरिएको छ।
en-mt: Corticosteroids and tocilizumab, anti-IL6 monoclonal antibodies, have been used to treat cytokine storms.

sourceString: Other immunosuppression treatments for cytokine storm include the modulation of T cell-directed immune response; the blockade of IFN-γ, IL-1, and TNF; JAK inhibition; blinatumomab; suppressor of cytokine signaling 4; and HDAC inhibitors.
targetString: साइटोकिन आँधीका लागि अन्य इम्यूनोसप्रेशन उपचारहरूमा T कोष-निर्देशित प्रतिरक्षा प्रतिक्रियाको मोडुलेसन समावेश छ; IFN-γ को रोकावट, IL-1, र TNF; JAK निषेध; ब्लिनाटुमोमाब; साइटोकिन संकेतको दमन गर्ने 4; र HDAC अवरोधकर्ताहरू।
en-mt: Other immunosuppression treatments for cytokine storms include modulation of the T cell-directed immune response; Blocking of IFN-γ, IL-1, and TNF; JAK inhibition; blinatumomab; suppressing cytokine signaling 4; and HDAC blockers.

sourceString: Steroids, as immunosuppressants, were widely used in the treatment of SARS to reduce the severity of inflammatory damage.
targetString: गम्भीरता र इन्फ्लेमेटरी क्षति कम गर्न SARS को उपचारमा इम्युनिसप्रेसेन्टको रूपमा स्टेरोइडहरूको व्यापक प्रयोग गरिएको थियो।
en-mt: Steroids were widely used as an immunosuppressant in the treatment of SARS to reduce severity and inflammatory damage.

sourceString: However, steroids at high dosages were not beneficial to severe lung injury in SARS and COVID-19 patients.
targetString: यद्यपि, SARS र COVID-19 बिरामीहरूमा गम्भीर फोक्सोको बिरामीका लागि उच्च मात्रामा स्टेरोइडहरू लाभदायी थिएनन्।
en-mt: However, high amounts of steroids were not beneficial for severe lung patients in SARS and COVID-19 patients.

sourceString: Instead, they may cause severe side effects, especially avascular osteonecrosis, dramatically affecting the prognosis.
targetString: यसको सट्टामा, तिनीहरूले गम्भीर अन्य असरहरू पैदा गर्न सक्दछन्, विशेष गरी अभास्कुलर ओस्टेकोरोसिस, जसले नाटकीय रूपमा रोगको निदानलाई असर गर्दछ।
en-mt: Instead, they can cause serious other effects, particularly avascular osteochorosis, which dramatically affects the prognosis of the disease.

sourceString: Nevertheless, short courses of corticosteroids at low-to-moderate doses have been recommended to be used prudently for critically ill COVID-19 patients.
targetString: तैपनि, जटिल रूपमा बिरामी भएका COVID-19 बिरामीहरूलाई सावधानीपूर्वक प्रयोग गर्नका लागि न्यून-देखि-मध्यम मात्राका कोर्टिकोस्टेरोइडहरूको कम मात्र सिफारिस गरिएको छ।
en-mt: Nevertheless, only a low of low-to-moderate amounts of corticosteroids is recommended for careful use in critically ill COVID-19 patients.

sourceString: At the time of writing, no effective antiviral therapy has been confirmed.
targetString: यो लेख्ने समयमा, कुनै प्रभावकारी एन्टिभाइरल थेरापी पुष्टि भएको छैन।
en-mt: At the time of writing this, no effective antiviral therapy has been confirmed.

sourceString: However, intravenous administration with remdesivir, a nucleotide analog, has been found to be efficacious in an American patient with COVID-19.
targetString: यद्यपि, रेमडेसिभिररको साथ इन्ट्राभेनस प्रशासन, एक न्युक्लियोटाइड एनालग, एक COVID-19 भएको अमेरिकी बिरामीमा प्रभावकारी पाइएको छ।
en-mt: However, intravenous administration with remdesivir, a nucleotide analogue, has been found to be effective in a U.S. patient with a COVID-19.

sourceString: Remdesivir is a novel antiviral drug developed by Gilead initially for the treatment of diseases caused by Ebola and Marlburg viruses.
targetString: रेमडेसिभिर इबोला र मार्लबर्ग भाइरसहरूद्वारा लाग्ने रोगहरूका उपचारको लागि सुरुमा जिलियाड द्वारा विकास गरिएको नयाँ एन्टिभाइरल औषधि हो।
en-mt: Remdesivir is a new antiviral drug initially developed by Gilead to treat diseases caused by Ebola and Marlberg viruses.

sourceString: Later, remdesivir also demonstrated possible inhibition of other single stranded RNA viruses including MERS and SARS viruses.
targetString: पछि, रेमडेसिभिरले MERS र SARS भाइरसहरू सहित अन्य एकल स्ट्र्यान्डेड RNA भाइरसहरूको सम्भावित प्रतिरोध पनि देखायो।
en-mt: Later, remdesivir also showed potential resistance to other single-stranded RNA viruses, including MERS and SARS viruses.

sourceString: Based on these, Gilead has provided the compound to China to conduct a pair of trials on SARS-CoV-2-infected individuals, and the results are highly anticipated.
targetString: यिनमा आधारित भएर, जिलियाड ले केही SARS-CoV-2-सङ्क्रमित व्यक्तिहरूमा परीक्षण सञ्चालन गर्न यौगिक लाई चीनमा प्रदान गर्‍यो र परिणामहरूको उच्च सराहना गरियो।
en-mt: Based on these, Gilead provided the compound to China to conduct trials on some SARS-CoV-2-infected individuals and the results were highly appreciated.

sourceString: In addition, baricitinb, interferon-α, lopinavir/ritonavir, and ribavirin have been suggested as potential therapies for patients with acute respiratory symptoms.
targetString: थप रूपमा, बेरीसिटिन्ब, इन्टरफेरोन-α, लोपीनाभिर/रीटोनाभिर र रिबाभिरिन लाई तीव्र श्वासप्रश्वास सम्बन्धि लक्षण भएका बिरामीहरूका लागि सम्भाव्य उपचारका रूपमा सुझाव गरिएको छ।
en-mt: Additionally, berecitinb, interferon-α, lopinavir/ritonavir, and ribavirin have been suggested as potential treatments for patients with acute respiratory symptoms.

sourceString: Diarrhea, nausea, vomiting, liver damage, and other adverse reactions can occur following combined therapy with lopinavir/ritonavir.
targetString: लोपीनाविर/रीटोनाविरको संयुक्त उपचारपछि पखाला, वाकवाकी, वान्ता, कलेजोको क्षति र अन्य प्रतिकूल प्रतिक्रियाहरू देखा पर्न सक्दछन्।
en-mt: Lopinavir/Ritunavir combined treatment can cause diarrhea, nausea, vomiting, liver damage and other adverse reactions.

sourceString: The interaction of these treatments with other drugs used in the patients should be monitored carefully.
targetString: बिरामीहरूमा अन्य औषधिसँग यी उपचारहरूको प्रयोगले हुने अन्तरक्रियाको ध्यान पूर्वक निगरानी गरिनुपर्दछ।
en-mt: The interaction of the use of these treatments with other drugs in patients should be carefully monitored.

sourceString: Plasma from recovered patients and antibody generation
targetString: निको भएका बिरामीहरूका प्लाज्मा र एन्टिबडी उत्पादन
en-mt: Plasma and antibody production of recovered patients

sourceString: The collection of the blood from patients who recovered from a contagious disease to treat other patients suffering from the same disease or to protect healthy individuals from catching the disease has a long history.
targetString: समान रोगबाट पिडित अन्य बिरामीहरूको उपचार गर्न वा स्वस्थ व्यक्तिहरूलाई रोगको सिकार हुनबाट जोगाउन सङ्क्रामक रोगबाट निको भएका बिरामीहरूबाट रगत सङ्कलनको इतिहास लामो छ।
en-mt: There is a long history of blood collection from patients who have recovered from infectious diseases to treat other patients suffering from the same disease or to protect healthy people from falling prey to the disease.

sourceString: Indeed, recovered patients often have a relatively high level of antibodies against the pathogen in their blood.
targetString: वास्तवमा, निको भएका बिरामीहरूमा प्रायः उनीहरूको रगतमा रोगजनकका बिरूद्ध तुलनात्मक रूपमा उच्च स्तरको एन्टिबडी हुन्छ।
en-mt: In fact, recovered patients often have relatively high levels of antibodies against the pathogen in their blood.

sourceString: Antibodies are an immunoglobulin (Ig) produced by B lymphocytes to fight pathogens and other foreign objects and they recognize unique molecules in the pathogens and neutralize them directly.
targetString: एन्टिबडीहरू B लिम्फोसाइटहरूले रोगजनक र अन्य बाह्य वस्तुहरूसँग लड्न उत्पादन गरेका इम्युनोग्लोबिन हुन् (Ig) र तिनीहरूले रोगजनकमा अद्वितीय अणुहरूको पहिचान गर्छन् र तिनीहरूलाई सिधै तटस्थ पार्छन्।
en-mt: Antibodies are immunoglobin produced by B lymphocytes to fight pathogens and other extracellular objects (Ig) and they identify unique molecules in the pathogen and directly neutralize them.

sourceString: Based on this, plasma was collected from the blood of a group of patients who recovered from COVID-19 and was injected into 10 seriously ill patients.
targetString: यसको आधारमा, COVID-19 बाट निको भएका बिरामीहरूको समूहको रगतबाट प्लाज्मा सङ्कलन गरिएको थियो र 10 गम्भीर बिरामी रोगीहरूमा इन्जेक्ट गरिएको थियो।
en-mt: Based on this, plasma was collected from the blood of a group of patients who had recovered from COVID-19 and injected into 10 critically ill patients.

sourceString: Their symptoms improved within 24 hours, accompanied by reduced inflammation and viral loads and improved oxygen saturation in the blood.
targetString: उनीहरूका लक्षणहरू 24 घण्टाभित्र सुधार भए, जसमा जलन र भाइरल लोड कम भयो र रगतमा अक्सिजनको सन्तृप्तता सुधार भयो।
en-mt: Their symptoms improved within 24 hours, with reduced inflammation and viral load and improved oxygen saturation in the blood.

sourceString: However, verification and clarification are necessary to propose the method for large-scale use before specific therapies are not yet developed.
targetString: यद्यपि, विशिष्ट थेरापीहरू विकास हुनुअघि ठूलो मात्रामा प्रयोगको लागि विधि प्रस्ताव गर्न प्रमाणीकरण र स्पष्टीकरण आवश्यक हुन्छन्।
en-mt: However, validation and clarification are required to propose a method for large-scale use before specific therapies are developed.

sourceString: In addition, given the therapeutic effects, some disadvantages associated with the plasma should be considered carefully.
targetString: थप रूपमा, चिकित्सीय प्रभावहरूलाई ध्यानमा राख्दै, प्लाज्मासँग सम्बन्धित केही बेफाइदाहरूलाई होसियारीपूर्वक विचार गर्नुपर्छ।
en-mt: In addition, considering the therapeutic effects, some of the disadvantages associated with plasma should be carefully considered.

sourceString: For example, antibodies can overstimulate the immune response and cause cytokine release syndrome, which is potentially a life-threatening toxicity.
targetString: उदाहरणको लागि, एन्टिबडीहरुले प्रतिरक्षा प्रतिक्रियालाई अधिक उत्तेजित गर्न सक्छन् र जसले साइटोकिन रिलीज सिन्ड्रोम निम्त्याउन सक्छ, जुन सम्भाव्य रूपमा जीवन-जोखिममा पार्ने विषाक्‍तता हो।
en-mt: For example, antibodies can over-stimulate the immune response and which can lead to cytokine release syndrome, which is potentially a life-threatening toxin.

sourceString: The concentration of antibodies in the blood is usually low, and the demand for the plasma is large to treat critically ill patients.
targetString: रगतमा एन्टिबडीहरूको मात्रा साधारणतया न्यून हुन्छ र जटिल अवस्थामा भएका बिरामीहरूको उपचार गर्न प्लाज्माको माग धेरै छ।
en-mt: The amount of antibodies in the blood is generally low and the demand for plasma to treat patients with complicated conditions is high.

sourceString: It is difficult to develop and produce specific antibodies rapidly enough to fight against a global epidemic.
targetString: विश्वव्यापी महामारी विरुद्ध लड्न पर्याप्त रुपमा विशिष्ट एन्टिबडीहरू छिटो तयार पार्न र उत्पादन गर्न गाह्रो छ।
en-mt: It is difficult to quickly prepare and produce sufficiently specific antibodies to fight the global pandemic.

sourceString: Thus, it is more critical and practical to isolate B cells from recovered patients and identify the genetic codes encoding effective antibodies or screen for effective antibodies against essential proteins of the virus.
targetString: त्यसैले, निको भएका बिरामीहरूबाट B कोषहरूलाई अलग गर्न र प्रभावी एन्टिबडीहरू संकेत गर्ने आनुवंशिक कोडहरु पहिचान गर्न वा भाइरसको आवश्यक प्रोटिनहरू विरुद्ध प्रभावकारी एन्टिबडीहरूका लागि जाँच गर्न यो महत्त्वपूर्ण र व्यावहारिक छ।
en-mt: Therefore, it is important and practical to isolate B cells from recovered patients and identify genetic codes indicating effective antibodies or to check for effector antibodies against essential proteins of the virus.

sourceString: This way, we can readily scale up the production of the antibodies.
targetString: यो तरिकाले, हामीले सजिलै एन्टिबडीहरूको उत्पादनको मात्रा वृद्धि गर्न सक्छौँ।
en-mt: In this way, we can easily increase the amount of production of antibodies.

sourceString: TCM has been used to treat a variety of diseases in China for thousands of years.
targetString: TCM लाई चीनमा हजारौं वर्षदेखि विभिन्न रोगहरूको उपचारमा प्रयोग गरिँदै आएको छ।
en-mt: TCM has been used in China for thousands of years to treat various diseases.

sourceString: However, its effects largely rely on a combination of multiple components in a formula that varies depending on the diagnosis of a disease based on the theories of TCM.
targetString: यद्यपि, यसका प्रभावहरू ठूलो मात्रामा एक सूत्रमा भएका बहु भागहरुको संयोजनमा निर्भर गर्दछ जुन TCM को सिद्धान्तमा आधारित रोगको निदानमा निर्भर गर्दै भिन्न हुन्छ।
en-mt: However, its effects largely depend on a combination of multiple parts in a formula that vary depending on the diagnosis of the disease based on the principle of TCM.

sourceString: Most of the effective components remain unknown or are vague as it is difficult to extract and verify such components or their optimal combinations.
targetString: अधिकांश प्रभावकारी अवयवहरू अज्ञात रहन्छन् वा अस्पष्ट हुन्छन् किनकि यस्ता अवयव वा तिनीहरूको सर्वोत्तम संयोजनलाई निकाल्न र प्रमाणित गर्न कठिन हुन्छ।
en-mt: Most effective ingredients remain unknown or unclear because such ingredients or their best combination are difficult to extract and prove.

sourceString: Currently, due to the lack of effective and specific therapy for COVID-19, TCM has become one of the major alternative treatments for patients with light to moderate symptoms or for those who have recovered from severe stages.
targetString: हाल, COVID-19 का लागि प्रभावकारी र विशिष्ट उपचारको अभावका कारण, TCM हल्का देखि मध्यम लक्षणहरू भएका वा गम्भीर अवस्थाबाट निको भएका बिरामीहरूका लागि प्रमुख वैकल्पिक उपचारमध्ये एक भएको छ।
en-mt: Currently, due to the lack of effective and specific treatments for COVID-19, TCM has become one of the major alternative therapies for patients with mild to moderate symptoms or who have recovered from severe conditions.

sourceString: For example, Shu Feng Jie Du capsules and Lian Hua Qing Wen capsules were found to be effective for COVID-19 treatment.
targetString: उदाहरणका लागी, Shu Feng Jie Du क्याप्सुलहरू र Lian Hua Qing Wen क्याप्सुलहरू COVID-19 उपचारका लागी प्रभावकारी पाइएका थिए।
en-mt: For example, Shu Feng Jie Du capsules and Lian Hua Qing Wen capsules were found to be effective for COVID-19 treatment.

sourceString: Top cure rates in the treatment of COVID-19 patients were observed in several provinces in China that used TCM in 87% of their patients, including Gansu (63.7%), Ningxia (50%), and Hunan (50%), whereas Hubei province, which used TCM in only approximately 30% of its COVID-19 patients, had the lowest cure rate (13%).
targetString: COVID-19 बिरामीहरूको उपचारमा शीर्ष इलाज दर चीनका कतिपय प्रान्तहरूमा देखिएको थियो जसले उनीहरूको 87% बिरामीमा TCM प्रयोग गर्‍यो, जसमा गान्सु (63.7%), निङ्जिया (50%), र हुनान (50%) थिए, जबकि हुबेई प्रान्त, जसले उसको COVID-19 बिरामीहरूको लगभग 30% मात्रमा TCM प्रयोग गर्‍यो, त्यसमा सबैभन्दा कम इलाज दर (13%) थियो।
en-mt: The top cure rate in the treatment of COVID-19 patients was seen in some provinces of China that used TCM in 87% of their patients, including Gansu (63.7%), Ningjia (50%), and Hunan (50%), while Hubei Province, which used only about 30% of its COVID-19 patients, had the lowest treatment rate (13%).

sourceString: However, this is quite a rough comparison as many other impact factors such as the number and severity of the patients should be included in the evaluation.
targetString: यद्यपि, मूल्याङ्कनमा बिरामीहरूको सङ्ख्या र गम्भीरता जस्ता अन्य धेरै प्रभावकारी कारक तत्त्वहरू समावेश गरिनुपर्ने कारणले यो एउटा अनुमानित तुलना हो।
en-mt: However, this is an approximate comparison because the evaluation should include many other influencing factors, such as the number and severity of patients.

sourceString: On February 18, 2020, Boli Zhang and coworkers published a study to compare western medicine (WM) treatment alone with combined treatment of WM and TCM.
targetString: फेब्रुअरी 18, 2020, बोली चाङ र सहकर्मीहरूले पश्चिमी औषधी (WM) उपचारसँगै WM र TCM को संयुक्त उपचारको तुलना गर्न एक अध्ययन प्रकाशन गरे।
en-mt: On February 18, 2020, Boli Chang and colleagues published a study to compare the combined treatment of WM and TCM with Western medicine (WM) treatment.

sourceString: They found that the times needed for body temperature recovery, symptom disappearance, and hospitalization were remarkably shorter in the WM+TCM group than in the WM only group.
targetString: तिनीहरूले फेला पारे कि शरीरको तापमानमा सुधार, लक्षण हराएर जानु र अस्पतालमा रहने समयको आवश्यकता WM+TCM समूहमा WM मात्र समूहको तुलनामा कम थियो।
en-mt: They found that improvements in body temperature, loss of symptoms, and hospital stay time requirement were lower in the WM+TCM group than in the WM alone group.

sourceString: Most impressively, the rate for symptomatic worsening (from light to severe) was remarkably lower for the WM+TCM group than for the WM only group (7.4% versus 46.2%) and the mortality was lower in the WM+TCM group than WM only group (8.8% versus 39%).
targetString: सबभन्दा प्रभावशाली रूपमा, लक्षणात्मक बिग्रिने दर (हलुका देखि गम्भीर सम्म) WM मात्र समूहभन्दा WM+TCM समूहको लागि (7.4% विरुद्ध 46.2%) उल्लेखनीय रूपमा कम थियो र मृत्यु दर WM मात्र समूहभन्दा WM+TCM समूहमा (8.8% विरुद्ध 39%) कम थियो।
en-mt: Most impressively, symptomatic worsening rates (from mild to severe) were significantly lower for the WM+TCM group (7.4% versus 46.2%) than for the WM-only group and mortality was lower in the WM+TCM group (8.8% versus 39%) than in the WM-TCM group.

sourceString: Nevertheless, the efficacy and safety of TCM still await more well-controlled trials at larger scales and in more centers.
targetString: यद्यपि, TCM को प्रभावकारिता र सुरक्षा अझै पनि ठूलो मात्रामा र अधिक केन्द्रहरूमा अझै राम्रो नियन्त्रित परीक्षणहरूका लागि प्रतीक्षा गरिरहन्छ।
en-mt: However, the efficacy and safety of TCM still awaits better controlled trials on a larger scale and in more centers.

sourceString: It would also be intriguing to characterize the mechanism of actions and clarify the effective components of TCM treatments or their combinations if possible.
targetString: यो कार्यहरूको कार्यविधिलाई वर्णन गर्न र TCM उपचारको प्रभावकारी अवयवहरू वा सम्भव भएमा तिनीहरूको संयोजनलाई स्पष्ट गर्नको लागि पनि मनमोहक हुनेछ।
en-mt: It will also be fascinating to describe the procedure of the functions and to clarify the effective components of TCM treatment or their combination if possible.

sourceString: Patients with suspected or confirmed COVID-19 mostly experience great fear of the highly contagious and even fatal disease, and quarantined people also experience boredom, loneliness, and anger.
targetString: शङ्कास्पद वा पुष्टि भएका COVID-19 का बिरामीहरू धेरैजसोले उच्च सङ्क्रामक र घातक रोग समेतको ठूलो डर अनुभव गर्छन् र क्वारेन्टाइनमा भएका मानिसहरूले पनि दिक्दार, एक्लोपन र रिसको अनुभव गर्छन्।
en-mt: Most of the suspected or confirmed COVID-19 patients experience a greater fear of high infectious and even deadly disease, and people in quarantine also experience distress, loneliness, and anger.

sourceString: Furthermore, symptoms of the infection such as fever, hypoxia, and cough as well as adverse effects of the treatments such as insomnia caused by corticosteroids can lead to more anxiety and mental distress.
targetString: यसबाहेक, समक्रमणका लक्षणहरू जस्तै ज्वरो, हाइपोक्सिया र खोकीको साथसाथै कोर्टिकोस्टेरोइड्सका कारणले हुने अनिद्रा जस्ता उपचारका प्रतिकूल प्रभावहरूले अधिक चिन्ता र मानसिक समस्या निम्त्याउन सक्दछन्।
en-mt: Furthermore, the adverse effects of treatment such as synchronization symptoms such as fever, hypoxia and cough, as well as insomnia caused by corticosteroids, can lead to more anxiety and mental problems.

sourceString: In the early phase of the SARS outbreak, a range of psychiatric morbidities including persistent depression, anxiety, panic attacks, psychomotor excitement, psychotic symptoms, delirium, and even suicidality were reported.
targetString: SARS प्रकोपको सुरुको चरणमा, निरन्तर तनाव, चिन्ता, आतङ्कित हुने, साइकोमोटर उत्प्रेरणा, मनोविकृत लक्षणहरू, प्रलाप र आत्महत्या समेत जस्ता मानसिक रोगसम्बन्धी रुग्णताहरूको दायरा रिपोर्ट गरिएका थिए।
en-mt: In the early stages of the SARS outbreak, a range of mental illness-related illnesses such as persistent stress, anxiety, panic, psychomotor motivation, psychotic symptoms, delirium, and even suicide were reported.

sourceString: Mandatory contact tracing and quarantine, as a part of the public health responses to the COVID-19 outbreak, can make people more anxious and guilty about the effects of the contagion, quarantine, and stigma on their families and friends.
targetString: अनिवार्य सम्पर्क ट्रेसिंग र क्वारेन्टाइन, COVID-19 प्रकोपको सार्वजनिक स्वास्थ्य प्रतिक्रियाहरूको एक हिस्साको रूपमा, ले मानिसहरूलाई उनीहरूको परिवार र साथीहरूमा सङ्क्रमण, क्वारेन्टाइन, र लान्छनाको प्रभावका बारेमा बढी चिन्तित र दोषी बनाउन सक्छ।
en-mt: Mandatory contact tracing and quarantine, as part of public health responses to the COVID-19 outbreak, can make people more concerned and guilty about the impact of infection, quarantine, and stigma on their family and friends.

sourceString: Thus, mental health care should be provided to COVID-19 patients, suspected individuals, and people in contact with them as well as the general public who are in need.
targetString: त्यसैले, मानसिक स्वास्थ्य सेवा COVID-19 बिरामी, सन्दिग्ध व्यक्ति र उनीहरूसँग सम्पर्कमा रहेका मानिसहरूलाई साथै आवश्यक परेका मानिसहरूलाई पनि प्रदान गरिनु पर्छ।
en-mt: Therefore, mental health services should be provided to COVID-19 patients, suspects and people who have come in contact with them, as well as to people in need.

sourceString: The psychological support should include the establishment of multidisciplinary mental health teams, clear communications with regular and accurate updates about the SARS-CoV-2 outbreak and treatment plans and the use of professional electronic devices and applications to avoid close contact with each other.
targetString: मनोवैज्ञानिक सहायताले बहुविधात्मक मानसिक स्वास्थ्य टोलीहरूको स्थापना, SARS-CoV-2 प्रकोपको बारेमा नियमित र ठीक अद्यावधिकहरूको साथमा स्पष्ट सञ्चार र उपचार योजनाहरू र एक अर्कासँग नजिकको सम्पर्क रोक्न पेसेवर इलेक्ट्रोनिक उपकरण र प्रयोग समावेश गर्नुपर्दछ।
en-mt: Psychological support should include the establishment of multidisciplinary mental health teams, regular and precise updates about the SARS-CoV-2 outbreak, along with clear communication and treatment plans, and the use of professional electronic devices and use to prevent close contact with each other.

sourceString: Effective vaccines are essential for interrupting the chain of transmission from animal reservoirs and infected humans to susceptible hosts and are often complementary to antiviral treatment in the control of epidemics caused by emerging viruses.
targetString: जनावरको भण्डार र सङ्क्रमित मानवहरूबाट संवेदनशील होस्टहरूमा सङ्क्रमणका श्रृंखलामा बाधा पुर्‍याउनका निम्ति प्रभावकारी खोपहरू आवश्यक छन् र अक्सर उदाउँदो भाइरसका कारण हुने महामारीको नियन्त्रणमा एन्टिभाइरल उपचारका लागि पूरक हुन्छ।
en-mt: Effective vaccines are necessary to disrupt the chain of infection from animal reserves and infected humans to susceptible hosts, and are often supplemented for antiviral treatments in the control of epidemics caused by emerging viruses.

sourceString: Efforts have been made to develop S protein-based vaccines to generate long-term and potent neutralizing antibodies and/or protective immunity against SARS-CoV.
targetString: SARS-CoV विरुद्ध दीर्घकालीन र शक्तिशाली तटस्थ एन्टिबडीहरू र/वा सुरक्षात्मक प्रतिरोधी क्षमता उत्पन्न गर्न S प्रोटिन-आधारित खोपहरू विकास गर्न कोशिस गरिएका छन्।
en-mt: Efforts have been made to develop S protein-based vaccines to generate long-term and potent neutralizing antibodies and/or protective immunity against SARS-CoV.

sourceString: Live-attenuated vaccines have been evaluated in animal models for SARS.
targetString: SARS का लागि पशु मोडलहरूमा प्रत्यक्ष-एटेनुएटेड खोपहरूको मूल्याङ्कन गरिएका छन्।
en-mt: Direct-attenuated vaccines have been evaluated in animal models for SARS.

sourceString: However, the in vivo efficacy of these vaccine candidates in elderly individuals and lethal-challenge models and their protection against zoonotic virus infection have yet to be determined before a clinical study is initiated.
targetString: यद्यपि, चिकित्सकीय अध्ययन प्रारम्भ गर्नुअघि वृद्ध व्यक्तिहरूमा यी खोप उम्मेदवारहरूको शरीरभित्रको प्रभावकारिता र घातक-चुनौती नमूनाहरू र जुनोटिक भाइरस विरुद्ध तिनीहरूको सुरक्षा निर्धारण गर्न अझै बाँकी छ।
en-mt: However, the efficacy within the bodies of these vaccine candidates in older people and their protection against lethal-challenged samples and zoonotic viruses in older people has yet to be determined before clinical studies begin.

sourceString: This is probably because SARS died down 17 years ago and no new case has been reported since.
targetString: यसैले गर्दा SARS को 17 वर्षअघि मृत्यु भएको र अहिलेसम्म कुनै नयाँ केस रिपोर्ट नगरिएको हुन सक्छ।
en-mt: This may be why SARS died 17 years ago and no new cases have been reported so far.

sourceString: In contrast, sporadic cases and clusters of MERS continue to occur in the Middle East and spread to other regions owing to the persistence of zoonotic sources in endemic areas.
targetString: यसको विपरीत, मध्य पूर्वमा MERS का फाटफुट मामिलाहरू र समूहहरू लगातार देखा पर्छन् र अन्य क्षेत्रहरूमा पनि फैलिन्छन् जुन स्थानीय क्षेत्रमा जुनोटिक स्रोतहरूको निरन्तरताको कारण हुने गर्दछन्।
en-mt: In contrast, cleft cases and clusters of MERS in the Middle East appear frequently and spread to other regions due to the continuity of zoonotic sources in the local area.

sourceString: Vaccination strategies have been developed for MERS by using inactivated virus, DNA plasmids, viral vectors, nanoparticles, virus-like particles and recombinant protein subunits and some have been evaluated in animal models.
targetString: निष्क्रिय भाइरसहरू, DNA प्लाज्मिडहरू, भाइरल भेक्टरहरू, नानो कणहरू, भाइरस-जस्ता कणहरू र पुनः संयोजक प्रोटिन उप-एकाइहरू प्रयोग गरेर MERS का लागि खोप रणनीतिहरू विकास गरिएका छन् र केहिलाई पशु नमुनाहरूमा मूल्याङ्कन गरिएको छ।
en-mt: Vaccination strategies for MERS using inactivated viruses, DNA plasmids, viral vectors, nanoparticles, virus-like particles and recombinant protein subunits have been developed and some have been evaluated in animal samples.

sourceString: The development of a safe and effective vaccine against SARS-CoV-2 for non-immune individuals is an urgent and critical task for controlling the ongoing epidemic.
targetString: गैर-प्रतिरक्षित व्यक्तिका लागि SARS-CoV-2 विरुद्ध सुरक्षित र प्रभावकारी खोपको विकास गर्नु जारी महामारीलाई नियन्त्रण गर्नका लागि जरुरी र महत्त्वपूर्ण कार्य हो।
en-mt: Developing a safe and effective vaccine against SARS-CoV-2 for non-immunized individuals is an urgent and important task to control the ongoing pandemic.

sourceString: However, it is challenging to overcome the difficulty because of the long period of time (averaged 18 months) needed for vaccine development and the dynamic variations of CoVs.
targetString: यद्यपि, खोप विकासको लागि लामो समयावधि (औसत 18 महिना) आवश्यक भएको र CoVs को गतिशील भिन्नताहरूका कारणले यो कठिन परिस्थितिलाई जित्न चुनौतीपूर्ण छ।
en-mt: However, it is challenging to overcome this difficult situation due to the long time period (average 18 months) required for vaccine development and the dynamic variations of CoVs.

sourceString: As a novel disease, COVID-19 has just started to manifest its full clinical course throughout thousands of patients.
targetString: नोवेल रोगको रूपमा, COVID-19 ले भर्खरै मात्र हजारौं बिरामीहरूमा आफ्नो पूर्ण चिकित्सकीय मार्ग प्रकट गर्न थालेको छ।
en-mt: As a novel disease, COVID-19 has only recently begun to reveal its full therapeutic path in thousands of patients.

sourceString: In most cases, patients can recover gradually without sequelae.
targetString: अधिकांश केसहरूमा, बिरामीहरू क्रमशः बिना सिक्वेल निको हुन सक्छन्।
en-mt: In most cases, patients can gradually recover without sequelae.

sourceString: However, similar to SARS and MERS, COVID-19 is also associated with high morbidity and mortality in patients with severe cases.
targetString: यद्यपि, SARS र MERS जस्तै COVID-19 पनि गम्भीर केस भएका बिरामीहरूमा उच्च रुग्णता र मृत्युदरसँग आबद्ध छ।
en-mt: However, COVID-19, like SARS and MERS, is also associated with higher morbidity and mortality in patients with severe cases.

sourceString: Therefore, building a prognosis model for the disease is essential for health-care agencies to prioritize their services, especially in resource-constrained areas.
targetString: त्यसकारण, रोगको लागि रोगको पूर्वानुमानको नमुना निर्माण गर्नु स्वास्थ्य-स्याहार एजेन्सीहरूका लागि विशेष गरी संसाधन नभएका क्षेत्रहरूमा आफ्ना सेवाहरूको प्राथमिकता छुट्याउनको लागि अत्यावश्यक छ।
en-mt: Therefore, building a pattern of disease prognosis for disease is imperative for health-care agencies to prioritize their services, especially in areas that are not resourceful.

sourceString: Based on clinical studies reported thus far, the following factors may affect or be associated with the prognosis of COVID-19 patients (Table ​(Table33):
targetString: अहिलेसम्मका चिकित्सकीय अध्ययनहरूले गरेका रिपोर्टमा आधारित हुँदा, COVID-19 का बिरामीहरूको पूर्वानुमानमा निम्न कारकहरूले प्रभाव पार्न वा आबद्ध हुन सक्छन् (तालिका ​(तालिका33):
en-mt: Based on reports from medical studies so far, the following factors may influence or associate with the prognosis of COVID-19 patients (Table 33):

sourceString: Age: Age was the most important factor for the prognosis of SARS, which is also true for COVID-19.
targetString: उमेर: SARS को पूर्वानुमानको लागि सबैभन्दा महत्त्वपूर्ण कारक थियो, जुन COVID-19 को लागि पनि साँचो हुन्छ।
en-mt: Age: WAS the most important factor for the prognosis of SARS, which also holds true for COVID-19.

sourceString: COVID-19 mainly happened at the age of 30-65 with 47.7% of those patients being over 50 in a study of 8,866 cases as described above.
targetString: COVID-19 मुख्यतया 30-65 वर्षको उमेरमा हुन्छ जसमध्ये 47.7% बिरामीहरू 8,866 केसहरूमा 50 भन्दा बढी माथि वर्णन गरिएको जस्तो भएको पाइएको छ।
en-mt: COVID-19 occurs mainly at the age of 30-65 years of age of which 47.7% of patients have been found to have more than 50 of the 8,866 cases as described above.

sourceString: Patients who required intensive care were more likely to have underlying comorbidities and complications and were significantly older than those who did not (at the median age of 66 versus 51), suggesting age as a prognostic factor for the outcome of COVID-19 patients.
targetString: सघन स्याहार आवश्यक भएका बिरामीहरू अन्तर्निहित रुग्णता र जटिलता भएका र नभएकाहरू उल्लेखनीय रूपमा वृद्ध हुने (66 र 51 को औसत उमेरका) सम्भावना बढी छ, जसले COVID-19 बिरामीहरूको प्रतिफलका लागि रोगको पूर्वानुमान कारक उमेर सुझाव गर्छ।
en-mt: Patients requiring intensive care are significantly more likely to be significantly older (median ages of 66 and 51) with and without underlying morbidity and complications, suggesting age as a prognostic factor for the return of COVID-19 patients.

sourceString: Sex: SARS-CoV-2 has infected more men than women (0.31/100,000 versus 0.27/100,000), as described above.
targetString: लिङ्गः SARS-CoV-2 ले माथि वर्णन गरिए अनुसार, महिला भन्दा बढी पुरुष ( 0.27/100,000 बिरूद्ध 0.31/100,000) लाई सङ्क्रमित गरेको छ।
en-mt: Gender: SARS-CoV-2 has infected more men (0.27/100,000 versus 0.31/100,000) than females, as described above.

sourceString: Comorbidities and complications: Patients with COVID-19 who require intensive care are more likely to suffer from acute cardiac injury and arrhythmia.
targetString: सहरुग्णता र जटिलताहरू: सघन स्याहार आवश्यक हुने COVID-19 का बिरामीहरू तीव्र हृदयको चोटपटक र एरिदमियाबाट ग्रसित हुने सम्भावना बढी हुन्छ।
en-mt: Complications and complications: COVID-19 patients who require intensive care are more likely to suffer from acute heart injury and arrhythmia.

sourceString: Cardiac events were also the main reason for death in SARS patients.
targetString: हृदय सम्बन्धी घटनाहरू पनि SARS का बिरामीहरूको मृत्युको लागि मुख्य कारण थिए।
en-mt: Cardiovascular events were also the main cause of death in patients with SARS.

sourceString: It has been reported that SARS-CoV-2 can also bind to ACE2-positive cholangiocytes, which might lead to liver dysfunctions in COVID-19 patients.
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 ACE2-सकारात्मक कोल्यान्जियोसाइट्ससँग पनि बाँधिन सक्छ, जसले COVID-19 का बिरामीहरूमा कलेजोको खराबी गराउन सक्छ।
en-mt: SARS-CoV-2 may also bind to ACE2-positive cholangiocytes, which can cause liver failure in patients with COVID-19.

sourceString: It is worth noting that age and underlying disease are strongly correlated and might interfere with each other.
targetString: उमेर र अन्तर्निहित रोग ज्यादै सह सम्बन्धित छन् र एक अर्कामा हस्तक्षेप गर्न सक्छन् भन्ने कुरामा ध्यान दिनु उपयोगी हुन्छ।
en-mt: It is useful to note that age and underlying disease are highly correlated and can interfere with each other.

sourceString: Abnormal laboratory findings: The C-reactive protein (CRP) level in blood reflects the severity of inflammation or tissue injury and has been proposed to be a potential prognostic factor for disease, response to therapy, and ultimate recovery.
targetString: असामान्य प्रयोगशाला खोजहरू: रगतमा C-प्रतिक्रिया प्रोटिन (CRP) स्तरले सुजन वा तन्तुको चोटको गम्भीरता प्रतिबिम्बित गर्दछ र रोग, उपचारको प्रतिक्रिया, र अन्तिम स्वास्थ्य लाभको सम्भावित रोग सूचक कारक भएको प्रस्तावित गरिएको छ।
en-mt: Abnormal laboratory findings: C-response protein (CRP) levels in the blood reflect the severity of swelling or tissue injury and have been proposed to be a potential prognostic factor of disease, response to treatment, and ultimate health benefits.

sourceString: The correlation of CRP level to the severity and prognosis of COVID-19 has also been proposed.
targetString: COVID-19 को CRP स्तर र गम्भीरता र रोग पूर्वानुमानको सहसम्बन्ध पनि प्रस्तावित गरिएको छ।
en-mt: The correlation of CRP levels and severity of COVID-19 and disease prognosis has also been proposed.

sourceString: In addition, elevated lactate dehydrogenase (LDH), aspartate aminotransferase (AST), alanine aminotransferase (ALT), and creatine kinase (CK) may also help predict the outcome.
targetString: यसका साथै, बढेको ल्याक्टेट डिहाइड्रोजिनेस (LDH), एस्पार्टेट एमिनोट्रान्सफेरेस (AST), आलानिन एमिनोट्रान्सफेरेस (ALT) र क्रियटिन काइनेस (CK) ले पनि प्रतिफलको पूर्वानुमान गर्न सक्छन्।
en-mt: In addition, increased lactate dehydrogenase (LDH), aspartate aminotransferase (AST), alanine aminotransferase (ALT) and creatine kinase (CK) can also predict returns.

sourceString: These enzymes are expressed extensively in multiple organs, especially in the heart and liver, and are released during tissue damage.
targetString: यी इन्जाइमहरू बहु अङ्गहरूमा विस्तारित रूपमा देखिन्छन्, विशेष गरी मुटु र कलेजोमा देखिन्छन् र तन्तुको क्षति हुँदा निस्किन्छन्।
en-mt: These enzymes are visible enlarged in multiple organs, especially in the heart and liver and released when tissue is damaged.

sourceString: Thus, they are traditional markers for heart or liver dysfunctions.
targetString: तसर्थ, ती मुटु वा कलेजो रोगका लागि परम्परागत निशानहरु हुन्।
en-mt: Therefore, they are traditional markers for heart or liver disease.

sourceString: Major clinical symptoms: Chest radiography and temporal progression of clinical symptoms should be considered together with the other issues for the prediction of outcomes and complications of COVID-19.
targetString: मुख्य चिकित्सकीय लक्षणहरू: छातीको रेडियोग्राफी र चिकित्सकीय लक्षणहरूको अस्थायी सुधारलाई COVID-19 का प्रतिफल र जटिलताहरूको पूर्वानुमानको लागि अन्य समस्याहरूको साथमा सँगै विचार गर्नुपर्दछ।
en-mt: Main medical symptoms: Temporary improvement of chest radiography and medical symptoms should be considered together with other problems for the prognosis of the outcome and complications of COVID-19.

sourceString: Use of steroids: As described above, steroids are immunosuppressant commonly used as an adjunctive therapy for infectious diseases to reduce the severity of inflammatory damage.
targetString: स्टेरोइडहरूको प्रयोग: माथि वर्णन गरिए जस्तै स्टेरोइडहरू इम्युनोसप्रेसेंट हुन् जुन सामान्यतया सङ्क्रामक रोगहरूको लागि एक सहायक चिकित्सा को रुपमा प्रयोग गरिन्छ ताकि सुजन को क्षति को गम्भीरता लाई कम गर्न सकियोस्।
en-mt: Use of steroids: As described above, steroids are immunosuppressants that are commonly used as an adjunctive therapy for infectious diseases to reduce the severity of swelling damage.

sourceString: Since a high dosage of corticosteroids was widely used in severe SARS patients, many survivors suffered from avascular osteonecrosis with life-long disability and poor life quality.
targetString: गम्भीर SARS का बिरामीहरूमा कर्टिकोस्टेरोइडको उच्च मात्रा व्यापक रूपमा प्रयोग भएकाले, बाँच्ने मध्ये धेरै जना दीर्घकालीन अशक्तता र कमजोर जीवन गुणस्तरको साथमा अभास्कुलर ओस्टियोनेक्रोसिसबाट ग्रसित भए।
en-mt: Due to the widespread use of corticosteroids in patients with severe SARS, many of the survivors suffered from avascular osteonecrosis with long-term disability and poor quality of life.

sourceString: Thus, if needed, steroids should be used at low dosage and for a short time in COVID-19 patients.
targetString: त्यसैले, आवश्यक भएमा, स्टेरोइड कम खुराकमा र COVID-19 बिरामीहरूमा छोटो समयका लागि प्रयोग गर्नु पर्छ।
en-mt: Therefore, if necessary, steroids should be used in low doses and for short periods of time in COVID-19 patients.

sourceString: Mental stress: As described above, during the COVID-19 outbreak many patients have suffered from extraordinary stress as they often endured long periods of quarantine and extreme uncertainty and witnessed the death of close family members and fellow patients.
targetString: मानसिक तनाव: माथि वर्णन गरिए अनुसार, COVID-19 प्रकोपको अवधिमा धेरै बिरामीहरूले लामो समयको क्वारेन्टाइन झेल्नुपरेको र अत्यधिक अनिश्चितता र नजिकको परिवारको सदस्य तथा साथी बिरामीहरूको मृत्यु देखेको कारणले उनीहरू असाधारण तनावबाट ग्रसित भएका छन्।
en-mt: Mental stress: As described above, during the COVID-19 outbreak, many patients have suffered from prolonged quarantine and have suffered from extraordinary stress due to extreme uncertainty and the death of close family members and fellow patients.

sourceString: It is imperative to provide psychological counseling and long-term support to help these patients recover from the stress and return to normal life.
targetString: यी बिरामीहरूलाई तनावबाट मुक्त हुन र साधारण जीवनमा फर्कन मद्दत गर्न मनोवैज्ञानिक परामर्श र दीर्घकालीन सहायता प्रदान गर्नु जरुरी छ।
en-mt: It is essential to provide psychological counseling and long-term support to help these patients recover from stress and return to normal life.

sourceString: According to demographic studies so far, COVID-19 seems to have different epidemiological features from SARS.
targetString: अहिलेसम्मको जनसाङ्ख्यिक अध्ययन अनुसार, COVID-19 को SARS भन्दा भिन्न महामारी पूर्ण विशेषताहरू भएको देखिन्छ।
en-mt: According to demographic studies so far, COVID-19 appears to have different epidemic features than SARS.

sourceString: In addition to replicating in the lower respiratory tract, SARS-CoV-2 can efficiently replicate in the upper respiratory tract and causes mild or no symptoms in the early phase of infection, similar to other CoVs that cause common colds.
targetString: तल्लो श्वासप्रश्वास मार्गमा सङ्ख्या वृद्धि हुनुको साथै, SARS-CoV-2 को माथिल्लो श्वासप्रश्वास मार्गमा पनि पर्याप्त मात्रमा सङ्ख्या वृद्धि हुन सक्छ र रुघा लाग्ने अन्य CoVs जस्तै सङ्क्रमणको सुरुको चरणमा मन्द लक्षण देखाउन वा कुनै पनि लक्षण नदेखाउन सक्छ।
en-mt: In addition to the increase in the number in the lower respiratory tract, the upper respiratory tract of SARS-CoV-2 may also have a substantial number increase and may show mild symptoms or show no symptoms in the early stages of infection, such as other CoVs with a cold.

sourceString: Therefore, infected patients at the early phase or incubation period can produce a large amount of virus during daily activities, causing great difficulty for the control of the epidemic.
targetString: यसकारण, प्रारम्भिक चरण वा इन्क्युबेसन अवधिमा सङ्क्रमित बिरामीहरूले दैनिक गतिविधिहरूको समयमा अत्यधिक मात्रामा भाइरस उत्पादन गर्न सक्छन्, जसले महामारीलाई नियन्त्रण गर्न धेरै कठिन हुन्छ।
en-mt: Therefore, patients infected during the early stage or incubation period can produce excessive amounts of the virus during daily activities, which makes it very difficult to control the epidemic.

sourceString: However, the transmission of SARS-CoV was considered to occur when the patients are severely ill, while most transmission did not happen at the early phase.
targetString: यद्यपि, SARS-CoV को प्रसारण बिरामी गम्भीर हुँदा मात्र हुने भनिन्थ्यो, जबकि धेरैजसो प्रसारण सुरुको चरणमा भएका थिएनन्।
en-mt: However, the transmission of SARS-CoV was said to occur only when the patient was serious, while most of the broadcasts were not in the early stages.

sourceString: Thus, the current outbreak of COVID-19 is much more severe and difficult to control than the outbreak of SARS.
targetString: तसर्थ, COVID-19 को हालको प्रकोप SARS को प्रकोप भन्दा नियन्त्रण गर्न ज्यादै बढी गम्भीर र कठिन हुन्छ।
en-mt: Therefore, the current outbreak of COVID-19 becomes much more serious and difficult to control than the outbreak of SARS.

sourceString: Great efforts are currently underway in China including the lockdown of Wuhan and surrounding cities and continuous quarantine of almost the entire population in hopes of interrupting the transmission of SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 को प्रसारण रोक्ने आशामा वुहान र वरिपरिका सहरहरूको बन्दाबन्दी र लगभग सम्पूर्ण जनसङ्ख्याको लगातार क्वारेन्टाइन लगायतका महान् प्रयासहरू हाल चीनमा भइरहेका छन्।
en-mt: Great efforts, including the lockdown of Wuhan and surrounding cities in the hope of stopping the transmission of SARS-CoV-2 and the continuous quarantine of almost the entire population, are currently taking place in China.

sourceString: Although these actions have been dramatically damaging the economy and other sectors of the country, the number of new patients is declining, indicating the slowdown of the epidemic.
targetString: यद्यपि यी कार्यहरूले नाटकीय रूपमा देशको अर्थतन्त्र र अन्य क्षेत्रहरूलाई क्षति पुर्‍याइरहेका छन्, नयाँ बिरामीहरूको संख्या घट्दैछ, यसले महामारीको मन्दीलाई संकेत गर्दछ।
en-mt: Although these actions are dramatically damaging the country's economy and other sectors, the number of new patients is declining, indicating the slowdown of the pandemic.

sourceString: The most optimistic estimate is that the outbreak will end by March and the downswing phase will last for 3-4 months.
targetString: सबभन्दा आशावादी अनुमान यो छ कि प्रकोप मार्चसम्ममा सकिन्छ र तल झर्ने अवस्था 3-4 महिना रहन्छ।
en-mt: The most optimistic estimate is that the outbreak will occur by March and the situation of descending will last for 3-4 months.

sourceString: However, some other experts are not that optimistic.
targetString: यद्यपि, केही अन्य विशेषज्ञहरू त्यति आशावादी छैनन्।
en-mt: However, some other experts are not so optimistic.

sourceString: Paul Hunter, et al., estimated that COVID-19, which seems substantially more infectious than SARS, will not end in 2020.
targetString: पाउल हन्टर, et al., ले वास्तवमा SARS भन्दा थप सङ्क्रामक देखिने COVID-19 को 2020 मा अन्त्य नहुने अनुमान गरे।
en-mt: Paul Hunter, et al., actually predicted that covid-19, which appears more contagious than SARS, would not end in 2020.

sourceString: Ira Longini, et al., established a model to predict the outcome of the epidemic and suggested that SARS-CoV-2 could infect two-thirds of the global population.
targetString: इरा लङ्गिनी, et al. ले महामारीको प्रतिफलको पूर्वानुमान गर्ने नमुना स्थापित गरे र SARS-CoV-2 ले विश्वव्यापी जनसङ्ख्याको दुई-तिहाइलाई सङ्क्रमण हुन सक्ने सुझाव दिए।
en-mt: Ira Longini, et al. established a model for predicting the outcome of the pandemic, and SARS-CoV-2 suggested that two-thirds of the global population could be infected.

sourceString: A Canadian group reported that SARS-CoV-2 was detected in both mid-turbinate and throat swabs of patients who recovered and left the hospital 2 weeks earlier, which indicates that the newly identified virus could become a cyclical episode similar to influenza.
targetString: एक क्यानडियन समूहले 2 हप्ता पहिले निको भएका र घर फर्किएका बिरामीहरूको मध्य-टर्बिनेट र घाँटीको स्वाबमा SARS-CoV-2 देखिएको रिपोर्ट गर्‍यो, जसले नयाँ पहिचान भएको भाइरस इन्फ्लुएन्जा जस्तै चक्रीय शृङ्खला बन्न सक्छ।
en-mt: A Canadian group reported that SARS-CoV-2 was observed in mid-turbinate and throat swabs of patients who had recovered 2 weeks earlier and returned home, which could cause the newly identified virus to become an influenza-like cyclic chain.

sourceString: However, promising signs have occurred in China based on the declining number of new cases, indicating the current strategies might have been working.
targetString: यद्यपि, चीनमा नयाँ मामिलाहरूको घट्दो संख्याका आधारमा आशावादी सङ्केतहरू देखा परेका छन्, जसले वर्तमान रणनीतिहरूले काम गरिरहेको हुनसक्ने संकेत गर्दछ।
en-mt: However, optimistic signs have emerged based on the declining number of new cases in China, indicating that current strategies may be working.

sourceString: Ebola was originally predicted to cause up to a million cases with half a million deaths.
targetString: इबोलालाई मूल रूपमा एक मिलियन केसहरूको साथमा आधा मिलियन मृत्युको कारण बन्ने भविष्यवाणी गरिएको थियो।
en-mt: Ebola was originally predicted to cause half a million deaths, along with one million cases.

sourceString: However, via strict quarantine and isolation, the disease has eventually been put under control.
targetString: यद्यपि, कडा क्वारेन्टाइन र अलगाव मार्फत, रोगलाई अन्त्यमा नियन्त्रणमा राखिएको छ।
en-mt: However, through strict quarantine and isolation, the disease has finally been kept under control.

sourceString: It is possible, similar to SARS-CoV, that SARS-CoV-2 might become weaker in infectivity and eventually die down or become a less pathogenic virus co-existent with humans.
targetString: यो सम्भव छ, SARS-CoV जस्तै, SARS-CoV-2 संक्रमिततामा कमजोर हुन सक्छ र अन्ततः मर्छ वा मानवसँग कम रोगजनक भाइरसको सह-अस्तित्वमा रहन सक्छ।
en-mt: It is possible, like SARS-CoV, that SARS-CoV-2 may weaken in infection and eventually die or co-exist with a less pathogenic virus with humans.

sourceString: A comparison of the epidemic of COVID-19 with that of SARS and MERS is provided below (Fig. ​(Fig.55).
targetString: COVID-19 महामारीको SARS र MERS सँगको तुलना तल दिइएको छ (चित्र ​(चित्र55)।
en-mt: A comparison of the COVID-19 epidemic with SARS and MERS is given below (Figure 55).

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 is highly transmittable through coughing or sneezing, and possibly also through direct contact with materials contaminated by the virus.
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 खोकी वा हाच्छ्युँउको माध्यमबाट र सम्भवतः भाइरसद्वारा दूषित सामग्रीहरूसँग प्रत्यक्ष सम्पर्कको माध्यमबाट अत्यधिक सर्ने गर्छ।
en-mt: SARS-CoV-2 is highly transmitted through coughs or sneezes, and possibly through direct contact with materials contaminated with the virus.

sourceString: The virus was also found in feces, which raises a new possibility of feces-to-mouth transmission.
targetString: यो भाइरस दिसामा पनि भेट्टाइएको थियो, जसले मल द्वार-देखि-मुखको प्रसारणको नयाँ सम्भावना वृद्धि गर्दछ।
en-mt: The virus was also found in feces, which increases the chances of stool door-to-mouth transmission.

sourceString: A recent study on 138 cases reported that 41% of the cases were possibly caused by nosocomial infections, including 17 patients with other prior diseases and 40 health-care providers.
targetString: 138 केसहरूमा गरिएको एउटा हालको अध्ययनले 41% केसहरू सम्भवतः अस्पतालबाट उत्पत्ति हुने सङ्क्रमणद्वारा भएका थिए, जसमा 17 बिरामीहरूमा अन्य पूर्व रोगहरू थिए र 40 जना स्वास्थ्य-स्याहार प्रदायक थिए।
en-mt: A recent study of 138 cases found that 41% of cases were probably caused by infections originating from the hospital, with 17 patients having other prior illnesses and 40 being health-care providers.

sourceString: Thus, great precaution should be used to protect humans, especially health-care providers, social workers, family members, colleagues, and even bystanders in contact with patients or infected people.
targetString: तसर्थ, विशेष गरी स्वास्थ्य-स्याहार प्रदायक, समाजसेवी, पारिवारिक सदस्य, सहकर्मी र बिरामी वा सङ्क्रमित व्यक्तिको सम्पर्कमा पर्ने व्यक्तिहरूले समेत मानवहरूको संरक्षण गर्न ठूलो सावधानी अपनाउनुपर्छ।
en-mt: Therefore, especially health care providers, social workers, family members, co-workers, and even those who come in contact with sick or infected people should exercise great caution in protecting humans.

sourceString: The first line of defense that could be used to lower the risk of infection is through wearing face masks; both the use of surgical masks and N95 respirator masks (series # 1860s) helps control the spread of viruses.
targetString: सङ्क्रमणको जोखिमलाई कम गर्नका लागि प्रयोग गरिने रक्षाको पहिलो पङ्क्ति फेस मास्क लगाउने मार्फत हो; सर्जिकल मास्क र N95 श्वासप्रश्वास मास्क (श्रृंखला # 1860s) दुवैको प्रयोगले भाइरसहरूको फैलावटलाई नियन्त्रण गर्न मद्दत गर्छ।
en-mt: The first line of defense used to reduce the risk of infection is through wearing face masks; The use of both surgical masks and N95 respiratory masks (series #1860s) can help control the spread of viruses.

sourceString: Surgical face masks prevent liquid droplets from a potentially infected individual from traveling through the air or sticking onto surfaces of materials, where they could be passed on to others.
targetString: सर्जिकल अनुहार मास्कले सम्भावित सङ्क्रमित व्यक्तिबाट तरलका छिटाहरूलाई हावा मार्फत यात्रा गर्नबाट वा सामग्रीहरूको सतहमा टाँसिन बाट रोक्छ, जहाँ तिनीहरू अन्यमा सर्न सक्छन्।
en-mt: Surgical face masks prevent droplets of liquid from potentially infected individuals from traveling through the air or sticking to the surface of materials, where they can be transmitted to others.

sourceString: However, only N95 (series # 1860s) masks can protect against the inhalation of virions as small as 10 to 80 nm, with only 5% of the virions being able to penetrate completely; SARS-CoV-2 is similar to SARS-CoV in size and both are approximately 85 nm.
targetString: यद्यपि, N95 (श्रृंखला # 1860s) मास्कले मात्र 10 देखि 80 nm जति साना विषाणुहरूको इनहेलेसनबाट बचाउन सक्छ, 5% विषाणुहरू मात्र पूर्ण रूपमा प्रवेश गर्न सक्षम हुन्छन्; SARS-CoV-2 आकार मा SARS-CoV संग समान छ र दुवै करीव 85 nm का छन्।
en-mt: However, the N95 (series #1860s) mask can only protect against the inhalation of viruses as small as 10 to 80 nm, with only 5% of viruses being able to fully penetrate; SARS-CoV-2 is similar to SARS-CoV in size and both are about 85 nm.

sourceString: Since particles can penetrate even five surgical masks stacked together, health-care providers in direct contact with patients must wear N95 (series # 1860s) masks but not surgical masks.
targetString: कणहरू पाँच ओटा चाङ लगाइएका सर्जिकल मास्कबाट पनि छिर्न सक्ने भएकोले, बिरामीहरूसँग प्रत्यक्ष सम्पर्क हुने स्वास्थ्य-स्याहार प्रदायकहरूले सर्जिकल मास्कको सट्टामा N95 (श्रेणी # 1860s) मास्कहरू लगाउनुपर्छ।
en-mt: Since the particles can also penetrate through surgical masks worn by five changs, health-care providers who have direct contact with patients should wear N95 (Category #1860s) masks instead of surgical masks.

sourceString: In addition to masks, health-care providers should wear fitted isolation gowns in order to further reduce contact with viruses.
targetString: मास्कका साथै, स्वास्थ्य सेवा प्रदायकहरूले भाइरसको सम्पर्कलाई थप कम गर्नका लागि फिट हुने अलगावयुक्त गाउन लगाउनु पर्छ ।
en-mt: In addition to masks, healthcare providers must wear fit isolation gowns to further reduce exposure to the virus.

sourceString: Viruses can also infect an individual through the eyes.
targetString: भाइरसहरूले व्यक्तिलाई आँखाको माध्यमबाट पनि सङ्क्रमित पार्न सक्दछन्।
en-mt: Viruses can also infect a person through the eyes.

sourceString: On January 22, 2020, a doctor was infected with SARS-CoV-2 although he wore an N95 mask; the virus might have entered his body through his inflammatory eyes.
targetString: जनवरी 22, 2020, एक चिकित्सकले N95 मास्क लगाए तापनि SARS-CoV-2 बाट सङ्क्रमित भएका थिए; उनको शरीरमा भाइरस उनका इन्फ्लेमेटरी आँखाबाट प्रवेश गरेको हुनुपर्दछ।
en-mt: On January 22, 2020, a doctor was infected with SARS-CoV-2 despite wearing an N95 mask; The virus must have entered his body through his inflammatory eyes.

sourceString: Thus, health-care providers should also wear transparent face shields or goggles while working with patients.
targetString: त्यसैले, स्वास्थ्य सेवा प्रदायकहरूले पनि बिरामीहरूसँग काम गर्दा पारदर्शी अनुहार कवचहरू वा चश्माहरु लगाउनुपर्दछ।
en-mt: Therefore, healthcare providers should also wear transparent face shields or glasses when working with patients.

sourceString: For the general public in affected or potentially affected areas, it is highly suggested that everybody wash their hands with disinfectant soaps more often than usual, try to stay indoors for self-quarantine and limit contact with potentially infected individuals.
targetString: प्रभावित वा सम्भावित रुपमा प्रभावित क्षेत्रहरूमा सामान्य जनताका लागि, यो अत्यधिक सुझाव दिइन्छ कि सबैले आफ्नो हातहरू कीटाणुनाशक साबुनले सामान्य भन्दा बढी धुनुहोस्, स्वयं-क्वारेन्टाइनका लागि घर भित्र रहने प्रयास गर्नुहोस् र सम्भावित सङ्क्रमित व्यक्तिहरूसँग सम्पर्क सीमित गर्नुहोस्।
en-mt: For the general public in affected or potentially affected areas, it is highly suggested that everyone wash their hands with disinfectant soap more than usual, try to stay indoors for self-quarantine and limit contact with potentially infected people.

sourceString: Three feet is considered an appropriate distance for people to stay away from a patient.
targetString: व्यक्तिहरूका लागि बिरामीबाट टाढा रहनका लागि तीन फिट उपयुक्त दूरी मानिन्छ।
en-mt: Three feet is considered an appropriate distance for individuals to stay away from the patient.

sourceString: These actions are effective methods to lower the risk of infection as well as prevent the spread of the virus.
targetString: यी कार्यहरू सङ्क्रमणको जोखिम न्यून गर्नको साथै भाइरसको प्रसार रोक्नको लागि प्रभावकारी विधिहरू हुन्।
en-mt: These actions are effective methods to reduce the risk of infection as well as to prevent the spread of the virus.

sourceString: Although SARS-CoV-2 came as a new virus to the human world, its high homology to SARS-CoV as reported on 7 January 2020 should have caused high alert to China based on her deep memory of the SARS outbreak in 2003.
targetString: मानव जगतमा SARS-CoV-2 एक नयाँ भाइरसको रूपमा आएको भएतापनि, 7 जनवरी 2020 मा रिपोर्ट गरिएको अनुसार SARS-CoV को उच्च अनुरूपता 2003 को SARS को प्रकोपको गहिरो स्मृतिले चीनमा उच्च चेतावनी गराएको हुनुपर्छ।
en-mt: Although SARS-CoV-2 has emerged as a new virus in the human world, the high conformity of SARS-CoV as reported on 7 January 2020 must have been highly warned by deep memories of the 2003 SARS outbreak in China.

sourceString: However, not until 19 January 2020 did the director of the Center of Disease Control of Wuhan comfort the citizens by saying that the novel virus has low contagiousness and limited reproductivity from human to human and that it is not a problem to prevent and contain the disease.
targetString: यद्यपि, आज 19 जनवरी 2020 सम्म वुहान रोग नियन्त्रण केन्द्रका निर्देशकले नागरिकहरूलाई नयाँ भाइरस कम सङ्क्रामक र मानवदेखि मानवमा सीमित प्रजनन भएको र रोगलाई रोक्न र नियन्त्रण गर्न समस्या नभएको भनी सान्त्वना दिएका छैनन्।
en-mt: However, as of today, January 19, 2020, the Director of the Wuhan Centers for Disease Control has not comforted citizens by saying that the new virus is less contagious and has limited human-to-human reproduction and has no problems preventing and controlling the disease.

sourceString: This message remarkably relaxed the alarm of the public, especially when the entire country was preparing for the Spring Festival, and the critical time was missed to contain the disease at its minimal scale in Wuhan.
targetString: यो सन्देशले जनताको सन्त्रासलाई उल्लेखनीय रूपमा शान्त गर्‍यो, खास गरी जब सम्पूर्ण देश वसन्त चाडको तयारी गर्दै थियो र वुहानमा यसको न्यूनतम स्तरमा यस रोगलाई रोक्ने अत्यन्त महत्वपूर्ण समय छुटेको थियो।
en-mt: This message significantly calmed the panic of the people, especially when the entire country was preparing for the Spring Festival and a very important time was missed to stop the disease at its lowest level in Wuhan.

sourceString: The disease control agencies in China may take this hard lesson and make critical improvements in the future.
targetString: चीनका रोग नियन्त्रण एजेन्सीहरूले यो कठिन पाठ लिन सक्छन् र भविष्यमा महत्त्वपूर्ण सुधार गर्न सक्छन्।
en-mt: China's disease control agencies can take this difficult lesson and make significant improvements in the future.

sourceString: For example, these agencies should be (1) more careful when making public announcements as every word counts to citizens and can change their attitude and decisions; (2) more sensitive and reactive to unusual information from clinics rather than waiting for formal reports from doctors or officials; (3) more restrictive to contain a potential epidemic at its early stage rather than attempting to comfort the public; and (4) more often to issue targeted and effective drills to increase the public's awareness about epidemic diseases and to test and improve the response system of the society periodically.
targetString: उदाहरणको लागि, यी एजेन्सीहरू (1) प्रत्येक शब्द नागरिकको लागि महत्त्वपूर्ण हुने र तिनीहरूको मनोवृत्ति र निर्णयहरू परिवर्तन गर्न सक्ने कारणले सार्वजनिक घोषणाहरू गर्दा थप सावधान हुनुपर्छ; (2) चिकित्सक र अधिकारीहरूबाट औपचारिक रिपोर्टहरूको प्रतीक्षा गर्नुको सट्टा क्लिनिकहरूका असाधारण जानकारीमा थप संवेदनशील र प्रतिक्रियात्मक हुनुपर्छ; (3) जनतालाई सुविधा दिने प्रयास गर्नुको सट्टा सम्भावित महामारीलाई यसको सुरुको चरणमा नियन्त्रण गर्न थप कडा हुनुपर्छ; र (4) महामारी रोगहरूको बारेमा जनताको सजगता बढाउन र समाजको प्रतिक्रिया प्रणालीको परीक्षण र सुधार गर्न लक्षित र प्रभावकारी अभ्यासहरू पटक-पटक जारी गर्नुपर्छ।
en-mt: For example, these agencies should be more careful when making public announcements because (1) each word is important to the citizen and can change their attitudes and decisions; (2) be more sensitive and responsive to the extraordinary information of clinics rather than waiting for formal reports from physicians and authorities; (3) instead of trying to facilitate the public, it should be more stringent to control a potential epidemic in its early stages; and (4) targeted and effective practices should be repeatedly released to increase public awareness of epidemic diseases and to test and improve society's response system.

sourceString: The outbreak of COVID-19 caused by the novel virus SARS-CoV-2 started in the end of December 2019.
targetString: COVID-19 को प्रकोप नोवेल भाइरस SARS-CoV-2 का कारण डिसेम्बर 2019 को अन्त्यमा सुरू भयो।
en-mt: The outbreak of COVID-19 began in late December 2019 due to the novel virus SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: In less than two months, it has spread all over China and near 50 other countries globally at the time of this writing.
targetString: दुई महिना भन्दा कम समयमा, यो लेख्ने समयमा यो चीन भरि र विश्वव्यापी रूपमा लगभग अन्य 50 देशहरूमा फैलिएको छ।
en-mt: In less than two months, at the time of writing it has spread across China and almost 50 other countries worldwide.

sourceString: Since the virus is very similar to SARS-CoV and the symptoms are also similar between COVID-19 and SARS, the outbreak of COVID-19 has created a sense of SARS recurring.
targetString: यो भाइरस SARS-CoV सँग धेरै मिल्दोजुल्दो भएको र COVID-19 र SARS का बीच लक्षणहरू पनि समान भएको हुनाले, COVID-19 को प्रकोपले सार्स पुनरावर्तीको भावना सिर्जना गरेको छ।
en-mt: Since this virus is very similar to SARS-CoV and the symptoms between COVID-19 and SARS are also similar, the outbreak of COVID-19 has created a sense of SARS recurrence.

sourceString: However, there are some remarkable differences between COVID-19 and SARS, which are essential for containing the epidemic and treating the patients.
targetString: यद्यपि, COVID-19 र SARS को बीचमा केही उल्लेखनीय भिन्नताहरू छन्, जुन महामारी नियन्त्रण गर्न र बिरामीहरूको उपचार गर्न अत्यावश्यक छन्।
en-mt: However, there are some notable differences between COVID-19 and SARS, which are essential to controlling the epidemic and treating patients.

sourceString: COVID-19 affects more elderly individuals than youth and more men than women, and the severity and death rate are also higher in elderly individual than in youth.
targetString: COVID-19 ले युवा भन्दा बढी वृद्ध व्यक्तिहरूलाई र महिलाभन्दा पुरुषलाई बढी प्रभाव पार्दछ र गम्भीरता र मृत्यु दर पनि युवामा भन्दा वृद्ध व्यक्तिहरूमा उच्च हुन्छन्।
en-mt: COVID-19 affects older people more than young people and men more than women and severity and mortality rates are also higher in older people than in young people.

sourceString: SARS has higher mortality than COVID-19 (10.91% versus 1.44%).
targetString: SARS को COVID-19 भन्दा बढी मृत्युदर छ (10.91% र 1.44%)।
en-mt: SARS has a higher mortality rate than COVID-19 (10.91% and 1.44%).

sourceString: COVID-19 patients transmit the virus even when they are symptomless whereas SARS patients do so usually when they are severely ill, which causes much greater difficulty to contain the spread of COVID-19 than SARS.
targetString: COVID-19 का बिरामीहरूले आफू लक्षणविहीन हुँदा समेत भाइरस प्रसारण गर्न सक्छन् जबकि SARS बिरामीहरूले आफू गम्भीर रूपले बिरामी हुँदा मात्र प्रायः यस्तो गर्न सक्छन्, जसले SARS लाई भन्दा COVID-19 लाई नियन्त्रण गर्न ज्यादै धेरै कठिन बनाउँछ।
en-mt: Covid-19 patients can transmit the virus even when they are asymptomatic, while SARS patients can do so only when they are seriously ill, which makes IT much more difficult to control COVID-19 than SARS.

sourceString: This partially explains why SARS-CoV-2 spread much faster and broader than SARS-CoV.
targetString: यसले SARS-CoV-2 किन SARS-CoV भन्दा धेरै छिटो र व्यापक रूपमा प्रसार हुन्छ भन्ने कुरा आंशिक रूपले बताउँछ।
en-mt: This partly explains why SARS-CoV-2 spreads much faster and more widely than SARS-CoV.

sourceString: The regular RNA assay for SARS-CoV-2 can be negative in some COVID-19 patients.
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 का लागि नियमित RNA जाँच केही COVID-19 बिरामीहरूमा नकारात्मक हुन सक्छ।
en-mt: Routine RNA checks for SARS-CoV-2 may be negative in some COVID-19 patients.

sourceString: On the other hand, cured patients can be positive for the virus again.
targetString: अर्कोतर्फ, उपचार गरिएका बिरामीहरू फेरि भाइरसको लागि सकारात्मक हुन सक्छन्।
en-mt: On the other hand, treated patients may again be positive for the virus.

sourceString: These findings dramatically increase the risk of virus spreading.
targetString: यी निष्कर्षहरूले भाइरस प्रसारको जोखिमलाई नाटकीय रूपले वृद्धि गर्छन्।
en-mt: These findings dramatically increase the risk of virus spread.

sourceString: Given such rapid progress in research on COVID-19, several critical issues remain to be solved, as follows:
targetString: COVID-19 मा अनुसन्धानको यस्तो द्रुत विकासले, निम्नानुसार गम्भीर जटिल समस्याहरू समाधान हुन बाँकी छन्:
en-mt: With such rapid development of research on COVID-19, serious complex problems remain to be solved as follows:

sourceString: Where did SARS-CoV-2 come from?
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 कहाँबाट आयो?
en-mt: Where did SARS-CoV-2 come from?

sourceString: Although 96% genetic homolog was found between SARS-CoV-2 and two bat SARS-like CoVs, we still cannot conclude that SARS-CoV-2 is from bats.
targetString: यद्यपि SARS-CoV-2 र दुई चमेरा SARS-जस्तो CoVs का बीचमा 96% आनुवंशिक समरुपता फेला परेको थियो, हामी अझै पनि SARS-CoV-2 चमेराहरुबाट आएको भन्ने निष्कर्षमा पुग्न सक्दैनौं।
en-mt: Although 96% genetic similarity was found between SARS-CoV-2 and two bat SARS-like CoVs, we still cannot conclude that SARS-CoV-2 came from bats.

sourceString: What animal was the intermediate species to transmit the virus from the original host, say bats, to humans?
targetString: मूल होस्ट, भनौँ चमेराहरूबाट भाइरसलाई मानिसमा सार्ने मध्यवर्ती प्रजाति कुन जनावर थियो?
en-mt: Which animal was the intermediate species that transmitted the virus from the original host, let's say bats, to humans?

sourceString: Without knowing answers to #1 and 2, we cannot efficiently cut the transmission, and the outbreak can relapse at any time.
targetString: #1 र 2 को जवाफ थाहा नपाइकन हामी सङ्क्रमणलाई कुशलताका साथ कटौती गर्न सक्दैनौँ र प्रकोप कुनै पनि समयमा दोहोरिन सक्छ।
en-mt: Without knowing the answer to #1 and 2, we can't efficiently cut the infection and the outbreak can repeat at any time.

sourceString: Although molecular modeling and biochemical assays have demonstrated that SARS-CoV-2 binds to ACE2, how exactly does the virus enter the airway cells and cause subsequent pathological changes?
targetString: आणविक मोडलिङ र जैव रसायन परीक्षणहरूले SARS-CoV-2 ACE2 सँग बाँधिने देखाएको भएतापनि, भाइरस ठ्याक्कै कसरी वायुमार्ग कोषहरूमा प्रवेश गर्दछ र त्यसपछि रोगजनक परिवर्तनहरू ल्याउँदछ?
en-mt: Although molecular modeling and biochemistry tests have shown that SARS-CoV-2 binds to ACE2, exactly how does the virus enter airway cells and then bring about pathogenic changes?

sourceString: Does the virus also bind ACE2-expressing cells in other organs?
targetString: के भाइरसले अन्य अंगहरूमा ACE2-अभिव्यक्त गर्ने कोषहरूलाई पनि बाँध्छ?
en-mt: Does the virus also bind to ACE2-expressing cells in other organs?

sourceString: Without clear answers to these questions, we cannot achieve fast and accurate diagnosis and effective treatment.
targetString: यी प्रश्नहरूको स्पष्ट जवाफ बिना, हामी चाँडो र सही निदान र प्रभावकारी उपचार प्राप्त गर्न सक्दैनौं।
en-mt: Without clear answers to these questions, we cannot get a quick and accurate diagnosis and effective treatment.

sourceString: How long will the epidemic last?
targetString: यो महामारी कहिले सम्म रहनेछ?
en-mt: How long will this pandemic last?

sourceString: How is the virus genetically evolving during transmission among humans?
targetString: मानवहरूका बीचमा सङ्क्रमणको क्रममा भाइरस कसरी आनुवंशिक रूपमा विकसित हुँदै छ?
en-mt: How is the virus evolving genetically during infection among humans?

sourceString: Will it become a pandemic worldwide, die down like SARS or relapse periodically like the flu?
targetString: के यो विश्वव्यापी रूपमा महामारी बन्नेछ, SARS जस्तै मर्नेछ वा फ्लू जस्तै आवधिक रूपमा दोहोरिनेछ?
en-mt: Will it become a global pandemic, die like SARS, or repeat periodically like the flu?

sourceString: It is essential but may take some time to search for answers to the above and many other questions.
targetString: यो आवश्यक छ तर माथिको र अन्य धेरै प्रश्नहरूको जवाफ खोज्नको लागि केही समय लाग्न सक्छ।
en-mt: This is necessary but it may take some time to find answers to the above and many other questions.

sourceString: However, with whatever expense it may demand, we have no other choice but to stop the epidemic as soon as possible and bring our life back to normal.
targetString: यद्यपि, यसले जतिसुकै खर्चको माग गरे तापनि, हामीसँग महामारी लाई चाँडो भन्दा चाँडो रोक्नु र आफ्नो जीवनलाई सामान्य अवस्थामा फिर्ता ल्याउनु बाहेक अर्को कुनै विकल्प छैन।
en-mt: However, no matter how much expenditure it demands, we have no choice but to stop the pandemic as soon as possible and bring our lives back to normal.

sourceString: Zoonotic origins of human coronaviruses
targetString: मानव कोरोनाभाइरसहरूको जुनोटिक उत्पत्ति
en-mt: Zoonotic origin of human coronaviruses

sourceString: Mutation and adaptation have driven the co-evolution of coronaviruses (CoVs) and their hosts, including human beings, for thousands of years.
targetString: उत्परिवर्तन र अनुकूलनले कोरोनाभाइरसहरू (CoV हरू) को सह-विकास र हजारौं बर्षदेखि मानिसहरूसहित उनीहरूको होस्टहरू चलाएको छ।
en-mt: Mutations and adaptations have led to the co-evolution of coronaviruses (CoVs) and running their hosts, including humans, for thousands of years.

sourceString: Before 2003, two human CoVs (HCoVs) were known to cause mild illness, such as common cold.
targetString: 2003 भन्दा पहिले, दुई मानव CoV हरू (HCoV हरू) लाई रुघाखोकी जस्तै हल्का बिमारी भएको थियो।
en-mt: Prior to 2003, two human CoVs (HCoVs) had a mild illness similar to a cold.

sourceString: The outbreaks of severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS) and the Middle East respiratory syndrome (MERS) have flipped the coin to reveal how devastating and life-threatening an HCoV infection could be.
targetString: गम्भीर तीव्र श्वासप्रश्वास सिन्ड्रोम (SARS) र मिडल इस्ट श्वासप्रश्वास सिन्ड्रोम (MERS) को प्रकोपले HCoV सङ्क्रमण कत्तिको विनाशकारी र जीवनमा जोखिमपूर्ण हुन सक्छ भन्ने कुरा देखाउनका लागि सिक्का पल्टाएको छ।
en-mt: Outbreaks of severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS) and Middle East respiratory syndrome (MERS) have turned the coin to show how devastating and life-threatening HCoV infection can be.

sourceString: The emergence of SARS-CoV-2 in central China at the end of 2019 has thrusted CoVs into the spotlight again and surprised us with its high transmissibility but reduced pathogenicity compared to its sister SARS-CoV.
targetString: 2019 को अन्त्यमा केन्द्रीय चीनमा भएको SARS-CoV-2 को उदयले CoV हरूलाई फेरि स्पोटलाइटमा रोकेको छ र हामीलाई यसको उच्च प्रसारणले आश्चर्यचकित पारेको छ तर यसको सिस्टर SARS-CoV को तुलनामा कम रोगजनक छ।
en-mt: The rise of SARS-CoV-2 in central China at the end of 2019 has stopped CoVs again in the spotlight and surprised us by its high transmission but less pathogenic than its sister SARS-CoV.

sourceString: HCoV infection is a zoonosis and understanding the zoonotic origins of HCoVs would serve us well.
targetString: HCoV सङ्क्रमण एक जुनोसिस हो र HCoVs को जुनोटिक उत्पत्ति बुझ्नाले हामीलाई सहयोग मिल्नेछ।
en-mt: HCoV infection is a zoonosis and understanding the zoonotic origin of HCoVs will help us.

sourceString: Most HCoVs originated from bats where they are non-pathogenic.
targetString: धेरैजसो HCoV हरू चमेरोहरूबाट उत्पन्न भएका हुन् जहाँ तिनीहरू गैर-रोगजनक हुन्छन्।
