en-mt: Most HCoVs originate from bats where they are non-pathogenic.

sourceString: The intermediate reservoir hosts of some HCoVs are also known.
targetString: केही HCoV हरूको मध्यवर्ती सञ्चय होस्टहरू पनि परिचित छन्।
en-mt: Intermediate accumulation hosts of some HCoVs are also known.

sourceString: Identifying the animal hosts has direct implications in the prevention of human diseases.
targetString: रोग लागेका पशुहरू पहिचान गर्दा यसले मानव रोगको रोकथाममा प्रत्यक्ष प्रभाव पार्दछ।
en-mt: Identifying diseased animals has a direct impact on the prevention of human disease.

sourceString: Investigating CoV-host interactions in animals might also derive important insight on CoV pathogenesis in humans.
targetString: पशुहरूमा CoV-होस्टका अन्तरक्रियाहरूको अनुसन्धानले पनि मानिसहरूमा CoV रोगजनक बारे महत्त्वपूर्ण अन्तरदृष्टि लिन सक्छन्।
en-mt: Research into CoV-host interactions in animals can also lead to important insights into CoV pathogens in humans.

sourceString: In this review, we present an overview of the existing knowledge about the seven HCoVs, with a focus on the history of their discovery as well as their zoonotic origins and interspecies transmission.
targetString: यस समीक्षामा, हामी सात HCoV हरूको आविष्कारका साथै उनीहरूको जुनोटिक उत्पत्ति र अन्तरप्रजातिय संक्रमणको इतिहासमा केन्द्रित गर्दै उनीहरूको बारेमा विद्यमान ज्ञानको संक्षिप्त विवरण प्रस्तुत गर्छौँ।
en-mt: In this review, we present a brief account of the existing knowledge about the seven HCoVs, focusing on their inventions as well as their zoonotic origins and history of interspecies transitions.

sourceString: Importantly, we compare and contrast the different HCoVs from a perspective of virus evolution and genome recombination.
targetString: महत्त्वपूर्ण रूपमा, हामी भाइरसको विकास र जिनोम पुनर्संयोगको दृष्टिकोणबाट विभिन्न HCoVs को तुलना र यसको भेद गर्छौँ।
en-mt: Importantly, we compare and distinguish different HCoVs from the point of view of virus evolution and genome recombination.

sourceString: The current CoV disease 2019 (COVID-19) epidemic is discussed in this context.
targetString: वर्तमान CoV रोग 2019 (COVID-19) महामारी बारे यस सन्दर्भमा छलफल गरिएको छ।
en-mt: The current CoV disease 2019 (COVID-19) epidemic is discussed in this context.

sourceString: In addition, the requirements for successful host switches and the implications of virus evolution on disease severity are also highlighted.
targetString: यसका अतिरिक्त, सफल होस्ट परिवर्तनका लागि आवश्यकता र रोगको गम्भीरतामा भाइरस विकासको प्रभावहरू पनि प्रकाश पारिएका छन्।
en-mt: In addition, the need for successful host changes and the effects of virus development on disease severity are also highlighted.

sourceString: Coronaviruses (CoVs) belong to the family Coronaviridae, which comprises a group of enveloped, positive-sensed, single-stranded RNA viruses.
targetString: कोरोनाभाइरस (CoV हरू) खाम, सकारात्मक-भाव, एकल-मानक RNA भाइरसहरूको समूह समावेश गर्ने कोरोनाभिरिडी परिवारसँग सम्बन्धित छ।
en-mt: Coronaviruses (CoVs) belong to the coronaviridae family comprising a group of envelope, positive-sense, single-standard RNA viruses.

sourceString: These viruses harbouring the largest genome of 26 to 32 kilobases amongst RNA viruses were termed “CoVs” because of their crown-like morphology under electron microscope.
targetString: RNA भाइरसहरूमध्ये सबैभन्दा ठूलो जेनोम 26 देखि 32 किलोबेसहरूलई आश्रय दिने यी भाइरसहरूलाई उनीहरूको इलेक्ट्रोन माइक्रोस्कोप अन्तर्गतको मुकुट जस्तो आकृतिको कारणले "CoV हरू" भनिएको थियो।
en-mt: These viruses harboring the largest genome of RNA viruses ranging from 26 to 32 kilobases were called "CoVs" due to their crown-like shape under the electron microscope.

sourceString: Structurally, CoVs have non-segmented genomes that share a similar organization.
targetString: संरचनात्मक रूपमा, CoV हरूमा समान संस्था साझा गर्ने गैर-विभाजित जिनोमहरू छन्।
en-mt: Structurally, CoVs have non-spliced genomes that share the same entity.

sourceString: Approximately two thirds of the genome contain two large overlapping open reading frames (ORF1a and ORF1b), which are translated into the pp1a and pp1ab replicase polyproteins.
targetString: जिनोमको लगभग दुईतिहाईमा pp1a र pp1ab कुनाका पोलिप्रोटिनहरूमा अनुवाद गरिएको दुई ठूला खप्टिएका खुला पठन फ्रेमहरू (ORF1a र ORF1b) समावेश छन्।
en-mt: About two-thirds of the genome consist of two large scraped open reading frames (ORF1a and ORF1b) translated into polyproteins in the pp1a and pp1ab corners.

sourceString: The polyproteins are further processed to generate 16 non-structural proteins, designated nsp1~16.
targetString: पोलीप्रोटिनहरूलाई निर्दिष्ट गरिएको nsp1~16, 16 गैर-संरचनात्मक प्रोटिनहरू निर्माण गर्न थप प्रक्रिया गरिएको छ।
en-mt: The polyproteins assigned to nsp1~16, 16 are further processed to form non-structural proteins.

sourceString: The remaining portion of the genome contains ORFs for the structural proteins, including spike (S), envelope (E), membrane (M) and nucleoprotein (N).
targetString: जिनोमको बाँकी भागमा संरचनात्मक प्रोटिनहरूको लागि ओआरएफ हुन्छन् जसमा स्पाइक (S), खाम (E), झिल्ली (M) र न्यूक्लियोप्रोटीन (N) समावेश छ।
en-mt: The rest of the genome contains ORFs for structural proteins including spike (S), envelope (E), membrane (M) and nucleoprotein (N).

sourceString: A number of lineage-specific accessory proteins are also encoded by different lineages of CoVs.
targetString: विभिन्न CoV हरूका वंशजहरूद्वारा थुप्रै वंशज-विशिष्ट सहायक प्रोटिनहरू पनि इनकोड गरिएका छन्।
en-mt: Several lineage-specific helper proteins have also been encoded by descendants of various CoVs.

sourceString: Based on the difference in protein sequences, CoVs are classified into four genera (alpha-CoV, beta-CoV, gamma-CoV and delta-CoV), among which the beta-CoV genera contains most HCoVs and is subdivided into four lineages (A, B, C and D).
targetString: प्रोटिन अनुक्रममा फरकको आधारमा, CoVs लाई चार जेनेरा (अल्फा-CoV, बेटा-CoV, गामा-CoV र डेल्टा-CoV) मा वर्गीकृत गरिएको छ, जसमध्ये बेटा-CoV जेनेराले अधिकांश HCoVs समावेश गर्छ र यसलाई चार वंश (A , B, C र D) मा उपविभाजित गरिएको छ।
en-mt: Based on differences in protein sequences, CoVs is classified into four genera (alpha-CoV, Beta-CoV, Gamma-CoV and Delta-CoV), of which the Beta-CoV genera contains most HCoVs and is subdivided into four lineages (A, B, C and D).

sourceString: Phylogenetic evidence has shown that bats and rodents serve as the gene source of most alpha-CoVs and beta-CoVs, while birds are the main reservoir of gamma-CoVs and delta-CoVs.
targetString: जातिवृत्तीय प्रमाणले, चमेरा र मुसाहरूलाई धेरैजसो अल्फा-CoV हरू र बेटा-CoV हरूको जिन स्रोतको रूपमा मानिन्छ भने यसैगरी चराहरू गामा-CoV हरू र डेल्टा-CoV हरूको मुख्य जलाशय हुन् भन्ने कुरा देखाएको छ।
en-mt: Genetic evidence has shown that bats and mice are considered gene sources of most alpha-CoVs and beta-CoVs, while birds are similarly the main reservoir of gamma-CoVs and delta-CoVs.

sourceString: For thousands of years, CoVs have constantly crossed species barriers and some have emerged as important human pathogens.
targetString: हजारौँ वर्षदेखि, CoVs ले निरन्तर रूपमा विभिन्न प्रजातिहरूको बाधालाई पार गर्दै आएका छन् र केही भने महत्त्वपूर्ण मानव रोगको रूपमा देखा परेका छन्।
en-mt: For thousands of years, CoVs has consistently overcome the barrier of different species, and some have emerged as important human diseases.

sourceString: To date, seven human CoVs (HCoVs) are known.
targetString: आजसम्म, सात मानव CoV हरू (HCoV हरू) परिचित छन्।
en-mt: To date, seven human CoVs (HCoVs) are known.

sourceString: Among them HCoV-229E and HCoV-NL63 are alpha-CoVs.
targetString: तीमध्ये HCoV-229E र HCoV-NL63 अल्फा-CoV हरू हुन्।
en-mt: Among them are HCoV-229E and HCoV-NL63 alpha-CoVs.

sourceString: The other five beta-CoVs include HCoV-OC43, HCoV-HKU1, severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus (SARS-CoV), Middle East respiratory syndrome coronavirus (MERS-CoV) and SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: अन्य पाँच बेटा-CoV हरूमा HCoV-OC43, HCoV-HKU1, गम्भीर तीव्र श्वासप्रश्वास सिन्ड्रोम कोरोनाभाइरस (SARS-CoV), मिडल इस्ट श्वासप्रश्वास सिन्ड्रोम कोरोनाभाइरस (MERS-CoV) र SARS-CoV-2 समावेश हुन्छ।
en-mt: The other five beta-CoVs include HCoV-OC43, HCoV-HKU1, severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus (SARS-CoV), Middle East Respiratory Syndrome Coronavirus (MERS-CoV) and SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: HCoV-229E, HCoV-OC43, HCoV-HKU1 and HCoV-NL63 usually cause mild symptoms, like common cold and/or diarrhea.
targetString: HCoV-229E, HCoV-OC43, HCoV-HKU1 र HCoV-NL63 ले प्राय: रुघाखोकी र/वा पखाला जस्ता हल्का लक्षणहरू निम्त्याउँछ।
en-mt: HCoV-229E, HCoV-OC43, HCoV-HKU1 and HCoV-NL63 often cause mild symptoms such as cold and/or diarrhea.

sourceString: In contrast, SARS-CoV, MERS-CoV and the newly-identified SARS-CoV-2 are highly pathogenic, causing severe lower respiratory tract infection in relatively more patients with a higher chance to develop acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS) and extrapulmonary manifestations.
targetString: यसको विपरीत, तीव्र श्वासप्रश्वासको समस्या सिन्ड्रोम (ARDS) र एक्स्ट्रापल्मोनरी अभिव्यक्तिहरू विकास गर्ने उच्च सम्भावनाको तुलनामा अधिक बिरामीहरूमा गम्भीर तल्लो श्वासप्रश्वास मार्ग सङ्क्रमणको कारणले SARS-CoV, MERS-CoV र भर्खरै पहिचान गरिएको SARS-CoV-2 अत्यधिक रोगजनक हुन्।
en-mt: In contrast, SARS-CoV, MERS-CoV and newly identified SARS-CoV-2 are highly pathogenic due to severe lower respiratory tract infections in more patients compared to those with a high probability of developing acute respiratory problem syndrome (ARDS) and extrapulmonary manifestations.

sourceString: The first HCoV-229E strain, B814, was isolated from the nasal discharge of patients with common cold in mid-1960s.
targetString: पहिलो HCoV-229E तनाव, B814 लाई सन् 1960 दशकको बीचमा रुघा लागेका बिरामीहरूको नाकबाट अलग गरिएको थियो।
en-mt: The first HCoV-229E strain, B814, was isolated from the noses of patients with colds in the mid-1960s.

sourceString: Since then, more knowledge was accumulated through extensive studies on HCoV-229E and HCoV-OC43, both of which cause self-limiting symptoms.
targetString: त्यस बेलादेखि, HCoV-229E र HCoV-OC43 मा विस्तृत अध्ययनहरू मार्फत अधिक ज्ञान सञ्चय गरिएको थियो, जसमध्ये दुबैले स्वयं-सीमित हुने लक्षणहरू निम्त्याउँछन्।
en-mt: Since then, more knowledge was accumulated through detailed studies on HCoV-229E and HCoV-OC43, both of which lead to self-limiting symptoms.

sourceString: Indeed, the concept had been widely accepted that infection with HCoVs is generally harmless until the outbreak of SARS.
targetString: वास्तवमा, SARS को प्रकोप नहुँदासम्म HCoV हरूको सङ्क्रमण सामान्यतया हानिरहित भएको अवधारणा व्यापक रूपमा स्वीकार गरिएको थियो।
en-mt: In fact, the concept that HCoV infection was generally harmless until the outbreak of SARS was widely accepted.

sourceString: The SARS outbreak occurred in 2003 is one of the most devastating in current history, infecting over 8,000 people with a crude case fatality of approximately 10%.
targetString: लगभग 10% कच्चा केसको साथमा 8,000 भन्दा बढी मानिसहरूलाई सङ्क्रमित गर्ने 2003 मा देखा परेको SARS को प्रकोप वर्तमान इतिहासको सबैभन्दा विनाशकारी अवस्था हो।
en-mt: The SARS outbreak that emerged in 2003, infecting more than 8,000 people with nearly 10% of the raw cases, is the most devastating condition in current history.

sourceString: Ten years later, the Middle East respiratory syndrome (MERS) outbreak resulted in a persistent epidemic in the Arabian Peninsula with sporadic spreading to the rest of the world.
targetString: दस वर्ष पछि, मध्य पूर्व श्वासप्रश्वास लक्षण (MERS) प्रकोपको परिणामस्वरूप अरबी प्रायद्वीपहरूमा महामारी सुरु हुनेछ र त्यो विश्वका अन्य भूभागहरूमा पनि फैलिनेछ।
en-mt: Ten years later, the Middle East Respiratory Symptoms (MERS) outbreak will result in an epidemic in the Arabian Peninsula and spread to other parts of the world.

sourceString: The 2019 novel HCoV (2019-nCoV), which has subsequently been renamed SARS-CoV-2, is the causative agent of the ongoing epidemic of coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19), which has claimed more than 3,120 lives and infected more than 91,000 people as of March 3, 2020.
targetString: 2019 को नोबेल HCoV (2019-nCoV), जसलाई पछि SARS-CoV-2 नाम दिइएको थियो, कोरोनोभाइरस रोग 2019 (COVID-19) चलिरहेको महामारीको रूपमा प्रकट भएको छ, जसले 3,120 भन्दा बढीको ज्यान लिएको छ र यसबाट सङक्रमित 3 मार्च, 2020 सम्म 91,000 मानिसहरू रहेका थिए।
en-mt: The 2019 Nobel HCoV (2019-nCoV), which was later renamed SARS-CoV-2, has emerged as an ongoing pandemic of coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19), which has killed more than 3,120 people and infected with it, covering 91,000 people as of March 3, 2020.

sourceString: The alarm has been ringing and the world has to prepare for the coming pandemic of SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: अलार्म बजिरहेको छ र विश्वले SARS-CoV-2 को आउँदै गरेको महामारीका लागि तयारी गर्नु पर्छ।
en-mt: The alarm is ringing and the world must prepare for the upcoming pandemic of SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: All seven HCoVs have a zoonotic origin from bats, mice or domestic animals.
targetString: सबै सात HCoV विषाणुहरू चमेरा, मुसा वा घरेलु जनावरबाट उत्पत्ति हुन्छन्।
en-mt: All seven HCoV viruses originate from bats, mice, or domestic animals.

sourceString: Multiple lines of evidence support an evolutionary origin of all HCoVs from bats, where viruses are well adapted and non-pathogenic but show great genetic diversity.
targetString: प्रमाणका बहु रेखाहरूले चमेराहरूबाट सबै HCoV को विकासवादी उत्पत्तिलाई समर्थन गर्दछन्, जहाँ भाइरसहरू राम्रोसँग अनुकूलित र गैर-रोगजनक हुन्छन् तर ठूलो आनुवंशिक विविधता देखाउँछन्।
en-mt: Multiple lines of evidence support the evolutionary origin of all HCoVs from bats, where viruses are well adapted and non-pathogenic but show great genetic diversity.

sourceString: The COVID-19 epidemic has presented enormous medical, scientific, social and moral challenges to China and the world.
targetString: COVID-19 महामारीले चीन र विश्वका लागि एकदमै ठूलो चिकित्सा, वैज्ञानिक, सामाजिक र नैतिक चुनौतीहरू दिएको छ।
en-mt: The COVID-19 pandemic has presented enormous medical, scientific, social and ethical challenges for China and the world.

sourceString: Tracing the zoonotic origins of HCoVs provides a framework to understand the natural history, driving force and restriction factors of species jumping.
targetString: HCoV हरूको जुनोटिक उत्पत्ति ट्रेस गर्नाले प्राकृतिक इतिहास, प्रतिबन्ध कारकहरू र प्रजाति जम्पिङको ड्राइभिङ फोर्स बारे बुझ्नका लागि रूपरेखा प्रदान गर्छ।
en-mt: Tracing the zoonotic origin of HCoVs provides a framework for understanding natural history, restriction factors, and the driving force of species jumping.

sourceString: This might also guide or facilitate the search for the reservoir, intermediate and amplifying animal host(s) of SARS-CoV-2, with important implications in the prevention of future spillovers.
targetString: यसले भविष्यको फैलावट रोकथाममा महत्वपूर्ण प्रभावको साथ SARS-CoV-2 को जलाशय, मध्यवर्ती र प्रवर्धन जनावर होस्ट(हरू) को लागि मार्गनिर्देशन वा खोजी गर्न पनि सक्दछ।
en-mt: It can also guide or search for reservoir, intermediate and amplified animal host(s) of SARS-CoV-2 with significant impact on future dispersal prevention.

sourceString: In this review we present an overview of the zoonotic origins, interspecies transmission and pathogenesis of HCoVs.
targetString: यस समीक्षामा हामी जुनोटिक उत्पत्ति, अन्तरप्रजातीय संक्रमण र HCoV हरूको प्याथोजेनेसिसको संक्षिप्त विवरण प्रस्तुत गर्छौं।
en-mt: In this review we present a brief description of zoonotic origins, interspecific infections, and pathogenesis of HCoVs.

sourceString: Particularly, we highlight and discuss the common theme that parental viruses of HCoVs are typically non-pathogenic in their natural reservoir hosts but become pathogenic after interspecies transmission to a new host.
targetString: विशेष रूपमा, हामी प्रकाश पार्छौँ र छलफल गर्छौं कि सामान्य विषय HCoVs को उत्पादक भाइरस सामान्यतया आफ्नो प्राकृतिक स्थान होस्टहरूमा गैर रोगजनक हो तर नयाँ होस्टमा छेउछाउको सङ्क्रमण पछि रोगजनक बन्छ।
en-mt: Specifically, we highlight and discuss whether the producing virus of the common theme HCoVs is usually non-pathogenic in its natural location hosts but becomes pathogenic after adjacent infection in the new host.

sourceString: We also review the trend of HCoV evolution in which the increase in transmissibility often comes with the decrease in pathogenicity.
targetString: हामी HCoV विकासको चलनलाई पनि समीक्षा गर्दछौँ जसमा प्रसारणको वृद्धि प्राय: प्याथोजेनिसिटीको कमी अनुसार हुन्छ।
en-mt: We also review the trend of HCoV evolution in which the growth of transmission is often in accordance with a lack of pathogenicity.

sourceString: The outcome of the ongoing SARS-CoV-2 outbreak is also discussed in this context.
targetString: यस सन्दर्भमा भइरहेको SARS-CoV-2 को प्रकोपको नतिजा पनि छलफल गरिएको छ।
en-mt: The consequences of the ongoing SARS-CoV-2 outbreak are also discussed in this context.

sourceString: Animal CoVs have been known since late 1930s.
targetString: पशुका CoV हरू अघिल्लो 1930 को दशकको अन्तिमदेखि पत्ता लागेका छन्।
en-mt: Animal CoVs have been discovered since the late 1930s.

sourceString: Before the first isolation of HCoV-229E strain B814 from the nasal discharge of patients who had contracted common cold, different CoVs had been isolated in various infected animals, including turkey, mouse, cow, pig, cat and dog.
targetString: रुघा लागेका विरामीहरूको नाकबाट सिँगान बग्नाले B814 थकान भएर HCoV-229E पहिले छुट्टिनुअघि टर्की, मुसा, गाई, सुँगुर, बिरालो र कुकुर लगायत विभिन्न सङ्क्रमित जनावरहरूमा विभिन्न CoV हरू छुट्टिएका थिए।
en-mt: B814 fatigue caused b814 fatigue due to the flow of horns from the noses of patients with cold. HCoV-229E Before separation, various CoVs were isolated in various infected animals, including turkeys, rats, cows, pigs, cats, and dogs.

sourceString: In the past decades, seven HCoVs have been identified.
targetString: पछिल्ला दशकहरूमा, सात HCoV हरू पहिचान गरिएको छ।
en-mt: In recent decades, seven HCoVs have been identified.

sourceString: A brief summary of the history of HCoV discovery in chronological order (Table ​1) would be informative and instructive.
targetString: कालानुक्रमिक क्रम (तालिका 1) मा HCoV खोजको इतिहासको एक संक्षिप्त सार जानकारीपूर्ण र जानकारीमूलक हुनेछ।
en-mt: A brief summary of the history of HCoV searches in chronological order (Table 1) will be informative and informative.

sourceString: The first HCoV-229E strain was isolated from the respiratory tract of patients with upper respiratory tract infection in the year of 1966, and was subsequently adapted to grow in WI-38 lung cell lines.
targetString: पहिलो HCoV-229E तनाव सन् 1966 मा माथिल्लो श्वसन मार्ग सङ्क्रमण भएका बिरामीहरूको श्वसन मार्गबाट अलग गरिएको थियो र पछि WI-38 फोक्सो कोष लाइनहरूमा बढ्न अनुकूलित गरिएको थियो।
en-mt: The first HCoV-229E strain was isolated from the respiratory tract of patients with upper respiratory tract infections in 1966 and later adapted to grow in WI-38 lung cell lines.

sourceString: Patients infected with HCoV-229E presented with common cold symptoms, including headache, sneezing, malaise and sore-throat, with fever and cough seen in 10~20% cases.
targetString: HCoV-229E बाट सङ्क्रमित बिरामीहरूको 10~20% केसहरूमा ज्वरो आउने र खोकी लाग्ने सँगै टाउको दुख्ने, हाँछ्यु आउने, अस्वस्थता र घाँटी दुख्ने सहित सामान्य रूघाको लक्षण देखियो।
en-mt: 10~20% of cases of patients infected with HCoV-229E had symptoms of common cold, including fever and cough, along with headache, sneezing, ill-health and sore throat.

sourceString: Later in 1967, HCoV-OC43 was isolated from organ culture and subsequent serial passage in brains of suckling mice.
targetString: पछि 1967 मा, HCoV-OC43 लाई अङ्ग संस्कृति र चुस्ने मुसाको दिमागमा पछि आउने सिरियल प्यासेजबाट आइसोलेट गरिएको थियो।
en-mt: Later in 1967, HCoV-OC43 was isolated from the organ culture and subsequent serial passages in the brains of sucking mice.

sourceString: The clinical features of HCoV-OC43 infection appear to be similar to those caused by HCoV-229E, which are symptomatically indistinguishable from infection with other respiratory tract pathogens such as influenza A viruses and rhinoviruses.
targetString: HCoV-OC43 सङ्क्रमणका क्लिनिकल विशेषताहरू इन्फ्लुएन्जा A भाइरस र राइनोभाइरस जस्ता अन्य श्वासप्रश्वास मार्गका रोगजनकहरूको सङ्क्रमणबाट लक्षणात्मक रूपमा फरक भएका HCoV-229E द्वारा भएका कुराहरू जस्तै देखिन्छ।
en-mt: The clinical features of HCoV-OC43 infection appear to be similar to what is caused by HCoV-229E, symptomatically different from infection with other respiratory tract pathogens such as influenza A virus and rhinovirus.

sourceString: Both HCoV-229E and HCoV-OC43 are distributed globally, and they tend to be predominantly transmitted during the season of winter in temperate climate.
targetString: दुवै HCoV-229E र HCoV-OC43 विश्वव्यापी रूपमा वितरण गरिएको छ र तिनीहरू मुख्य रूपमा मध्यम जलवायुमा हुने जाडो मौसमको समयमा संक्रमण हुन सक्छन्।
en-mt: Both HCoV-229E and HCoV-OC43 are distributed worldwide and they can be transitioned during the winter season that occurs mainly in moderate climates.

sourceString: Generally, the incubation time of these two viruses is less than one week, followed by an approximately 2-week illness.
targetString: सामान्यतया, यी दुई भाइरसहरूको ऊष्मायन समय लगभग 2 हप्ताको बिमारीद्वारा पालना गरी, एक हप्ता भन्दा कम हुन्छ।
en-mt: In general, the incubation time of these two viruses is less than a week, followed by a disease of about 2 weeks.

sourceString: According to a human volunteer study, healthy individuals infected with HCoV-229E developed mild common cold.
targetString: मानव स्वयंसेवक अध्ययन अनुसार, HCoV-229E सङ्क्रमित स्वस्थ व्यक्तिहरूलाई हल्का रुघाखोकी लाग्छ।
en-mt: According to human volunteer studies, healthy people infected with HCoV-229E develop a mild cold.

sourceString: Only a few immunocompromised patients exhibited severe lower respiratory tract infection.
targetString: प्रतिरक्षा जोखिममा भएका थोरै बिरामीहरूले मात्र तल्लो श्वासप्रश्वास मार्गका गम्भीर सङ्क्रमणहरू प्रदर्शन गरे।
en-mt: Only a small number of patients at immune risk exhibited severe infections of the lower respiratory tract.

sourceString: SARS, also known as “atypical pneumonia”, was the first well documented HCoV-caused pandemic in human history and the etiological agent is SARS-CoV, the third HCoV discovered.
targetString: असामान्य न्यूमोनिया को रूपमा पनि परिचित SARS, मानव इतिहासमा पहिलो राम्रोसँग दस्तावेज गरिएको HCoV-द्वारा फैलिएको महामारी थियो र तेस्रो HCoV ले फेला पारेको इटियोलोजिकल एजेन्ट SARS-CoV हो।
en-mt: SARS, also known as abnormal pneumonia, was the first well-documented HCoV-spread epidemic in human history and the etiological agent found by the third HCoV is SARS-CoV.

sourceString: The first case of SARS can be traced back to late 2002 in Guangdong Province of China.
targetString: SARS को पहिलो घटना चीनको गुआनडोङ प्रान्तमा सन् 2002 पछि पत्ता लगाइएको थियो।
en-mt: The first case of SARS was detected in China's Guangdong Province after 2002.

sourceString: The SARS epidemic resulted in 8,096 reported cases with 774 deaths, spreading across many countries and continents.
targetString: SARS महामारीको परिणाम स्वरूप, धेरै देश र महादेशहरूमा फैलिँदै 774 मृत्युको साथमा 8,096 केसहरू रिपोर्ट गरियो।
en-mt: As a result of the SARS epidemic, 8,096 cases were reported, with 774 deaths spreading across several countries and continents.

sourceString: Apart from the super-spreaders, it was estimated that each case could give rise to approximately two secondary cases, with an incubation period of 4 to 7 days and the peak of viral load appearing on the 10th day of illness.
targetString: सुपर-स्प्रेडर्स बाहेक, प्रत्येक घटनाले लगभग दुई सहायक घटनाहरूलाई जन्म दिन सक्छ जुन 4 देखि 7 दिनको इन्क्युबेसन अवधि र भाइरल लोडको चरम बिमारीको 10औँ दिनमा देखा पर्दछ।
en-mt: Aside from super-spreaders, each event can lead to approximately two ancillary events that occur on the 10th day of the incubation period of 4 to 7 days and peak illness of viral load.

sourceString: Patients infected with SARS-CoV initially present with myalgia, headache, fever, malaise and chills, followed by dyspnea, cough and respiratory distress as late symptoms.
targetString: SARS-CoV बाट सङ्क्रमित बिरामीहरूलाई सुरुमा माइल्जिया हुने, टाउको दुख्ने, ज्वरो आउने, अस्वस्थता हुने र चिसो लाग्ने हुन्छ र डिस्प्नी, खोकी र श्वासप्रश्वासको समस्या पछि ढिलो लक्षणहरूको रूपमा देखा पर्छन्।
en-mt: Patients infected with SARS-CoV initially develop myelgia, headaches, fever, ill-health, and chills, followed by dyspnea, cough, and respiratory problems.

sourceString: Lymphopenia, deranged liver function tests, and elevated creatine kinase are common laboratory abnormalities of SARS.
targetString: लिम्फोपेनिया, विक्षिप्त मिर्गौला परीक्षण र उन्नत क्रिएटिन किनासे SARS को सामान्य प्रयोगशाला असामान्यताहरू हो।
en-mt: Lymphopenia, deranged kidney testing and advanced creatine kinase are common laboratory abnormalities of SARS.

sourceString: Diffuse alveolar damage, epithelial cell proliferation and an increase of macrophages are also observed in SARS patients.
targetString: प्रकट भएको वायुकोषियको क्षति, इपिथेलियस कोषको र फोक्सोमा हुने भक्षक कोषहरू वृद्धि SARS रोगका बिरामीहरूमा देखिएको छ।
en-mt: Manifested alveolar damage, epithelius cells, and increased inflammatory cells in the lungs have been observed in patients with SARS disease.

sourceString: Approximately 20-30% of patients subsequently require intensive care and mechanical ventilation.
targetString: लगभग 20-30% बिरामीहरूलाई गहन हेरचाह र यान्त्रिक भेन्टिलेसनको आवश्यक पर्दछ।
en-mt: Approximately 20-30% of patients require intensive care and mechanical ventilation.

sourceString: In addition to lower respiratory tract, multiple organs including gastrointestinal tract, liver and kidney can also be infected in these severe cases, usually accompanied with a cytokine storm, which might be lethal particularly in immunocompromised patients.
targetString: तल्लो श्वास नलीको साथै आन्द्रा नली, कलेजो र मिर्गौला लगायत बहु अङ्गहरू पनि यी गम्भीर अवस्थामा सङक्रमित हुन सक्छन्, सामान्यतया साइटोकीन निष्कासन कमीका साथ विशेषगरी रोग प्रतिरोधात्मक क्षमता कम भएका बिरामीहरूमा घातक हुन सक्छ।
en-mt: The lower respiratory tract as well as multiple organs, including the intestines, liver, and kidneys, can be infected in these severe conditions, usually fatal in patients with decreased cytokine expulsion, especially in patients with low immunity.

sourceString: The virus was first isolated from the open lung biopsy of a relative of the index patient who travelled to Hong Kong from Guangzhou.
targetString: भाइरस पहिलो पटक सूचक बिरामीको नातेदारको फोक्सो तन्तुपरीक्षाबाट अलग गरिएको थियो जो हङकङबाट ग्वाङ्झाउ गएका थिए।
en-mt: The virus was first isolated from lung tissue tests of a relative of an indicator patient who had travelled from Hong Kong to Guangzhou.

sourceString: Since then, tremendous efforts have been dedicated to HCoV research.
targetString: त्यस दिनदेखि, HCoV को अनुसन्धानमा अद्भुत प्रयासहरू समर्पित गरिएको छ।
en-mt: Since that day, amazing efforts have been devoted to the research of HCoV.

sourceString: HCoV-NL63 was isolated from a 7-month-old child from the Netherlands during late 2004.
targetString: HCoV-NL63 गत 2004 को समयमा नेदरल्यान्डबाट 7 महिनाको बच्चाबाट अलग गरिएको थियो।
en-mt: HCoV-NL63 was separated from a 7-month-old child from the Netherlands during the last 2004.

sourceString: It was initially found to be prevalent in young children, the elderly and immunocompromised patients with respiratory illnesses.
targetString: यो सुरुवाती चरणमा बालबालिकाहरू र रोग प्रतिरोधात्मक क्षमता कम भएका तथा श्वासप्रश्वाससँग सम्बन्धी रोग भएका व्यक्तिहरूमा प्रष्ट रूपमा देखा पर्दछ।
en-mt: It is evident in early stages in children and people with low immunity and respiratory diseases.

sourceString: Presentation of coryza, conjunctivitis, fever, and bronchiolitis is common in the disease caused by HCoV-NL63.
targetString: कोरिजा, कन्जङ्टिभिटिज, ज्वरो र ब्रोङ्कोइलाइटिसको प्रस्तुति HCoV-NL63 द्वारा हुने रोगमा सामान्य छ।
en-mt: The presentation of coryza, conjunctivitis, fever and bronchoelitis is common in diseases caused by HCoV-NL63.

sourceString: Another independent study described the isolation of the same virus from a nasal specimen from an 8-month-old boy suffering from pneumonia in the Netherlands.
targetString: अर्को स्वतन्त्र अध्ययनले नेदरल्यान्डमा निमोनियाबाट पीडित 8 महिने बालकको नाकको नमूनाबाट सोही भाइरसको अलगावलाई वर्णन गरेको छ।
en-mt: Another independent study described the isolation of the same virus from a nasal sample of an 8-month-old boy suffering from pneumonia in the Netherlands.

sourceString: Although it was identified in Netherlands, it is actually distributed globally.
targetString: यो नेदरल्यान्डमा पहिचान गरिएतापनि, यो वास्तवमै विश्वव्यापी रूपमा वितरित छ।
en-mt: Although it is identified in the Netherlands, it is truly distributed worldwide.

sourceString: It has been estimated that HCoV-NL63 accounts for approximately 4.7% of common respiratory diseases, and its peak incidence occurs during early summer, spring and winter.
targetString: HCoV-NL63 सामान्य श्वासप्रश्वास रोगहरूको लगभग 4.7% हो भनेर अनुमान गरिएको छ र यसको उच्च सङ्क्रमणको घटना गर्मी, वसन्त र जाडोको सुरुमा हुन्छ।
en-mt: HCoV-NL63 is estimated to account for about 4.7% of common respiratory diseases and its high incidence occurs in the summer, spring and early winter.

sourceString: HCoV-NL63 is associated with obstructive laryngitis, also known as croup.
targetString: HCoV-NL63 अब्सट्रक्टिभ लेरिङ्गाइटिससँग सम्बन्धित छ, जसलाई क्रूप पनि भनिन्छ।
en-mt: HCoV-NL63 is associated with obstructive laryngitis, also known as croup.

sourceString: In the same year, HCoV-HKU1 was isolated from a 71-year-old man who had been hospitalized with pneumonia and bronchiolitis in Hong Kong.
targetString: सोही वर्ष, हङकङमा HCoV-HKU1 लाई निमोनिया र ब्रोन्कोइलाइटिसबाट पीडित अस्पतालमा भर्ना गरिएका 71 वर्षीया वृद्ध व्यक्तिबाट अलग गरिएको थियो।
en-mt: In the same year, HCoV-HKU1 in Hong Kong was isolated from a 71-year-old hospitalized man suffering from pneumonia and bronchoyelitis.

sourceString: Besides community-acquired pneumonia and bronchiolitis, HCoV-HKU1 was reported to be associated with acute asthmatic exacerbation.
targetString: निमोनिया र ब्रोङ्कियोलाइटिस समावेश गर्ने समुदाय बाहेक, HCoV-HKU1 लाई तीव्र दम बढ्नुको साथमा सम्बद्ध भएको रिपोर्ट गरिएको थियो।
en-mt: Except for communities that include pneumonia and bronchiolitis, HCoV-HKU1 was reported to be associated with acute asthma exacerbations.

sourceString: Similar to HCoV-NL63, HCoV-229E and HCoV-OC43, HCoV-HKU1 was found worldwide, causing mild respiratory diseases.
targetString: HCoV-NL63, HCoV-229E र HCoV-OC43 जस्तै, HCoV-HKU1 शान्त श्वास रोगका कारण विश्वव्यापी रूपमा फेला परेको थियो।
en-mt: Like HCoV-NL63, HCoV-229E and HCoV-OC43, HCoV-HKU1 was found worldwide due to quiet breathing disease.

sourceString: All these four community-acquired HCoVs have been well adapted to humans and are generally less likely to mutate to cause highly pathogenic diseases, though accidents did occur for unknown reasons as in the rare case of a more virulent subtype of HCoV-NL63, which has recently been reported to cause severe lower respiratory tract infection in China.
targetString: HCoV हरू समावेश भएका यी चारै समुदाय मानिसहरूमा राम्रोसँग अनुकूलित भएका छन् र हाल चीनमा गम्भीर तल्लो श्वासप्रश्वास मार्ग सङ्क्रमण भएको रिपोर्ट गरिएको HCoV-NL63 को थप विषाक्त उपप्रकारको दुर्लभ मामिलामा भएका अज्ञात कारणहरूका लागि दुर्घटनाहरू भएता पनि, सामान्यतया अत्यधिक रोगजनक रोगहरूका लागि उत्परिवर्तन हुने सम्भावना कम हुन्छ।
en-mt: These four communities that include HCoVs are well adapted to humans and although accidents occur for unknown reasons in rare cases of a more virulent subtype of HCoV-NL63 currently reported to have severe lower respiratory tract infections in China, mutations are generally less likely to occur for highly pathogenic diseases.

sourceString: Generally, when these HCoVs acquire the abilities to transmit efficiently and to maintain themselves continuously within humans, they also become less virulent or pathogenic.
targetString: सामान्यतया, जब यी HCoVs एक मानिसबाट अर्को मानिसमा सर्न र आफूलाई मानव शरीर भित्र राख्नको लागि क्षमताहरू प्राप्त गर्दछन् भने तिनीहरू कम विषालु वा रोगजनक पनि हुन्छन्।
en-mt: In general, they are also less virulent or pathogenic when these HCoVs acquire abilities to spread from one person to another and keep themselves inside the human body.

sourceString: MERS-CoV was first isolated in 2012 from the lung of a 60-year-old patient who developed acute pneumonia and renal failure in Saudi Arabia.
targetString: MERS-CoV पहिलो पटक सन् 2012 मा साउदी अरबमा तीव्र निमोनिया र मिर्गौला असफलता विकास गर्ने 60 वर्षे बिरामीको फोक्सोबाट अलग्गिएको थियो।
en-mt: MERS-CoV was first isolated from the lungs of a 60-year-old patient who developed acute pneumonia and kidney failure in Saudi Arabia in 2012.

sourceString: Whereas most of the laboratory-confirmed cases originate from the Middle East, imported cases with occasional secondary spreads to close contacts have been reported in various European countries and Tunisia.
targetString: धेरैजसो प्रयोगशालामा पुष्टि भएका केसहरू केन्द्रीय पूर्वबाट उत्पन्न हुने भएकाले, कहिलेकाहिँ दुवै नजिकका सम्पर्कहरू भएका युरोपेली देशहरू र ट्युनिसियामा आयात गरिएका केसहरू रिपोर्ट गरिएका छन्।
en-mt: Since most laboratory-confirmed cases originate from the Central East, cases imported from European countries with both close contacts and Tunisia have been reported.

sourceString: Another secondary outbreak occurred in South Korea in 2015 with 186 confirmed cases.
targetString: 2015 मा दक्षिण कोरियामा 186 पुष्टि भएका केसहरूको साथमा अर्को दोस्रो प्रकोप देखा पर्‍यो।
en-mt: Another second outbreak occurred in South Korea in 2015 with 186 confirmed cases.

sourceString: Clinical manifestations of MERS resemble those of SARS, characterized by progressive acute pneumonia.
targetString: प्रगतिशील तीव्र निमोनियाद्वारा वर्गीकृत गरे अनुसार, MERS का क्लिनिकल प्रकटीकरणहरू SARS का जस्ता छन्।
en-mt: As classified by progressive acute pneumonia, the clinical manifestations of MERS are similar to those of SARS.

sourceString: Unlike SARS, many patients with MERS also developed acute renal failure, which is thus far unique for MERS among HCoV-caused diseases.
targetString: SARS भन्दा फरक, MERS भएका धेरै बिरामीहरूमा तीव्र मिर्गौला असफलताको पनि विकास हने गरेको छ जुन HCoV द्वारा हुने रोगहरूमा MERS को लागि अनुपम छ।
en-mt: Unlike SARS, many patients with MERS also develop acute kidney failure, which is unique for MERS in diseases caused by HCoV.

sourceString: More than 30% of patients present with gastrointestinal symptoms, such as diarrhea and vomiting.
targetString: झाडापखाला र वान्ता जस्ता पेट र आन्द्रा सम्बन्धी लक्षणहरू भएका 30% भन्दा बढि बिरामीहरू उपस्थित छन्।
en-mt: More than 30% of patients with abdominal and bowel symptoms such as diarrhea and vomiting are present.

sourceString: As of February 14, 2020, over 2500 laboratory confirmed cases were reported with a high case fatality of 34.4%, making MERS-CoV one of the most devastating viruses known to humans.
targetString: 14 फेब्रुअरी 2020 सम्म 2500 भन्दा बढी प्रयोगशालाहरूले यस भाइरसका कारण सङ्क्रमित हुनेहरूको मृत्युदर 34.4% भन्दा बढी रहेको पुष्टि गरेका थिए जसले गर्दा MERS-CoV सबैभन्दा विनाशकारी भाइरसको रूपमा परिचित भएको छ।
en-mt: As of 14 February 2020, more than 2500 laboratories had confirmed that the mortality rate of those infected with this virus was more than 34.4%, making MERS-CoV known as the most destructive virus.

sourceString: During middle to late December 2019, clusters of pneumonia patients retrospectively known to be associated with SARS-CoV-2 infection were detected in Wuhan, Hubei Province, China.
targetString: मध्यदेखि डिसेम्बर 2019 को अवधिमा, निमोनियाका एकमुष्ट बिरामीहरू SARS-CoV-2 सङ्क्रमणसँग सम्बन्धित छन् भनेर चीनको वुहान, हुबेई प्रान्तमा पत्ता लागेको थियो।
en-mt: During the period from mid to December 2019, it was discovered in China's Wuhan, Hubei Province, that outright patients with pneumonia are associated with SARS-CoV-2 infection.

sourceString: World Health Organization declared the ongoing outbreak of lower respiratory tract infection caused by SARS-CoV-2 a Public Health Emergency of International Concern and also named the disease COVID-19.
targetString: विश्व स्वास्थ्य सङ्गठनले SARS-CoV-2 द्वारा हुने श्वासप्रश्वास मार्ग सङ्क्रमणको चलिरहेको प्रकोपलाई अन्तर्राष्ट्रिय सरोकारको सार्वजनिक स्वास्थ्य आपतकालीनको रूपमा घोषणा गर्‍यो र यो रोगलाई COVID-19 भनेर नाम पनि दियो।
en-mt: The World Health Organization declared the ongoing outbreak of respiratory tract infection caused by SARS-CoV-2 as a public health emergency of international concern and also named the disease AS COVID-19.

sourceString: As of March 3, 2020, 90,053 cases have been confirmed worldwide, with a crude case fatality of 3.4%.
targetString: 3 मार्च, 2020 सम्म, विश्वभरिमा 90,053 मामलाहरूको पुष्टि भएको थियो, जसमा सुरुवाती मामलाहरूको 3.4% मृत्युदर रहेको छ।
en-mt: As of March 3, 2020, 90,053 cases were confirmed worldwide, with a mortality rate of 3.4% of the initial cases.

sourceString: Notably, the case fatality in Hubei, China is 4.2%, whereas the one outside of it is 1.2%.
targetString: उल्लेखनीय रूपमा, हुबेई, चीनमा सङ्क्रमितहरूको मृत्युदर 4.2% छ भने यस बाहिरको क्षेत्रमा मृत्युदर 1.2% रहेको छ।
en-mt: Notably, the mortality rate of infected people in Hubei, China is 4.2% while the mortality rate in the area outside it is 1.2%.

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 causes severe respiratory infection like SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV, presented as fever, cough and dyspnea.
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 ले SARS-CoV र MERS-CoV जस्ता गम्भीर श्वासप्रश्वाससँग सम्बन्धित सङ्क्रमण गराउन सक्दछ जुन ज्वरो, खोकी र श्वासप्रश्वासमा कठिनाइको रूपमा प्रस्तुत हुन्छ।
en-mt: SARS-CoV-2 can cause severe respiratory infections such as SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV that present as fever, cough and difficulty breathing.

sourceString: Diarrhea is also seen in some patients.
targetString: केही बिरामीहरूमा पखाला पनि देखिन्छ।
en-mt: Diarrhea is also seen in some patients.

sourceString: Pneumonia is one of the most severe symptoms and can progress rapidly to acute respiratory distress syndrome.
targetString: निमोनिया सबैभन्दा गम्भीर लक्षणहरू मध्ये एक हो जसले तीव्र श्वासप्रश्वासको लक्षण जस्ता समस्याहरूमा छिटो प्रगति गर्न सक्दछ।
en-mt: Pneumonia is one of the most severe symptoms that can rapidly progress to problems such as acute respiratory symptoms.

sourceString: Although SARS-CoV and SARS-CoV-2 are very similar due to high nucleotide sequence homology of 82%, they cluster into different branches in the phylogenetic tree.
targetString: 82% न्युक्लिओटाइड अनुक्रमको उच्च होमोलोजीको कारणले SARS-CoV र SARS-CoV-2 एउटै भएतापनि, जातिवृत्तीय वृक्षमा तिनीहरू विभिन्न हाँगाहरूमा समूहमा हुन्छन्।
en-mt: Although SARS-CoV and SARS-CoV-2 are the same due to the high homology of the 82% nucleotide sequence, in the hereditary tree they group into different branches.

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 is apparently less pathogenic but more transmissible compared to SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV.
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 स्पष्ट रूपमा कम रोगजनक छ तर SARS-CoV र MERS-CoV सँग तुलना गर्दा बढी संक्रमणयुक्त छ।
en-mt: SARS-CoV-2 is clearly less pathogenic but more infectious when compared with SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV.

sourceString: Asymptomatic subjects infected with SARS-CoV-2 have been reported and might contribute to its rapid spreading around the world.
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 बाट सङ्क्रमित स्पर्शोन्मुख विषयहरू रिपोर्ट गरिएको छ र विश्वभरि यसको द्रुत संक्रमणमा योगदान पुर्‍याउन सक्छ।
en-mt: Asymptomatic subjects infected with SARS-CoV-2 have been reported and may contribute to its rapid infection worldwide.

sourceString: Comparing and contrasting SARS-CoV-2 with the other six HCoVs reveal similarities and differences of great interest.
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 को तुलना र फरकले अन्य छ HCoVs का साथ समानताहरू र ठूलो चासोको भिन्नताहरू प्रकट गर्दछ।
en-mt: The comparison and difference of SARS-CoV-2 reveals similarities and differences of great interest with the other six HCoVs.

sourceString: First, the incubation period and the duration of the course of HCoV disease are very similar.
targetString: सुरुमा, इनक्युबेसन अवधि र HCoV रोग कोर्सको अवधि धेरै समान छ।
en-mt: Initially, the incubation period and the duration of the HCoV disease course are very similar.

sourceString: In this regard, SARS-CoV-2 follows the general trend of the other six HCoVs.
targetString: यस सम्बन्धमा, SARS-CoV-2 ले अन्य छ HCoVs को सामान्य प्रवृत्तिहरूको अनुसरण गर्दछ।
en-mt: In this regard, SARS-CoV-2 follows the general trends of the other six HCoVs.

sourceString: Second, the severity of symptoms of COVID-19 lies between SARS-CoV and the four community-acquired HCoVs (i.e. HCoV-229E, HCoV-OC43, HCoV-HKU1 and HCoV-NL63).
targetString: दोस्रो, COVID-19 का लक्षणहरूको गम्भीरता SARS-CoV र HCoVs (अर्थात HCoV-229E, HCoV-OC43, HCoV-HKU1 र HCoV-NL63) समावेश गर्ने चारवटा समुदायको बीचमा पर्छ।
en-mt: Second, the severity of symptoms of COVID-19 falls between four communities including SARS-CoV and HCoVs (i.e. HCoV-229E, HCoV-OC43, HCoV-HKU1 and HCoV-NL63).

sourceString: On one hand, SARS-CoV-2 infection exhibits features that are more commonly seen during infection with community-acquired HCoVs, including the presentation of non-specific, mild or even no symptoms.
targetString: एकातर्फ, SARS-CoV-2 को सङ्क्रमणले गैर-विशेष, हल्का वा कुनै पनि लक्षणहरू नभएको प्रस्तुतीकरणसहित, HCoV हरू समावेश गर्ने समुदायमा भएको सङ्क्रमणको अवधिमा थप सामान्य रूपमा देखिने विशेषताहरू प्रदर्शन गर्छ।
en-mt: On the one hand, sars-coV-2 infection exhibits more commonly visible features during the transition period in the community that includes HCoVs, including non-specialized, mild, or no symptomatic presentations.

sourceString: On the other hand, a small subset of severe cases of COVID-19 can also be seen as in the case of SARS-CoV infection, although the ratio is a bit lower.
targetString: अर्को तर्फ, अनुपात हल्का कम भएतापनि COVID-19 का गम्भीर केसहरूको सानो उपसेट SARS-CoV सङ्क्रमणको केसमा पनि देखिन सक्छ।
en-mt: On the other hand, although the proportion is slightly lower, a small subset of severe cases of COVID-19 can also be seen in cases of SARS-CoV infection.

sourceString: Third, the transmission of SARS-CoV-2 also shows interesting patterns characteristic of both community-acquired HCoVs and SARS-CoV.
targetString: तेस्रो, SARS-CoV-2 को संक्रमणले दुवै HCoVs र SARS-CoV समावेश हुने समुदायको इच्छा लाग्दो ढाँचाको विशेषता पनि देखाउँछ।
en-mt: Third, the transition to SARS-CoV-2 also characterizes the desired pattern of the community that includes both HCoVs and SARS-CoV.

sourceString: On one hand, the transmissibility of SARS-CoV-2 is at least as high as that of community-acquired HCoVs.
targetString: एक तर्फ, SARS-CoV-2 को प्रसारण क्षमता कम से कम समुदायद्वारा अधिग्रहण गरिएको HCoVs भन्दा उच्च रहेको छ।
en-mt: On the one hand, the transmission capacity of SARS-CoV-2 remains at least higher than hCoVs acquired by the community.

sourceString: On the other hand, it remains to be verified whether the transmissibility of SARS-CoV-2 decreases after passages in humans as in the cases of SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV.
targetString: अर्को तर्फ, SARS-CoV र MERS-CoV का अवस्थाहरूको रूपमा मानिसहरूमा प्रवेशपछि SARS-CoV-2 को संक्रमण घट्छ कि घट्दैन भन्ने कुरा प्रमाणित गर्न बाँकी रहन्छ।
en-mt: On the other hand, it remains to be proved whether the infection of SARS-CoV-2 decreases after entry into humans as conditions of SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV.

sourceString: Finally, same as the other HCoVs, SARS-CoV-2 can be detected in fecal samples.
targetString: अन्त्यमा, अन्य HCoV हरूजस्तै SARS-CoV-2 फेकल नमूनाहरूमा पत्ता लगाउन सकिन्छ।
en-mt: Finally, other HCoVs such as SARS-CoV-2 can be detected in fecal samples.

sourceString: Whether fecal-oral transmission of SARS-CoV-2 plays an important role as in the case of SARS-CoV at least under some circumstance remains to be clarified by future studies.
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 को फेकल-ओरल प्रसारणले SARS-CoV को केसमा झैँ महत्त्वपूर्ण भूमिका कम्तीमा केही परिस्थितिमा भविष्यका अध्ययनहरूद्वारा स्पष्ट हुने गरी खेल्छ कि खेल्दैन।
en-mt: Whether the fecal-oral transmission of SARS-CoV-2 plays an important role, as in the case of SARS-CoV, in at least some circumstances in a way that will be clear by future studies.

sourceString: It is also of particularly great interest to see whether SARS-CoV-2 might exhibit seasonality as in the cases of community-acquired HCoVs.
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 छ या छैन भनेर हेर्नको लागि विशेष गरी ठूलो चासोको आवश्यकता पर्दछ जसले समुदाय अधिग्रहित HCoVs को सङ्क्रमित घटनामा जस्तै प्रवृत्ति प्रदर्शन गर्न सक्छ।
en-mt: Seeing whether there is SARS-CoV-2 requires particularly great interest which may exhibit the same trend as in the infected incidence of community acquired HCoVs.

sourceString: Nevertheless, the features of SARS-CoV-2 including its transmissibility, pathogenicity and sustainable spreading after passages in humans will be influential on the ultimate fate of the ongoing outbreak of COVID-19.
targetString: जे होस्, मानिसहरूमा सङ्क्रमणपछि यसको संक्रमण, रोगजनकता र दीगो फेलावटसहित SARS-CoV-2 का सुविधाहरू COVID-19 को भइरहेको प्रकोपको अन्तिम भाग्यमा प्रभावकारी हुने छ।
en-mt: However, the features of SARS-CoV-2, including its infection, pathogenicity and sustained detectability after infection in humans, will be effective in the final fate of the ongoing outbreak of COVID-19.

sourceString: All four community-acquired HCoVs causing mild symptoms have been well adapted to humans.
targetString: हल्का लक्षणहरू देखाउने सबै चार समुदाय-अधिग्रहित HCoVs मानवमा राम्रोसँग अनुकूलन भएका छन्।
en-mt: All four community-acquired HCoVs showing mild symptoms have adapted well in humans.

sourceString: From another perspective, it might also be true that humans have been well adapted to these four HCoVs.
targetString: अर्को परिप्रेक्ष्यमा, मानिसहरुलाई यी चार HCoV मा राम्ररी अनुकूलित गरिएको छ जुन सत्य हुन सक्छ।
en-mt: From another perspective, people are well adapted to these four HCoVs which may be true.

sourceString: In other words, both could be the survivors of ancient HCoV pandemics.
targetString: अर्को शब्दमा, दुवै पुरानो HCoV महामारीबाट बच्न सक्छन्।
en-mt: In other words, both can survive the chronic HCoV epidemic.

sourceString: HCoVs that cause severe diseases in humans and humans who developed severe HCoV diseases have been eliminated.
targetString: मानिसहरूमा गम्भीर रोगहरू निम्त्याउने HCoV हरू र गम्भीर HCoV रोगहरू विकास गर्ने मानिसहरूलाई हटाइएको छ।
en-mt: HCoVs that cause serious diseases in people and people who develop serious HCoV diseases have been eliminated.

sourceString: For this to happen, HCoVs have to replicate in humans to sufficient extent to allow the accumulation of adaptive mutations that counteract host restriction factors.
targetString: यो हुनको लागि, अनुकूलन उत्परिवर्तन सञ्चयको अनुमति दिने होस्ट प्रतिबन्ध कारक विरुद्ध HCoVs ले मानवमा पर्याप्त मात्रामा प्रतिकृति बनाउनु पर्दछ।
en-mt: For this to happen, HCoVs against the host restriction factor that allows adaptive mutation accumulation must replicate sufficiently in humans.

sourceString: In this sense, the longer the SARS-CoV-2 outbreak persists and the more people that it infects, the greater chance that it will fully adapt to humans.
targetString: यस अर्थमा, SARS-CoV-2 को प्रकोप जति लामोसमयसम्म जारी रहेर जति धेरै मानिसहरूलाई यसले सङ्क्रमित गर्छ, यो त्यत्ति नै पूर्ण रूपमा मानवमा अनुकूलित हुने बढी सम्भावना हुन्छ।
en-mt: In this sense, the longer a SARS-CoV-2 outbreak continues and infects more people, the more likely it is to fully adapt to humans.

sourceString: If it adapts well, its transmission in humans would be difficult to stop by quarantine or other infection control measures.
targetString: यसले राम्रोसँग अनुकूलन गरेमा, यसको संक्रमण क्वारेन्टाइन वा अन्य सङ्क्रमण नियन्त्रण उपायहरूद्वारा मानिसमा रोक्न कठिन हुने छ।
en-mt: If it adapts well, it will be difficult to prevent its infection in humans by quarantine or other infection control measures.

sourceString: For many years, the four community-acquired CoVs circulate in human populations, triggering common cold in immunocompetent subjects.
targetString: धेरै वर्षसम्म, CoV हरूमा समावेश भएका चार समुदाय इम्युनोकम्पिटेन्ट विषयहरूमा रूघा खोकी हुने मानव जनसङ्ख्यामा घुम्छन्।
en-mt: For many years, the four communities involved in CoVs revolve around the human population with a cold and cough in immunocompetent subjects.

sourceString: These viruses do not need an animal reservoir.
targetString: यी भाइरसहरूका लागि पशुको भण्डार आवश्यक छैन।
en-mt: Animal reserves are not necessary for these viruses.

sourceString: In contrast, highly pathogenic SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV have not adapted to humans well and their transmission within humans cannot be sustained.
targetString: यसको विपरीत, अत्यधिक रोगजनक SARS-CoV र MERS-CoV मानिहरूमा पनि अनुकूलन भएका छैनन् र मानिसहरूमा तिनीहरूको प्रसारण व्यवस्थित गर्न सकिँदैन।
en-mt: In contrast, even highly pathogenic SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV humans have not been adapted and their transmission to humans cannot be managed.

sourceString: They need to maintain and propagate in their zoonotic reservoirs and seek the chance to spillover to susceptible human targets, possibly via one or more intermediate and amplifying hosts.
targetString: उनीहरूलाई आफ्नो उत्पादन भण्डारलाई कायम राख्न र प्रचार गर्न आवश्यकता छ, संभवतः एक या अधिक मध्यवर्ती र प्रवर्धित होस्टहरूको माध्यमबाट अतिसंवेदनशील मानव लक्षणहरूलाई फैलाने मौका चाहिन्छ।
en-mt: They need to maintain and propagate their product reserves, possibly through one or more intermediate and amplified hosts, a chance to spread susceptible human traits.

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 has features that are similar to both SARS-CoV/MERS-CoV and the four community-acquired HCoVs.
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 का दुवै SARS-CoV/MERS-CoV र HCoV हरू समावेश भएका चार समुदायसँग मिल्ने सुविधाहरू छन्।
en-mt: SARS-CoV-2 has features similar to four communities consisting of both SARS-CoV/MERS-CoV and HCoVs.

sourceString: It is highly transmissible like community-acquired HCoVs, at least for the time being.
targetString: यो कम्तिमा समय अनुसार, HCoV हरू समावेश भएको समुदाय जस्तै उच्च रूपमा प्रसारणयुक्त छ।
en-mt: It is transmitted as highly as a community that includes HCoVs, at least over time.

sourceString: However, it is more pathogenic than community-acquired HCoVs and less pathogenic than SARS-CoV or MERS-CoV.
targetString: जे होस्, यो समुदायमा भएको HCoVs भन्दा बढी र SARS-CoV वा MERS-CoV भन्दा कम रोगजनक छ।
en-mt: However, it is more pathogenic than HCoVs in the community and less pathogenic than SARS-CoV or MERS-CoV.

sourceString: It remains to be seen whether it will adapt fully to humans and circulate within humans without a reservoir or intermediate animal host.
targetString: यो मानिसहरूमा पूर्ण रूपमा अनुकूल भएर कुनै भण्डार वा मध्यमपशुको होस्ट बिना मानिसहरूको शरीर भित्र सर्छ वा सर्दैन भन्ने कुरा देखिनँ बाँकी रहन्छ।
en-mt: It remains to be seen whether it moves into human bodies without a store or a host of medium animals, fully adapting to humans.

sourceString: Before discussing the animal origins of HCoVs, it will serve us well to discuss the definitions and characteristics of evolutionary, natural, reservoir, intermediate and amplifying hosts of HCoVs.
targetString: HCoV हरूको पशु उत्पत्ति बारे छलफल गर्नु अघि, यसले हामीलाई HCoV हरूको विकासात्मक, प्राकृतिक, भण्डार, मध्यम र बढाउने होस्टहरूको परिभाषा र विशेषताहरू बारे छलफल गर्नका लागि हामीलाई राम्रोसँग सेवा दिन्छ।
en-mt: Before discussing the animal origin of HCoVs, it serves us well to discuss the definitions and characteristics of the developmental, natural, repository, medium and enhancing hosts of HCoVs.

sourceString: An animal serves as the evolutionary host of an HCoV if it harbours a closely related ancestor sharing high homology at the level of nucleotide sequence.
targetString: एक जनावर HCoV ले विकासवादी होस्टको रूपमा कार्य गर्छ तर यस न्युक्लियोटाइड अनुक्रमको स्तरमा उच्च समरूपता साझा गर्ने निकट सम्बन्धी पूर्वजहरूलाई शरण गर्दछ।
en-mt: An animal HCoV acts as an evolutionary host but harbors closely related ancestors that share high homology at the level of this nucleotide sequence.

sourceString: The ancestral virus is usually well adapted and non-pathogenic in this host.
targetString: पैतृक भाइरस प्राय: यो होस्टमा राम्रोसँग अनुकूलित र गैर-रोगजनक हुन्छ।
en-mt: The ancestral virus is often well adapted and non-pathogenic to this host.

sourceString: Likewise, a reservoir host harbours HCoV continuously and for long term.
targetString: त्यस्तै, एक जलाशय होस्ट HCoV ले निरन्तर र लामो अवधिको लागि एक बन्दरगाहको रूपमा काम गर्दछ।
en-mt: Similarly, a reservoir host HCoV serves as a port for continuous and long periods of time.

sourceString: In both cases, the hosts are naturally infected and are the natural hosts of HCoV or its parental virus.
targetString: दुवै अवस्थाहरूमा, होस्टहरू प्राकृतिक रूपमा सङ्क्रमित छन् र HCoV वा यस पैतृक भाइरसका प्राकृतिक होस्टहरू हुन्।
en-mt: In both cases, hosts are naturally infected and are natural hosts of HCoV or this ancestral virus.

sourceString: In contrast, if the HCoV is newly introduced to an intermediate host right before or around its introduction to humans, it is not well adapted to the new host and is often pathogenic.
targetString: यसको विपरीत, HCoV मध्यम होस्टमा मानिसहरूलाई यसको परिचय थाहा हुनुभन्दा पहिले वा त्यस्तैमा हालै परिचय गराइएको हो भने, यो नयाँ होस्टमा राम्रोसँग अनुकूलित छैन र प्राय: रोगजनक हुन्छ।
en-mt: In contrast, if humans in the HCoV medium host are recently introduced before its introduction is known or so on, it is not well adapted to the new host and is often pathogenic.

sourceString: This intermediate host can serve as the zoonotic source of human infection and play the role of an amplifying host by allowing the virus to replicate transiently and then transmitting it to humans to amplify the scale of human infection.
targetString: यो मध्यम होस्टले मानव सङ्क्रमणको जुनोटिक स्रोतको रूपमा सेवा दिन सक्छ र भाइरसलाई क्षणिक रूपमा दोहोर्‍याउन दिएर त्यसपछि यसलाई मानव सङ्क्रमणको स्केल बढाउनका लागि मानिसमा प्रसारण गरेर होस्ट बढाउने भूमिका खेल्न सक्छ।
en-mt: This medium host can serve as a zoonotic source of human infection and play a role in increasing the host by allowing the virus to repeat transiently and then transmit it to humans to increase the scale of human infection.

sourceString: An HCoV can undergo a dead-end infection if it cannot sustain its transmission within the intermediate host.
targetString: HCoV ले मध्यमहोस्ट भित्र प्रसारण व्यवस्थित गर्न नसकेमा, यो डेड-एन्ड सङ्क्रमणबाट बाहिर निस्किन सक्छ।
en-mt: If HCoV fails to manage transmission within the medium host, it can exit the dead-end transition.

sourceString: On the contrary, HCoVs can also adapt to the intermediate host and even establish long-term endemicity.
targetString: यसको विपरीत, HCoV हरू ले मध्यमहोस्टलाई अनुकूलन गर्नुका साथै दीर्घकालीन गन्तव्य पनि स्थापना गर्न सक्छन्।
en-mt: In contrast, HCoVs can adapt to medium hosts as well as establish a long-term destination.

sourceString: In this case, the intermediate host becomes a natural reservoir host.
targetString: यस अवस्थामा, मध्यवर्ती होस्ट एक प्राकृतिक जलाशय होस्ट बन्छ।
en-mt: In this case, the intermediate host becomes a natural reservoir host.

sourceString: Epidemiological data revealed retrospectively that the index case of SARS had a contact history with game animals.
targetString: महामारी सम्बन्धी डाटाले पूर्वव्यापी ढङ्गमा SARS को सूचक केसमा खेल पशुहरूसँग सम्पर्क इतिहास भएको कुरा खुलासा गर्‍यो।
en-mt: Epidemiological data retrospectively revealed that sars indicator cases had a contact history with sports animals.

sourceString: Subsequent seroprevalence investigations indicated that animal traders had a higher prevalence of anti-SARS-CoV IgG compared with that of the general population.
targetString: आगामी सेरोप्रिभेलेन्स अनुसन्धानले पशु व्यापारीहरूले सामान्य जनसंख्याको तुलनामा एन्टी-SARS-CoV IgG को प्रचलन बढी भएको सङ्केत गर्‍यो।
en-mt: Upcoming seroprevalence research indicated that animal traders had a higher prevalence of anti-SARS-CoV IgG than the general population.

sourceString: Masked palm civets (Paguma larvata) and a racoon dog in live animal markets were first identified to carry SARS-CoV-like viruses that are almost identical to SARS-CoV.
targetString: मास्क्ड पाम सिभेट्स (पागुमा लाभार्टा) र प्रत्यक्ष जनावरको क्षेत्रमा, राकुन कुकुरलाई SARS-CoV जस्तो भाइरसहरू सार्नका लागि पहिचान गरिएको थियो जुन SARS-CoV सँग मिल्दोजुल्दो छ।
en-mt: In the masked palm civets (Paguma lavarta) and live animal areas, raccoon dogs were identified to transmit SARS-CoV-like viruses that resemble SARS-CoV.

sourceString: This was indirectly supported by the fact that no further SARS was reported after killing all civets in the markets.
targetString: बजारका सबै सिभेटहरू मारिसकेपछि कुनै पनि थप SARS रिपोर्ट गरिएको थिएन भन्ने तथ्यद्वारा यसलाई अप्रत्यक्ष रूपमा समर्थन गरिएको थियो।
en-mt: This was indirectly supported by the fact that no further SARS was reported after all civets in the market were killed.

sourceString: However, it has been reported that masked palm civets from the wild or farms without exposure to the live animal markets were largely negative for SARS-CoV, suggesting that masked palm civets might only serve as the intermediate amplifying host but not the natural reservoir of SARS-CoV.
targetString: यद्यपि, जङ्गली वा खेतहरूबाट आएका मास्क्ड पाम सिभेटहरू प्रत्यक्ष रूपमा जनावरहरू बसोबास गर्ने क्षेत्रहरूमा देखाइएको थिएन जुन SARS-CoV लागि ठूलो मात्रामा नकरात्मक रहेको जनाइएको थियो र मास्क्ड पाम सिभेटले केवल मध्यवर्ती प्रबर्द्धक होस्टको रूपमा काम गर्न सक्ने तर यो SARS-CoV प्राकृतिक भण्डार नरहेको पनि बताइएको थियो।
en-mt: However, masked palm civets from the wild or farms were not directly shown in animal-inhabited areas that were reported to be largely negative for SARS-CoV, and masked palm civets could only act as an intermediate promoter host but were not a SARS-CoV natural reservoir.

sourceString: Notably, since 80% of the different animals in the markets in Guangzhou have anti-SARS-CoV antibodies, the possibilities that multiple species of small mammals might also serve as intermediate amplifying hosts of SARS-CoV cannot be excluded.
targetString: ग्वाङ्झाउको बजारका 80% विभिन्न जनावरहरूसँग SARS-CoV एन्टिबडीहरू रहेकाले, साना स्तनपायी प्राणीहरूका धेरै प्रजातिहरूले SARS-CoV को मध्यवर्ती प्रवर्द्धक होस्टको रूपमा पनि काम गर्न सक्ने सम्भावनाहरू समावेश गर्न सकिन्छ जुन उल्लेखनीय कुरा हो।
en-mt: Since 80% of different animals in Guangzhou's market have SARS-CoV antibodies, many species of small mammals may also include the possibilities that they may also act as intermediate promoter hosts of SARS-CoV, which is remarkable.

sourceString: All of these appear to be dead-end hosts of SARS-CoV.
targetString: यी सबै SARS-CoV को डेड-एन्ड होस्टहरू भएको देखिन्छन्।
en-mt: All of these appear to be dead-end hosts of SARS-CoV.

sourceString: Subsequent search for the natural animal host of SARS-CoV unveiled a closely related bat CoV, termed SARS-related Rhinolophus bat CoV HKU3 (SARSr-Rh-BatCoV HKU3), which exists in Chinese horseshoe bats.
targetString: SARS-CoV को प्राकृतिक जनावर होस्टका लागि खोजी भएपछि एक निकट सम्बन्धित ब्याट CoV को अनावरण भएको थियो जसलाई SARS सँग सम्बन्धित Rhinolophus ब्याट CoV HKU3 (SARSr-Rh-BatCoV HKU3), भनिएको थियो जुन चिनियाँ हर्ससु ब्याटमा अवस्थित छ।
en-mt: After the search for a natural animal host of SARS-CoV a closely related Bat CoV was unveiled which was called Rhinolophus Bat CoV HKU3 (SARSR-Rh-BatCoV HKU3), which is located in the Chinese horsesu bat.

sourceString: These bats are positive for anti-SARS-CoV antibodies and genome sequence of SARSr-Rh-BatCoV HKU3.
targetString: यी चमेराहरू एन्टी-SARS-CoV का एन्टिबडीहरू र SARSr-Rh-BatCoV HKU3 को जिनोम अनुक्रमका लागि सकारात्मक छन्।
en-mt: These bats are positive for antibodies to anti-SARS-CoV and genome sequence of SARSR-Rh-BatCoV HKU3.

sourceString: This and other bat CoVs share 88-92% nucleotide sequence homology with SARS-CoV.
targetString: यो र अन्य ब्याट CoVs ले 88-92% न्यूक्लियोटाइड अनुक्रम अनुरूपता SARS-CoV को साथ साझा गर्दछ।
en-mt: This and other Bat CoVs share 88-92% nucleotide sequence compatibility with SARS-CoV.

sourceString: These studies have laid the foundation for the new concept that bats host emerging human pathogens.
targetString: यी अध्ययनहरूले चमेराहरूको होस्टले मानव रोगजनकहरू उदयमान हुने नयाँ अवधारणाका लागि आधारशिला राखेका छन्।
en-mt: These studies have laid the foundation for a new concept that a host of bats emerges human pathogens.

sourceString: Several SARS-like CoVs (SL-CoVs) have also been identified from bats, but none except for one designated WIV1 can be isolated as live virus.
targetString: केही SARS जस्ता CoV (SL-CoV) लाई चमेराबाट पहिचान गरिएको थियो, तर एक निर्दिष्ट WIV1 लाई छोडेर कुनै भाइरसलाई पनि जीवित भाइरसको रूपमा अलग गर्न सकिँदैन।
en-mt: Some SARS-like CoV (SL-CoV) were identified from bats, but no virus can be isolated as a living virus except for a specified WIV1.

sourceString: Human angiotensin converting enzyme 2 (ACE2) is known to be the receptor of SARS-CoV.
targetString: इन्जाइम 2 (ACE2) रूपान्तरण गर्ने मानव एन्जियोटेन्सिनलाई SARS-CoV को रिसेप्टर मानिन्छ।
en-mt: The human angiotensin that converts enzyme 2 (ACE2) is considered a receptor of SARS-CoV.

sourceString: WIV1 derived from fecal sample of bats was demonstrated to use bat, civet and human ACE2 as receptor for cell entry.
targetString: चमेराहरूको फेकल नमूनाबाट लिइएको WIV1 लाई सेल प्रवेशका लागि रिसेप्टरको रूपमा चमेरा, सिभेट र मानिस ACE2 प्रयोग गर्न प्रदर्शन गरिएको थियो।
en-mt: WIV1 taken from fecal samples of bats was demonstrated to use bats, civet and human ACE2 as a receptor for cell entry.

sourceString: Intriguingly, sera of convalescent SARS patients were capable of neutralizing WIV1.
targetString: अचम्मको कुरा, SARS सम्बन्धी सेराका बिरामीहरू WIV1 लाई निष्प्रभाव गर्न सक्षम थिए।
en-mt: Surprisingly, patients with SARS-related sera were able to neutralize WIV1.

sourceString: Thus far, WIV1 represents the most closely related ancestor of SARS-CoV in bats, sharing 95% nucleotide sequence homology.
targetString: अहिलेसम्म, WIV1 ले 95% न्यूक्लियोटाइड अनुक्रम होमोलोजी साझा गर्ने चमेराहरूमा SARS-CoV को सबैभन्दा नजिकबाट सम्बन्धित पूर्वजलाई प्रतिनिधित्व गर्छ।
en-mt: So far, WIV1 represents the most closely related ancestor of SARS-CoV in bats that share 95% nucleotide sequence homology.

sourceString: Albeit the high homology between these two viruses, it is generally believed that WIV1 is not the immediate parental virus of SARS-CoV and bats are not the immediate reservoir host of SARS-CoV.
targetString: यी दुई भाइरसहरूको बीचमा उच्च होमोलोजी भएतापनि, सामान्यतया WIV1 SARS-CoV को तत्काल पैतृक भाइरस होइन र चमेराहरू SARS-CoV को तत्काल भण्डारण होस्ट होइन भन्ने कुरा विश्वास गरिन्छ।
en-mt: Although there is high homology between these two viruses, it is generally believed that WIV1 is not the immediate ancestral virus of SARS-CoV and that bats are not immediate storage hosts of SARS-CoV.

sourceString: Phylogenetic analysis clusters MERS-CoV to the same group as bat CoV-HKU4 and bat CoV-HKU5.
targetString: जातिवृत्तीय विश्लेषणले चमेरा CoV-HKU4 र चमेरा CoV-HKU5 जस्तै समान समूहमा पनि MERS-CoV लाई क्लस्टर गर्छ।
en-mt: Racial analysis also clusters MERS-CoV in the same group as bat CoV-HKU4 and bat CoV-HKU5.

sourceString: Bat CoV-HKU4 and MERS-CoV utilize the same host receptor, dipeptidyl peptidase 4 (DPP4), for virus entry.
targetString: डिप्टिडिल पेप्टिडेज 4 (DPP4) भाइरस प्रविष्टिको लागि चमेरा CoV-HKU4 र MERS-CoV ले समान होस्ट ग्राही उपयोग गर्छन्।
en-mt: Bats CoV-HKU4 and MERS-CoV use the same host grahy for diptidyl peptidase 4 (DPP4) virus entry.

sourceString: RNA-dependent RNA polymerase sequences of MERS-CoV are phylogenetically closer to counterparts in bat beta-CoVs identified from Europe and Africa.
targetString: MERS-CoV को RNA-आश्रित RNA पोलिमरेज अनुक्रमहरू वंशावलीको आधारमा नजिक छन् जुन युरोप र अफ्रिकाबाट पहिचान गरिएका ब्याट बिटा CoV को विपरीत रहेको छ।
en-mt: The RNA-dependent RNA polymerase sequences of MERS-CoV are closely related to the lineage as opposed to bat beta CoV identified from Europe and Africa.

sourceString: Up to now, no live MERS-CoV can be found in wild bats.
targetString: अहिलेसम्म, जङ्गली चमेराहरूमा कुनै पनि प्रत्यक्ष MERS-CoV फेला पार्न सकिएको छैन।
en-mt: So far, no direct MERS-CoV has been found in wild bats.

sourceString: MERS-CoV and its closest relative bat CoV-HKU25 share only 87% nucleotide sequence homology.
targetString: MERS-CoV र यसको नजिकको सम्बन्धित चमेरा CoV-HKU25 ले 87% न्युक्लियोटाइड अनुक्रम होमोलोजी मात्र साझा गर्छन्।
en-mt: MERS-CoV and its closely related bat CoV-HKU25 share only 87% nucleotide sequence homology.

sourceString: Thus, bats might not be the immediate reservoir host of MERS-CoV.
targetString: यसैले, चमेरा MERS-CoV को तत्काल भण्डार होस्ट नहुन सक्छ।
en-mt: Therefore, bats may not host an immediate reservoir of MERS-CoV.

sourceString: On the other hand, studies in Middle East have shown that dromedary camels are seropositive for MERS-CoV-specific neutralizing antibodies, same as camels of Middle East origin in multiple African countries.
targetString: अर्को तर्फ, मध्य पूर्वमा गरिएका अध्ययनहरूमा ड्रमेडरी ऊँटहरू बहु अफ्रिकी देशहरूमा भएका मध्यपूर्वी उत्पत्तिका ऊँटहरू जस्ता एन्टीबडीहरू निष्प्रभाव गर्ने विशिष्ट MERS-CoV का लागि सेरो-पोजिटिभ छन् भन्ने कुरा देखिएको थियो।
en-mt: On the other hand, studies in the Middle East showed that drummedary camels are sero-positive for specific MERS-CoV neutralizing antibodies, such as camels of Middle Eastern origin in multiple African countries.

sourceString: Live MERS-CoV identical to the virus found in humans was isolated from the nasal swabs of dromedary camels, further indicating that camels serve as the bona fide reservoir host of MERS-CoV.
targetString: जीवित MERS-CoV मानिसमा भेट्टाइएको भाइरससँग मिल्दोजुल्दो उँटको नाकबाट तयार पारिएको थियो र उँटहरू MERS-CoV को होस्टको रूपमा काम गरेको पनि सङ्केत गर्दछ।
en-mt: Living MERS-CoV was prepared from camel noses similar to the virus found in humans and also indicated that camels acted as hosts of MERS-CoV.

sourceString: It is also noteworthy that generally mild symptoms but massive virus shedding were observed in camels experimentally infected with MERS-CoV.
targetString: सामान्यतया हल्का लक्षणहरू तर MERS-CoV बाट सङ्क्रमित उँट माथि गरिएको अध्ययनले भाइरसको बहाव विशाल रहेको जनाएको थियो जुन उल्लेखनीय छ।
en-mt: A study of camels infected with MERS-CoV, which is usually mild, showed that the flow of the virus was huge, which is remarkable.

sourceString: Notably, infected camels shed viruses not only through respiratory route but also through fecal-oral route, which is also the main route for virus shedding from bats.
targetString: विशेष रूपमा, सङ्क्रमित उँटहरूले श्वसप्रश्वासको माध्यमबाट नभई, मल-मूत्र मार्गको माध्यमबाट पनि भाइरस निकालेका छन्, जुन चमेराबाट निक्लने भाइरसको मुख्य मार्ग पनि हो।
en-mt: In particular, infected camels have extracted the virus not only through breathing, but also through the stool-urinary tract, which is also the main route of the virus that emerges from bats.

sourceString: However, questions still remain since many confirmed cases of MERS have no contact history with camels prior to symptom onset, plausibly ascribed to human-to-human transmission or unknown transmission routes involving unrecognized animal species that harbour MERS-CoV.
targetString: यद्यपि प्रश्नहरू अझै पनी बाँकी नै छ किनकि MERS को धेरै पुष्टि भएका घटनाहरू लक्षणको सुरुवात हुनुभन्दा पहिले उँटसँग कुनै सम्पर्क इतिहास थिएन जसले मानौँ मानव-मानव प्रसारण वा अज्ञात प्रसारण मार्गमा मान्यता दिन्छ भने यसले अपरिचित पशु प्रजातिहरू समावेश गर्दछ र यसले MERS-CoV लाई समेट्दछ।
en-mt: However, questions still remain because many confirmed cases of MERS had no contact history with the camel prior to the onset of symptoms, assuming it was recognized in a human-to-human transmission or unknown transmission route if it involved unidentified animal species and that it encompassed MERS-CoV.

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 shares 96.2% nucleotide homology with a bat CoV RaTG13 isolated from Rhinolophus affinis bats.
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 ले 96.2% न्युक्लियोटाइड होमोलोजीलाई एक चमेरा CoV RaTG13 को साथ साझा गर्दछ जुन राइनोफस भन्दा पृथक छ।
en-mt: SARS-CoV-2 shares 96.2% nucleotide homology with a bat CoV RaTG13 isolated from Rhinophus.

sourceString: As in the cases of SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV, the sequence divergence between SARS-CoV-2 and RaTG13 is too great to assign parental relationship.
targetString: SARS-CoV र MERS-CoV को मामलाहरूमा, SARS-CoV-2 र RaTG13 बीच अनुक्रम विचलन पैतृक सम्बन्ध कायम गर्नु ठूलो कुरा हो।
en-mt: In the case of SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV, the sequence divergence between SARS-CoV-2 and RaTG13 is a big deal to maintain an ancestral relationship.

sourceString: That is to say, bats might not be the immediate reservoir host(s) of SARS-CoV-2 unless almost identical bat CoVs are found in future.
targetString: भन्नुको मतलब, चमेराहरू भविष्यमा लगभग उस्तै चमेरा CoVs नभए सम्म SARS-CoV-2 को तत्काल होस्ट (हरू) हुन सक्दैन।
en-mt: That is to say, bats cannot be the immediate host(s) of SARS-CoV-2 until they are roughly the same bat CoVs in the future.

sourceString: Presumably, the intermediate animal hosts of SARS-CoV-2 should be among the wildlife species sold and killed at the Huanan Seafood Wholesale Market, with which many of the initial cases of COVID-19 were associated, indicative of a probable animal-to-human transmission event.
targetString: अनुमानित रूपमा, SARS-CoV-2 का मध्यम पशु होस्टहरू Huanan Seafood को थोक बजारमा मारेर बेचिएका वन्यजन्तुहरूको बीचमा हुनुपर्छ, जससँग सम्भाव्य पशुबाट मानिसमा सर्ने अवस्थाको सूचक COVID-19 का धेरै प्रारम्भिक अवस्थाहरू सम्बद्ध थिए।
en-mt: Predictably, the medium animal hosts of SARS-CoV-2 must have been among wildlife killed and sold in the wholesale market of Huanan Seafood, with which many of the early conditions of COVID-19 were associated with a potential animal-to-human transmission condition.

sourceString: Several recent studies based on metagenomic sequencing have suggested that a group of endangered small mammals known as pangolins (Manis javanica) could also harbour ancestral beta-CoVs related to SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: मेटागेनोमिक अनुक्रमणमा आधारित धेरै भर्खरका अध्ययनहरूले पेन्गोलिन्स (मनिस जाभानिका) को रूपमा चिनिने लोपोन्मुख साना स्तनपायीहरूका समूहले SARS-CoV-2 सम्बन्धित पुर्खाहरूको बिटा- CoVs लाई पनि नियन्त्रण गर्न सक्छ भन्ने सुझाव दिएका छन्।
en-mt: Several recent studies based on metagenomic sequencing have suggested that a group of endangered small mammals known as pangolins (Manis javanica) may also control the beta-CoVs of SARS-CoV-2 related ancestors.

sourceString: These novel pangolin CoV genomes share 85-92% nucleotide sequence homology with SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: यी नोभेल सालकको CoV जिनोमहरूले SARS-CoV-2 सँग 85-92% न्युक्लियोटाइड अनुक्रमको होमोलोजी साझा गर्छन्।
en-mt: The CoV genomes of these novel salk share homology of the 85-92% nucleotide sequence with SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: However, they are equally closely related to RaTG13 with about 90% identity at the level of nucleotide sequence.
targetString: यद्यपि, तिनीहरू समान रूपमा न्युक्लियोटाइड अनुक्रमको स्तरमा लगभग 90% पहिचान गरिएको RaTG13 सँग नजिकबाट सम्बन्धित छन्।
en-mt: However, they are similarly closely related to about 90% of the identified RaTG13 at the level of the nucleotide sequence.

sourceString: They cluster into two sub-lineages of SARS-CoV-2-like viruses in the phylogenetic tree, one of which share a more similar receptor binding domain (RBD) with SARS-CoV-2, with 97.4% amino acid sequence identity.
targetString: तिनीहरू जातिवृत्तीय वृक्षमा SARS-CoV-2 जस्तै भाइरसहरूको दुई उप-वंशजहरूमा समूहमा हुन्छन्, जसमध्ये एउटाले 97.4% एमिनो एसिड अनुक्रम पहिचान भएको SARS-CoV-2 को साथमा थप समान रिसेप्टर बाइन्डिङ डोमेन (RBD) साझा गर्छ।
en-mt: They group into two sub-descendants of viruses similar to SARS-CoV-2 in the racial tree, one of which shares a more similar receptor binding domain (RBD) with a 97.4% amino acid sequence identity, SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: In stark contrast, the RBDs of SARS-CoV-2 and RaTG13 are more divergent, albeit a higher degree of sequence homology genome-wide.
targetString: यसको ठीक विपरीत, SARS-CoV-2 र RaTG13 का RBD हरू होमोलोजी जिनोम-व्यापक अनुक्रमको उच्च डिग्रीमा भएपनि अधिक भिन्न छन्।
en-mt: In contrast, the RBDs of SARS-CoV-2 and RaTG13 are more distinct, albeit at a high degree of homology genome-wide sequencing.

sourceString: An earlier study on diseased pangolins also reported the detection of viral contigs from lung samples, which turn out to be similarly related to SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: अस्वस्थ सालक बारे गरिएको अघिल्लो अध्ययनमा SARS-CoV-2 जस्तै एउटै भएको फोक्सोको नमूनाहरूबाट भाइरल कन्टिगहरू पत्ता लगाएको कुरा पनि रिपोर्ट गरिएको छ।
en-mt: Previous studies on unhealthy salk have also reported the detection of viral contigs from lung samples that are the same as SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: This study adopted different assembly methods and manual curation to generate a partial genome sequence comprising about 86.3% of the full-length viral genome.
targetString: यस अध्ययनले लगभग 86.3% पूरा लम्बाइको भाइरल जिनोम समावेश भएको आंशिक जिनोम अनुक्रम निर्माण गर्नका लागि विभिन्न सम्मेलन विधिहरू र म्यानुअल उपचार अपनाएको छ।
en-mt: This study adopted various conference methods and manual treatments for constructing a partial genome sequence consisting of a viral genome of approximately 86.3% full length.

sourceString: We cannot exclude the possibility that pangolin is one of the intermediate animal hosts of SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: हामी यस सम्भावनालाई हटाउन सक्दैनौँ किनकि लामो जिब्रो भएको कमिला खाने जीव SARS-CoV-2 को मध्यवर्ती जनावर होस्ट मध्ये एक हो।
en-mt: We cannot rule out this possibility because the long-tongued ant-eating organism is one of the intermediate animal hosts of SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: However, currently there is no evidence in support of a direct pangolin origin of SARS-CoV-2 due to the sequence divergence between SARS-CoV-2 and pangolin SARS-CoV-2-related beta-CoVs.
targetString: यद्यपि, SARS-CoV-2 र सालक SARS-CoV-2 सम्बन्धित बेटा-CoV हरू बीचको अनुक्रम विचलनको कारणले SARS-CoV-2 को प्रत्यक्ष सालक उत्पत्तिको समर्थनमा हाल कुनै प्रमाण छैन।
en-mt: However, there is currently no evidence to support the direct Salk origin of SARS-CoV-2 due to sequence divergence between SARS-CoV-2 and Salk SARS-CoV-2 related beta-CoVs.

sourceString: In addition, the distance between SARS-CoV-2 and RaTG13 is even shorter than that between SARS-CoV-2 and pangolin SARS-CoV-2-related beta-CoVs.
targetString: यसका साथै, SARS-CoV-2 र RaTG13 बीचको दूरी SARS-CoV-2 र पाङ्गोलिन SARS-CoV-2 सँग सम्बन्धित बिटा-CoVs को भन्दा पनि छोटो छ।
en-mt: In addition, the distance between SARS-CoV-2 and RaTG13 is even shorter than that of the beta-CoVs associated with SARS-CoV-2 and Pangolin SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: The evolutionary pathway of SARS-CoV-2 in bats, pangolins and other mammals remains to be established.
targetString: चमेरो, सालक र अन्य स्तनधारीहरूमा SARS-CoV-2 को विकासात्मक मार्ग स्थापना गर्न बाँकी रहन्छ।
en-mt: The developmental pathway of SARS-CoV-2 in bats, barks and other mammals remains to be established.

sourceString: Whereas the highest sequence homology has been found in the RBDs between SARS-CoV-2 and pangolin, SARS-CoV-2-related beta-CoVs, SARS-CoV-2 and RaTG13 share the highest genome-wide sequence homology.
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 र सालक बीचको RBD हरू मा उच्च अनुक्रमको होमोलोजी फेला पार्दा, SARS-CoV-2 सम्बन्धित बेटा-CoV हरू, SARS-CoV-2 र RaTG13 ले उच्चतम जेनोम-व्यापक अनुक्रमको होमोलोजी साझा गर्छ।
en-mt: When finding homology of high sequences in RBDs between SARS-CoV-2 and Salk, SARS-CoV-2 related beta-CoVs, SARS-CoV-2 and RaTG13 share homology of the highest genome-wide sequence.

sourceString: It is highly speculative that the high degree of similarity between the RBDs of pangolin SARS-CoV-2-related beta-CoVs and SARS-CoV-2 is driven by selectivity-mediated convergent evolution.
targetString: सालक SARS-CoV-2 सम्बन्धित बेटा-CoV हरू र SARS-CoV-2 को RBD हरू बीच उच्च समानता छनौट-मध्यस्थता अभिसरण विकासक्रमद्वारा सञ्चालित भएको कुरा अत्यधिक अनुमानित छ।
en-mt: That the high similarity between salk SARS-CoV-2 related beta-CoVs and RBDs of SARS-CoV-2 is driven by choice-mediated convergence evolution is highly speculative.

sourceString: A counter-proposal is in favour of a recombination between a pangolin SARS-CoV-2-related beta-CoV and RaTG13 in the third wild animal species.
targetString: प्रति-प्रस्ताव तेस्रो जङ्गली पशुको प्रजातिमा भएको सालक SARS-CoV-2-सम्बन्धी बेटा-CoV र RaTG13 बीचको पुनः संयोजनको पक्षमा छ।
en-mt: The counter-proposal favors the recombination between SARS-CoV-2-related beta-CoV and RaTG13 in the third wild animal species.

sourceString: As a driving force in evolution, recombination is widespread among beta-CoVs.
targetString: विकासमा चाल शक्तिको रूपमा, बिटा-CoVs बीच जडान व्यापक रूपमा रहेको छ।
en-mt: As a move power in development, the connection between beta-CoVs has been widespread.

sourceString: The jury is still out on the immediate zoonotic origin of SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: जुरी अझैपनि SARS-CoV-2 को तत्काल जुनोटिक उत्पत्तिमा छ।
en-mt: The jury is still in the immediate zoonotic origin of SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: Besides the highly pathogenic HCoVs, the zoonotic origin of HCoV-229E, HCoV-OC43, HCoV-NL63 and HCoV-HKU1 have also been studied.
targetString: अत्यधिक रोगजनक HCoV हरू बाहेक, HCoV-229E, HCoV-OC43, HCoV-NL63 र HCoV-HKU1 को जुनोटिक उत्पत्ति बारे पनि अध्ययन गरिएको छ।
en-mt: In addition to the highly pathogenic HCoVs, the zoonotic origins of HCoV-229E, HCoV-OC43, HCoV-NL63 and HCoV-HKU1 have also been studied.

sourceString: Phylogenetic evidence indicated that both HCoV-NL63 and HCoV-229E might have originated from bat CoVs, while the parental viruses of HCoV-OC43 and HCoV-HKU1 have been found in rodents.
targetString: जातिवृत्तीय प्रमाणले HCoV-OC43 र HCoV-HKU1 का पैतृक भाइरसहरू मुसाहरूमा फेला पर्दा, दुवै HCoV-NL63 र HCoV-229E चमेरा CoV हरूबाट उत्पन्न भएको हुन सक्ने कुरा सङ्केत गर्‍यो।
en-mt: Racial evidence indicated that the ancestral viruses of HCoV-OC43 and HCoV-HKU1 were found in mice, both HCoV-NL63 and HCoV-229E may have originated from bat CoV.

sourceString: It has been reported that a bat CoV termed ARCoV.2 (Appalachian Ridge CoV) detected in North American tricolored bat displayed close relationship with HCoV-NL63.
targetString: यो उत्तर अमेरिकी त्रिरङ्गी चमेरामा पत्ता लागेको ARCoV.2 (अपलाचियन रिज CoV) भन्ने चमेरो CoV को HCoV-NL63 सँग घनिष्ठ सम्बन्ध प्रदर्शन गर्‍यो भनी रिपोर्ट गरिएको छ।
en-mt: It has been reported to exhibit a close relationship with HCoV-NL63 of the bat CoV called ARCoV.2 (Appalachian Ridge CoV) discovered in North American tricolor bats.

sourceString: On the other hand, HCoV-229E was genetically related to another bat CoV, termed Hipposideros/GhanaKwam/19/2008, which was detected in Ghana, while camelids have also been suspected as its intermediate host.
targetString: अर्कोतर्फ, ऊँटहरूलाई पनि यसको मध्यम होस्टको रूपमा शङ्का गरिएको हुँदा, HCoV-229E घानामा पत्ता लागेका आनुवंशिक रूपमा हिप्पोसिडेरोस/घानाक्वाम/19/2008 भनिने अर्को चमेरा CoV सँग आनुवंशिक रूपमा सम्बन्धित थियो।
en-mt: On the other hand, since camels were also suspected as its medium host, HCoV-229E was genetically related to another bat CoV called Hipposideros/Ghanaquam/19/2008 discovered in Ghana.

sourceString: For clarity, the current knowledge on animal origins of known HCoVs is summarized in Figure ​1 and Table 2.
targetString: स्पष्टताको लागि, ज्ञात HCoVs पशुहरूको उत्पत्तिमा हालको ज्ञान चित्र 1 र तालिका 2 मा सारांश गरिएको छ।
en-mt: For clarity, recent knowledge on the origin of known HCoVs animals is summarized in Figure 1 and Table 2.

sourceString: Phylogenetic analysis has provided evidence for interspecies transmission events of HCoVs in the history.
targetString: जातिवृत्तीय विश्लेषणले इतिहासमा HCoV हरूको अन्तरप्रजातीय प्रसारण केसहरूका लागि प्रमाण प्रदान गरेको छ।
en-mt: Racial analysis has provided evidence for interspecific transmission cases of HCoVs throughout history.
