Healthcare providers caring for an infected person are recommended to use standard precautions, contact precautions, and eye protection. Contact tracing is an important method for health authorities to determine the source of infection and prevent further transmission.

sourceString: The use of location data from mobile phones by governments for this purpose has prompted privacy concerns, with Amnesty International and over 100 other organizations issuing a statement calling for limits on this kind of surveillance.
targetString: यस उद्देश्यका लागि सरकारले मोबाइल फोनबाट स्थानको डाटाको प्रयोगले गोपनीयता चिन्ताको सङ्केत गरेको छ, एमनेस्टी इन्टरनेसनल र 100 भन्दा बढी अन्य संस्थाहरूले यस प्रकारको निगरानीमा सीमा तय गर्न भन्दै बयान जारी गरेका छन्।
en-mt: The government's use of location data from mobile phones for this purpose has signalled privacy concerns, with Amnesty International and more than 100 other organizations issuing statements calling for limits on this type of surveillance.

sourceString: Various mobile apps have been implemented or proposed for voluntary use, and as of April 7, 2020, over a dozen expert groups were working on privacy-friendly solutions, such as using Bluetooth to log a user's proximity to other cellphones.
targetString: विभिन्न मोबाइल अनुप्रयोगहरू लागू गरिएका वा स्वैच्छिक प्रयोगका लागि प्रस्ताव गरिएका छन् र अप्रिल 7, 2020 सम्ममा, दर्जन भन्दा बढी विज्ञ समूहहरू गोपनीयता-मैत्री समाधानहरूमा काम गर्दै थिए, ब्लुटुथको प्रयोग गरेर फोन प्रयोगकर्ताहरू सँगको निकटता रेकर्ड गर्ने।
en-mt: Various mobile applications have been implemented or offered for voluntary use and as of April 7, 2020, more than a dozen expert groups were working on privacy-friendly solutions, using Bluetooth to record proximity to phone users.

sourceString: Users then receive a message if they've been in close contact with someone who has tested positive for COVID-19.Misconceptions are circulating about how to prevent infection; for example, rinsing the nose and gargling with mouthwash are not effective.
targetString: यदि तिनीहरू COVID-19 को परीक्षणमा सङ्क्रमित भएको पुष्टि भएकासँग सम्पर्कमा छन् भने प्रयोगकर्ताहरूले त्यस पश्चात् सन्देश प्राप्त गर्दछन्। उदाहरणका लागि, सङ्क्रमणलाई कसरी रोक्न सकिन्छ भनेर नाक भिजाउने वा पखाल्ने र मुख कुल्ला गर्ने लगायतका अप्रभावकारी गलत धारणाहरू सञ्चालन भइरहेको छन्।
en-mt: Users receive a message after that if they have been in contact with someone who has tested positive for COVID-19. For example, ineffective misconceptions, including soaking or washing the nose and rinsing the mouth, are operating on how to prevent infection.

sourceString: There is no COVID-19 vaccine, though many organizations are working to develop one.
targetString: COVID-19 को कुनै खोप छैन, यद्यपि धेरै संस्थाले यसको विकासको लागि काम गरिरहेका छन्।
en-mt: There is no vaccine for COVID-19, although many institutions are working to develop it.

sourceString: Hand washing is recommended to prevent the spread of the disease.
targetString: रोगलाई फैलनबाट रोक्नका लागि हात धुने सिफारिस गरिन्छ।
en-mt: Hand washing is recommended to prevent the spread of the disease.

sourceString: The CDC recommends that people wash hands often with soap and water for at least twenty seconds, especially after going to the toilet or when hands are visibly dirty; before eating; and after blowing one's nose, coughing, or sneezing.
targetString: CDC ले मानिसहरूलाई विशेष गरी शौचालय गएपछि वा हातहरू दृश्यात्मक रूपमा फोहोर हुँदा; खाना खानुअघि; र नाक पुछेपछि, खोकेपछि वा हाच्छिउँ गरेपछि हातहरूलाई बारम्बार साबुन र पानीले कम्तीमा बीस सेकेन्डसम्म धुन सिफारिस गर्दछ।
en-mt: CDC allows people especially after going to the toilet or when hands are visibly dirty; before eating; And after wiping, coughing, or sneezing, it is recommended to wash hands frequently with soap and water for at least twenty seconds.

sourceString: This is because outside the human body, the virus is killed by household soap, which bursts its protective bubble.
targetString: किनकि मानव शरीर बाहिर, भाइरस घरायसी साबुन द्वारा मारिन्छ, जसले यसका सुरक्षात्मक बबलहरुलाई फुटाउँछ।
en-mt: Because outside the human body, the virus is killed by household soap, which breaks its protective bubbles.

sourceString: CDC further recommended using an alcohol-based hand sanitizer with at least 60% alcohol by volume when soap and water are not readily available.
targetString: CDC ले साबुन र पानी सजिलै उपलब्ध नभएमा मात्रामा कम्तीमा 60% अल्कोहल भएको अल्कोहल-आधारित ह्यान्ड स्यानिटाइजर प्रयोग गर्न थप सिफारिस गर्‍यो।
en-mt: The CDC further recommended using an alcohol-based hand sanitizer containing at least 60% alcohol in quantities if soap and water were not readily available.

sourceString: The WHO advises people to avoid touching the eyes, nose, or mouth with unwashed hands.
targetString: WHO ले मानिसहरूलाई नधोएको हातले आँखा, नाक, वा मुख छुनुबाट टाढा रहन सल्लाह दिन्छ।
en-mt: WHO advises people to refrain from touching eyes, nose, or mouth with unwashed hands.

sourceString: Surfaces may be decontaminated with a number of solutions (within one minute of exposure to the disinfectant for a stainless steel surface), including 62–71% ethanol, 50–100% isopropanol, 0.1% sodium hypochlorite, 0.5% hydrogen peroxide, and 0.2–7.5% povidone-iodine.
targetString: सतहहरूलाई थुप्रै घोलहरू द्वारा कीटाणुरहित पार्न सकिन्छ (खिया नलाग्ने स्टिल सतहको लागि कीटाणुनाशकको सम्पर्कमा आएको एक मिनेटभित्र), जसमा 62–71% इथेनल, 50–100% आइसोप्रोपेनोल, 0.1% सोडियम हाइपोक्लोराइट, 0.5% हाइड्रोजन पेरोक्साइड, र 0.2–7.5% प्रोभिडोन-आयोडिन समावेश हुन्छन्।
en-mt: Surfaces can be disinfected with a number of solvents (within a minute of exposure to disinfectants for non-worn steel surfaces), which contain 62–71% ethanol, 50–100% isopropenol, 0.1% sodium hypochlorite, 0.5% hydrogen peroxide, and 0.2–7.5% providone–iodine.

sourceString: Other solutions, such as benzalkonium chloride and chrohexidine gluconate, are less effective.
targetString: अन्य समाधानहरू, जस्तै बेन्जाल्कोनियम क्लोराइड र क्रोहेक्सिडाइन ग्लुकोनेट, कम प्रभावकारी हुन्छन्।
en-mt: Other solutions, such as benzalconium chloride and crohxidine gluconate, are less effective.

sourceString: The CDC recommends that if a COVID case is suspected or confirmed at a facility such as an office or day care, all areas such as offices, bathrooms, common areas, shared electronic equipment like tablets, touch screens, keyboards, remote controls, and ATM machines used by the ill persons, should be disinfected.
targetString: CDC ले सिफारिस गर्दछ कि यदि कुनै COVID को शङ्कास्पद वा पुष्टि भएको कुनै मामिला कार्यालय परिसर वा दिन हेरचाह केन्द्रमा छ भने सबै क्षेत्रहरू जस्तै कार्यालयहरू, बाथरुमहरू, साझा क्षेत्रहरू, साझा इलेक्ट्रोनिक उपकरणहरू जस्तै ट्याब्लेटहरू, टच स्क्रीनहरू, किबोर्डहरू, रिमोट कन्ट्रोलहरू र विरामी व्यक्तिद्वारा प्रयोग गरिएका ATM मेसिनहरूलाई कीटाणुरहित पार्नुपर्दछ।
en-mt: CDC recommends that if any case suspected or confirmed of COVID is in an office premises or day care center, all areas such as offices, bathrooms, shared areas, shared electronic devices such as tablets, touch screens, keyboards, remote controls and ATM machines used by the sick person should be disinfected.

sourceString: Health organizations recommended that people cover their mouth and nose with a bent elbow or a tissue when coughing or sneezing, and disposing of any tissue immediately.
targetString: स्वास्थ्य सङ्गठनहरूले सिफारिस गरे कि खोक्दा वा हाच्छ्युँ गर्दा मानिसहरूले आफ्नो मुख र नाक कुहिनो बङ्गाएर वा एक टिस्युले छोप्नुपर्दछ र कुनै पनि टिस्युलाई तुरुन्त व्यवस्थापन गरिनुपर्छ।
en-mt: Health organizations recommend that people cover their mouths and noses with an elbow or a tissue when coughing or sneezing, and that any tissue should be handled immediately.

sourceString: Surgical masks are recommended for those who may be infected, as wearing a mask can limit the volume and travel distance of expiratory droplets dispersed when talking, sneezing, and coughing.
targetString: सङ्क्रमित व्यक्तिहरूका लागि सर्जिकल मास्कको सिफारिस गरिन्छ, किनकि मास्क लगाउनाले बोल्दा, हाच्छ्युँ गर्दा र खोक्दा तितरबितर भएका श्वासका छिटाहरूको मात्रा र यात्रा दूरी सीमित गर्न सक्छ।
en-mt: Surgical masks are recommended for infected people, as wearing a mask can limit the amount of breath droplets scattered while speaking, sneezing, and coughing and travel distance.

sourceString: The WHO has issued instructions on when and how to use masks.
targetString: WHO ले मास्क कहाँ र कसरी प्रयोग गर्ने बारेमा निर्देश जारी गरेको छ।
en-mt: WHO has issued instructions on where and how to use masks.

sourceString: According to Stephen Griffin, a virologist at the University of Leeds, "Wearing a mask can reduce the propensity [of] people to touch their faces, which is a major source of infection without proper hand hygiene."Masks have also been recommended for use by those taking care of someone who may have the disease.
targetString: लिड्स युनिभर्सिटीका एक जना भाइरस विज्ञ, स्टिफन ग्रिफिनका अनुसार, “मास्क लगाउनुले मानिसहरू [को] अनुहार छुन सक्ने प्रबलतालाई कम गर्न सक्छ जुन उचित हातको स्वच्छताबिना सङ्क्रमणको प्रमुख स्रोत हो।” रोग लागेको व्यक्तिको हेरचाह गर्नेहरूको प्रयोगका लागि पनि मास्कहरू सिफारिस गरिएका छन्।
en-mt: According to Stephen Griffin, a virologist at the University of Leeds, "Wearing masks can reduce the predominance of people [touching] faces that are a major source of infection without proper hand hygiene." Masks are also recommended for use by caregivers of people with the disease.

sourceString: The WHO has recommended the wearing of masks by healthy people only if they are at high risk, such as those who are caring for a person with COVID-19, although they also acknowledge that wearing masks may help people avoid touching their face.
targetString: WHO ले स्वस्थ व्यक्तिहरू उच्च जोखिममा भएको बेलामा मात्र मास्क लगाउन सिफारिस गरेको छ। यदि उनीहरू उच्च जोखिममा छन्, जस्तै COVID-19 सङ्क्रमित व्यक्तिको हेरचाह गरिरहेका व्यक्तिहरू, यद्यपि उनीहरूले मास्क लगाउँदा मानिसहरूलाई आफ्नो अनुहार नछुनलाई मद्दत गर्न सक्ने स्वीकार गर्दछन्।
en-mt: WHO recommends wearing masks only when healthy people are at high risk. If they are at high risk, such as people caring for a COVID-19 infected person, although they admit that wearing masks can help people not touch their faces.

sourceString: Several countries have started to encourage the use of face masks by members of the public.
targetString: धेरै देशहरूले जनतामाझ अनुहार-मास्कको प्रयोगलाई प्रोत्साहित गर्न थालेका छन्।
en-mt: Many countries have begun to encourage the use of face masks among the public.

sourceString: In the U.S., the CDC recommends wearing non-medical face mask made out of cloth.China has specifically recommended the use of disposable medical masks by healthy members of the public, particularly when coming into close contact (1 metre (3 ft) or less) with other people.
targetString: अमेरिकामा CDC ले कपडाले बनेको नन-मेडिकल फेस मास्क लगाउन सिफारिस गर्छ। चीनले विशेष रूपमा जनताका स्वस्थ सदस्यहरूद्वारा, विशेषत: अन्य मानिससँगको निकट सम्पर्क (1 मिटर (3 फिट) वा कम) मा आउँदा डिस्पोजेबल मेडिकल मास्कको प्रयोगलाई सिफारिस गरेको छ।
en-mt: In the U.S., the CDC recommends wearing non-medical face masks made of cloth. China specifically recommends the use of disposable medical masks by healthy members of the public, especially when in close contact with other people (1 meter (3 feet) or less).

sourceString: Hong Kong recommends wearing a surgical mask when taking public transport or staying in crowded places.
targetString: हङकङले सार्वजनिक यातायात सुविधाको उपयोग गर्ने बेला वा भीड स्थानहरूमा रहँदा सर्जिकल मास्क लगाउने सल्लाह दिएको छ।
en-mt: Hong Kong has recommended wearing surgical masks while using public transport facilities or in crowded places.

sourceString: Thailand's health officials are encouraging people to make cloth facemasks at home and wash them daily.
targetString: थाइल्याण्डका स्वास्थ्य अधिकारीहरूले मानिसहरूलाई घरमा कपडाको अनुहार मास्क बनाउन र तीनीहरुलाई दिनहुँ धुन प्रोत्साहन गरिरहेका छन्।
en-mt: Thai health authorities are encouraging people to make cloth face masks at home and wash them daily.

sourceString: The Czech Republic and Slovakia banned going out in public without wearing a mask or covering one's nose and mouth.
targetString: चेक गणतन्त्र र स्लोभाकियाले मानिसहरूलाई भिडभाडमा जाँदा माक्स तथा नाक मुख ढाक्ने वस्तुको प्रयोग नगरी बाहिर निस्किन प्रतिबन्ध लगाएको थियो।
en-mt: The Czech Republic and Slovakia banned people from going out without the use of masks and mouth coverings when gatherings.

sourceString: On 16 March, Vietnam requested everyone to wear a face mask when going to public areas in order to protect themselves and others.
targetString: 16 मार्चमा, भियतनामले सार्वजनिक क्षेत्रमा जाँदा आफ्नो र अरूको सुरक्षाका लागि सबैलाई अनुहार मास्क लगाउन अनुरोध गर्‍यो।
en-mt: On March 16, Vietnam requested everyone to wear face masks for the safety of themselves and others when visiting public areas.

sourceString: The Austrian government mandated that everyone entering a grocery store must wear a face mask.
targetString: अस्ट्रिया सरकारले अनिवार्य गरेको छ कि किराना स्टोरमा प्रवेश गर्ने सबैले अनुहारमा मास्क लगाउनु पर्छ।
en-mt: The Austrian government has made it mandatory for everyone entering grocery stores to wear face masks.

sourceString: Israel has asked all residents to wear face masks when in public.
targetString: इजरायलले सबै बासिन्दाहरूलाई सार्वजनिक ठाउँमा फेस मास्क लगाउन भनेको छ।
en-mt: Israel has asked all residents to wear face masks in public.

sourceString: Taiwan, which has been producing ten million masks per day since mid-March, required passengers on trains and intercity buses to wear face masks on 1 April.
targetString: मार्चको मध्यदेखि प्रतिदिन एक करोड मास्क उत्पादन गरिरहेको ताइवानले 1 अप्रिलमा रेल र इन्टरसिटी बसमा यात्रुहरूलाई फेस मास्क लगाउन आवश्यक गरेको थियो।
en-mt: Taiwan, which has been producing 10 million masks per day since mid-March, on April 1 made it mandatory for passengers on trains and intercity buses to wear face masks.

sourceString: Panama has made it obligatory to wear a face mask whenever going outside, while also recommending the manufacture of a homemade face mask for those who cannot purchase face masks.
targetString: पानामाले बाहिर जाँदा अनुहारको मास्क लगाउन अनिवार्य गरेको छ , जब कि जसले अनुहार मास्क खरिद गर्न सक्दैनन् तिनीहरूको लागि घरेलु अनुहार मास्क उत्पादनको सिफारिस पनि गरेको छ।
en-mt: Panama has made it mandatory to wear face masks when going out, while also recommending the production of homemade face masks for those who cannot afford it.

sourceString: Face masks have also been widely used in Japan, South Korea, Malaysia, and Singapore.
targetString: अनुहार मास्क जापान, दक्षिण कोरिया, मलेसिया र सिङ्गापुरमा पनि व्यापक रूपमा प्रयोग भएका छन्।
en-mt: Face masks have also been widely used in Japan, South Korea, Malaysia and Singapore.

sourceString: Social distancing (also known as physical distancing) includes infection control actions intended to slow the spread of disease by minimizing close contact between individuals.
targetString: सामाजिक दूरी (शारीरिक दूरी भनेर पनि चिनिन्छ) मा व्यक्तिहरूबीचको घनिष्ठ सम्पर्कलाई कम गर्दै रोगको फैलावटलाई सुस्त बनाउनको लागि गरिने सङ्क्रमण नियन्त्रणका कार्यहरू समावेश गर्दछ।
en-mt: Social distancing (also known as physical distancing) involves infection control actions to slow the spread of the disease while reducing close contact between individuals.

sourceString: Methods include quarantines; travel restrictions; and the closing of schools, workplaces, stadiums, theatres, or shopping centres.
targetString: विधिहरूमा क्वारेन्टाइनहरू; यात्रामा रोक; र विद्यालयहरू, कार्यस्थलहरू, रङ्गशालाहरू, थिएटरहरू वा किनमेल केन्द्रहरू बन्द गर्ने समावेश छन्।
en-mt: Quarantines in methods; stop traveling; and closing schools, workplaces, stadiums, theaters or shopping centers.

sourceString: Individuals may apply social distancing methods by staying at home, limiting travel, avoiding crowded areas, using no-contact greetings, and physically distancing themselves from others.
targetString: व्यक्तिहरूले घरमा बसेर, यात्रा सीमित गरेर, भीडभाड भएको क्षेत्रहरूबाट जोगिएर, सम्पर्क नहुने अभिवादनको प्रयोग गरेर र अरूबाट आफूलाई शारीरिक रूपमा टाढा राखेर सामाजिक दूरीको विधि लागू गर्न सक्छन्।
en-mt: Individuals can apply social distancing methods by staying at home, limiting travel, avoiding crowded areas, using contactless greetings, and physically distancing themselves from others.

sourceString: Many governments are now mandating or recommending social distancing in regions affected by the outbreak.
targetString: धेरै सरकारले प्रकोपबाट प्रभावित क्षेत्रहरूमा अहिले सामाजिक दूरीको पालना अनिवार्य वा सिफारिस गरिरहेका छन्।
en-mt: Many governments are now making social distancing mandatory or recommending adherence in disaster-affected areas.

sourceString: The maximum gathering size recommended by US government bodies and health organizations was swiftly reduced from 250 people (if there was no known COVID-19 spread in a region) to 50 people, and later to 10 people.
targetString: अमेरिकी सरकारी निकायहरू र स्वास्थ्य संगठनहरूले सिफारिस गरेको अधिकतम मानिसहरूको भेला हुने आकार द्रुत रूपमा 250 जनाबाट (यदि त्यस क्षेत्रमा COVID-19 फैलिएको थिएन भने) 50 जनामा घटाइएको थियो ​​र पछि 10 जनामा घटाइयो।
en-mt: The gathering size of the maximum number of people recommended by U.S. government agencies and health organizations was quickly reduced from 250 people (if COVID-19 had not spread in that area) to 50 people and was later reduced to 10.

sourceString: On 22 March 2020, Germany banned public gatherings of more than two people.Older adults and those with underlying medical conditions such as diabetes, heart disease, respiratory disease, hypertension, and compromised immune systems face increased risk of serious illness and complications and have been advised by the CDC to stay home as much as possible in areas of community outbreak.In late March 2020, the WHO and other health bodies began to replace the use of the term "social distancing" with "physical distancing", to clarify that the aim is to reduce physical contact while maintaining social connections, either virtually or at a distance.
targetString: 22 मार्च 2020 मा, जर्मनीले दुई भन्दा बढी व्यक्तिको सार्वजनिक जमघटमा प्रतिबन्ध लगायो। वृद्ध वयस्कहरू र अन्तर्निहित मेडिकल अवस्थाहरू जस्तै मधुमेह, हृदय रोग, श्वास रोग, उच्च रक्तचाप र सम्झौता युक्त प्रतिरोधात्मक प्रणाली भएकाहरूले गम्भीर बिरामीको बढ्दो खतरा र जटिलताहरूको सामना गर्छन् र उनीहरूलाई CDC द्वारा सामुदायिक प्रकोपका क्षेत्रहरूमा सकेसम्म घरमै बस्न सल्लाह दिइएको छ। मार्च 2020 को अन्त्यतिर, WHO र अन्य स्वास्थ्य निकायहरूले “सामाजिक दूरी” भन्ने शब्दलाई “शारीरिक दूरी” शब्द ले बदलेर प्रयोग गर्न सुरु गरे, यो स्पष्ट गर्न कि यसको उद्देश्य वस्तुतः वा एक दूरीमा सामाजिक सम्पर्क कायम गर्दा शारीरिक सम्पर्कलाई कम गर्नु हो।
en-mt: On 22 March 2020, Germany banned public gatherings of more than two people. Older adults and those with underlying medical conditions such as diabetes, heart disease, respiratory disease, high blood pressure and a compromised immune system face an increased risk and complications of serious illness and are advised by the CDC to stay at home as much as possible in areas of community outbreaks. Towards the end of March 2020, WHO and other health agencies began using the term "social distancing" by changing the term "physical distance" to clarify whether its purpose is to reduce physical contact while virtually or maintaining social contact at a distance.

sourceString: The use of the term "social distancing" had led to implications that people should engage in complete social isolation, rather than encouraging them to stay in contact with others through alternative means.Some authorities have issued sexual health guidelines for use during the pandemic.
targetString: “सामाजिक दूरी” भन्ने शब्दको प्रयोगले मानिसहरूलाई वैकल्पिक माध्यमबाट अरूसँग सम्पर्कमा रहन प्रोत्साहित गर्नुको सट्टा पूर्ण उनीहरूमा सामाजिक अलगावमा संलग्न हुनुपर्छ भन्ने प्रभाव पारेको थियो। केही अधिकारीहरूले महामारीको समयमा प्रयोगका लागि यौन स्वास्थ्य दिशानिर्देशहरू जारी गरेका छन्।
en-mt: The use of the term "social distancing" had the effect that people should engage in complete social isolation instead of encouraging them to stay in touch with others through alternative means. Some authorities have issued sexual health guidelines for use during the pandemic.

sourceString: These include recommendations to only have sex with someone you live with, who does not have the virus or symptoms of the virus.
targetString: यिनमा तपाईँसँग बस्नेसँग मात्र यौन सम्पर्क गर्ने सिफारिस समावेश छ, जोसँग भाइरस वा भाइरस भएको लक्षण छैन।
en-mt: These include recommendations to have sex only with someone you live with, who do not have symptoms of having the virus or the virus.

sourceString: Self-isolation at home has been recommended for those diagnosed with COVID-19 and those who suspect they have been infected.
targetString: COVID-19 बाट निदान भएकाहरू र जसलाई शंका छ कि उनीहरू सङ्क्रमित भएका छन्, उनीहरूलाई घरमा स्व-अलगाव को सिफारिस गरिएको छ।
en-mt: Those diagnosed with COVID-19 and those who suspect they have been infected are recommended self-isolation at home.

sourceString: Health agencies have issued detailed instructions for proper self-isolation.Many governments have mandated or recommended self-quarantine for entire populations living in affected areas.
targetString: स्वास्थ्य एजेन्सीहरूले उचित स्व-अलगावको लागि विस्तृत निर्देशनहरू जारी गरेका छन्। धेरै सरकारहरूले प्रभावित क्षेत्रहरूमा बसोवास गर्ने सम्पूर्ण जनसङ्ख्याका लागि स्व-अलगाव अनिवार्य वा सिफारिस गरेका छन्।
en-mt: Health agencies have issued detailed instructions for proper self-isolation. Many governments have mandated or recommended self-isolation for the entire population living in the affected areas.

sourceString: The strongest self-quarantine instructions have been issued to those in high risk groups.
targetString: उच्च जोखिम समूहहरूमा सबैभन्दा कडा स्व-अलगाव निर्देशनहरू जारी गरिएका छन्।
en-mt: The strictest self-isolation instructions have been issued in high-risk groups.

sourceString: Those who may have been exposed to someone with COVID-19 and those who have recently travelled to a country or region with widespread transmission have been advised to self-quarantine for 14 days from the time of last possible exposure.
targetString: जो COVID-19 भएको कसैको सम्पर्कमा आएको हुन सक्छ र जसले भर्खरै कुनै देश वा क्षेत्रको यात्रा गरेको छ जहाँ व्यापक प्रसारण रहेको छ उनीहरूलाई अन्तिम सम्भावित जोखिमको समयदेखि 14 दिनका लागि सेल्फ-क्वारेन्टाइन गर्न सल्लाह दिइएको छ।
en-mt: Those who may have come in contact with someone with COVID-19 and who have recently traveled to a country or region where there is widespread transmission are advised to self-quarantine for 14 days from the time of the last possible risk.

sourceString: Strategies in the control of an outbreak are containment or suppression, and mitigation.
targetString: प्रकोपको नियन्त्रणमा रणनीतिहरू भनेको नियन्त्रण वा दमन, र शमन हुन्।
en-mt: Strategies for disaster control are control or suppression, and mitigation.

sourceString: Containment is undertaken in the early stages of the outbreak and aims to trace and isolate those infected as well as introduce other measures of infection control and vaccinations to stop the disease from spreading to the rest of the population.
targetString: प्रकोपको प्रारम्भिक चरणमा रोकथामका उपायहरू लिइन्छन् र यो संक्रमितहरूलाई पत्ता लगाउन र अलग गर्नका साथै यस रोगलाई बाँकी जनसङ्ख्यामा फैलनबाट रोक्न सङ्क्रमण नियन्त्रणका अन्य उपायहरू र खोपहरू पनि पेश गर्नका निम्ति लक्षित छ।
en-mt: Preventive measures are taken in the early stages of the outbreak and are aimed at detecting and isolating the infected, as well as introducing other infection control measures and vaccines to prevent the disease from spreading to the rest of the population.

sourceString: When it is no longer possible to contain the spread of the disease, efforts then move to the mitigation stage: measures are taken to slow the spread and mitigate its effects on the healthcare system and society.
targetString: यो रोगको फैलावलाई अब उपरान्त समेट्न सम्भव नहुँदा, प्रयासहरू शमन चरणमा जान्छन्: फैलावको गति कम गर्न र स्वास्थ्य सेवा प्रणाली र समाजमा यसका असरहरूलाई कम गर्नका लागि उपायहरू गरिन्छ।
en-mt: Since it is no longer possible to contain the spread of the disease, efforts go into the mitigation phase: measures are taken to slow the spread and its effects on the healthcare system and society.

sourceString: A combination of both containment and mitigation measures may be undertaken at the same time.
targetString: रोकथाम र निवारण दुवै उपायहरूको संयोजन एकै समयमा अपनाउन सकिन्छ।
en-mt: A combination of both prevention and prevention measures can be adopted at the same time.

sourceString: Suppression requires more extreme measures so as to reverse the pandemic by reducing the basic reproduction number to less than 1.Part of managing an infectious disease outbreak is trying to decrease the epidemic peak, known as flattening the epidemic curve.
targetString: दमनका लागि अधिक चरम उपायहरू आवश्यक पर्दछन् जसले आधारभूत प्रजनन संख्यालाई 1 भन्दा कम मा घटाएर महामारीलाई उल्ट्याउन सकोस्। एउटा सङ्क्रामक रोगको प्रकोपलाई प्रबन्ध गर्ने एक हिस्सा महामारीको शिखरलाई घटाउने कोसिस गर्नु हो, जसलाई महामारी वक्र लाई समतल गर्नु भनिन्छ।
en-mt: Suppression requires more extreme measures that can reverse the pandemic by reducing the baseline reproduction number to less than 1. Part of managing an infectious disease outbreak is trying to reduce the peak of an epidemic, which is called flattening the epidemic curve.

sourceString: This decreases the risk of health services being overwhelmed and provides more time for vaccines and treatments to be developed.
targetString: यसले स्वास्थ्य सेवाहरूलाई अप्ठ्यारोमा पार्ने जोखिमलाई घटाउँछ र खोप र उपचारको विकासका लागि अधिक समय प्रदान पर्दछ।
en-mt: This reduces the risk of endangering health services and provides more time for the development of vaccines and treatments.

sourceString: Non-pharmaceutical interventions that may manage the outbreak include personal preventive measures, such as hand hygiene, wearing face-masks, and self-quarantine; community measures aimed at physical distancing such as closing schools and cancelling mass gathering events; community engagement to encourage acceptance and participation in such interventions; as well as environmental measures such surface cleaning.More drastic actions aimed at containing the outbreak were taken in China once the severity of the outbreak became apparent, such as quarantining entire cities and imposing strict travel bans.
targetString: प्रकोपलाई व्यवस्थापन गर्न सक्ने गैर-औषधिय हस्तक्षेपहरूमा व्यक्तिगत निवारणमा उपायहरू, जस्तै हातको स्वच्छता, फेस मास्क लगाउने, र सेल्फ क्वारेन्टाइन; शारीरिक दूरीप्रति लक्षित सामुदायिक उपायहरू जस्तै विद्यालयहरू बन्द गर्ने र हुल जम्मा हुने कार्यक्रमहरू रद्द गर्ने; सामुदायिक व्यस्तता जसद्वारा स्वीकार्यता र यस्ता हस्तक्षेपमा सहभागिता प्रोत्साहित गर्न; साथै वातावरणीय उपायहरू जस्तै सतह सफाइ गर्ने समावेश छन्। चीनमा प्रकोप समाहित गर्न लक्षित थप कडा कारबाहीहरू लिइएका थिए जब यस प्रकोपको गम्भीरता प्रष्ट भयो, जस्तै सम्पूर्ण शहरहरू क्वारेन्टाइन गर्ने र कडा यात्रा प्रतिबन्धहरू लगाउने।
en-mt: Non-pharmacological interventions that can manage the outbreak include measures on individual prevention, such as hand hygiene, wearing face masks, and self-quarantine; community measures aimed at physical distancing such as closing schools and canceling crowd gatherings; community engagement by which to encourage acceptance and participation in such interventions; As well as environmental measures such as surface cleaning. More stringent actions aimed at containing the outbreak in China were taken when the severity of the outbreak became clear, such as quarantined entire cities and imposing strict travel restrictions.

sourceString: Other countries also adopted a variety of measures aimed at limiting the spread of the virus.
targetString: अन्य देशहरूले पनि भाइरसको फैलावटलाई सीमित गर्न लक्षित विभिन्न उपायहरू अपनाए।
en-mt: Other countries also adopted various measures aimed at limiting the spread of the virus.

sourceString: South Korea introduced mass screening and localized quarantines, and issued alerts on the movements of infected individuals.
targetString: दक्षिण कोरियाले सामूहिक स्क्रिनिङ र स्थानीयकृत क्वारेन्टाइन सुरु गर्‍यो, र सङ्क्रमित व्यक्तिहरूको हिँडडुलको बारेमा सतर्कताहरू जारी गर्‍यो।
en-mt: South Korea began mass screening and localized quarantine, and issued alerts about the movement of infected people.

sourceString: Singapore provided financial support for those infected who quarantined themselves and imposed large fines for those who failed to do so.
targetString: सिङ्गापुरले संक्रमितहरूका लागि आर्थिक सहयोग प्रदान गर्‍यो जसले आफैंलाई क्वारेन्टाइनमा राखे र त्यसो गर्न असफल भएकाहरूलाई ठूलो जरिवाना लगायो।
en-mt: Singapore provided financial support for those infected who quarantined themselves and imposed heavy fines on those who failed to do so.

sourceString: Taiwan increased face mask production and penalized hoarding of medical supplies.Simulations for Great Britain and the United States show that mitigation (slowing but not stopping epidemic spread) and suppression (reversing epidemic growth) have major challenges.
targetString: ताइवानले अनुहारमा लगाउने मास्कको उत्पादन वृद्धि गर्‍यो र चिकित्सा आपूर्ति सञ्चय गरी राख्नेलाई दण्ड दियो। बेलायत र संयुक्त राज्यको लागि सिमुलेसनले न्यूनीकरण (कम हुने तर महामारी फैलिन नरोकिने) र शमन (महामारी वृद्धिलाई उल्टाउने) मा मुख्य चुनौतीहरू भएको देखाउँछ।
en-mt: Taiwan increased the production of face masks and punished those who hoard medical supplies. For the UK and the United States, the simulation shows that mitigation (reducing but not preventing the spread of epidemics) and mitigation (reversing epidemic growth) are key challenges.

sourceString: Optimal mitigation policies might reduce peak healthcare demand by 2/3 and deaths by half, but still result in hundreds of thousands of deaths and health systems being overwhelmed.
targetString: अधिकतम न्यूनीकरण नीतिहरूले उच्च स्वास्थ्य स्याहारको मागलाई 2/3 र मृत्युलाई आधा कम गर्न सक्छन्, तर अझै पनि लाखौँ मृत्युहरु हुन्छन् र स्वास्थ्य प्रणालीहरू व्याकुल हुन्छन्।
en-mt: Maximal mitigation policies can reduce the demand for high health care by 2/3 and deaths by half, but there are still millions of deaths and health systems are disturbed.

sourceString: Suppression can be preferred but needs to be maintained for as long as the virus is circulating in the human population (or until a vaccine becomes available, if that comes first), as transmission otherwise quickly rebounds when measures are relaxed.
targetString: मानव जनसङ्ख्यामा भाइरस फैलिरहेको अवस्थामा दमनलाई प्राथमिकता दिन सकिन्छ (वा खोप उपलब्ध नभएसम्म वा त्यो पहिले नै आएमा) तबसम्म यसलाई कायम राख्नुपर्दछ, किनभने सम्पर्कका अन्यथा उपायहरू अपनाउन छोड्दा चाँडै फर्किन सक्छ।
en-mt: Suppression may be preferred when the virus is spreading to the human population (or unless a vaccine is available or if it comes earlier) it should be maintained until it is stopped, as stopping otherwise means of contact can return quickly.

sourceString: Long-term intervention to suppress the pandemic causes social and economic costs.
targetString: महामारीलाई दबाउन गरिएको दीर्घकालीन हस्तक्षेप सामाजिक र आर्थिक खर्चहरूको कारक बन्दछ।
en-mt: Long-term interventions to suppress the pandemic become a factor in social and economic costs.

sourceString: There are no specific antiviral medications approved for COVID-19, but development efforts are underway, including testing of existing medications.
targetString: COVID-19 को लागि स्वीकृत भएको कुनै पनि एन्टिभाइरल औषधि छैन, तर विकासका प्रयासहरू हुँदै छन्, जसमा विद्यमान औषधिहरूको परीक्षण समावेश छ।
en-mt: There is no antiviral drug approved for COVID-19, but development efforts are underway, including testing existing drugs.

sourceString: Taking over-the-counter cold medications, drinking fluids, and resting may help alleviate symptoms.
targetString: काउण्टरमा सजिलै पाइने चिसो औषधि सेवनले, तरल पदार्थ पिउनाले र आरामले लक्षणहरूलाई कम गर्न मद्दत गर्न सक्छ।
en-mt: Taking cold medicines, easily available on the counter, drinking fluids and resting can help ease symptoms.

sourceString: Depending on the severity, oxygen therapy, intravenous fluids, and breathing support may be required.
targetString: गम्भीरताको आधारमा, अक्सिजन थेरापी, इन्ट्राभेनस फ्लुड्स र श्वासप्रश्वास सहायता आवश्यक पर्न सक्छ।
en-mt: Depending on the severity, oxygen therapy, intravenous fluids and respiratory support may be needed.

sourceString: The use of steroids may worsen outcomes.
targetString: स्टेरोइडको प्रयोगले परिणामलाई खराब बनाउन सक्छ।
en-mt: The use of steroids can make the results worse.

sourceString: Several compounds that were previously approved for treatment of other viral diseases are being investigated for use in treating COVID-19.
targetString: COVID-19 को उपचारमा प्रयोग गर्नका लागि अन्य भाइरल रोगहरूको उपचारको लागि पहिले नै स्वीकृत भएका विभिन्न यौगिकहरूको जाँच भइरहेको छ।
en-mt: Various compounds already approved for the treatment of other viral diseases are being examined for use in the treatment of COVID-19.

sourceString: The WHO also stated that some "traditional and home remedies" can provide relief of the symptoms caused by SARS-CoV-19.
targetString: WHO ले यो पनि भनेको छ कि केही “परम्परागत र घरेलु उपचार” ले SARS-CoV-19 को कारणले हुने लक्षणहरूलाई राहत दिन सक्छ।
en-mt: WHO also said that some "traditional and home remedies" can relieve symptoms caused by SARS-CoV-19.

sourceString: Increasing capacity and adapting healthcare for the needs of COVID-19 patients is described by the WHO as a fundamental outbreak response measure.
targetString: क्षमता बढाउने र COVID-19 बिरामीहरूको आवश्यकताको लागि स्वास्थ्य सेवा अनुकूलनलाई WHO द्वारा एक मौलिक प्रकोप प्रतिक्रिया उपायको रूपमा वर्णन गरिएको छ।
en-mt: Capacity building and healthcare optimization for the needs of COVID-19 patients has been described by WHO as a fundamental disaster response measure.

sourceString: The ECDC and the European regional office of the WHO have issued guidelines for hospitals and primary healthcare services for shifting of resources at multiple levels, including focusing laboratory services towards COVID-19 testing, cancelling elective procedures whenever possible, separating and isolating COVID-19 positive patients, and increasing intensive care capabilities by training personnel and increasing the number of available ventilators and beds.
targetString: ECDC र WHO को युरोपेली क्षेत्रीय कार्यालयले संसाधनहरूलाई बहु स्तरहरूमा सार्नको लागि अस्पताल र प्राथमिक स्वास्थ्य स्याहारको लागि निर्देशनहरू जारी गरेका छन्, जसमा COVID-19 परीक्षणतर्फ प्रयोगशाला सेवाहरू केन्द्रित गर्ने, सम्भव भएसम्म चयन गर्ने प्रक्रिया रद्द गर्ने, COVID-19 सकारात्मक बिरामीहरूलाई अलग राख्ने र अलगाव गर्ने र कर्मचारीलाई तालिम दिएर गहन स्याहार क्षमताहरू वृद्धि गर्ने र उपलब्ध भेन्टिलेटर र ओछयानहरूको सङ्ख्या वृद्धि गर्ने कार्य समावेश छन्।
en-mt: The ECDC and WHO's European Regional Office have issued guidelines for hospitals and primary health care to move resources to multiple levels, including focusing laboratory services towards COVID-19 testing, cancelling the selection process as much as possible, isolating and isolating COVID-19 positive patients, and increasing intensive care capabilities by training staff, and increasing the number of available ventilators and beds.

sourceString: There are various theories about where the very first case (the so-called patient zero) may have originated.
targetString: सबैभन्दा पहिलो मामिला (तथाकथित शून्य बिरामी) को सुरुवात भएको हुन सक्ने ठाउँ बारे त्यहाँ धेरै सिद्धान्तहरू छन्।
en-mt: There are many theories about the place where the first case (the so-called zero patient) may have begun.

sourceString: The first known case of the novel coronavirus may trace back to 1 December 2019 in Wuhan, Hubei, China.
targetString: नोवेल कोरोनाभाइरसको पहिलो ज्ञात मामिला 1 डिसेम्बर 2019 मा वुहान, हुबेई, चीनमा भएको पत्ता लगाउन सकिन्छ।
en-mt: The first known case of novel coronavirus can be traced to Wuhan, Hubei, China on 1 December 2019.

sourceString: Within a month, the number of coronavirus cases in Hubei gradually increased.
targetString: एक महिनाभित्र नै हुबेईमा कोरोनाभाइरसको सङ्ख्या बिस्तारै बढ्यो।
en-mt: Within a month, the number of coronaviruses in Hubei gradually increased.

sourceString: These were mostly linked to the Huanan Seafood Wholesale Market, which also sold live animals, and one theory is that the virus came from one of these kinds of animals; or, in other words, has a zoonotic origin.A pneumonia cluster of unknown cause was observed on 26 December and treated by the doctor Zhang Jixian in Hubei Provincial Hospital, who informed the Wuhan Jianghan CDC on 27 December.
targetString: यी अधिकतर हुवानन सीफूडको थोक बजार सँग सम्बन्धित थिए, जसले जीवित जनावरहरू पनि बेच्थ्यो, र एउटा सिद्धान्त यो छ कि भाइरस यी विभिन्न प्रकारको जनावर मध्ये एक बाट आएको थियो, वा, अर्को शब्दमा, जनावर जन्य उत्पत्ति रहेको छ। अज्ञात कारणहरूको निमोनियाँ समूह 26 डिसेम्बरमा अवलोकन गरिएको थियो र जसको हुबे प्रादेशिक अस्पतालमा डाक्टर झाङ् जियानले उपचार गरेका थिए, जसले 27 डिसेम्बरमा वुहान जियाघन CDC लाई सूचित गरे।
en-mt: These were mostly related to the wholesale market of Huvanan seafood, which also sold living animals, and one theory is that the virus came from one of these different types of animals, or, in other words, has animal origins. Pneumonia group of unknown causes was observed on 26 December and was treated by Dr. Zhang Jian at Hubei Provincial Hospital, who informed Wuhan Jiaghan CDC on 27 December.

sourceString: On 30 December, a group of doctors at Wuhan Central Hospital alerted their colleagues of a "SARS-like coronavirus".
targetString: 30 डिसेम्बरमा, वुहान केन्द्रीय अस्पतालका चिकित्सकहरूको समूहले आफ्ना सहकर्मीहरूलाई "SARS-जस्तो कोरोनाभाइरस" को चेतावनी दिएका थिए।
en-mt: On December 30, a group of doctors at Wuhan Central Hospital warned their colleagues of the "SARS-like coronavirus".

sourceString: Eight of these doctors, including Li Wenliang, were admonished by the police for spreading false rumours, and another, Ai Fen, was reprimanded by her superiors for raising the alarm.
targetString: यिनीहरु मध्ये आठ चिकित्सकहरू, लि वेनलियाङ लगायत लाई प्रहरीले झूटा अफवाह फैलाएकोमा चेतावनी दिएका थिए र अर्का आइ फेनलाई अलार्म उठाएको आरोपमा उहाँको सुपरिवेक्षणद्वारा हप्काएका थिए।
en-mt: Eight of these doctors, including Li Wenliang, were warned by the police for spreading false rumors and another I Fen was reprimanded by his supervision for raising an alarm.

sourceString: The Wuhan Municipal Health Commission later released a public notice on 31 December and informed the WHO.
targetString: वुहान नगरीय स्वास्थ्य आयोगले पछि 31 डिसेम्बरमा सार्वजनिक सूचना प्रकाशन गर्‍यो र WHO लाई जानकारी गरायो।
en-mt: The Wuhan Urban Health Commission later published a public notice on 31 December and informed WHO.

sourceString: Enough cases of unknown pneumonia had been reported to health authorities in Wuhan to trigger an investigation in early January.During the early stages of the outbreak, the number of cases doubled approximately every seven and a half days.
targetString: अज्ञात निमोनियाँका पर्याप्त घटनाहरू वुहानमा स्वास्थ्य अधिकारीहरूलाई जनवरीको सुरुमा छानबिन सुरु गर्नका लागि रिपोर्ट गरिएका थिए। प्रकोपको शुरुवाती चरणको अवधिमा, मामिलाहरूको सङ्ख्या लगभग साढे सात दिनमा दुई गुणा भयो।
en-mt: Substantial cases of unknown pneumonia were reported to health authorities in Wuhan in early January to launch an investigation. During the initial phase of the outbreak, the number of cases doubled in about seven and a half days.

sourceString: In early and mid-January 2020, the virus spread to other Chinese provinces, helped by the Chinese New Year migration and Wuhan being a transport hub and major rail interchange.
targetString: जनवरी 2020 को सुरुवात र मध्यमा, भाइरस अन्य चिनियाँ प्रान्तहरूमा फैलियो, जसलाई चिनियाँ नयाँ वर्षको बसाई सराइ र वुहान ट्रान्सपोर्ट हब र प्रमुख रेल इंटरचेंजको स्थान हुनाले मद्दत गर्‍यो।
en-mt: In early and mid-January 2020, the virus spread to other Chinese provinces, which were helped by the Chinese New Year's migration and being the location of Wuhan transport hubs and major rail interchanges.

sourceString: On 20 January, China reported nearly 140 new cases in one day, including two people in Beijing and one in Shenzhen.
targetString: 20 जनवरीमा, चीनले एकै दिनमा लगभग 140 नयाँ घटनाहरू रिपोर्ट गरेको थियो जसमा दुई जना बेइजिङ र एक शेन्जेनमा रहेका थिए।
en-mt: On January 20, China reported nearly 140 new cases in a single day including two in Beijing and one in Shenzhen.

sourceString: Later official data shows that 6,174 people had already developed symptoms by 20 January 2020.As of 26 March, the United States has overtaken China and Italy with the highest number of confirmed cases in the world.As of 9 April 2020, more than 1.61 million cases have been reported worldwide; more than 97,000 people have died and more than 364,000 have recovered.
targetString: पछि आधिकारिक तथ्याङ्कले देखाउँछ कि 20 जनवरी 2020 सम्म मा 6,174 व्यक्तिले पहिले नै लक्षण हरू विकास गरिसकेका थिए। 26 मार्च सम्म, संयुक्त राज्य अमेरिकाले संसारमा सब भन्दा बढि पुष्टि भएका मामलाहरूको हकमा चीन र इटालीलाई पछाडि पारेको छ। 9 अप्रिल 2020 सम्म, विश्वव्यापी रुपमा 1.61 मिलियन भन्दा बढी मामलाहरू रिपोर्ट गरिएका छन्; 97,000 भन्दा बढी मानिस मरेका छन् र 364,000 भन्दा बढी निको भएका छन्।
en-mt: Later official statistics show that by 20 January 2020, 6,174 people had already developed symptoms. As of March 26, the United States has overtaken China and Italy in terms of the most confirmed cases in the world. As of 9 April 2020, more than 1.61 million cases have been reported worldwide; More than 97,000 people have died and more than 364,000 have recovered.

sourceString: Around 200 countries and territories have had at least one case.
targetString: करिब 200 देश र इलाकाहरूमा कम्तीमा एक मामिला भएको छ।
en-mt: At least one case has occurred in nearly 200 countries and territories.

sourceString: Due to the pandemic in Europe, many countries in the Schengen Area have restricted free movement and set up border controls.
targetString: युरोपमा विश्वमहामारीको कारण, Schengen क्षेत्रका धेरै देशहरूले स्वतन्त्र आन्दोलन प्रतिबन्ध गरेका छन् र सीमा नियन्त्रणहरू स्थापना गरेका छन्।
en-mt: Due to the global epidemic in Europe, many countries in the Schengen region have banned free movement and established border controls.

sourceString: National reactions have included containment measures such as quarantines (known as stay-at-home orders, shelter-in-place orders, or lockdown) and curfews.As of 2 April, nearly 300 million people, or about 90% of the population, are under some form of lockdown in the United States, more than 50 million people are in lockdown in the Philippines, about 59 million people are in lockdown in South Africa, and 1.3 billion people are in lockdown in India.
targetString: राष्ट्रिय प्रतिक्रियाहरूले क्वारेन्टाइन (घर-मै-बस्ने आदेश, बसेको-ठाउँमा-आश्रय वा बन्दाबन्दीको रूपमा चिनिन्छ) र कर्फ्युजस्ता नियन्त्रणका उपायहरू समावेश गरेका छन्। 2 अप्रिलसम्म, झन्डै 3000 लाख मानिस वा जनसङ्ख्याको करिब 90% संयुक्त राज्यमा बन्दाबन्दीको कुनै रूप अन्तर्गत छन्, 500 लाखभन्दा बढी मानिस फिलिपिन्समा बन्दाबन्दीमा छन्, करिब 590 लाख मानिस दक्षिण अफ्रिकाको बन्दाबन्दीमा छन् र 1.3 अरब मानिस भारतको बन्दाबन्दीमा छन्।
en-mt: National responses have included control measures such as quarantines (stay-at-home orders, known as stay-in-shelters or lockdowns) and curfews. As of April 2, nearly 3,000 million people or about 90% of the population are under some form of lockdown in the United States, more than 500 million people are under lockdown in the Philippines, about 590 million people are under lockdown in South Africa and 1.3 billion people are under lockdown in India.

sourceString: On 26 March, 1.7 billion people worldwide were under some form of lockdown, which increased to 2.6 billion people two days later—around a third of the world's population.
targetString: 26 मार्चमा, विश्वव्यापी रुपमा 1.7 अरब मानिस केही प्रकारको बन्दाबन्दी मा थिए, जुन दुई दिन पछि बढेर 2.6 अरब मानिस पुग्यो - यो विश्वको जनसङ्ख्याको एक तिहाइ हो।
en-mt: On March 26, 1.7 billion people worldwide were under some kind of lockdown, which increased two days later to 2.6 billion people – a third of the world's population.

sourceString: The first confirmed case of COVID-19 has been traced back to 1 December 2019 in Wuhan; one unconfirmed report suggests the earliest case was on 17 November.
targetString: COVID-19 को पहिलो पुष्टि गरिएको मामिला वुहानमा 1 डिसेम्बर 2019 मा पत्ता लगाइएको थियो; एउटा पुष्टि नभएको प्रतिवेदनले सबैभन्दा पहिलो सङ्क्रमण 17 नोभेम्बरमा भएको सुझाव दिएको छ।
en-mt: The first confirmed case of COVID-19 was detected in Wuhan on 1 December 2019; An unconfirmed report suggested that the first case occurred on November 17.

sourceString: Doctor Zhang Jixian observed a cluster of pneumonia cases of unknown cause on 26 December, upon which her hospital informed Wuhan Jianghan CDC on 27 December.
targetString: डाक्टर झाङ जिसियानले 26 डिसेम्बरमा अज्ञात कारणका निमोनियाका मामिलाहरूको घटनाहरूको समूह देखे, जसलाई उनको अस्पतालले 27 डिसेम्बरमा वुहान जियाङहान CDC लाई खबर गर्‍यो।
en-mt: Dr. Zhang Jixian saw a group of cases of pneumonia of unknown cause on 26 December, which his hospital reported to Wuhan Jianghan CDC on 27 December.

sourceString: Initial genetic testing of patient samples on 27 December 2019 indicated the presence of a SARS-like coronavirus.
targetString: 27 डिसेम्बर 2019 मा बिरामी नमुनाहरूको प्रारम्भिक आनुवंशिक परीक्षणले SARS-जस्तो कोरोनाभाइरसको उपस्थिति दर्सायो।
en-mt: Initial genetic testing of patient samples on 27 December 2019 showed the presence of a SARS-like coronavirus.

sourceString: A public notice was released by Wuhan Municipal Health Commission on 31 December.
targetString: वुहान नगर स्वास्थ्य आयोगद्वारा 31 डिसेम्बरमा एक सार्वजनिक सूचना जारी गरियो।
en-mt: A public notice was issued by the Wuhan City Health Commission on 31 December.

sourceString: The WHO was informed on the same day.
targetString: WHO लाई सोही दिन सूचित गरिएको थियो।
en-mt: WHO was notified on the same day.

sourceString: As these notifications occurred, doctors in Wuhan were warned by police for "spreading rumours" about the outbreak.
targetString: यस्ता सूचनाहरू देखा पर्दा, प्रहरीद्वारा वुहानका चिकित्सकहरूलाई प्रकोपको बारेमा "फैलिरहेको अफवाह" को लागि चेतावनी दिइएको थियो।
en-mt: When such information emerged, doctors in Wuhan were warned by the police for "spreading rumors" about the outbreak.

sourceString: The Chinese National Health Commission initially claimed that there was no "clear evidence" of human-to-human transmission.
targetString: चिनियाँ राष्ट्रिय स्वास्थ्य आयोगले सुरुमा मानव-देखि-मानव प्रसारणको कुनै “स्पष्ट प्रमाण” नभएको दाबी गर्‍यो।
en-mt: China's National Health Commission initially claimed there was no "clear evidence" of human-to-human transmission.

sourceString: In late January, the Chinese government launched a radical campaign later described by the Chinese Communist Party general secretary Xi Jinping as a "people's war" to contain the spread of the virus.
targetString: जनवरीको आखिरमा, चिनियाँ सरकारले एक क्रान्तिकारी अभियान थाल्यो जुन पछि चिनियाँ कम्युनिष्ट पार्टीका महासचिव सी जिनपिङले भाइरसको फैलावटलाई रोक्न गरिएको “जनयुद्ध” भनेर व्याख्या गरे।
en-mt: In late January, the Chinese government launched a revolutionary campaign that was later described by Communist Party of China General Secretary Xi Jinping as a "people's war" to contain the spread of the virus.

sourceString: In what has been described as "the largest quarantine in human history", a cordon sanitaire was announced on 23 January stopping travel in and out of Wuhan, which was extended to a total of 15 cities in Hubei, affecting a total of about 57 million people.
targetString: “मानव इतिहासको सब भन्दा ठूलो क्वारेन्टाइन” को रूपमा जसलाई व्याख्या गरिएको छ, जनवरी 23 मा वुहानबाट भित्र र बाहिर यात्रा रोक्न एक सुरक्षा घेरा घोषित गरियो, जुन हुबेईको कूल 15 शहरहरूमा विस्तार गरिएको थियो, जसका कारण करिब 57 करोड मानिस प्रभावित भए।
en-mt: In what has been described as the "largest quarantine in human history", a security cordon was announced on January 23 to prevent travel in and out of Wuhan, which was extended to a total of 15 cities in Hubei, affecting nearly 570 million people.

sourceString: Private vehicle use was banned in the city.
targetString: सहरमा निजी वाहन प्रयोग गर्न प्रतिबन्ध लगाइएको थियो।
en-mt: The use of private vehicles was banned in the city.

sourceString: Chinese New Year (25 January) celebrations were cancelled in many places.
targetString: चिनियाँ नयाँ वर्ष (25 जनवरी) उत्सवहरू धेरै ठाउँमा रद्द गरिएका थिए।
en-mt: Chinese New Year (January 25) celebrations were canceled in many places.

sourceString: The authorities also announced the construction of a temporary hospital, Huoshenshan Hospital, which was completed in 10 days.
targetString: प्राधिकरणले एक अस्थायी अस्पताल, Huoshenshan अस्पताल, जसको निर्माण 10 दिनमा पूरा भएको घोषणा गरेको थियो।
en-mt: The authority had announced a temporary hospital, Huoshenshan Hospital, whose construction was completed in 10 days.

sourceString: Another hospital was built afterwards, Leishenshan Hospital, to handle additional patients.
targetString: त्यसपछि थप बिरामीहरूको व्यवस्थापनको लागि अर्को अस्पताल, लेशनसान अस्पतालको निर्माण गरियो।
en-mt: Then another hospital, Leshanshan Hospital, was built for the management of more patients.

sourceString: In addition to newly constructed hospitals, China also converted 14 other facilities in Wuhan, such as convention centers and stadiums, into temporary hospitals.On 26 January, the government instituted further measures to contain the COVID-19 outbreak, including issuing health declarations for travellers and extending the Spring Festival holiday.
targetString: नयाँ निर्माण गरिएका अस्पतालहरूको साथै, चीनले वुहानका सुविधा केन्द्र र रङ्गशालाहरू जस्ता अन्य 14 भवनहरूलाई अस्थायी अस्पतालमा परिणत गरेको छ। 26 जनवरीमा, सरकारले COVID-19 प्रकोप नियन्त्रण गर्न अरू उपायहरू स्थापित गरेको छ, जसमा यात्रुहरूको लागि स्वास्थ्य घोषणाहरू जारी गर्ने र वसन्त महोत्सवको विदालाई बढाउने समावेश छन्।
en-mt: In addition to the newly constructed hospitals, China has converted 14 other buildings, such as facilities and stadiums in Wuhan, into temporary hospitals. On January 26, the government set up other measures to control the COVID-19 outbreak, including issuing health announcements for passengers and extending the Spring Festival holiday.

sourceString: Universities and schools around the country were also closed.
targetString: देशभरका विश्वविद्यालय र विद्यालयहरू पनि बन्द भइसकेका छन्।
en-mt: Universities and schools across the country have also been closed.

sourceString: The regions of Hong Kong and Macau instituted several measures, particularly in regard to schools and universities.
targetString: हङकङ र मकाउका क्षेत्रहरूले विशेष गरी विद्यालयहरू र विश्वविद्यालयहरूका सम्बन्धमा विभिन्न उपायहरू अवलम्बन गरे।
en-mt: The regions of Hong Kong and Macau adopted various measures, especially with regard to schools and universities.

sourceString: Remote working measures were instituted in several Chinese regions.
targetString: टाढाबाट काम गर्ने उपायहरू धेरै चिनियाँ क्षेत्रहरूमा स्थापित गरिएका थिए।
en-mt: Measures to work remotely were established in many Chinese regions.

sourceString: Travel restrictions were enacted in and outside of Hubei.
targetString: हुबेई भित्र र बाहिर यात्रा प्रतिबन्धहरू लागू गरिए।
en-mt: Travel restrictions were imposed in and out of Hubei.

sourceString: Public transport was modified, and museums throughout China were temporarily closed.
targetString: सार्वजनिक यातायात परिमार्जन गरिएको थियो, र चीन भर सङ्ग्रहालयहरू अस्थायी रूपमा बन्द गरिएका थिए।
en-mt: Public transportation was modified, and museums across China were temporarily closed.

sourceString: Control of public movement was applied in many cities, and it has been estimated that about 760 million people (more than half the population) faced some form of outdoor restriction.After the outbreak entered its global phase in March, Chinese authorities took strict measures to prevent the virus from "importing" from other countries.
targetString: धेरै सहरहरूमा सार्वजनिक आन्दोलनमा नियन्त्रण लागू गरियो र यो अनुमान लगाइएको छ कि करिब 760 मिलियन मानिस (आधाभन्दा बढी जनसङ्ख्या) ले कुनै रूपको बाहिरी प्रतिबन्धको सामना गरेका छन्। मार्चमा प्रकोप विश्वव्यापी चरणमा प्रवेश गरेपछि चिनियाँ अधिकारीहरूले भाइरसलाई अन्य देशहरूबाट “आयात” हुनबाट रोक्नको लागि कडा कदम चाले।
en-mt: Controls were imposed on public movements in many cities and it is estimated that about 760 million people (more than half the population) have faced some form of external sanctions. After the outbreak entered the global phase in March, Chinese authorities took strong measures to prevent the virus from being "imported" from other countries.

sourceString: For example, Beijing has imposed a 14-day mandatory quarantine for all international travellers entering the city.On 23 March, mainland China only one case had transmitted domestically in the five days prior, in this instance via a traveller returning to Guangzhou from Istanbul.
targetString: उदाहरणका लागि, बेइजिङले सहरमा प्रवेश गर्ने सबै अन्तर्राष्ट्रिय यात्रीहरूका लागि 14 दिनको अनिवार्य क्वारेन्टाइन लागू गरेको छ। 23 मार्चमा, यस घटनामा इस्तानबुलबाट ग्वाङझाउ फर्कने यात्रीको माध्यमबाट पूर्व पाँच दिन अघि सम्म मुख्य भूमि चीनमा केवल एक मामिला घरेलु सङ्क्रमण भएको थियो।
en-mt: Beijing, for example, has imposed a mandatory 14-day quarantine for all international travelers entering the city. On 23 March, only one case of domestic infection occurred in mainland China until the former five days ago through a passenger returning from Istanbul to Guangzhou.

sourceString: On 24 March 2020, Chinese Premier Li Keqiang reported that the spread of domestically transmitted cases has been basically blocked and the outbreak has been controlled in China.
targetString: 24 मार्च 2020 मा, चिनियाँ प्रिमियर लि केकियाङ ले चीनमा स्थानीय रूपमा प्रसार भएका केसहरू फैलन मूलतः ब्लक गरिएको र प्रकोप नियन्त्रण भएको रिपोर्ट गरे।
en-mt: On March 24, 2020, Chinese Premier Li Keqiang reported that the spread of locally transmitted cases in China was basically blocked and the outbreak was under control.

sourceString: The same day travel restrictions were eased in Hubei, apart from Wuhan, two months after the lockdown was imposed.The Chinese Ministry of Foreign Affairs announced on 26 March 2020 that entry for visa or residence permit holders would be suspended from 28 March onwards, with no specific details on when this policy will end.
targetString: लकडाउन भएको दुई महिनापछि सोही दिन यात्रा प्रतिबन्ध वुहान सहरमा बाहेक अन्य ठाउँमा सहज पारिएको थियो। कहिले यस नीति अन्त्य हुनेछ भन्नेमा कुनै विशेष विवरणहरू नराखी चिनियाँ विदेश मन्त्रालयले 26 मार्च 2020 मा घोषणा गर्‍यो कि भिसा वा निवास अनुमतिपत्र धारकहरूका लागि प्रवेश 28 मार्चदेखि निलम्बन गरिनेछ।
en-mt: On the same day, two months after the lockdown, travel restrictions were eased in places other than Wuhan city. Without giving any specific details on when this policy would end, the Chinese Foreign Ministry announced on 26 March 2020 that entry for visa or residence license holders would be suspended from 28 March.

sourceString: Those who wish to enter China will have to apply for visas in Chinese embassies or consulates.
targetString: चीन प्रवेश गर्न चाहनेहरूले चिनियाँ दूतावास वा कन्सुलेटमा भिसाका लागि आवेदन दिनु पर्नेछ।
en-mt: Those wishing to enter China will have to apply for a visa at the Chinese Embassy or Consulate.

sourceString: The Chinese government encouraged businesses and factories to re-open on 30 March, and provided monetary stimulus packages for firms.The State Council declared a day of mourning to begin with a national three-minute moment of silence on 10:00 4 April, coinciding with Qingming Festival, although the central government asked families to pay their respects online in observance of physical distancing as to avoid a renewed COVID-19 outbreak.
targetString: चिनियाँ सरकारले 30 मार्चमा व्यवसाय र कारखानाहरूलाई पुनः खोल्न प्रोत्साहित गर्‍यो, र फर्महरूलाई मौद्रिक प्रोत्साहन प्याकेजहरू प्रदान गर्‍यो। राज्य परिषदले 4 अप्रिल 10:00 बजेलाई राष्ट्रव्यापी रूपमा तीन मिनेटको मौन धारणका साथ शोक दिन घोषणा गर्‍यो, किङमिङ चाडसँग संयोग पर्‍यो, यद्यपि केन्द्र सरकारले परिवारहरूलाई COVID-19 को प्रकोपबाट जोगिन शारीरिक दूरीको विचार गर्दै अनलाइन मार्फत आफ्नो सम्मान व्यक्त गर्न भन्यो।
en-mt: The Chinese government encouraged businesses and factories to reopen on March 30, and provided monetary stimulus packages to firms. The State Council declared April 4 at 10:00 pm a nationwide mourning day with a three-minute silence, coincident with the Kingming festival, though the central government asked families to express their respects online considering physical distancing to avoid the outbreak of COVID-19.

sourceString: COVID-19 was confirmed to have spread to South Korea on 20 January 2020 from China.
targetString: 20 जनवरी 2020 मा COVID-19 चीनबाट दक्षिण कोरियामा फैलिएको पुष्टि भयो।
en-mt: On 20 January 2020, it was confirmed that COVID-19 had spread from China to South Korea.

sourceString: The nation's health agency reported a significant increase in confirmed cases on 20 February, largely attributed to a gathering in Daegu of a new religious movement known as the Shincheonji Church of Jesus.
targetString: राष्ट्रको स्वास्थ्य एजेन्सीले 20 फेब्रुअरीमा पुष्टि भएका घटनाहरूमा उल्लेखनीय बृद्धि भएको बताएको छ, जसको श्रेय मुख्यतया येशूको शिन्चौंजी चर्चको रूपमा चिनिने नयाँ धार्मिक आन्दोलनका लागि डेगूमा भएको भेला लाई दिइयो।
en-mt: The nation's health agency said there had been a significant increase in confirmed incidents on February 20, primarily attributed to a gathering in Degu for a new religious movement known as the Shinchaunji Church of Jesus.

sourceString: Shincheonji devotees visiting Daegu from Wuhan were suspected to be the origin of the outbreak.
targetString: वुहानबाट डेगु भ्रमण गरिरहेका शिन्चौंजी भक्तजनहरू यस प्रकोपको उत्पत्ति हुन् भन्ने शंका गरिएको थियो।
en-mt: Shinchaunji devotees visiting Daegu from Wuhan were suspected to be the origin of the outbreak.

sourceString: As of 22 February, among 9,336 followers of the church, 1,261 or about 13% reported symptoms.South Korea declared the highest level of alert on 23 February 2020.
targetString: 22 फ्रेबुअरीसम्म, चर्चका 9,336 अनुयायीमध्ये, 1,261 वा करिब 13% मा लक्षण देखियो। दक्षिण कोरियाले 23 फ्रेबुअरी 2020 मा उच्चतम स्तरको सतर्कताको घोषणा गर्‍यो।
en-mt: As of February 22, of the church's 9,336 adherents, 1,261 or about 13% had symptoms. South Korea announced the highest level of vigilance on 23 February 2020.

sourceString: On 28 February, more than 2,000 confirmed cases were reported in Korea, rising to 3,150 on 29 February.
targetString: 28 फेब्रुअरीमा कोरियामा 2,000 भन्दा बढी पुष्टि भएका घटनाहरू रिपोर्ट गरिएको थियो जुन 29 फेब्रुअरीमा बढेर 3,150 पुगेको थियो।
en-mt: More than 2,000 confirmed cases were reported in Korea on February 28, which increased to 3,150 on February 29.

sourceString: All South Korean military bases were quarantined after tests confirmed that three soldiers were positive for the virus.
targetString: परीक्षणमा तीन सैनिकहरू भाइरसका लागि सकारात्मक रहेको पुष्टि भएपछि सबै दक्षिण कोरियाली सैन्य बेसहरूको क्वारेन्टाइन गरिएको थियो।
en-mt: All South Korean military bases were quarantined after tests confirmed that three soldiers had tested positive for the virus.

sourceString: Airline schedules were also affected and therefore they were changed.South Korea introduced what was considered the largest and best-organized programme in the world to screen the population for the virus, and isolate any infected people as well as tracing and quarantining those who contacted them.
targetString: वायुसेवाको कार्यतालिकामा पनि असर पारेको थियो र यसैले उक्त तालिकाहरूलाई परिवर्तन गरिएको थियो। दक्षिण कोरियाको कार्यलाई भाइरसको जनसङ्ख्या जाँच गर्न विश्वको सबैभन्दा ठूलो र सबैभन्दा राम्रो-सङ्गठित कार्यक्रम मानिन्थ्यो जसले कुनै पनि सङ्क्रमित मानिसहरूलाई अलग पार्नुका साथसाथै उनीहरूलाई सम्पर्क गर्नेहरूलाई पछ्याउन र क्वारेन्टाइनमा राख्ने लगायतका कार्यहरू सञ्चालन गरेको छ।
en-mt: The airline's schedule was also affected and hence those schedules were changed. South Korea's work was considered the world's largest and best-organized program to check the virus population, which has carried out tasks including isolating any infected people as well as tracking and quarantining those who contacted them.

sourceString: Screening methods included mandatory self-reporting of symptoms by new international arrivals through mobile application, drive-thru testing for the virus with the results available the next day, and increasing testing capability to allow up to 20,000 people to be tested every day.
targetString: स्क्रिनिंग विधिहरूले मोबाइल अनुप्रयोगको माध्यमबाट नयाँ अन्तर्राष्ट्रिय आगमनहरू द्वारा लक्षणहरूको अनिवार्य स्वयम्-रिपोर्टिंग, ड्राइभ-मार्फत भाइरसका लागि परीक्षण अर्को दिन परिणामहरू उपलब्ध हुने गरि, र प्रत्येक दिन 20,000 सम्म परीक्षण गर्न अनुमति दिन बढ्दो परीक्षण क्षमता समावेश गर्दछ।
en-mt: Screening methods include mandatory self-reporting of symptoms by new international arrivals via a mobile application, drive-through testing for the virus the next day so that results become available the next day, and increased testing capacity to allow up to 20,000 tests per day.

sourceString: South Korea's programme is considered to be a success in controlling the outbreak despite not quarantining entire cities.The South Korean society was initially polarized on President Moon Jae-in's response to the crisis.
targetString: दक्षिण कोरियाका सम्पूर्ण सहरहूलाई क्वारेन्टाइन गरेता पनि दक्षिण कोरियाली कार्यक्रम प्रकोपलाई नियन्त्रण गर्न सफल भएका छन्। दक्षिण कोरियाली समाजले सुरुमा राष्ट्रपति मुन जा-इनको सङ्कटको जवाफप्रति ध्रुवीकरण गरेको थियो।
en-mt: South Korea's program has been successful in controlling the outbreak, even though all of South Korea's cities have been quarantined. South Korean society was initially polarized by President Moon Jae-in's response to the crisis.

sourceString: Many Koreans signed petitions either calling for the impeachment of Moon over what they claimed to be government mishandling of the outbreak, or praising his response.
targetString: धेरै कोरियालीहरूले आफूले दाबी गरे अनुसार प्रकोपको सरकारले उचित व्यवस्थापन नभएको भन्दै मुनलाई महाभियोग लगाउने आह्वान गरे या उनको प्रतिक्रियाको प्रशंसा गर्दै याचना पत्र हस्ताक्षर गरे।
en-mt: Many Koreans called for Moon's impeachment or signed petitions praising his response, saying the government was not properly managing the outbreak as they claimed.

sourceString: On 23 March, it was reported that South Korea had the lowest one-day case total in four weeks.
targetString: 23 मार्चमा, यो रिपोर्ट गरिएको थियो कि दक्षिण कोरियामा चार हप्तामा सब भन्दा कम प्रति दिनको मामिला रेकर्ड गरिएको थियो।
en-mt: On March 23, it was reported that South Korea recorded the lowest number of cases per day in four weeks.

sourceString: On 29 March it was reported that beginning 1 April all new overseas arrivals will be quarantined for two weeks.
targetString: 29 मार्चमा यो जानकारी गराइएक‍ो थियो कि 1 अप्रिलदेखि सबै आगमनहरू बन्द गरिएको छ भने आगमन भएकालाई दुई हप्ताका लागि क्वारेन्टाइनमा राख्ने व्यवस्था मिलाइएको छ।
en-mt: On March 29, it was informed that all arrivals have been stopped since April 1 and arrangements have been made to quarantine the arrivals for two weeks.

sourceString: Per media reports on 1 April, South Korea has received requests for virus testing assistance from 121 different countries.
targetString: 1 अप्रिलको मिडिया प्रतिवेदन अनुसार, दक्षिण कोरियाले 121 विभिन्न देशहरूबाट भाइरस परीक्षण सहायताका लागि अनुरोधहरू प्राप्त गरेको थियो।
en-mt: According to a media report of April 1, South Korea had received requests for virus testing assistance from 121 different countries.

sourceString: Iran reported its first confirmed cases of SARS-CoV-2 infections on 19 February in Qom, where, according to the Ministry of Health and Medical Education, two people died later that day.
targetString: इरानले 19 फेब्रुअरीमा कोममा SARS-CoV-2 सङ्क्रमणको पहिलो पुष्टि भएका घटनाहरू रिपोर्ट गरेको थियो जहाँ स्वास्थ्य तथा चिकित्सा शिक्षा मन्त्रालयका अनुसार त्यस दिनपछि दुई व्यक्तिको मृत्यु भएको थियो।
en-mt: Iran reported the first confirmed cases of SARS-CoV-2 infection on February 19 in Qom, where two people died that day, according to the Ministry of Health and Medical Education.

sourceString: Early measures announced by the government included the cancellation of concerts and other cultural events, sporting events, and Friday prayers, and closures of universities, higher education institutions, and schools.
targetString: सरकारले घोषणा गरेको प्रारम्भिक उपायहरूमा कन्सर्ट र अन्य सांस्कृतिक कार्यक्रमहरू, खेलकुद कार्यक्रमहरू र शुक्रवारको प्रार्थनाहरू रद्द गर्नु र विश्वविद्यालयहरू, उच्च शिक्षा संस्थानहरू र विद्यालयहरू बन्द गर्नु समावेश थियो।
en-mt: The initial measures announced by the government included cancelling concerts and other cultural events, sporting events and Friday prayers, and closing universities, higher education institutions and schools.

sourceString: Iran allocated five trillion rials to combat the virus.
targetString: इरानले भाइरससँग लड्न पचास खरब रियाल छुट्याएको छ।
en-mt: Iran has set aside 5 trillion riyals to fight the virus.

sourceString: President Hassan Rouhani said on 26 February 2020 that there were no plans to quarantine areas affected by the outbreak, and only individuals would be quarantined.
targetString: राष्ट्रपति हसन रूहानीले 26 फेब्रुअरी 2020 मा यो प्रकोपबाट प्रभावित क्षेत्रहरू क्वारेन्टाइनका लागि कुनै योजना नरहेको र केवल व्यक्तिहरूलाई मात्र अलग राख्नुपर्ने बताएका थिए।
en-mt: President Hassan Rouhani said on 26 February 2020 that there were no plans for quarantine in areas affected by the outbreak and that only individuals should be isolated.

sourceString: Plans to limit travel between cities were announced in March, although heavy traffic between cities ahead of the Persian New Year Nowruz continued.
targetString: सहरहरू बीच हुने यातायात सीमित गर्ने योजना मार्चमा घोषित गरिएको थियो जबकि फारसी नयाँ वर्ष नाउरुज भन्दा अघि सहरहरू बीच अधिक मात्रामा यातायात जारी नै रहेको थियो।
en-mt: Plans to limit traffic between cities were announced in March while greater traffic between cities continued before the Persian New Year of Nauruz.

sourceString: Shia shrines in Qom remained open to pilgrims until 16 March 2020.Iran became a centre of the spread of the virus after China during February.
targetString: कोमका शिया मस्जिदहरू तीर्थ यात्रीहरूका लागि 16 मार्च 2020 सम्म खुला रहेका थिए। फेब्रुअरीको समयमा इरान चीनपछि भाइरसको फैलावटको केन्द्र बन्यो।
en-mt: Shia mosques in Qom remained open to pilgrims until 16 March 2020. In February, Iran became the epicentre of the virus's spread after China.

sourceString: Amidst claims of a cover-up of the extent of the outbreak in Iran, more than ten countries had traced their cases back to Iran by 28 February, indicating that the extent of the outbreak may be more severe than the 388 cases reported by the Iranian government by that date.
targetString: इरानमा प्रकोपको सीमालाई सम्हाल्ने दावीबीचमा, 28 फेब्रुअरीसम्म दशभन्दा धेरै देशहरूले इरानमा आफ्ना केसहरू पत्ता लगाएका थिए, यो दर्शाउँदै कि त्यो मितिसम्म इरानी सरकारद्वारा रिपोर्ट गरिएका 388 केसहरूको तुलनामा प्रकोपको सीमा धेरै गम्भीर हुन सक्छ।
en-mt: Amid claims to handle the extent of the outbreak in Iran, as of February 28, more than ten countries had detected their cases in Iran, showing that the extent of the outbreak could be much more severe than the 388 cases reported by the Iranian government up to that date.

sourceString: The Iranian Parliament was shut down, with 23 of its 290 members reported to have had tested positive for the virus on 3 March.
targetString: 290 जना सदस्यमध्ये 23 जनाले 3 मार्चमा भाइरस सङ्क्रमणको सकारात्मक परीक्षण गरेपछि, इरानी संसद बन्द गरिएको थियो।
en-mt: After 23 of the 290 members tested positive for the virus on March 3, the Iranian parliament was shut down.

sourceString: On 12 March, the Human Rights Watch urged the Iranian prison authorities to unconditionally release the human rights defenders detained for peaceful dissent, and to also temporarily release all the eligible prisoners.
targetString: 12 मार्चमा, मानव अधिकार वाच ले इरानी जेल अधिकारीहरूलाई शान्तिपूर्ण असहमतिको कारण पक्राउ परेका मानव अधिकार रक्षकहरुलाई बिना सर्त रिहाइ गर्न र सबै योग्य बन्दीहरुलाई अस्थायी रुपमा रिहा गर्न आग्रह गर्यो।
en-mt: On March 12, Human Rights Watch urged Iranian prison authorities to unconditionally release human rights defenders arrested because of peaceful dissent and temporarily release all eligible detainees.

sourceString: It stated that there is a greater risk of the virus to spread in closed institutions like detention centres, which also lack adequate medical care.
targetString: यसले भनेको छ कि बन्द संस्थाहरू जस्तै हिरासत केन्द्रहरूमा भाइरसको फैलावट हुने जोखिम बढी छ, यिनीहरूमा पर्याप्त चिकित्सा सेवाको अभाव पनि छ।
en-mt: It said closed institutions such as detention centres are at a higher risk of spreading the virus, including those that lack adequate medical care.

sourceString: On 15 March, the Iranian government reported 100 deaths in a single day, the most recorded in the country since the outbreak began.
targetString: 15 मार्चमा इरानी सरकारले एकै दिनमा 100 व्यक्तिहरूको मृत्यु भएको जनाएको थियो, जुन देशमा प्रकोप सुरु भएदेखिकै सबैभन्दा बढी रेकर्ड गरिएको तथ्याङ्क हो।
en-mt: On March 15, the Iranian government said 100 people had died in a single day, the highest recorded figure since the outbreak began in the country.

sourceString: At least 12 sitting or former Iranian politicians and government officials had died from the disease by 17 March.
targetString: 17 मार्च सम्म यस रोगबाट कम्तीमा 12 पदासीन वा पूर्व इरानी राजनीतिज्ञ र सरकारी अधिकारीहरूको मृत्यु भयो।
en-mt: As of March 17, at least 12 incumbents or former Iranian politicians and government officials had died from the disease.

sourceString: By 23 March, Iran was experiencing 50 new cases every hour and one new death every ten minutes due to coronavirus.
targetString: 23 मार्चसम्ममा, इरानले कोरोनाभाइरसका कारण हरेक घण्टा 50 वटा नयाँ मामिलाहरू र हरेक दश मिनेटमा एक नयाँ मृत्यु भोगिरहेको थियो।
en-mt: As of March 23, Iran was experiencing 50 new cases every hour due to coronavirus and one new death every ten minutes.

sourceString: According to a WHO official, there may be five times more cases in Iran than what is being reported.
targetString: एक WHO अधिकारीका अनुसार इरानमा रिपोर्ट भइरहेको भन्दा पाँच गुणा बढी घटना हुन सक्छन्।
en-mt: According to an WHO official, there could be five times more incidents than what is being reported in Iran.

sourceString: It is also suggested that U.S. sanctions on Iran may be affecting the country's financial ability to respond to the viral outbreak.
targetString: यो पनि सुझाव गरिएको छ कि अमेरिकाको इरानमा माथिको प्रतिबन्धले भाइरल प्रकोपको प्रतिक्रिया दिने देशको आर्थिक क्षमतालाई असर गरिरहेको हुन सक्छ।
en-mt: It has also been suggested that the U.S. sanctions on Iran may be affecting the country's economic ability to respond to the viral outbreak.

sourceString: The UN High Commissioner for Human Rights has demanded economic sanctions to be eased for nations most affected by the pandemic, including Iran.
targetString: संयुक्त राष्ट्र सङ्घीय मानवअधिकार उच्चायुक्तले इरानलगायत विश्वमहामारीले सबैभन्दा बढी प्रभावित राष्ट्रहरूका लागि आर्थिक प्रतिबन्ध सहज बनाउन माग गरेको छ।
en-mt: The United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights has called for easing economic sanctions for countries most affected by the pandemic, including Iran.

sourceString: The outbreak was confirmed to have spread to Italy on 31 January, when two Chinese tourists tested positive for SARS-CoV-2 in Rome.
targetString: यो प्रकोप 31 जनवरीमा इटालीमा फैलिएको पुष्टि भयो, जब दुई चिनियाँ पर्यटकहरूले रोममा SARS-CoV-2 को सकारात्मक सङ्क्रमण परीक्षण गरे।
en-mt: The outbreak was confirmed to have spread to Italy on 31 January, when two Chinese tourists tested positive for SARS-CoV-2 in Rome.

sourceString: Cases began to rise sharply, which prompted the Italian government to suspend all flights to and from China and declare a state of emergency.
targetString: मामिलाहरू द्रुत गतिमा वृद्धि हुन थाले, जसले इटालियन सरकारलाई चीन बाट आउने र जाने सबै उडानहरू स्थगित गर्न र आपतकालिन अवस्थाको घोषणा गर्न प्रेरित गर्‍यो।
en-mt: Matters began to rise rapidly, prompting the Italian government to suspend all flights to and from China and declare a state of emergency.

sourceString: An unassociated cluster of COVID-19 cases was later detected, starting with 16 confirmed cases in Lombardy on 21 February.On 22 February, the Council of Ministers announced a new decree-law to contain the outbreak, including quarantining more than 50,000 people from 11 different municipalities in northern Italy.
targetString: 21 फेब्रुअरीमा लोम्बार्डीमा निश्चित भएका 16 मामिलाहरूको सुरुवातका साथ COVID-19 मामिलाहरूको एक असम्बद्ध समूह पछि पत्ता लाग्यो। 22 फेब्रुअरीमा, मन्त्रिपरिषदले प्रकोप नियन्त्रण गर्न उत्तरी इटालीका 11 विभिन्न नगरपालिकाका 50,000 भन्दा बढी व्यक्तिलाई क्वारेन्टाइन गर्ने सहित एक नयाँ आदेश-कानुनको घोषणा गर्‍यो।
en-mt: An unrelated group of COVID-19 cases was later discovered with the onset of 16 cases confirmed in Lombardy on 21 February. On 22 February, the Cabinet announced a new decree-law, including the quarantine of more than 50,000 people in 11 different municipalities in northern Italy, to control the outbreak.

sourceString: Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte said, "In the outbreak areas, entry and exit will not be provided.
targetString: प्रधानमन्त्री ज्युसेप कोन्टे ले भने, “प्रकोप क्षेत्रहरूमा, प्रवेश र निकास प्रदान गरिने छैन।”
en-mt: Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte said, "In disaster areas, entry and exit will not be provided. ”

sourceString: Suspension of work activities and sports events has already been ordered in those areas."On 4 March, the Italian government ordered the full closure of all schools and universities nationwide as Italy reached 100 deaths.
targetString: कार्य गतिविधि र खेल कार्यक्रमहरूको निलम्बन ती क्षेत्रहरूमा पहिले नै आदेश गरिएको छ। "4 मार्चमा, इटालीमा मृत्यु 100 पुगेपछि इटालियन सरकारले राष्ट्रव्यापी रूपमा सबै विद्यालयहरू र विश्वविद्यालयहरू पूर्ण बन्द गर्ने आदेश दियो।
en-mt: The suspension of work activities and sporting events has already been ordered in those areas. "On 4 March, the Italian government ordered a complete closure of all schools and universities nationwide after deaths reached 100 in Italy.

sourceString: All major sporting events, including Serie A football matches, were to be held behind closed doors until April, but on 9 March, all sport was suspended completely for at least one month.
targetString: सबै मुख्य खेलकुद गतिविधिहरू, Serie A फुटबल म्याचहरूसहित, अप्रिलसम्म बन्द ढोकाभित्र सञ्चालन गरिनुपर्थ्यो तर 9 मार्चमा, सबै खेल कम्तीमा एक महिनाको लागि पूर्ण रूपमा स्थगित भयो।
en-mt: All major sporting activities, including Serie A football matches, were to be conducted behind closed doors until April but on 9 March, all games were completely suspended for at least a month.

sourceString: On 11 March, Prime Minister Conte ordered stoppage of nearly all commercial activity except supermarkets and pharmacies.On 6 March, the Italian College of Anaesthesia, Analgesia, Resuscitation and Intensive Care (SIAARTI) published medical ethics recommendations regarding triage protocols that might be employed.
targetString: 11 मार्चमा, प्रधानमन्त्री कोन्टेले सुपरमार्केट र फार्मेसीहरू बाहेक लगभग सबै व्यवसायिक गतिविधि रोक्न आदेश दिए। 6 मार्चमा, इटालियन कलेज अफ एनेस्थेसिया, एनल्जेसिया, रिसक्सिटेसन एन्ड इन्टेन्सिभ केयर (SIAARTI) ले ट्राएज प्रोटोकलको बारेमा मेडिकल एथिक्सको सिफारिसलाई प्रकाशित गर्‍यो जुन कार्यान्वयन हुन सक्थ्यो।
en-mt: On 11 March, Prime Minister Conte ordered the suspension of almost all business activity except supermarkets and pharmacies. On March 6, the Italian College of Anaesthesia, Analgesia, Resection and Intensive Care (SIAARTI) published a recommendation of medical ethics regarding the triage protocol that could have been implemented.

sourceString: On 19 March, Italy overtook China as the country with the most coronavirus-related deaths in the world after reporting 3,405 fatalities from the pandemic.
targetString: 19 मार्चमा इटालीले महामारीका कारण 3,405 व्यक्तिको मृत्युपछि विश्वमा सबैभन्दा बढी कोरोनाभाइरस सम्बन्धी मृत्यु हुने मुलुकको रूपमा चीनलाई पछाडि पार्यो।
en-mt: On March 19, Italy overtook China as the country with the highest number of coronavirus-related deaths in the world after 3,405 people died due to the pandemic.

sourceString: On 22 March, it was reported that Russia had sent nine military planes with medical equipment to Italy.
targetString: 22 मार्चमा, रूसले इटालीमा चिकित्सा उपकरणसहित नौ सैन्य विमान पठाएको खबर प्राप्त भएको थियो।
en-mt: On March 22, it was reported that Russia had sent nine military aircraft with medical equipment to Italy.

sourceString: As of 5 April, there were 128,948 confirmed cases, 15,887 deaths, and 21,815 recoveries in Italy, with the majority of those cases occurring in the Lombardy region.
targetString: 5 अप्रिलसम्म, इटालीमा लोम्बार्डी क्षेत्रमा हुने अधिकांश सङ्क्रमणहरूसँगै, 128,948 सङ्क्रमणहरू पुष्टि, 15,887 को मृत्यु र 21,815 निको भएका थिए।
en-mt: As of April 5, along with most infections occurring in the Lombardy region in Italy, 128,948 infections had been confirmed, 15,887 had died and 21,815 had recovered.

sourceString: A CNN report indicated that the combination of Italy's large elderly population and inability to test all who have the virus to date may be contributing to the high fatality rate.
targetString: CNN को एक रिपोर्टले सङ्केत दियो कि इटालीको विशाल वृद्ध जनसङ्ख्याको संयोजन र आजसम्म भाइरस हुनेलाई परीक्षण गर्नमा असमर्थता राख्ने सबै उच्च मृत्यु दरमा योगदान दिन सक्छन्।
en-mt: An CNN report indicated that the combination of Italy's vast elderly population and those who have an inability to test those who have the virus to date could all contribute to a high mortality rate.

sourceString: The United Kingdom's response to the virus first emerged as one of the most relaxed of the affected countries, and until 18 March 2020, the British government did not impose any form of social distancing or mass quarantine measures on its citizens.
targetString: संयुक्त अधिराज्यको भाइरसप्रति प्रतिक्रिया पहिलो पटक प्रभावित देशहरूमध्ये सबैभन्दा बढी आराम पाएको रूपमा देखा परेको थियो र 18 मार्च 2020 सम्म बेलायती सरकारले यसका नागरिकहरूमा कुनै किसिमको सामाजिक दूरी वा क्वारेन्टाइनका उपायहरू लागू गरेको थिएन।
en-mt: The United Kingdom's response to the virus first emerged as the most relaxed of the affected countries, and as of 18 March 2020, the British government had not implemented any kind of social distancing or quarantine measures on its citizens.

sourceString: As a result, the government received criticism for the perceived lack of pace and intensity in its response to concerns faced by the public.On 16 March, Prime Minister Boris Johnson made an announcement advising against all non-essential travel and social contact, suggesting people work from home where possible and avoid venues such as pubs, restaurants, and theatres.
targetString: फलस्वरूप, जनताले सामना गरिरहेका चिन्ताहरूको जवाफमा गति र तीव्रताको कथित कमीको लागि सरकारलाई आलोचना गरिएको थियो। 16 मार्चमा प्रधानमन्त्री बोरिस जोनसनले सबै अत्यावश्यक नभएका यात्रा र सामाजिक सम्पर्कको विरुद्ध सल्लाह दिँदै जनताहरूलाई घरबाटै कार्य गर्न र पब, रेस्टुरेन्ट, तथा थियटर जस्ता स्थानहरू नजान सुझाव दिएका थिए।
en-mt: As a result, the government was criticized for its perceived lack of speed and intensity in response to the concerns faced by the public. On March 16, Prime Minister Boris Johnson advised against all non-essential travel and social contact, advising people to work from home and avoid places such as pubs, restaurants, and theaters.
