targetString: 12 मार्च 2020 मा, भारतको स्वास्थ्य मन्त्रालयले उनीहरू 11 आइसोलेटहरूको साथमा काम गरिरहेको र द्रुत गतिमा पनि यसको भ्याक्सिन विकास गर्न कम्तीमा डेढदेखि दुई वर्ष लाग्छ भनेर घोषणा गर्‍यो।
en-mt: On 12 March 2020, the Ministry of Health of India announced that they are working with 11 isolates and it will take at least one and a half to two years to develop its vaccine even at a fast pace.

sourceString: On 12 March 2020, Medicago, a biotechnology company in Quebec City, Quebec, reported development of a coronavirus-like particle under partial funding from the Canadian Institutes for Health Research.
targetString: 12 मार्च 2020 मा, मेडिकागो, क्युबेक सहर, क्युबेक मा भएको बायो टेक्नोलोजीकम्पनीले क्यानेडियन इन्सटिच्युट फर हेल्थ रिसर्चको आंशिक फन्डिङ अन्तर्गत कण जस्ता कोरोना भाइरसको विकास रिपोर्ट गर्नुभयो।
en-mt: On March 12, 2020, a biotechnology company based in Medicago, Quebec, Quebec reported the development of particulate-like coronaviruses under partial funding from the Canadian Institutes for Health Research.

sourceString: The vaccine candidate is in laboratory research, with human testing planned for July or August 2020.
targetString: भ्याक्सिन परीक्षार्थी प्रयोगशाला अनुसन्धानमा रहेको छ, जसको मानव परीक्षण जुलाई वा अगस्ट 2020 को लागि योजना गरिएको छ।
en-mt: The vaccine examinee is in laboratory research, whose human trials are planned for July or August 2020.

sourceString: Earlier that week, The Guardian reported that the US President Donald Trump had offered CureVac "'large sums of money' for exclusive access to a Covid-19 vaccine", against which the German government protested.
targetString: त्यस हप्ता प्रारम्भिक रूपमा, अभिभावकले रिपोर्ट गरे कि अमेरिकी राष्ट्रपति डोनाल्ड ट्रम्पले क्योरभ्याकलाई "Covid-19 खोपमा विशेष पहुँचका लागि ठूलो रकम" प्रस्ताव गरेका थिए, जसको विरुद्धमा जर्मन सरकारले विरोध गर्‍यो।
en-mt: Early that week, parents reported that U.S. President Donald Trump had offered CureVac "a large amount of money for exclusive access to the Covid-19 vaccine," against which the German government protested.

sourceString: On 17 March 2020, American pharmaceutical company Pfizer announced a partnership with German company BioNTech to jointly develop a mRNA-based vaccine.
targetString: 17 मार्च 2020 मा, अमेरिकी औषधि कम्पनी फाइजरले जर्मन कम्पनी BioNTech सँग संयुक्त रूपमा mRNA-आधारित भ्याक्सिनको विकासको लागि साझेदारीको घोषणा गर्‍यो।
en-mt: On March 17, 2020, Us pharmaceutical company Pfizer announced a partnership with German company BioNTech for the development of an mRNA-based vaccine.

sourceString: mRNA-based vaccine candidate BNT162, currently in pre-clinical testing with clinical trials expected to begin in April 2020.
targetString: mRNA-आधारित भ्याक्सिन उम्मेद्वार BNT162, हाल क्लिनिकल परीक्षणसँगै क्लिनिकल परीक्षणमा अप्रिल 2020 मा सुरु हुने अपेक्षा गरियो।
en-mt: MRNA-based vaccine candidate BNT162, currently expected to begin clinical trials as well as clinical trials in April 2020.

sourceString: In Italy on 17 March 2020, Takis Biotech, an Italian biotech company announced they will have pre-clinical testing results in April 2020 and their final vaccine candidate could begin human testing by fall.
targetString: इटालीमा 17 मार्च 2020 मा, टाकिस बायोटेक, इटालियन बायोटेक कम्पनीले उनीहरूको अप्रिल 2020 मा पूर्व-क्लिनिकल परीक्षणका परिणामहरू निस्केको र उनीहरूको अन्तिम खोप प्रार्थकले फलबाट मानव परीक्षण सुरु गर्न सक्नेछ भनी घोषणा गर्‍यो।
en-mt: On 17 March 2020 in Italy, Takis Biotech, the Italian biotech company, announced in April 2020 that the results of their pre-clinical trial had been released and that their final vaccine provider could start human trials from fruit.

sourceString: In France on 19 March 2020, the Coalition for Epidemic Preparedness Innovations (CEPI) announced a US$4.9 million investment in a COVID-19 vaccine research consortium involving the Institut Pasteur, Themis Bioscience (Vienna, Austria), and the University of Pittsburgh, bringing CEPI's total investment in COVID-19 vaccine development to US$29 million.
targetString: फ्रान्समा 19 मार्च 2020 मा एपिडेमिक प्रिपेडिरेन्स इनोवेशन्स (CEPI) ले COVID-19 खोप अनुसन्धान संघमा US$4.9 मिलियन अमेरिकी डलरको लगानी घोषणा गर्‍यो जुन संस्थागत पाश्चर, थेमिस बायोसाइन्स (भियना, अष्ट्रिया) र पिट्सबर्ग विश्वविद्यालयमा र CEPI का कुल लगानी COVID-19 भ्याक्सिन विकासमा US$29 मिलियन सम्मिलित थियो।
en-mt: On March 19, 2020 in France, Epidemic Prepaidance Innovations (CEPI) announced an investment of US$4.9 million in the COVID-19 Vaccine Research Association that included the total investment of US$29 million in institutional pasteur, Themis Bioscience (Vienna, Austria) and the University of Pittsburgh and CEPI in THE COVID-19 vaccine development.

sourceString: CEPI's other investment partners for COVID-19 vaccine development are Moderna, Curevac, Inovio, Novavax, the University of Hong Kong, the University of Oxford, and the University of Queensland.
targetString: COVID-19 खोप विकासका लागि CEPI का अन्य लगानी साझेदारहरू मोडर्ना, क्युरिभ्याक, इनोभिओ, नोभाभाक्स, हङकङ विश्वविद्यालय, अक्सफोर्ड विश्वविद्यालय रक्विन्सल्याण्ड विश्वविद्यालय हुन्।
en-mt: Cepi's other investment partners for COVID-19 vaccine development are Moderna, Curivac, Inovio, Novavax, The University of Hong Kong, The University of Oxford and the University of Rawinsland.

sourceString: On 20 March 2020, Russian health officials announced that scientists have begun animal testing of six different vaccine candidates.
targetString: 20 मार्च 2020 मा, वैज्ञानिकहरूले छ वटा विभिन्न भ्याक्सिन परीक्षार्थीहरूको जनावर परीक्षण सुरु गरेको रूसी स्वास्थ्य अधिकारीहरूले घोषणा गरेका छन्।
en-mt: On March 20, 2020, scientists have begun animal trials of six different vaccine examinees, Russian health authorities have announced.

sourceString: Imperial College London researchers announced on 20 March 2020 that they are developing a self-amplifying RNA vaccine for COVID-19.
targetString: इम्पेरियल कलेज लण्डनका अनुसन्धानकर्ताहरूले 20 मार्च 2020 मा आफूहरूले COVID-19 को लागि स्वयं-एम्प्लिफाइङ RNA खोप विकास गरेको घोषणा गरे।
en-mt: Researchers from Imperial College London announced on 20 March 2020 that they had developed a self-amplifying RNA vaccine for COVID-19.

sourceString: The vaccine candidate was developed within 14 days of receiving the sequence from China.
targetString: भ्याक्सिन परीक्षार्थी चीनबाट अनुक्रम प्राप्त भएको 14 दिन भित्र विकसित भयो।
en-mt: The vaccine examinee developed within 14 days of receiving the sequence from China.

sourceString: In late March, the Canadian government announced C$275 million in funding for 96 research projects on medical countermeasures against COVID-19, including numerous vaccine candidates at Canadian companies and universities, such as the Medicago and University of Saskatchewan initiatives.
targetString: मार्चको अन्तिम चरणमा क्यानडा सरकारले COVID-19 विरूद्ध मेडिकल काउण्टर उपायहरू सम्बन्धी 96 अनुसन्धान परियोजनाका लागि C$275 मिलियन कोष दिने घोषणा गर्‍यो, जसमा क्यानाडाली कम्पनी र विश्वविद्यालयहरूमा मेडिकेगो र सास्काचेवान विश्वविद्यालयको पहल जस्ता धेरै खोप सहभागी पनि थिए।
en-mt: In the last phase of March, the Canadian government announced funding of C$275 million for 96 research projects related to medical counter measures against COVID-19, including several vaccine participants such as The Initiative of Medicago and the University of Saskatchewan at Canadian companies and universities.

sourceString: Around the same time, the Canadian government announced C$192 million specifically for developing a COVID-19 vaccine, with plans to establish a national "vaccine bank" of several new vaccines that could be used if another coronavirus outbreak occurs.
targetString: समान समयको वरपर, अर्को कोरोना भाइरस प्रकोप हुन्छ भने प्रयोग गर्न सकिने विभिन्न नयाँ खोपहरूको राष्ट्रिय “खोप बैंक” निर्माण गर्न योजनाहरूको साथमा COVID-19 खोप विकास गर्नका लागि विशेष रूपमा क्यानाडियन सरकारले C$192 मिलियन घोषणा गर्‍यो।
en-mt: Around the same time, the Canadian government announced C$192 million specifically for developing a COVID-19 vaccine, along with plans to build a national "vaccine bank" of various new vaccines that could be used if another coronavirus outbreak occurs.

sourceString: On 2 April 2020, researchers at the University of Pittsburgh School of Medicine reported on testing of PittCoVacc, a possible COVID-19 vaccine in mice, stating that "MNA delivered SARS-CoV-2 S1 subunit vaccines elicited potent antigen-specific antibody responses [in the mice] that were evident beginning 2 weeks after immunization."
targetString: 2 अप्रिल 2020 मा, "MNA ले खोप लगाएपछिको सुरुवाती 2 हप्तामा स्पष्ट भएका SARS-CoV-2 S1 उपयुनिट खोपहरूको प्रकट गरिएका पोटेन्ट एन्टिजेन-विशिष्ट एन्टीबडीका प्रतिक्रियाहरू [मुसाहरूमा] डेलिभर गर्‍यो भनी उल्लेख गर्दै" पिट्सबर्ग स्कुल अफ मेडिसिन विश्वविद्यालयका अनुसन्धानकर्ताहरूले मुसामा सम्भावित COVID-19 को खोप बारे PittCoVacc को परीक्षणमा रिपोर्ट गरे।
en-mt: On April 2, 2020, "Noting that MNA delivered responses [to mice] to revealed putative antigen-specific antibody responses to SARS-CoV-2 S1 subunit vaccines that were apparent in the first 2 weeks after vaccination," researchers from the University of Pittsburgh School of Medicine reported on a trial of PittCoVacc about a potential COVID-19 vaccine in mice.

sourceString: In Canada on 16 April 2020, the University of Waterloo School of Pharmacy announced design of a DNA-based vaccine candidate as a possible nasal spray.
targetString: क्यानडामा 16 अप्रिल 2020 मा, वाटरलु स्कुल अफ फार्मेसी विश्वविद्यालयले DNA-आधारित भ्याक्सिन उम्मेद्वारको डिजाइन सम्भावित नेजल स्प्रे जस्तै घोषणा गर्‍यो।
en-mt: On 16 April 2020 in Canada, the University of Waterloo School of Pharmacy announced the design of a DNA-based vaccine candidate similar to a potential nasal spray.

sourceString: Using bacteriophages, the DNA will be designed to replicate inside human bacteria to produce harmless virus-like particles, which may stimulate the immune system to produce antibodies against the SARS-CoV-2 virus.
targetString: ब्याक्टेरियोफेजेसको प्रयोग गरेर, हानिरहित भाइरस जस्ता कणहरू उत्पादन गर्न मानव जीवाणुहरू भित्र प्रतिकृति बनाउन DNA डिजाइन गरिने छ, जसले SARS-CoV-2 भाइरस विरूद्ध प्रतिजीवी उत्पादन गर्न प्रतिरक्षा प्रणालीलाई उत्प्रेरित गर्न सक्छ।
en-mt: Using bacteriophages, DNA will be designed to replicate within human bacteria to produce particles such as harmless viruses, which can stimulate the immune system to produce antibodies against the SARS-CoV-2 virus.

sourceString: In March 2020, the US government, industry, and three universities pooled resources to access supercomputers from IBM, combined with cloud computing resources from Hewlett Packard Enterprise, Amazon, Microsoft, and Google.
targetString: मार्च 2020 मा, अमेरिकी सरकार, उद्योग र तीन विश्वविद्यालयहरूले Hewlett Packard Enterprise, Amazon, Microsoft र Google बाट निकालिएका संसाधानहरू गणना गर्ने क्लाउडसँग संयोजन गरिएको IBM बाट सुपर कम्प्युटरहरू पहुँच गर्न संसाधनहरू बनाए।
en-mt: In March 2020, the U.S. government, industry, and three universities created resources to access supercomputers from IBM combined with a cloud that counts resources extracted from Hewlett Packard Enterprise, Amazon, Microsoft and Google.

sourceString: Some vaccines have heterologous effects, also called non-specific effects.
targetString: केही खोपहरूका गैर-विशेष प्रभावहरू भनिने हेटेरोलोगस प्रभावहरू छन्।
en-mt: Some vaccines have heterologous effects called non-special effects.

sourceString: That means they can have benefits beyond the disease they prevent.
targetString: यसको मतलब तिनीहरूले आफूले रोक्ने रोग बाहेकका लाभहरू प्राप्त गर्न सक्छन्।
en-mt: This means that they can reap benefits other than the disease they prevent.

sourceString: A further randomized trial in Australia is seeking to enrol 4,170 healthcare workers.
targetString: अष्ट्रेलियामा थप रेन्डमाइज परीक्षणको लागि 4,170 जना हेल्थकेयर कामदारलाई नामाङ्कन गर्न लागिएको छ।
en-mt: A total of 4,170 healthcare workers are to be enrolled in Australia for further randomized testing.

sourceString: It is possible vaccines in development will not be safe or effective.
targetString: विकासमा खोपहरू सुरक्षित वा प्रभावशाली हुँदैनन भन्ने सम्भव छ।
en-mt: It is possible that vaccines are not safe or effective in development.

sourceString: Early research to assess vaccine efficacy using COVID-19-specific animal models, such as ACE2-transgenic mice, other laboratory animals, and non-human primates, indicate a need for biosafety-level 3 containment measures for handling live viruses, and international coordination to ensure standardized safety procedures.
targetString: ACE2-ट्रान्सजेनिक मुसा, अन्य प्रयोगशाला जनावरहरू र गैर-मानव नर-वानरहरू जस्ता COVID-19-विशिष्ट जनावरका मोडेलहरू प्रयोग गरेर खोप प्रभावकारिता मूल्याङ्कन गर्ने प्रारम्भिक अनुसन्धानले मानकीकृत सुरक्षा प्रक्रियाहरू सुनिश्चित गर्न प्रत्यक्ष भाइरसहरू अन्तर्राष्ट्रिय समन्वय ह्याण्डल गर्नका लागि जैविक सुरक्षा-स्तरको 3 निरीक्षण उपायहरूको आवश्यकता सङ्केत गर्छ।
en-mt: Preliminary research evaluating vaccine efficacy using MODELS of COVID-19-specific animals such as ACE2-transgenic mice, other laboratory animals, and non-human male-apes indicates the need for 3 biological safety-level inspection measures to handle international coordination of live viruses to ensure standardized safety procedures.

sourceString: Vaccines against SARS and MERS have been tested in non-human animal models.
targetString: SARS र MERS को विरुद्धको भ्याक्सिन गैर-मानव जनावरका मोडेलमा परीक्षण गरिएका छन्।
en-mt: Vaccines against SARS and MERS have been tested in non-human animal models.

sourceString: As of 2020, there is no cure or protective vaccine for SARS that has been shown to be both safe and effective in humans.
targetString: 2020 सम्म, SARS को लागि कुनै उपचार वा संरक्षक भ्याक्सिन छैन जसले मानवमा सुरक्षित र प्रभावकारी दुबै भएको देखाइएको छ।
en-mt: As of 2020, there is no cure or preservative vaccine for SARS that has been shown to be both safe and effective in humans.

sourceString: According to research papers published in 2005 and 2006, the identification and development of novel vaccines and medicines to treat SARS was a priority for governments and public health agencies around the world.There is also no proven vaccine against MERS.
targetString: 2005 र 2006 मा प्रकाशित भएका अनुसन्धान पत्रहरू अनुसार, SARS को उपचार गर्नका लागि नयाँ खोप तथा औषधिहरूको पहिचान र विकास भनेको विश्वभरिका सरकार र सार्वजनिक स्वास्थ्य एजेन्सीहरूका लागि प्राथमिकता थियो। MERS विरुद्ध पनि कुनै प्रमाणित खोप छैन।
en-mt: According to research papers published in 2005 and 2006, the identification and development of new vaccines and drugs to treat SARS was a priority for governments and public health agencies around the world. There is also no proven vaccine against MERS.

sourceString: When MERS became prevalent, it was believed that existing SARS research may provide a useful template for developing vaccines and therapeutics against a MERS-CoV infection.
targetString: MERS प्रचलित हुँदा, विद्यमान SARS अनुसन्धानले MERS-CoV सङ्क्रमणको विरूद्ध खोप र थेराप्युटिकहरू बनाउनका लागि उपयोगी टेम्पलेट उपलब्ध गराउन सक्छ भन्ने कुरामा विश्वास गरिएको थियो।
en-mt: When MERS was prevalent, it was believed that existing SARS research could provide a useful template for making vaccines and therapeutics against MERS-CoV infection.

sourceString: As of March 2020, there was one (DNA based) MERS vaccine which completed phase I clinical trials in humans, and three others in progress, all of which are viral-vectored vaccines, two adenoviral-vectored (ChAdOx1-MERS,  BVRS-GamVac), and one MVA-vectored (MVA-MERS-S).
targetString: मार्च 2020 सम्म, एउटा (DNA आधारित) MERS भ्याक्सिन थियो जसले मानवमा चरण I को क्लिनिकल परीक्षण सम्पन्न गर्‍यो, र तीन अन्य प्रक्रियामा रहेका छन्, ती सबै भाइरल-भेक्टर भएका भ्याक्सिनहरू हुन्, दुई एडिनोभाइरल-भेक्टर भएको (ChAdOx1-MERS, BVRS-GamVac), र एउटा MVA-भेक्टर भएको (MVA-MERS-S)।
en-mt: As of March 2020, there was one (DNA-based) MERS vaccine that completed clinical trials of phase I in humans, and three are in other processes, all of which are vaccines containing a viral-vector, two containing an adenoviral-vector (ChAdOx1-MERS, BVRS-GamVac), and one with an MVA-vector (MVA-MERS-S).

sourceString: Social media posts have promoted a conspiracy theory claiming the virus behind COVID-19 was known and that a vaccine was already available.
targetString: सामाजिक सञ्जालका पोस्टहरूले COVID-19 पछाडिको भाइरस बारे थाहा थियो र खोप पहिले नै उपलब्ध भइसकेको थियो भनी दावी गर्ने षड्यन्त्रलाई प्रोत्साहन दिएका छन्।
en-mt: Social media posts have encouraged a conspiracy to claim that the virus behind COVID-19 was known and that a vaccine was already available.

sourceString: The patents cited by various social media posts reference existing patents for genetic sequences and vaccines for other strains of coronavirus such as the SARS coronavirus.
targetString: विभिन्न सामाजिक सञ्जालका पोस्टहरूद्वारा उल्लेख गरिएका पेटेन्टहरूले SARS कोरोनाभाइरस जस्ता कोरोनाभाइरसका अन्य नस्लहरूका लागि आनुवंशिक अनुक्रम र खोपहरूका लागि सन्दर्भ विद्यमान पेटेन्टहरू सन्दर्भ गर्छन्।
en-mt: The patents mentioned by various social media posts refer to existing patents reference to genetic sequences and vaccines for other strains of coronavirus, such as the SARS coronavirus.

sourceString: b'Coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) is an infectious disease caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).
targetString: कोरोनाभाइरस रोग 2019 (COVID-19) एक सङ्क्रामक रोग हो जुन गम्भीर तीव्र श्वासप्रश्वास सिन्ड्रोम कोरोनाभाइरस 2 (SARS-CoV-2) को कारणले गर्दा हुन्छ।
en-mt: Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19) is an infectious disease caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).

sourceString: Common symptoms include fever, cough, and shortness of breath.
targetString: साधारण लक्षणहरूमा ज्वरो, खोकी र स्वाँस्वाँ हुने पर्छन्।
en-mt: Common symptoms include fever, cough, and shortness of breath.

sourceString: Other symptoms may include fatigue, muscle pain, diarrhea, sore throat, loss of smell, and abdominal pain.
targetString: अन्य लक्षणहरूमा थकावट, मांसपेशी दुख्ने, झाडापखाला, घाँटी दुख्ने, गन्ध गुम्ने र पेट दुखाइ समावेश हुन सक्छन्।
en-mt: Other symptoms may include fatigue, muscle aches, diarrhea, sore throat, loss of smell, and abdominal pain.

sourceString: The time from exposure to onset of symptoms is typically around five days but may range from two to fourteen days.
targetString: लक्षणहरूको अनावरणदेखि प्रारम्भ हुने समय सामान्यतया लगभग पाँच दिनको हुन्छ तर दुईदेखि चौध दिनको दायरामा हुन सक्छन्।
en-mt: The time from the unveiling of symptoms is usually about five days but can be in the range of two to fourteen days.

sourceString: While the majority of cases result in mild symptoms, some progress to viral pneumonia and multi-organ failure.
targetString: जबकि बहुसङ्ख्यक केसहरूले मन्द लक्षणहरू, भाइरल निमोनियामा केही सुधार र बहु-अङ्ग विफलताको परिणाम ल्याउँछन्।
en-mt: While the majority of cases result in mild symptoms, some improvement in viral pneumonia and multi-organ failure.

sourceString: As of 17 April 2020, more than 2.24 million cases have been reported across 210 countries and territories, resulting in more than 153,000 deaths.
targetString: 17 अप्रिल 2020 सम्म, 210 देश र भूभागहरूमा 153,000 भन्दा बढी मृत्युको परिणाम दिँदै 2.24 मिलियनभन्दा बढी मामिलाहरू रिपोर्ट गरिएको छन्।
en-mt: As of 17 April 2020, more than 2.24 million cases have been reported, resulting in more than 153,000 deaths in 210 countries and territories.

sourceString: More than 568,000 people have recovered.The virus is primarily spread between people during close contact, often via small droplets produced by coughing, sneezing, or talking.
targetString: 568,000 भन्दा धेरै मानिसहरू निको भएका छन्। भाइरस प्राथमिक रूपमा नजिकको सम्पर्कको समयमा मानिसहरूको बीचमा, प्राय: खोकेर, हाच्छ्युँ गरेर वा बोलेर निस्केका साना छिटाहरूबाट फैलिन्छ।
en-mt: More than 568,000 people have been cured. The virus is primarily transmitted among people during close contact, often through small droplets released by coughing, sneezing, or speaking.

sourceString: While these droplets are produced when breathing out, they usually fall to the ground or onto surfaces rather than being infectious over long distances.
targetString: जब श्वास बाहिर फ्याँक्दा यी छिटाहरू उत्पादन हुन्छन्, तिनीहरू लामो दूरीहरूमा सङ्क्रामक हुनुभन्दा पनि बरु साधारणतया भुईँ वा अन्य सतहहरूमा खस्छन्।
en-mt: When exhalation produces these droplets, they usually fall to the ground or other surfaces, rather than being contagious over long distances.

sourceString: People may also become infected by touching a contaminated surface and then touching their eyes, nose, or mouth.
targetString: मानिसहरू दूषित सतहमा छोएपछि आफ्ना आँखा, नाक वा मुखमा छोएर पनि सङ्क्रमित हुन सक्ने छन्।
en-mt: People may also become infected by touching their eyes, nose, or mouth after touching contaminated surfaces.

sourceString: The virus can survive on surfaces up to 72 hours.
targetString: भाइरस यी सतहहरूमा 72 घन्टासम्म जीवित रहन सक्छ।
en-mt: The virus can survive on these surfaces for up to 72 hours.

sourceString: It is most contagious during the first three days after the onset of symptoms, although spread may be possible before symptoms appear and in later stages of the disease.The standard method of diagnosis is by real-time reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR) from a nasopharyngeal swab.
targetString: लक्षण देखिनुअघि र रोगका पछिल्ला चरणहरूमा प्रसार हुन सक्ने भएतापनि, यो लक्षणहरू देखिएको पहिलो तीन दिनसम्म सबैभन्दा सङ्क्रामक हुन्छ। निदानको स्तरीय विधि नेसोफ्यारिङ्गियल स्वाबबाट रियल-टाइम रिभर्स पोलिमरेज चेन रियाक्सन (rRT-PCR) हो।
en-mt: Although symptoms can spread before and in later stages of the disease, it is most contagious during the first three days of onset of symptoms. The standard method of diagnosis is real-time reverse polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR) from a nasopharyngeal swab.

sourceString: The use of masks is recommended for those who suspect they have the virus and their caregivers.
targetString: आफूमा भाइरस भएको शङ्का गर्नेहरू र तिनीहरूका स्याहारकर्ताहरूले मास्कको प्रयोग गर्न सिफारिस गरिन्छ।
en-mt: Masks are recommended by those suspected of having the virus and their caregivers.

sourceString: Recommendations for mask use by the general public vary, with some authorities recommending against their use, some recommending their use, and others requiring their use.
targetString: साधारण जनताद्वारा मास्कको प्रयोगको सिफारिस भिन्न छ, जसमा केही अधिकारीहरूले तिनीहरूको प्रयोगको विरुद्ध सिफारिस गर्छन्, केहीले तिनीहरूको प्रयोगको सिफारिस गर्छन् र अरूले तिनीहरूको प्रयोग अनिवार्य गर्छन्।
en-mt: The recommendation for the use of masks by the general public varies, with some authorities recommending against their use, some recommending their use, and others making their use mandatory.

sourceString: Currently, there is no vaccine or specific antiviral treatment for COVID-19.
targetString: हाल, COVID-19 को लागि कुनै भ्याक्सिन वा विशेष एन्टिभाइरल उपचार छैन।
en-mt: Currently, there is no vaccine or specific antiviral treatment for COVID-19.

sourceString: Local transmission of the disease has been recorded in most countries across all six WHO regions.
targetString: सबै छ WHO क्षेत्रहरूका प्रायः देशहरूमा रोगको स्थानीय प्रसार रेकर्ड गरिएको छ।
en-mt: The local prevalence of the disease has been recorded in most countries of all six WHO regions.

sourceString: Those infected with the virus may be asymptomatic or develop flu-like symptoms such as fever, cough, fatigue, and shortness of breath.
targetString: भाइरसबाट सङ्क्रमित व्यक्ति लक्षण नदेखिने हुन सक्छ र ज्वरो आउने, खोकी लाग्ने, थकाइ लाग्ने र श्वासको कमी जस्ता फ्लूका लक्षणहरू विकास गर्न सक्छ।
en-mt: A person infected with the virus may not show symptoms and may develop flu symptoms such as fever, cough, fatigue, and shortness of breath.

sourceString: Emergency symptoms include difficulty breathing, persistent chest pain or pressure, confusion, difficulty waking, and bluish face or lips; immediate medical attention is advised if these symptoms are present.
targetString: आपतकालीन लक्षणहरूमा श्वास फेर्न कठिनाइ, लगातार छाती दुख्ने वा दबावहरू हुने, भ्रम, उठ्न कठिनाइ हुने र अनुहार र ओठ नीलो हुने कुराहरू पर्छन्; यी लक्षणहरू छन् भने तुरुन्तै चिकित्सकीय सावधानी अपनाउनु पर्छ।
en-mt: Emergency symptoms include difficulty breathing, persistent chest pain or pressures, confusion, difficulty getting up, and blue face and lips; If you have these symptoms, medical attention should be taken immediately.

sourceString: Less commonly, upper respiratory symptoms such as sneezing, runny nose or sore throat may be seen.
targetString: कम सम्भावित रूपमा, हाच्छ्युँ आउने, नाकबाट पानी बग्ने वा घाँटी दुख्ने जस्ता माथिल्लो श्वासप्रश्वास सम्बन्धी लक्षणहरू देखिन सक्छन्।
en-mt: Less likely, upper respiratory symptoms, such as sneezing, runny nose, or sore throat, may occur.

sourceString: Gastrointestinal symptoms such as nausea, vomiting and diarrhoea have been observed in varying percentages.
targetString: वाकवाकी हुने, वान्ता हुने र पखाल लाग्ने जस्ता ग्यास्ट्रोइन्टेस्टाइनल लक्षणहरू भिन्न प्रतिशतहरूमा देखा परेका छन्।
en-mt: Gastrointestinal symptoms, such as nausea, vomiting, and diarrhea, are found in varying percentages.

sourceString: Some cases in China initially presented only with chest tightness and palpitations.
targetString: चीनका केही केसहरूले सुरुमा छाती कसिने र कम्पनहरू देखाएका थिए।
en-mt: Some cases in China initially showed chest tightness and tremors.

sourceString: In some, the disease may progress to pneumonia, multi-organ failure, and death.
targetString: केहीमा, रोग निमोनियाँ, बहु-अङ्ग विफलता र मृत्युमा विकास हुन सक्छ।
en-mt: In some, the disease can develop into pneumonia, multi-organ failure, and death.

sourceString: This is called the incubation period.
targetString: यसलाई इन्क्युबेसन अवधि भनिन्छ।
en-mt: This is called the incubation period.

sourceString: The incubation period for COVID-19 is typically five to six days but may range from two to 14 days.
targetString: COVID-19 का लागि इन्क्युबेसन अवधि सामान्यतया पाँचदेखि छ दिन हुन्छ तर दायरा दुईदेखि 14 दिनसम्म हुन सक्छ।
en-mt: The incubation period for COVID-19 is usually five to six days but the range can range from two to 14 days.

sourceString: 97.5% of people who develop symptoms will do so within 11.5 days of infection.Reports indicate that not all who are infected develop symptoms.
targetString: लक्षणहरू विकास गरेका 97.5% मानिसहरूले सङ्क्रमणको 11.5 दिनभित्र त्यस्तो गर्नेछन्। रिपोर्टहरूले सङ्क्रमित भएका सबै मानिसहरूले लक्षणहरू विकास गर्दैन भन्ने सङ्केत गर्दछन्।
en-mt: 97.5% of people who develop symptoms will do so within 11.5 days of infection. Reports indicate that not all people who are infected develop symptoms.

sourceString: The role of these asymptomatic carriers in transmission is not yet fully known; however, preliminary evidence suggests that they may contribute to the spread of the disease.
targetString: प्रसारणमा यी स्पर्शोन्मुख वाहकहरूको भूमिका अझै पनि पूर्ण रूपमा थाहा छैन; यद्यपि, प्रारम्भिक प्रमाणहरूले उनीहरू रोग फैलाउन योगदान पुर्‍याउन सक्छन् भन्ने कुराको सुझाव दिन्छन्।
en-mt: The role of these asymptomatic carriers in transmission is still not fully known; However, preliminary evidence suggests that they may contribute to the spread of the disease.

sourceString: The proportion of infected people who do not display symptoms is currently unknown and being studied, with the Korea Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (KCDC) reporting that 20% of all confirmed cases remained asymptomatic during their hospital stay.
targetString: लक्षणहरू नदेखाउने सङ्क्रमित मानिसहरूको समानुपात हाल अज्ञात छ र अध्ययन गरिँदैछ, जसमा कोरिया रोग नियन्त्रण तथा रोकथाम केन्द्र (KCDC) ले सबै पुष्टि भएका अवस्थाहरू मध्ये 20% ले आफ्नो अस्पतालको बसाइमा कुनै लक्षण नदेखाएको रिपोर्ट गरेको छ।
en-mt: The proportion of asymptomatic infected people is currently unknown and is being studied, with the Korea Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (KCDC) reporting that 20% of all confirmed conditions showed no symptoms during their hospital stay.

sourceString: China's National Health Commission began including asymptomatic cases in its daily cases on 1 April; of the 166 infections on that day, 130 (78%) were asymptomatic at the time of testing.
targetString: चीनको राष्ट्रिय स्वास्थ्य आयोगले 1 अप्रिलमा भएको दैनिक मामिलाहरुमा लक्षण नुहुनेलाई संलग्न गर्न सुरु गर्‍यो; उक्त दिनमा भएका 166 सङ्क्रमणहरू, 130 (78%) परीक्षणको समयमा लक्षण नभएका थिए।
en-mt: China's National Health Commission began to involve symptomatic people in daily affairs that took place on April 1; Of the 166 infections that occurred on that day, 130 (78%) were asymptomatic at the time of testing.

sourceString: Both sputum and saliva can carry large viral loads.
targetString: खकार र र्‍याल दुबैले ज्यादा भाइरल लोड बोक्न सक्छन्।
en-mt: Both khakar and ral can carry a higher viral load.

sourceString: Loud talking releases more droplets than normal talking.
targetString: साधारण रूपमा कुरा गर्दा भन्दा चर्को स्वरमा कुरा गर्दा बढी छिटाहरू निस्कन्छन्।
en-mt: Talking loudly leads to more distractions than when you talk normally.

sourceString: A study in Singapore found that an uncovered cough can lead to droplets travelling up to 4.5 meters (15 feet).
targetString: सिङ्गापुरको एक अध्ययनले नछोपिएको खोकीले छिटाहरूलाई 4.5 मिटर (15 फिट) सम्म टाढा पुर्‍याउन सक्ने पत्ता लगाएको छ।
en-mt: A study in Singapore has found that an unguided cough can push droplets up to 4.5 meters (15 feet) away.

sourceString: Though the virus is not generally airborne, the National Academy of Science has suggested that bioaerosol transmission may be possible and air collectors positioned in the hallway outside of people's rooms yielded samples positive for viral RNA.
targetString: भाइरस साधारणतया हावाबाट आउने नभए तापनि, राष्ट्रिय विज्ञान प्रतिष्ठानले बारोएरोसोल प्रसारण सम्भव हुन सक्ने र मानिसहरूका कोठाको बाहिर हलवेमा राखिएका हावा जम्मा गर्नेमा भाइरल RNA को लागि सकारात्मक नमूनाहरू पाइएका थिए।
en-mt: Although the virus does not usually come from the air, the National Academy of Sciences found positive samples for viral RNA in those who collect air stored in hallways outside people's rooms where baroerosol transmission may be possible.

sourceString: Some medical procedures such as intubation and cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) may cause respiratory secretions to be aerosolised and thus result in airborne spread.
targetString: इन्ट्युबेसन र कार्डियोपल्मोनरी रिससिटेसन (CPR) जस्ता केही मेडिकल प्रक्रियाहरू एरोलाइज गरिने श्वासप्रश्वास सम्बन्धी सेक्रेसन गर्न सक्छ र त्यसकारण हावाबाट सर्ने रोग फैलाउँछ।
en-mt: Certain medical procedures, such as intubation and cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR), can lead to aerolyzed respiratory secretion and therefore spread airborne disease.

sourceString: While there are concerns it may spread via feces, this risk is believed to be low.The virus is most contagious when people are symptomatic; while spread may be possible before symptoms emerge, the risk is low.
targetString: यो मलबाट फैलिन सक्छ भन्नेमा त्यहाँ चासोहरू हुँदा, यो जोखिम न्यून भएको मानिन्छ। जब मानिस लक्षणात्मक हुन्छन्, भाइरस सबैभन्दा बढी सङ्क्रामक हुन्छ; जब लक्षण देखिनुभन्दा अघि प्रसार सम्भव हुन सक्छ, जोखिम न्यून हुन्छ।
en-mt: While there are concerns that it can spread from feces, this risk is thought to be minimal. When humans are symptomatic, the virus is most contagious; When the spread may be possible before symptoms appear, the risk is low.

sourceString: The European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control (ECDC) says while it is not entirely clear how easily the disease spreads, one person generally infects two to three others.The virus survives for hours to days on surfaces.
targetString: रोगको रोकथाम तथा नियन्त्रणको लागि युरोपेली केन्द्रहरू (ECDC) ले भन्छ रोग कति सजिलै फैलिन्छ भन्ने पूर्ण रूपमा स्पष्ट नहुँदा, एक व्यक्तिले साधारणतया दुई वा तीन अन्यलाई सङ्क्रमित बनाउँछ। भाइरस सतहहरूमा घन्टौँदेखि दिनौँसम्म बाँच्छ।
en-mt: The European Centers for Disease Prevention and Control (ECDC) says that while there is no complete clarity on how easily the disease spreads, one person usually infects two or three others. The virus lives on surfaces for hours to days.

sourceString: Specifically, the virus was found to be detectable for one day on cardboard, for up to three days on plastic (polypropylene) and stainless steel (AISI 304), and for up to four hours on 99% copper.
targetString: विशेष रूपमा, भाइरस कार्डबोर्डमा एक दिन, प्लास्टिक (पोलिप्रोपाइलिन) र स्टेनलेस स्टिल (AISI 304) मा तीन दिनसम्म र 99% तामामा चार घण्टासम्म पहिचान भएको पाइयो।
en-mt: Specifically, the virus was detected one day in cardboard, three days in plastic (polypropylene) and stainless steel (AISI 304), and up to four hours in 99% copper.

sourceString: This, however, varies depending on the humidity and temperature.
targetString: यद्यपि, यो, आर्द्रता र तापक्रमको आधारमा भिन्न हुन्छ।
en-mt: This, however, varies depending on humidity and temperature.

sourceString: Soap and detergent are also effective if correctly used; soap products degrade the virus' fatty protective layer, deactivating it, as well as freeing them from skin and other surfaces.
targetString: सही तरिकाले प्रयोग भएमा साबुन र डिटर्जेन्ट पनि प्रभावकारी हुन्छ; साबुन उत्पादकले भाइरसको फ्याट्टी सुरक्षात्मक जालीलाई निष्क्रिय पार्दै ह्रास गराउँछ साथै तिनीहरूलाई छाला र अन्य सतहहरूबाट खाली पार्छ।
en-mt: Soaps and detergents are also effective if used properly; The soap manufacturer degrades the fatty protective mesh of the virus and empties them from the skin and other surfaces.

sourceString: Other solutions, such as benzalkonium chloride and chlorhexidine gluconate (a surgical disinfectant), are less effective.In a Hong Kong study, saliva samples were taken a median of two days after the start of hospitalization.
targetString: बेन्जाल्कोनियम क्लोराइड र क्लोरहेक्साइडिन ग्लुकोनेट (एक शल्य कीटाणुनाशक) जस्ता अन्य घोलहरू कम प्रभावकारी हुन्छन्। हङकङको अध्ययनमा, थुकका नमूनाहरू अस्पताल भर्ना सुरु भएको औसत दुई दिनमा लिइएको थियो।
en-mt: Other solutions, such as benzalconium chloride and chlorhexidin gluconate (a surgical disinfectant), are less effective. In the Hong Kong study, saliva samples were taken on an average of two days after the start of hospitalization.

sourceString: In five of six patients, the first sample showed the highest viral load, and the sixth patient showed the highest viral load on the second day tested.
targetString: छ मध्ये पाँच विरामीहरूमा, पहिलो नमुनाले उच्चतम भाइरल लोड देखायो र छैटौँ विरामीले दोस्रो दिन परीक्षण गर्दा उच्चतम भाइरल लोड देखायो।
en-mt: In five of the six patients, the first sample showed the highest viral load and the sixth patient showed the highest viral load when tested on the second day.

sourceString: Severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) is a novel severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus, first isolated from three people with pneumonia connected to the cluster of acute respiratory illness cases in Wuhan.
targetString: गम्भीर तीव्र श्वासप्रश्वास सिन्ड्रोम कोरोनाभाइरस 2 (SARS-CoV-2) एक नयाँ गम्भीर तीव्र श्वासप्रश्वास सिन्ड्रोम कोरोनाभाइरस हो, जुन पहिले वुहान तीव्र श्वासप्रश्वासको बिरामीपनाका अवस्थाहरूको समूहसँग जोडिएको निमोनियाँ भएको तीन मानिसबाट छुट्टिएको थियो।
en-mt: Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome Coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) is a new severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus, which was previously isolated from three people with pneumonia associated with a group of Wuhan acute respiratory illness conditions.

sourceString: All features of the novel SARS-CoV-2 virus occur in related coronaviruses in nature.
targetString: प्रकृतिमा नयाँ SARS-CoV-2 का सबै विशेषताहरू सम्बन्धित कोरोनाभाइरसहरूमा देखिन्छन्।
en-mt: All features of the new SARS-CoV-2 in nature are seen in the corresponding coronaviruses.

sourceString: Outside the human body, the virus is killed by household soap, which bursts its protective bubble.SARS-CoV-2 is closely related to the original SARS-CoV.
targetString: मानिसको शरीरभन्दा बाहिर, भाइरस घरेलु साबुनद्वारा मर्दछन्, जसले यसका सुरक्षात्मक बबलहरुलाई फुटाउँछ। SARS-CoV-2 वास्तविक SARS-CoV सँग घनिष्ट रूपमा सम्बन्धित छ।
en-mt: Outside the human body, viruses die through homemade soap, which breaks its protective bubbles. SARS-CoV-2 is closely related to the actual SARS-CoV.

sourceString: The lungs are the organs most affected by COVID-19 because the virus accesses host cells via the enzyme angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 (ACE2), which is most abundant in the type II alveolar cells of the lungs.
targetString: भाइरसले फोक्सोको प्रकार II एल्भिओलारमा अधिक प्रचुर हुने एन्जाइम एन्जियोटेन्सिन-रुपान्तरण एन्जाइम 2 (ACE2) मार्फत होस्ट कोषहरूमा पहुँच गर्ने भएकोले COVID-19 बाट अधिक प्रभावित हुने अङ्ग फोक्सोहरू हुन्।
en-mt: Since the virus accesses host cells through angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 (ACE2), a more abundant enzyme in lung type II alveolar, organs that are most affected by COVID-19 are lungs.

sourceString: The virus uses a special surface glycoprotein called a "spike" (peplomer) to connect to ACE2 and enter the host cell.
targetString: भाइरसले ACE2 मा जोडिन र होस्ट कोषहरूमा प्रवेश गर्न “स्पाइक” भनिने विशेष सतह ग्लाइकोप्रोटिन (पेप्लोमर) को प्रयोग गर्दछ।
en-mt: The virus uses a special surface glycoprotein (peplomer) called "spike" to bind to ACE2 and enter host cells.

sourceString: Acute cardiac injury was found in 12% of infected people admitted in hospital in Wuhan, China, and is more frequent in severe disease.
targetString: वुहान, चीनको, अस्पतालमा भर्ना भएका 12% सङ्क्रमित मानिसहरूमा गम्भीर हृदयको चोटपटक फेला पर्‍यो र यो गम्भीर रोगमा धेरै पटक भेटिन्छ।
en-mt: Severe heart injury was found in 12% of hospitalized infected people in Wuhan, China, and it is found many times in severe disease.

sourceString: Rates of cardiovascular symptoms is high, owing to the systemic inflammatory response and immune system disorders during disease progression, but acute myocardial injury may also be related to ACE2 receptors in the heart.
targetString: कार्डियोभास्कुलर लक्षणहरूका दरहरू रोग प्रगतिको अवधिमा प्रणालीगत ज्वलनशील प्रतिक्रिया र प्रतिरक्षा प्रणालीको विकारहरूको कारणले उच्च हुन्छ तर तीव्र मायोकार्डियल चोटपटक मुटुमा ACE2 रिसेप्टर्ससँग सम्बन्धित पनि हुन सक्छ।
en-mt: Rates of cardiovascular symptoms are high due to systemic inflammatory response and immune system disorders during disease progression but acute myocardial injury may also be related to ACE2 receptors in the heart.

sourceString: ACE2 receptors are highly expressed in the heart and are involved in heart function.
targetString: ACE2 रिसेप्टर्स उच्च रूपमा मुटुमा प्रकट हुन्छन् र मुटुमा संलग्न हुन्छन्।
en-mt: ACE2 receptors are highly manifested in the heart and attached to the heart.

sourceString: A high incidence of thrombosis (31%) and venous thromboembolism (25%) have been found in ICU patients with COVID-19 infections and may be related to poor prognosis.Autopsies of people who died of COVID-19 have found diffuse alveolar damage (DAD), and lymphocyte-containing inflammatory infiltrates within the lung.
targetString: COVID-19 सङ्क्रमण भएका ICU विरामीहरूमा थ्रोम्बोसिस (31%) र भेनस थ्रोम्बोइम्बोलिज्म (25%) को उच्च घटना भएको पाइएको छ र कमजोर पूर्वानुमानसँग सम्बन्धित हुन सक्छ। COVID-19 ले मरेका मानिसहरूको अटोप्सीहरूले डिफ्युज एल्भिओलार क्षति (DAD) र फोक्सोभित्र लिम्फोसाइट भएका इन्फ्लेमेटरी इन्फिल्ट्रेट्स पत्ता लगाएका छन्।
en-mt: ICU patients with COVID-19 infection have been found to have a higher incidence of thrombosis (31%) and venous thromboembolism (25%) and may be associated with a poor prognosis. Autopsies of people who died of COVID-19 have revealed diffuse alveolar damage (DAD) and inflammatory infiltrates containing lymphocytes inside the lungs.

sourceString: Although SARS-COV-2 has a tropism for ACE2-expressing epithelial cells of the respiratory tract, patients with severe COVID-19 have symptoms of systemic hyperinflammation.
targetString: SARS-COV-2 को श्वासप्रश्वास नलीका ACE2-देखाउने इपिथेलियल कोषहरूको लागि ट्रपिज्म छ, गम्भीर COVID-19 भएका बिरामीहरूमा सिस्टेमिक हाइपरइनफ्लेमेसनका लक्षणहरू छन्।
en-mt: SARS-COV-2 has tropism for ACE2-showing epithelial cells of the respiratory tract, patients with severe COVID-19 have symptoms of systemic hyperinflammation.

sourceString: In particular, pathogenic GM-CSF-secreting T-cells were shown to correlate with the recruitment of inflammatory IL-6-secreting monocytes and severe lung pathology in COVID-19 patients.
targetString: विशेषगरी, रोगजनक GM-CSF-निकाल्ने T-कोषहरू COVID-19 बिरामीहरूमा ज्वलनशील Il-6-निकाल्ने मोनोसाइट्स र गम्भीर फोक्सोको प्याथोलोजीको भर्नासँग सहसम्बन्ध गर्न देखाइएको थियो।
en-mt: Specifically, pathogenic GM-CSF-extracting T-cells were shown to correlate with the admission of flammable Il-6-extracting monocytes and severe lung pathology in COVID-19 patients.

sourceString: Lymphocytic infiltrates have also been reported at autopsy.
targetString: लिम्फोसाइटिक इनफिल्ट्रेटहरू बारे पनि अटोप्सीमा रिपोर्ट गरिएको छ।
en-mt: Lymphocytic infiltrates have also been reported in autopsies.

sourceString: The WHO has published several testing protocols for the disease.
targetString: WHO ले रोगका लागि धेरै परीक्षण प्रोटोकलहरू प्रकाशन गरेको छ।
en-mt: WHO has published several testing protocols for the disease.

sourceString: The standard method of testing is real-time reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR).
targetString: परीक्षणको लागि स्तरीय विधि रियल-टाइम रिभर्स ट्रान्सक्रिप्सन पोलिमरेज चेन रियाक्सन (rRT-PCR) हो।
en-mt: The standard method for testing is real-time reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR).

sourceString: The test is typically done on respiratory samples obtained by a nasopharyngeal swab; however, a nasal swab or sputum sample may also be used.
targetString: परीक्षण सामान्य रूपमा नेसोफ्यारिङ्गल स्वाबद्वारा प्राप्त गरिएका श्वासप्रश्वासका नमुनाहरूमा गरिन्छ; यद्यपि, नेजल स्वाब वा खकारको नमूना पनि प्रयोग हुन सक्नेछ।
en-mt: The test is usually done on respiratory samples obtained by the nasopharyngeal swab; However, nasal swabs or swab samples may also be used.

sourceString: Results are generally available within a few hours to two days.
targetString: नतिजाहरू सामान्यतया केही घण्टादेखि दुई दिनभित्र उपलब्ध हुन्छन्।
en-mt: Results are usually available within a few hours to two days.

sourceString: Blood tests can be used, but these require two blood samples taken two weeks apart and the results have little immediate value.
targetString: रक्त परीक्षणहरू प्रयोग गर्न सकिन्छन्, तर यिनलाई दुई हप्ताको फरकमा दुई रक्त नमुनाहरू आवश्यक हुन्छन् र परिणामको तत्काल महत्त्व कम मात्र हुन्छ।
en-mt: Blood tests can be used, but these require two blood samples two weeks apart, and the immediate significance of the results is minimal.

sourceString: Chinese scientists were able to isolate a strain of the coronavirus and publish the genetic sequence so laboratories across the world could independently develop polymerase chain reaction (PCR) tests to detect infection by the virus.
targetString: चिनियाँ वैज्ञानिकहरू कोरोना भाइरसको तनावलाई आइसोलेट गर्न र आनुवंशिक अनुक्रम प्रकाशन गर्न सक्षम थिए जसले गर्दा विश्वभरिका प्रयोगशालाहरू स्वतन्त्र रूपमा भाइरसको सङ्क्रमण पत्ता लगाउनका लागि पोलिमरेज चेन रियाक्सन (PCR) परीक्षणहरू विकास गर्न सके।
en-mt: Chinese scientists were able to isolate the strain of the coronavirus and publish the genetic sequence, allowing laboratories around the world to independently develop polymerase chain reaction (PCR) tests to detect virus infection.

sourceString: As of 4 April 2020, antibody tests (which may detect active infections and whether a person had been infected in the past) were in development, but not yet widely used.
targetString: 4 अप्रिल 2020 सम्म, एन्टिबडी परीक्षण (जसले सक्रिय सङ्क्रमणहरू र व्यक्ति विगतमा सङ्क्रमित भएको छ वा छैन भन्ने पहिचान गर्न सक्छ) विकास गरिँदै छन्, तर अझैसम्म व्यापक रूपमा प्रयोग गरिएका छैनन्।
en-mt: As of 4 April 2020, antibody tests (which can identify active infections and whether a person has been infected in the past) are being developed, but have not yet been widely used.

sourceString: The Chinese experience with testing has shown the accuracy is only 60 to 70%.
targetString: परीक्षण गरेका चिनियाँ अनुभवले शुद्धता 60 देखि 70% सम्म मात्र हुन्छ भनी देखाएको छ।
en-mt: The Chinese experience tested has shown that accuracy ranges only from 60 to 70%.

sourceString: The FDA in the United States approved the first point-of-care test on 21 March 2020 for use at the end of that month.Diagnostic guidelines released by Zhongnan Hospital of Wuhan University suggested methods for detecting infections based upon clinical features and epidemiological risk.
targetString: संयुक्त राज्यको FDA ले पहिलो महिनाको स्याहार परीक्षण 21 मार्च 2020 मा यो महिनाको अन्तिममा प्रयोगका लागि अनुमोदन गर्‍यो। वुहान विश्वविद्यालयको झोङनान अस्पतालद्वारा जारी गरिएको निदान निर्देशिकाहरूले क्लिनिकल सुविधाहरू र महामारी विज्ञान जोखिममा आधारित सङ्क्रमण पत्ता लगाउने विधिहरूको सुझाव दिए।
en-mt: FDA in the United States approved the first-month care trial for use at the end of this month on March 21, 2020. Diagnostic guidelines issued by Wuhan University's Zhongnan Hospital suggested clinical features and epidemiological risk-based infection detection methods.

sourceString: Bilateral multilobar ground-glass opacities with a peripheral, asymmetric and posterior distribution are common in early infection.
targetString: पेरिफेरल, असममितीय र पोस्टेरियर वितरणको साथमा द्विपक्षीय मल्टिलोबर ग्राउन्ड-ग्लासका जटिलताहरू प्रारम्भिक सङ्क्रमणमा सामान्य हुन्छन्।
en-mt: Complications of bilateral multilobar ground-glass with peripheral, asymmetric and posterior distribution are common in the initial transition.

sourceString: Subpleural dominance, crazy paving (lobular septal thickening with variable alveolar filling), and consolidation may appear as the disease progresses.
targetString: सबप्लयुरल प्रभुत्व, क्रेजी पेभिङ (चर एल्भिओलार भरेर लोब्युलार सेप्टल मोटो बनाउने) र एकीकरण रोगको प्रगतिको रूपमा देखा पर्न सक्छ।
en-mt: Subpleural dominance, crazy paving (thickening the lobular septal by filling the variable alveolar) and integration can appear as disease progresses.

sourceString: Few data are available about microscopic lesions and the pathophysiology of COVID-19.
targetString: सूक्ष्म घाउ र COVID-19 को प्याथोफिजियोलोजी बारे केही डाटा उपलब्ध छन्।
en-mt: Some data are available about microscopic lesions and the pathophysiology of COVID-19.

sourceString: The main pathological findings at autopsy are:
targetString: शव परीक्षणका मुख्य रोगविज्ञान सम्बन्धी परिणामहरू निम्नलिखित छन्:
en-mt: The main pathological results of the autopsy are as follows:

sourceString: Macroscopy: pleurisy, pericarditis, lung consolidation and pulmonary oedema
targetString: म्याक्रोस्कोपी: प्लेउरिसी, पेरीकार्डाइटिस, फोक्सोको एकीकरण र पल्मोनरी ओइडेमा
en-mt: Macroscopicy: plaurisi, pericarditis, lung integration and pulmonary oedema

sourceString: Four types of severity of viral pneumonia can be observed:
targetString: भाइरल निमोनियाका चार प्रकारका गम्भीरताहरू देखिएका छन्:
en-mt: There are four types of severity of viral pneumonia:

sourceString: mild pneumonia: pulmonary oedema, pneumocyte hyperplasia, large atypical pneumocytes, interstitial inflammation with lymphocytic infiltration and multinucleated giant cell formation
targetString: हल्का निमोनिया: पल्मोनरी ओइडेमा, निमोनिया हाइपरप्लेसिया, ठूलो असामान्य न्युमोसाइट्स, लिम्फोकाइटिक इन्फिल्ट्रेसन र मल्टिन्युक्लेटेड विशाल कोशीका गठनका साथ मध्यवर्ती सुजन
en-mt: Mild pneumonia: intermediate swelling with pulmonary oedema, pneumonia hyperplasia, large abnormal pneumocytes, lymphokitic infiltration and multinucleated giant cell formation

sourceString: severe pneumonia: diffuse alveolar damage (DAD) with diffuse alveolar exudates.
targetString: गम्भीर निमोनियाँ: डिफ्युज एल्भिओलार एक्ज्युडेटहरूको साथमा डिफ्युज एल्भिओलार क्षति (DAD)।
en-mt: Severe pneumonias: Diffuse alveolar damage (DAD) with diffuse alveolar exudates.

sourceString: DAD is the cause of acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS) and severe hypoxemia.
targetString: DAD गम्भीर श्वासप्रश्वास कठिनाइ सिन्ड्रोम (ARDS) र गम्भीर हाइपोक्सेमियाको कारण हो।
en-mt: DAD is the cause of severe respiratory difficulty syndrome (ARDS) and severe hypoxemia.

sourceString: healing pneumonia: organisation of exudates in alveolar cavities and pulmonary interstitial fibrosis
targetString: निमोनियाँ निको बनाउने: एल्भिओलार क्याभिटीहरू र पल्मोनरी इन्टरस्टिटियल फाइब्रोसिसमा एक्ज्युडेट को सङ्गठन
en-mt: Curing pneumonia: organization of exudate in alveolar cavities and pulmonary interstitial fibrosis

sourceString: Blood: disseminated intravascular coagulation (DIC); leukoerythroblastic reaction
targetString: रगत: छरिएको शिराभित्रको जमाव (DIC); ल्युकोएरिथ्रोब्लास्टिक प्रतिक्रिया
en-mt: Blood: deposition within the dispersed vein (DIC); Leukoerythroblastic Reaction

sourceString: Preventive measures to reduce the chances of infection include staying at home, avoiding crowded places, washing hands with soap and water often and for at least 20 seconds, practising good respiratory hygiene and avoiding touching the eyes, nose or mouth with unwashed hands.
targetString: सङ्क्रमणका सम्भावनाहरू घटाउने सुरक्षात्मक उपायहरूमा घरमै बस्ने, भिडभाड हुने स्थानहरूमा नजाने, हातहरूलाई पटक-पटक साबुन र पानीले कम्तीमा 20 सेकेन्डसम्म धुने, राम्रो श्वासप्रश्वास स्वच्छता अभ्यास गर्ने र नधोएका हातहरूले आँखा, नाक वा मुखलाई नछुने कार्य समावेश हुन्छन्।
en-mt: Protective measures to reduce the chances of infection include staying at home, avoiding crowded places, washing hands frequently with soap and water for at least 20 seconds, practicing good respiratory hygiene, and not touching the eyes, nose or mouth with unwashed hands.

sourceString: The CDC recommends covering the mouth and nose with a tissue when coughing or sneezing and recommends using the inside of the elbow if no tissue is available.
targetString: CDC ले खोक्दा वा हाच्छ्युँ गर्दा टिस्युले मुख र नाक छोप्न र कुनै टिस्यु उपलब्ध नभएमा कुहिनाले छोप्न सिफारिस गर्दछ।
en-mt: The CDC recommends that tissue cover the mouth and nose when coughing or sneezing, and covering it with the elbow if no tissue is available.

sourceString: Proper hand hygiene after any cough or sneeze is encouraged.
targetString: कुनै पनि खोकी वा हाच्छ्युँ पछि उचित हातको स्वच्छताको लागि प्रोत्साहित गरिन्छ।
en-mt: Proper hand hygiene is encouraged after any cough or sneeze.

sourceString: The CDC has recommended the use of cloth face coverings in public settings, in part to limit transmission by asymptomatic individuals.Social distancing strategies aim to reduce contact of infected persons with large groups by closing schools and workplaces, restricting travel and cancelling large public gatherings.
targetString: CDC ले स्पर्शोन्मुख व्यक्तिहरूबाट प्रसारण सीमित गर्ने भागमा सार्वजनिक ठाउँहरूमा कपडाको फेस कभरिङहरू प्रयोग गर्न सुझाव दिएको छ। सामाजिक दूरीका रणनीतिहरूले विद्यालय र कार्यस्थलहरू बन्द गरेर, यात्रामा प्रतिबन्ध लगाएर र ठूला सार्वजनिक भिडहरू रद्द गरेर ठूला समूहहरूमा सङ्क्रमित व्यक्तिहरूको सम्पर्क कम गर्ने लक्ष्य राख्छ।
en-mt: THE CDC recommends using cloth face coverings in public spaces in areas that limit transmission from asymptomatic individuals. Social distancing strategies aim to reduce contact with infected people in large groups by closing schools and workplaces, restricting travel, and canceling large public gatherings.

sourceString: Distancing guidelines also include that people stay at least 6 feet (1.8 m) apart.
targetString: दूरी बनाउने दिशानिर्देशहरुले मानिसहरू कम्तीमा 6 फिट (1.8 मि.) टाढा बस्नुपर्छ भन्ने पनि समावेश गर्छ।
en-mt: Distancing guidelines also require people to stay at least 6 feet (1.8 m) away.

sourceString: There is no medication known to be effective at preventing COVID-19.As a vaccine is not expected until 2021 at the earliest, a key part of managing COVID-19 is trying to decrease the epidemic peak, known as "flattening the curve".
targetString: COVID-19 रोकथाम गर्न कुनै पनि औषधि प्रभावकारी हुन सकेको छैन। खोप चाँडो भन्दा चाँडो 2021 सम्म अपेक्षित नहुने भएकाले, COVID-19 को प्रबन्धको मुख्य भागले "वक्रलाई सिधा गर्न" को रूपमा चिनिने महामारी शिखरलाई घटाउने प्रयास गर्दै छ।
en-mt: No drugs have been shown to be effective in preventing COVID-19. Since a vaccine is not expected until 2021 as soon as possible, the main part of the COVID-19 arrangement is trying to reduce the epidemic peak known as "straightening the curve".

sourceString: The CDC also recommends that individuals wash hands often with soap and water for at least 20 seconds, especially after going to the toilet or when hands are visibly dirty, before eating and after blowing one's nose, coughing or sneezing.
targetString: CDC ले व्यक्तिहरूलाई हात धुन विशेष गरी शौचालय गएपछि वा हातहरू दृश्यात्मक रूपमा फोहोर हुँदा, खाना खानुअघि र आफ्नो नाक पुछेपछि, खोकेपछि वा हाच्छ्युँ गरेपछि कम्तीमा 20 सेकेन्डसम्म साबुन र पानीले बारम्बार हातहरू धुन सुझाव दिन्छ।
en-mt: CDC recommends individuals wash their hands frequently with soap and water for at least 20 seconds, especially after going to the toilet or when hands are visually dirty, before eating and after wiping their nose, coughing or sneezing.

sourceString: It further recommends using an alcohol-based hand sanitiser with at least 60% alcohol, but only when soap and water are not readily available.For areas where commercial hand sanitisers are not readily available, the WHO provides two formulations for local production.
targetString: यसले थप 60% अल्कोहल भएको अल्कोहल-आधारित हाते स्यानिटाइजर प्रयोग गर्न सुझाव दिन्छ, तर साबुन र पानी सहजै उपलब्ध नहुँदा मात्र। व्यावसायिक हाते स्यानिटाइजरहरू सहजै उपलब्ध नहुने क्षेत्रहरूका लागि, WHO ले स्थानीय उत्पादनका लागि दुई वटा निरूपणहरू उपलब्ध गराउँछ।
en-mt: This suggests using an alcohol-based hand sanitizer containing an additional 60% alcohol, but only when soap and water are not readily available. For areas where commercial hand sanitizers are not readily available, WHO provides two representations for local production.

sourceString: In these formulations, the antimicrobial activity arises from ethanol or isopropanol.
targetString: यी निरूपणहरूमा, एन्टिमाइक्रोबियल क्रियाकलाप इथानोल वा आइसोप्रोपेनोलबाट उत्पन्न हुन्छन्।
en-mt: In these representations, antimicrobial activity arises from ethanol or isopropenol.

sourceString: Hydrogen peroxide is used to help eliminate bacterial spores in the alcohol; it is "not an active substance for hand antisepsis".
targetString: हाइड्रोजन पेरोक्साइडलाई अल्कोहलमा ब्याक्टेरियल बीजाणुहरू हटाउन मद्दतको लागि प्रयोग गरिन्छ; यो “ह्यान्ड एन्टिसेप्सिसको लागि सक्रिय पदार्थ होइन”।
en-mt: Hydrogen peroxide is used to help remove bacterial spores in alcohol; It is "not an active substance for hand antisepsis".

sourceString: Glycerol is added as a humectant.
targetString: ग्लिसरोललाई आर्द्रकारकको रूपमा थपिन्छ।
en-mt: Glycerol is added as a humidizer.

sourceString: People are managed with supportive care, which may include fluid therapy, oxygen support, and supporting other affected vital organs.
targetString: मानिसहरूलाई तरल थेरापी, अक्सिजन समर्थन, र अन्य प्रभावित भएका महत्त्वपूर्ण अङ्गहरू समर्थन गर्ने कार्य समावेश हुन सक्ने सहायक स्याहारले व्यवस्थित गरिएको छ।
en-mt: People are organized by supportive care that may include fluid therapy, oxygen support, and supporting other vital organs that have been affected.

sourceString: The CDC recommends that those who suspect they carry the virus wear a simple face mask.
targetString: CDC ले सिफारिस गर्छ कि भाइरस लागेको शङ्का लागेका व्यक्तिहरूले सामान्य फेस मास्क लगाउनु पर्छ।
en-mt: The CDC recommends that people suspected of having the virus wear normal face masks.

sourceString: Extracorporeal membrane oxygenation (ECMO) has been used to address the issue of respiratory failure, but its benefits are still under consideration.
targetString: श्वास-प्रश्वास विफलताको समस्या सम्बोधन गर्नका लागि एक्स्ट्राकर्पोरियल मेम्ब्रेन अक्सिजेनेसन (ECMO) प्रयोग गरिएको थियो, तर यसका लाभहरू अझै पनि विचारगत छन्।
en-mt: Extracorporeal membrane oxygenation (ECMO) was used to address the problem of respiratory failure, but its benefits are still considered.

sourceString: Personal hygiene and a healthy lifestyle and diet have been recommended to improve immunity.
targetString: व्यक्तिगत स्वच्छता र स्वस्थ जीवनशैली र आहार प्रतिरक्षा प्रणाली सुधार गर्नका लागि सिफारिस गरिन्छन्।
en-mt: Personal hygiene and a healthy lifestyle and diet are recommended for improving the immune system.

sourceString: Supportive treatments may be useful in those with mild symptoms at the early stage of infection.The WHO and Chinese National Health Commission have published recommendations for taking care of people who are hospitalised with COVID-19.
targetString: सङ्क्रमणको प्रारम्भिक चरणमा मन्द लक्षणहरू भएकाहरूको लागि सहायतामूलक उपचारहरू उपयोगी हुन सक्छन्। WHO र चिनियाँ राष्ट्रिय स्वास्थ्य आयोगले COVID-19 ले अस्पतालमा भर्ना भएका मानिसहरूको हेरचाह गर्नको लागि सिफारिसहरू प्रकाशन गरेका छन्।
en-mt: Supportive therapies may be useful for those with mild symptoms in the early stages of infection. WHO and the Chinese National Health Commission have published recommendations for COVID-19 to care for hospitalized people.

sourceString: Intensivists and pulmonologists in the U.S. have compiled treatment recommendations from various agencies into a free resource, the IBCC.
targetString: U.S. का इन्टेन्सिभिस्ट र पल्मोनोलोजिस्टहरूले विभिन्न एजेन्सीहरूबाट निःशुल्क संसाधन IBCC मा उपचार सिफारिसहरू सङ्ग्रहित गरेका छन्।
en-mt: Intensivists and pulmonologists at U.S. have archived treatment recommendations at free resource IBCC from various agencies.

sourceString: As of April 2020, there is no specific treatment for COVID-19.
targetString: अप्रिल 2020 सम्म, COVID-19 को लागि कुनै विशेष उपचार छैन।
en-mt: As of April 2020, there is no specific treatment for COVID-19.

sourceString: For symptoms, some medical professionals recommend paracetamol (acetaminophen) over ibuprofen for first-line use.
targetString: लक्षणहरूका लागि, केही चिकित्सकीय पेशाकर्मीहरूले पहिलो प्रयोगमा इबुप्रोफेनको सट्टामा पारासिटामोल (एसिटामिनोफेन) सिफारिस गर्छन्।
en-mt: For symptoms, some medical professionals recommend paracetamol (acetaminophen) instead of ibuprofen in the first use.

sourceString: Precautions must be taken to minimise the risk of virus transmission, especially in healthcare settings when performing procedures that can generate aerosols, such as intubation or hand ventilation.
targetString: विशेष गरी इन्ट्युबेसन वा हाते भेन्टिलेसन जस्ता एरोसोलहरू उत्पादन गर्न सक्ने प्रक्रियाहरू सम्पादन गर्दा, स्वास्थ्य स्याहार सेटिङहरूमा भाइरसको सङ्क्रमणको जोखिम कम गर्न सावधानीहरू अपनाउनु पर्छ।
en-mt: Especially when performing procedures that can produce aerosols such as intubation or hand ventilation, precautions should be taken to reduce the risk of virus infection in health care settings.

sourceString: For healthcare professionals caring for people with COVID-19, the CDC recommends placing the person in an Airborne Infection Isolation Room (AIIR) in addition to using standard precautions, contact precautions and airborne precautions.The CDC outlines the guidelines for the use of personal protective equipment (PPE) during the pandemic.
targetString: COVID-19 भएका मानिसहरूको स्याहार गर्ने स्वास्थ्य स्याहार पेशाकर्मीहरूलाई, CDC ले मानक सावधानी, सम्पर्क सावधानी र एयरबोर्न सावधानीहरू प्रयोग गर्नुका साथै एयरबोर्न सङ्क्रमण आइसोलेसन कक्ष (AIIR) मा व्यक्तिलाई राख्न सुझाव दिन्छ। CDC ले महामारीको अवधिमा व्यक्तिगत सुरक्षात्मक उपकरण (PPE) को प्रयोगका लागि मार्गनिर्देशनहरू उल्लेख गर्छ।
en-mt: To health care professionals caring for people with COVID-19, the CDC recommends using standard precautions, contact precautions and airborne precautions, as well as keeping the person in an airborne infection isolation room (AIIR). CDC mentions guidelines for the use of personal protective equipment (PPE) during the pandemic.

sourceString: The recommended gear is: PPE gown, respirator or facemask, eye protection, and medical gloves.When available, respirators (instead of facemasks) are preferred.
targetString: सिफारिस गरिएको गियर निम्न होः PPE गाउन, रेस्पिरेटर वा फेसमास्क, आँखाको सुरक्षा र चिकित्सा पञ्जाहरू। उपलब्ध हुँदा, रेस्पिरेटर (फेसमास्कको सट्टामा) लाई प्राथमिकता दिइन्छ।
en-mt: The recommended gear is: PPE gowns, respirators or facemasks, eye protection and medical gloves. When available, respirators (instead of facemasks) are preferred.

sourceString: N95 respirators are approved for industrial settings but the FDA has authorised the masks for use under an Emergency Use Authorisation (EUA).
targetString: N95 श्वास यन्त्रहरू औद्योगिक सेटिङहरूका लागि स्वीकृत छन् तर FDA ले आपतकालीन प्रयोग अधिकार (EUA) अन्तर्गत प्रयोगका लागि मास्कहरू अधिकृत गरेको छ।
en-mt: N95 breathing devices are approved for industrial settings but the FDA has authorized masks for use under the Emergency Use Authorization (EUA).

sourceString: They are designed to protect from airborne particles like dust but effectiveness against a specific biological agent is not guaranteed for off-label uses.
targetString: तिनीहरू धूलोहरू जस्तै हावामा भएका कणहरूबाट सुरक्षित गर्न डिजाइन गरिएका हुन् तर लेबल बाहेकका प्रयोगहरूका लागि विशेष जैविक एजेन्टका विरुद्ध प्रभावकारिता सुनिश्चित छैन।
en-mt: They are designed to protect against particles in the air such as dust but are not guaranteed efficacy against specific biological agents for non-labeled uses.

sourceString: When masks are not available, the CDC recommends using face shields or, as a last resort, homemade masks.
targetString: मास्कहरू उपलब्ध नहुँदा, CDC ले अनुहार छोप्नेहरू वा अन्तिम उपायको रूपमा घरेलु मास्कहरूको प्रयोग गर्न सिफारिस गर्दछ।
en-mt: When masks are not available, the CDC recommends the use of face coverings or homemade masks as a last resort.

sourceString: Most cases of COVID-19 are not severe enough to require mechanical ventilation or alternatives, but a percentage of cases are.
targetString: धेरैजसो COVID-19 का मामिलाहरू यान्त्रिक भेन्टिलेटर वा विकल्पहरूको आवश्यकता हुन पर्याप्त गम्भीर हुँदैनन्, तर केसका केही प्रतिशत हुन्छन्।
en-mt: Most COVID-19 cases are not serious enough to require mechanical ventilators or alternatives, but account for a few percent of cases.

sourceString: The type of respiratory support for individuals with COVID-19 related respiratory failure is being actively studied for people in hospital, with some evidence that intubation can be avoided with a high flow nasal cannula or bi-level positive airway pressure.
targetString: COVID-19 सम्बन्धित श्वासप्रश्वास विफलतामा व्यक्तिहरूका लागि श्वासप्रश्वास समर्थनको प्रकार अस्पतालमा भएका मानिसहरूका लागि सक्रिय रूपमा अध्ययन भइरहेको छ, जसमा नेजल क्यानुलाको उच्च प्रवाह र द्वि-स्तरको सकारात्मक वायुमार्ग चापको साथमा इन्ट्युबेसन रोक्न सकिने केही प्रमाणहरू भेटिएका छन्।
en-mt: The type of respiratory support for individuals with COVID-19 related respiratory failure is being actively studied for people in hospital, with some evidence that intubation can be prevented with high flow of nasal cannula and bi-level positive airway pressure.

sourceString: Whether either of these two leads to the same benefit for people who are critically ill is not known.
targetString: गम्भीर रूपमा बिरामी भएका मानिसहरूमा यी समान लाभ भएका दुइ मध्ये कसले लिड गर्छ भन्ने अज्ञात छ।
en-mt: It is unknown which of the two who have these similar benefits leads in people who are seriously ill.

sourceString: Some doctors prefer staying with invasive mechanical ventilation when available because this technique limits the spread of aerosol particles compared to a high flow nasal cannula.Severe cases are most common in older adults (those older than 60 years, and especially those older than 80 years).
targetString: केही चिकित्सकहरू उपलब्ध हुँदा इन्भेन्सिभ मेकानिकल भेन्टिलेसनमा रहन रुचाउँछन् किनकि यो तरिकाले उच्च स्रावको नेजल क्यानुलासँग तुलना गर्दा एरोसोल कणहरूको प्रसारणलाई सीमित राख्छ। गम्भीर केसहरू वृद्ध मानिसहरू (60 वर्षभन्दा ठूलो उमेरका र विशेष गरी 80 वर्षभन्दा ठूलो उमेरका मानिसहरू) मा धेरै सामान्य हुन्छ।
en-mt: Some physicians prefer to stay on invasive mechanical ventilation when available because this method limits the transmission of aerosol particles when compared with high-secretion nasal cannulas. Severe cases are very common in older people (people older than 60 years of age and especially people older than 80 years).

sourceString: Many developed countries do not have enough hospital beds per capita, which limits a health system's capacity to handle a sudden spike in the number of COVID-19 cases severe enough to require hospitalisation.
targetString: धेरै विकसित देशहरूमा प्रतिव्यक्ति पर्याप्त अस्पतालका शैय्याहरू छैनन्, जसले अस्पतालमा भर्ना गर्न आवश्यक हुन पर्याप्त COVID-19 केसहरू अचानक बढेमा त्यसलाई व्यवस्थापन गर्न सक्ने स्वास्थ्य प्रणालीको क्षमतालाई सीमित गर्छ।
en-mt: Many developed countries do not have enough hospital beds per capita, which limits the health system's ability to manage a sudden spike in COVID-19 cases enough to require hospitalization.

sourceString: One study in China found 5% were admitted to intensive care units, 2.3% needed mechanical support of ventilation, and 1.4% died.
targetString: चीनको एउटा अध्ययनमा सघन स्याहार एकाइमा 5% भर्ना भएको, 2.3% लाई भेन्टिलेसनको मेकानिकल समर्थन आवश्यक परेको, र 1.4 % को मृत्यु भएको कुरा फेला पर्‍यो।
en-mt: A study in China found that 5% were admitted to intensive care units, 2.3% required mechanical support of ventilation, and 1.4% died.

sourceString: In China, approximately 30% of people in hospital with COVID-19 are eventually admitted to ICU.
targetString: चीनमा, COVID-19 भई अस्पतालमा रहेका लगभग 30% मानिसहरू अन्ततः ICU मा भर्ना हुन्छन्।
en-mt: In China, about 30% of people hospitalized with COVID-19 are eventually admitted to the ICU.

sourceString: Mechanical ventilation becomes more complex as acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS) develops in COVID-19 and oxygenation becomes increasingly difficult.
targetString: तीव्र श्वासप्रश्वास सम्बन्धी कठिनाइ सिन्ड्रोम (ARDS) COVID-19 मा विकास हुने र अक्सिजेनेसन बढ्दो रूपमा कठिन हुने भएकाले यान्त्रिक भेन्टिलेसन थप जटिल हुन्छ।
en-mt: As acute respiratory difficulty syndrome (ARDS) develops in COVID-19 and oxidation becomes increasingly difficult, mechanical ventilation is further complicated.

sourceString: Ventilators capable of pressure control modes and high PEEP are needed to maximise oxygen delivery while minimising the risk of ventilator-associated lung injury and pneumothorax.
targetString: भेन्टिलेटर-सम्बन्धित फोक्सोको चोट र न्युमोथोरेक्सको जोखिम कम गर्दा अक्सिजन डेलिभरीलाई अधिकतम बनाउन दबाव नियन्त्रण मोडहरूको लागि सक्षम भेन्टिलेटरहरू र उच्च PEEP आवश्यक छन्।
en-mt: Competent ventilators and highER PEEP are needed for pressure control modes to maximize oxygen delivery while reducing the risk of ventilator-related lung injury and pneumothorax.

sourceString: High PEEP may not be available on older ventilators.
targetString: पुराना भेन्टिलेटरहरूमा उच्च PEEP उपलब्ध नहुन सक्छ।
en-mt: Older ventilators may not have high PEEP available.

sourceString: Research into potential treatments started in January 2020, and several antiviral drugs are in clinical trials.
targetString: सम्भावित उपचारहरूमा अनुसन्धान जनवरी 2020 मा सुरु भयो, र केही एन्टिभाइरस औषधिहरू क्लिनिकल परीक्षणहरूमा छन्।
en-mt: Research on potential treatments began in January 2020, and some antivirus drugs are in clinical trials.

sourceString: Remdesivir appears to be the most promising.
targetString: रेमडेसिभिर सबैभन्दा आशाजनक देखिन्छ।
en-mt: Remdesivir looks the most promising.

sourceString: Although new medications may take until 2021 to develop, several of the medications being tested are already approved for other uses or are already in advanced testing.
targetString: नयाँ औषधिहरूको विकास हुन 2021 सम्म लाग्न सक्ने भएतापनि, परीक्षण भइरहेका धेरै औषधिहरू अन्य प्रयोगकर्ताहरूको लागि पहिले नै स्वीकृत भइसकेका छन् वा पहिले नै उन्नत परीक्षणमा गइसकेका छन्।
en-mt: Although it may take until 2021 for new drugs to be developed, many of the drugs being tested have already been approved for other users or have already gone into advanced testing.

sourceString: Antiviral medication may be tried in people with severe disease.
targetString: गम्भीर रोग भएका मानिसहरूमा एन्टिभाइरल औषधिहरूको प्रयोग गरेर हेर्न सकिन्छ।
en-mt: People with serious illnesses can be viewed using antiviral drugs.

sourceString: The WHO recommended volunteers take part in trials of the effectiveness and safety of potential treatments.The FDA has granted temporary authorisation to convalescent plasma as an experimental treatment in cases where the person's life is seriously or immediately threatened.
targetString: WHO ले स्वयंसेवकहरूलाई सम्भावित उपचारहरूका लागि प्रभावकारिता र सुरक्षाका परीक्षणहरूमा भाग लिन सुझाव दियो। FDA ले व्यक्तिको जीवन गम्भीर रूपमा वा तत्कालै जोखिममा भएको अवस्थाहरूमा परीक्षणात्मक उपचारको रूपमा स्वास्थ्य लाभ सम्बन्धी प्लाज्मामा अस्थायी प्रमाणीकरणको अनुमति दिएको छ।
en-mt: WHO advised volunteers to participate in trials of efficacy and safety for potential treatments. FDA allows temporary validation of health benefits in plasma as a trial treatment in cases where a person's life is seriously or immediately at risk.

sourceString: It has not undergone the clinical studies needed to show it is safe and effective for the disease.
targetString: यो रोगका लागि सुरक्षित र प्रभावकारी देखाउन आवश्यक भएको क्लिनिकल अध्ययनहरू गरिएका छैनन्।
en-mt: Clinical studies that are needed to show it safe and effective for the disease have not been conducted.

sourceString: In February 2020, China launched a mobile app to deal with the disease outbreak.
targetString: फेब्रुअरी 2020 मा, चीनले रोगको प्रकोपको सामना गर्नको लागि एउटा मोबाइल एप लन्च गर्‍यो।
en-mt: In February 2020, China launched a mobile app to combat the outbreak of the disease.

sourceString: Users are asked to enter their name and ID number.
targetString: प्रयोगकर्ताहरूलाई आफ्नो नाम र ID नम्बर प्रविष्ट गर्न अनुरोध गरिन्छ।
en-mt: Users are requested to enter their name and ID number.

sourceString: The app is able to detect 'close contact' using surveillance data and therefore a potential risk of infection.
targetString: यो एप निगरानी डाटा प्रयोग गरेर ‘नजिकको सम्पर्क’ र त्यसकारण सङ्क्रमणको सम्भावित जोखिम पहिचान गर्न सक्षम छ।
en-mt: The app is capable of using surveillance data to identify 'close contact' and therefore potential risk of infection.

sourceString: Every user can also check the status of three other users.
targetString: प्रत्येक प्रयोगकर्ताले अन्य तीन प्रयोगकर्ताहरूको स्थिति जाँच्न पनि सक्छन्।
en-mt: Each user can also check the status of the other three users.

sourceString: If a potential risk is detected, the app not only recommends self-quarantine, it also alerts local health officials.Big data analytics on cellphone data, facial recognition technology, mobile phone tracking and artificial intelligence are used to track infected people and people whom they contacted in South Korea, Taiwan and Singapore.
targetString: सम्भावित जोखिम पत्ता लगाइयो भने, एपले सेल्फ-क्वारेन्टाइनका लागि मात्र सिफारिस गर्दैन, यसले स्थानीय स्वास्थ्य अधिकारीहरूलाई पनि सतर्क गराउँछ। सेलफोन डाटा, अनुहार पहिचान प्रविधि, मोबाइल फोन ट्र्याकिङ र कृत्रिम बौद्धिकताका ठूलो डाटा विश्लेषकहरूलाई सङ्क्रमित मानिस र दक्षिण कोरिया, ताइवान र सिङ्गापुरमा तिनीहरू सम्पर्कमा आएका मानिसहरूलाई ट्र्याक गर्नका लागि प्रयोग गरिन्छ।
en-mt: If potential risks are identified, the app not only recommends self-quarantine, it also alerts local health authorities. Cellphone data, facial recognition technology, mobile phone tracking and artificial intelligence are used by big data analysts to track infected people and people they have come into contact with in South Korea, Taiwan and Singapore.

sourceString: In March 2020, the Israeli government enabled security agencies to track mobile phone data of people supposed to have coronavirus.
targetString: मार्च 2020 मा, इजरायल सरकारले कोरोना भाइरस लाग्न सक्ने मानिसहरूको मोबाइल फोन डाटालाई ट्र्याक गर्नका लागि सुरक्षा निकायहरू सक्षम गर्‍यो।
en-mt: In March 2020, the Israeli government enabled security agencies to track the mobile phone data of people who may be infected with the coronavirus.

sourceString: The measure was taken to enforce quarantine and protect those who may come into contact with infected citizens.
targetString: सङ्क्रमित नागरिकहरूसँग सम्पर्कमा आएका हुन सक्नेहरूलाई क्वारेन्टाइन लागू गर्न र बचाउन उपायहरू अपनाइएको थियो।
en-mt: Measures were taken to enforce quarantine and protect those who may have come in contact with infected citizens.

sourceString: Also in March 2020, Deutsche Telekom shared aggregated phone location data with the German federal government agency, Robert Koch Institute, in order to research and prevent the spread of the virus.
targetString: मार्च 2020 मा पनि, ड्युच टेलिकम ले भाइरसको प्रसारको अनुसन्धान र रोकथाम गर्न जर्मन सङ्घीय सरकारी एजेन्सी, रोबर्ट कोच इन्स्टिच्युट, ले फोनको स्थानको डाटा साझेदारी गर्‍यो।
en-mt: Also in March 2020, Deutsche Telecom, the German federal government agency to investigate and prevent the spread of the virus, the Robert Koch Institute, shared data on the location of the phone.

sourceString: Russia deployed facial recognition technology to detect quarantine breakers.
targetString: रूसले क्वारेन्टाइन तोड्नेहरू पत्ता लगाउन अनुहार पहिचान प्रविधिको प्रयोग गर्‍यो।
en-mt: Russia used facial recognition technology to detect quarantine breakers.

sourceString: Italian regional health commissioner Giulio Gallera said he has been informed by mobile phone operators that "40% of people are continuing to move around anyway".
targetString: इटालियन क्षेत्रीय स्वास्थ्य आयुक्त गुइलियो ग्यालेरा ले भने उनलाई मोबाइल फोन अपरेटरद्वारा यो जानकारी गराइयो कि “40% मानिसहरू जेसुकै भए पनि यताउती जान जारी राख्दैछन्”।
en-mt: Italian Regional Health Commissioner Guillio Gallera said he was informed by a mobile phone operator that "40% of people are continuing to move around no matter what happens".

sourceString: German government conducted a 48 hours weekend hackathon with more than 42.000 participants.
targetString: जर्मन सरकारले 42.000 भन्दा धेरै सहभागीहरूको साथमा 48 घण्टाको सप्ताहान्त ह्याकाथन सञ्चालन गर्‍यो।
en-mt: The German government conducted a 48-hour weekend hackathon with more than 42.000 participants.

sourceString: Also the president of Estonia, Kersti Kaljulaid, made a global call for creative solutions against the spread of coronavirus.
targetString: इस्टोनियाका राष्ट्रपति, कर्स्टी कल्जुलाइड ले पनि कोरोनाभाइरसको प्रसारको विरुद्ध सिर्जनात्मक समाधानहरूका लागि विश्वव्यापी आह्वान गरे।
en-mt: The President of Estonia, Kirsty Kaljulaid, also called globally for creative solutions against the spread of the coronavirus.

sourceString: Individuals may experience distress from quarantine, travel restrictions, side effects of treatment or fear of the infection itself.
targetString: व्यक्तिहरूले क्वारेन्टाइन, यात्रा प्रतिबन्ध, उपचारका दुष्प्रभावहरू र सङ्क्रमणबाट तनाव महसुस गर्न सक्छन्।
en-mt: Individuals may feel stressed by quarantine, travel restrictions, side effects of treatment, and infection.

sourceString: BBC quoted Rory O'Connor in saying, "Increased social isolation, loneliness, health anxiety, stress and an economic downturn are a perfect storm to harm people's mental health and wellbeing."
targetString: BBC ले "बढ्दो सामाजिक अलग्याई, एक्लोपन, स्वास्थ्य चिन्ता, तनाव र आर्थिक कमी मानिसको स्वास्थ्य र तन्दुरुस्तीलाई हानि गर्नको लागि पूर्ण आँधी हो” भन्दा रोरी ओ कोनर लाई उद्धृत गर्‍यो।
en-mt: The BBC quoted Rory O'Connor as saying that "increasing social isolation, loneliness, health anxiety, stress and economic deprivation are a complete storm to harm people's health and well-being."

sourceString: The disease may take a mild course with few or no symptoms, resembling other common upper respiratory diseases such as the common cold.
targetString: रोगले रुघाखोकी जस्तो अन्य सामान्य माथिल्लो श्वासप्रश्वास सम्बन्धी रोगहरूको समान रूप लिँदै, केही वा कुनै लक्षणबिना मध्यम अवधि लिन सक्छ।
en-mt: The disease can take a moderate period of time, taking the same form as other common upper respiratory diseases, such as the cold, with some or no symptoms.

sourceString: Mild cases typically recover within two weeks, while those with severe or critical diseases may take three to six weeks to recover.
targetString: निको हुन तीनदेखि छ हप्ता लाग्न सक्ने गम्भीर वा स्वभाविक रोगहरू लाग्दा सामान्य अवस्थामा सामान्यतया दुई हप्ताभित्र निको हुन्छ।
en-mt: In cases of serious or natural illnesses that can take three to six weeks to heal, they usually recover within two weeks.

sourceString: Pregnant women may be at higher risk for severe infection with COVID-19 based on data from other similar viruses, like SARS and MERS, but data for COVID-19 is lacking.In some people, COVID-19 may affect the lungs causing pneumonia.
targetString: गर्भवती महिलाहरू SARS र MERS जस्ता अन्य समान भाइरसहरूका डाटाको आधारमा COVID-19 को गम्भीर सङ्क्रमणका लागि उच्च जोखिममा हुन सक्छन्, तर COVID-19 का लागि डाटा कम छ। केही मानिसमा, COVID-19 ले निमोनिया गराएर फोक्सोहरूमा असर गर्न सक्छ।
en-mt: Pregnant women may be at higher risk for severe infections of COVID-19 based on data from other similar viruses such as SARS and MERS, but data for COVID-19 are scarce. In some people, COVID-19 can affect the lungs by causing pneumonia.

sourceString: In those most severely affected, COVID-19 may rapidly progress to acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS) causing respiratory failure, septic shock or multi-organ failure.
targetString: ती सबैभन्दा गम्भीर रूपले प्रभावितहरूमा, COVID-19 द्रुत गतिमा गम्भीर श्वासप्रश्वासको समस्या सिन्ड्रोम (ARDS) मा बढ्न सक्छ जसले श्वासप्रश्वास विफलता, सेप्टिक झट्का वा बहु-अङ्ग विफलता हुन सक्छ।
en-mt: Among those most severely affected, COVID-19 can rapidly develop into severe respiratory problem syndrome (ARDS) which can lead to respiratory failure, septic shock or multi-organ failure.

sourceString: Complications associated with COVID-19 include sepsis, abnormal clotting and damage to the heart, kidneys and liver.
targetString: COVID-19 सँग सम्बन्धित जटिलताहरू सेप्सिस, असाधारण रगत जम्ने र मुटु, मृगौला र कलेजोमा क्षति हुन्।
en-mt: Complications associated with COVID-19 are sepsis, abnormal blood clotting and damage to the heart, kidneys and liver.

sourceString: Clotting abnormalities, specifically an increase in prothrombin time, have been described in 6% of those admitted to hospital with COVID-19, while abnormal kidney function is seen in 4% of this group.
targetString: जम्ने अशक्तता, विशेष गरी प्रोथ्रोम्बिनमा वृद्धि, COVID-19 ले अस्पतालमा भर्ना भएका मध्ये 6% मा वर्णन गरिएको छन्, जबकि यस समूहको 4% मा असाधारण मृगौलाको कार्य देखिएको छ।
en-mt: Freezing disability, particularly an increase in prothrombin, has been described in 6% of those hospitalized with COVID-19, while abnormal kidney function has been observed in 4% of this group.

sourceString: Approximately 20-30% of people who present with COVID-19 demonstrate elevated liver enzymes (transaminases).
targetString: COVID-19 भएका करिब 20-30% मानिसले बढ्दो लिभर इन्जाइम (ट्रान्सएमिनसेस) देखाउँछन्।
en-mt: About 20-30% of people with COVID-19 show growing liver enzymes (transaminases).

sourceString: According to the same report, the median time between onset of symptoms and death was ten days, with five being spent hospitalised.
targetString: उही रिपोर्टको अनुसार, लक्षणहरू देखिएको र मृत्युको बीचको औसत समय दश दिनको छ, जसमा पाँच दिन अस्पतालमा भर्ना भएर बितेको छ।
en-mt: According to the same report, the average time between symptom onset and death is ten days, with five days spent in hospitalization.

sourceString: However, patients transferred to an ICU had a median time of seven days between hospitalisation and death.
targetString: यद्यपि, ICU मा सारिएका विरामीहरूको अस्पताल भर्ना र मृत्युको बीचमा औसत सात दिनको समय हुन्छ।
en-mt: However, patients transferred to ICU have an average time of seven days between hospitalization and death.

sourceString: In a study of early cases, the median time from exhibiting initial symptoms to death was 14 days, with a full range of six to 41 days.
